Reviews.Title: “Good, Affordable option”
Reviews.Author: nelgar67
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Maingate Lakeside Resort during the first week of April 2012. Overall, the hotel - it's a real stretch to call it a "resort" - is an affordable Disney-area option for those wanting a placing to sleep. The rooms aren't super clean and hot water in bathroom was intermittent. The outdoor pool was clean. Not much else in the way of amenities; and certainly none to justify the resort fee which is added to the room rate. One real annoyance is the inability to check in even a minute before the 3 pm hour. The front desk was understaffed, somewhat unhelpful, and not capable of handling the lineup of people waiting for 3 pm. For about $70 a night it might be worth it, provided that you don't have high expectations.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: bess24
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three weeks from the 24th March to the 14th April from reading the reviews before i left i was very anxious as staying for so long however when i arrived it was better than worst fears, by no means is this hotel anything special but it is a good priced hotel close to disney. During our stay there was only one day with no towels and maid left a note to appologise so we rang through for some when we got back and it wasn;t an issue. there was also an ongoing issue with our safe which was a little irrating three different days it errored and we needed both maintance and security to come to room to sort which each time took 30min or so. Pool was warm and salt water which is better for us. most days we left at 7am and was back for after 11pm so the room was all we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Aman1410
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our holiday (family of 4 with 2 children aged 11 and 6). I was slightly nervous after reading the negative reviews, but didn't need to be. We found the room to be fine for our needs. It was slightly dated maybe, but certainly not a problem for us. It was kept clean every day and had enough room for the 4 of us. We only really used it as a base, as we were out at the parks all day, and for this purpose it was absolutely fine. The only negative about the rooms was that on several occasions the towels, cups and coffee were not replenished, but a quick call to reception and they were delivered immediately. Was slightly annoying, but certainly not a major big deal. We used the pool area twice and that was lovely. Nice to be able to relax and have a swim after a long day at the parks. We had breakfast a couple of times, and although slightly more expensive than the surrounding restaurants, was really nice. They even do a breakfast to go, where you can fill plastic trays which are then weighed and charged at $5.50 per lb in weight. We used this service several times if we were leaving early to get to the parks early. This was a great help in getting us to the parks before they opened to avoid the long lines. I can't comment on the shuttle service as we never used them. We never found any problems with the staff being rude, in fact they were always very helpful and polite. The resort fee was explained to us at the time of booking, so no surprises there for us. All in all we really enjoyed our stay. We found this hotel to be great value for money, in an excellent location for all the parks and loads of nice restaurants and we would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “medication stolen from room”
Reviews.Author: dale f
Reviews.Content: First of all they will not let you check in even 5 minutes early so if you have an early flight coming in you should find something to do. And when we did show up at 3 we had to wait in line for an hour to check in. Rooms were outdated and not real clean, the shower heads had some kind of mould or something on them and behind the desk had some kind of stain on the wall. There was only wireless internet in certain parts of the hotel and when we called to the front desk they insisted there was a modem in our room which we could not find and when we finally got someone to check after telling them 3 times there was no modem someone finally came and gave us one and unless your use to dial-up internet it was not worth so if your there on bussiness make sure you get a room with wireless because you will not be able to do anything. All this i could deal with but when most of my wifes medication went missing that is when i had to write this review. we called the front desk and they called the police but when all was said and done my wife ended up missing out on 2 days of our family time at disney and pretty much ruined her vacation and the hotel refused to make it right and told us the maid said there was beer in our room everyday and basically made it sound like we were a bunch of drunken party animals which we are not .Well first of all my wife does not drink and can you imagine anyone having a beer on there vacation after a long day at disney (a little sarcasm). so overall our experience was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Seemed OK - But no one was going to go out of their way.”
Reviews.Author: Jason S
Reviews.Content: Reading some of the reviews I was concerned. The rooms are some what dated. Beds were pretty bad. There were 3 "Adult" pools but only 1 of them was open and this is a spring break week? This was spring break folks..... why did everyone have to pile into 1 pool. There was no one manning the Pizza Hut location when I tried to order and they were delivering an order to the complex. It was a good location and reasonably priced, one particular issue hacked me off. We returned from one of the parks for our 3rd night of our 4 day stay and didnt have enough towels. I personally walked to the front desk and requested additional towels 30-40 min later we called again and requested them again for the 2nd time and they never came. The sad part was that our building was one of the closest to their laundry facility. The 4th night we at least hoped for improvement but the same inadiquate amount of towels were left. Heck they didnt even replenish the toilet paper when we hit the auxillary roll. If I had called to try and get another roll I probably would have not gotten that either. Luckly there is a Walgreens in the parking lot that you can get some if it gets that bad. Probably would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent 2.5 star close to Main Gate”
Reviews.Author: imdarkside
Reviews.Content: They charge a "resort fee" in addition to your cost of stay. Clean but solid 2.5 star. Rooms are roomy with lots of space, fridge. Bathroom is small. Overall it was a 2 star that has been painted etc... to bring it to a 2.5 star. Decent place to stay on the cheap at Disney. Look for MLR in balls on sign near the Walgreens as you head away from Kissimee to find this hotel. There is a Publix, Target etc.. down the road towards the Turnpike and a Winn Dixie grocery store across the street (WD is within walking distance of hotel).

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Disney Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: jlamruiz
Reviews.Content: LOVED our stay! I was a bit put off by some of the negative reviews but we really didn't encounter any of the problems other people had. Our room was cleaned every day and towels were replenished, I even asked one of the housekeeping ladies for extra towels to put in my room (based on reviews I read) but didn't really need them, however, the towels are very small...I brought some from home as well based on reviews. Bugs, you're in Florida people, there are going to be bugs, the lovebugs don't bother anyone but there are red fire ants, I did not encounter any bed bugs, I brought one of those Off Clip on discs and had it on all day at pool and turned on every night before bed (again, based on other reviews) and had absolutely no issues. I was not fond of the pillows but that is because I prefer firm ones. Yes, they don't use full sheets on the bed, but all other sheets were neatly tucked and it presented no problems. No, it isn't the Hilton, but for the price you pay did anyone really expect that. Yes, hotel could use some maintenance but I called ahead and requested renovated room and they happily granted me that. Miniature golf course isn't very great but it's free along with the use of basketball and court which my son thoroughly enjoyed, along with the arcade room. General store inside also sold snacks, beer, wine, and cigarettes. Pool by building 1-3 is heated at night and open till 11pm, unlike the pool by the other building, there is no lifeguard though, and I was in the pool till 1am at times. Great thing about that pool is that every night at 8pm they show a movie for the kids, my son, and all the kids (as well as myself) loved this. Breakfast buffet was not the best, but definitely edible and doable at $8.50 and kids eat free, the rest of the food there was good though, and reasonably priced. There is a pizza hut on premise, and they also serve food from the restaurant there which is also available at the tiki bar by the pool (by building 1). There are places to eat right on the street when you walk out like Cici's, Fridays, Red Lobster, Dennys, Crackerbarrel, etc, as well as a Winn Dixie across the street (to buy snacks for your fridge) and a 24 Wallgreens literally in the parking lot of hotel. Only thing I didn't like was that the shuttles to attractions only leave to go to certain places at certain times and the same with returns, BUT that was nothing cause if you plan your day you can make it so that you can come back later if you want from another pickup location since all the Disney Busses are free and you could just take a bus from there to catch the hotel shuttle at a different park and return time. Other than that, this was a very family friendly hotel with lots to keep the kids busy AND happy and feasible options for transportation to your theme parks. My son loved this place, we hung out there for 3 full days he had so much fun and said he didn't wanna leave anywhere. If you just want somewhere to hang with the kids and a clean, comfortable room to sleep in after long days at the parks then look no further, great value for the price. All the staff was friendly and helpful. I am a single mom so finding places my son enjoys, that are safe and comfortable for him are my top priority, and this did it. He said he wants to come here every year for vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Laurie J
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights. Staff were excellent, every day. Responded cheerfully to requests. Room was basic and a bit run down, but housekeeper did a very good job. Breakfast buffet pretty good. Grounds were not well kept and the overall exterior building condition is bordering on poor. Air conditioning unit didn't work properly and windows don't open so sleeping was uncomfortably warm with the A/C unit off, and unbearably noisy with the A/C unit on. Price was right though considering. Get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION BUT RUN-DOWN..”
Reviews.Author: nrios
Reviews.Content: The front desk people lack of costumer service skils! The morning crew seems to be angry. I went to the front desk at 7 AM to let them know my tub was clogged, by 5 pm when I returned to my room, nobody had shown up to fix the tub. Smalls ants all over the room. House keeping did not clean my room one of the days we stayed there. Bathtub was moldy. Overall the hotel is a a very convenient location but it need some renovations and some customer service traning mainly at front desk. Theire breakfast place is good the employees at the restaurants are very polite and the lady making the omelets is very frendly.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of basic supplies in the room”
Reviews.Author: Mahmood R
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights form March 31, we were constantly pleading for basic supplies like toilet papers, towels, cups. Beds were not made. Nothing was supplied in the room until you beg for it. It has an apearance of cheap motel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad at all for the price!”
Reviews.Author: QueenBreeze
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised. I got a very low rate on this property, and it was not bad at all. We had a room near the lake for a 1 night stay. It was clean and the bed was comfy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & clean!”
Reviews.Author: J A
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights while visiting family at one of the Disney resorts. This was perfect for what we wanted it for. A clean room, quiet, AC that works and a great location. The pool was and Cafe were both nice, and we found the staff friendly. There is a pharmacy and many restaurants in walking distance. Yes, the hotel is in need of an update, and some of the outside areas could use a good scrubbing. I agree with the other reviewers that the towels were not sufficient (fortunately I had read the reviews ahead of time so I brought some with us). You can always go buy them for a few bucks- they do have laundry facilities All in all, we would stay here again, you can't beat it for the money- and quite frankly, if you are planning a trip to Orlando, who wants to spend their day IN the hotel room!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel for an awesome price”
Reviews.Author: otrebor
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for an awesome price on Travelocity secret rates for 23.08 plus taxes and 7.50 daily resort fee. Upon entering the hotel lobby there was a line but within five minutes we were checked in by Kathy who was great. We got a king room which was just as pictured with the exception of no minnie/mickey mouse on the bed. The room was clean and smelled good the only downfall is that for some reason they do not put fitted sheets on the mattress they put a flat sheet and tuck it under the mattress. The bed was ok, there is a mini-fridge, sofa and old tv (not flat screen). Overall if you are NOT PICKY and just looking for a place to shower and sleep this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised, Plan to go back!”
Reviews.Author: banjo60
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I stayed here about 4 years back when this was a Best Western and had a disappointing experience. After I got the room off Hotwire and read all the bad reviews on here I must say I was a little scared to see what I would find. But from the time I got there until the time I checked out I have nothing but good things to say about this place. The check in clerk was very nice and professional, very nice manners! I stayed in building #2, room 188. I found the room to be very clean, the beds were nice and the bathroom was spotless! I had a poolside room and it looked nice and the grounds were well kept. To summarize I normally stay in Disney resorts but had to get something quick and cheap for a funeral. A Disney resort would be my first choice, however if you don't have that in your budget and stay off property I don't see how you get a better bang for your buck than this place. Don't let all the negative reviews scare you away, give this place a try. And BTW, this place even has a Pizza Hut Express in addition they make hamburgers and have a little snack place....I didn't even know it was here until after I walked to Walgreens! All the food was made to order!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as reviews made it out to be”
Reviews.Author: Kcolonel
Reviews.Content: We arrived to one person trying to check in 6 with the manager walking by to do nothing. Then got to room and had no towels ( 2 days in a row we have had to call for them) Grounds are ok amenities are ok nothing great but nothing bad. The people seem to help when asked. The room. It isn't bad seems clean not problems there but things like tub broke, door to bathroom broke, safe locked just don't think I would stay here again even for the decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let all the reviews scare you , Unless you are use to a LUXURY resort none of it was true.”
Reviews.Author: james t
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from here and we had a great time. We travel alot and I found the rooms to be average and clean. We stayed in a pet friendly room because we carried our beloved american bulldog on his first trip ever. They we very nice with our dog. One of the men that work there even petted him and talked to him . The rooms had a few things you could find wrong with them but nothing I haven't seen in every other hotel we have ever stayed. The pet yard was perfect for what you need it for. The only bad experience we had was the one girl at the front desk was hateful. We actually came down the night before our reservations and we got right on it , then we decided to stay and extra night and we had no trouble doing that either. The only thing I didn't like was having to find the maids to get towels and toliet paper. because they didn't clean our room because of the dog. And the maids acted like they were the ones buying the toliet paper when u asked for it . If they would get rid of the rude girl up front and get all new maids to clean the rooms .this would be an awesome hotel. But we still had a great time there so don't let all the bad scare you. We NEVER seen any bugs, that was what scared me the most was thinking our room was gonna have bugs, but thank goodness it didn't......

Reviews.Title: “Bad Disney World Neighbor”
Reviews.Author: vinigmartins
Reviews.Content: The hotel is (self) considered a resort, but is far from it. The service is terrible. This includes the reception and room service. I did some shopping on the internet and asked the store to deliver my products at the hotel. When I saw the tracking status on the Internet, I noticed that my products had arrived. I was at the front desk and they informed me that nothing had arrived for. I left there, print a proof of delivery on the Internet and went back to the reception. Again, the front desk guys said they had nothing for me. I waited about 10 minutes and came back there. I spoke with another employee, who was older than the others. Surprise, my purchases were there. Thus, I recommend extreme caution when leaving belongings in the hotel. I do not know the names of two employees (one woman and one attendant, they both work in the afternoon) that "not found" my packages to denounce them to the manager.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: West Palm Beach, Florida, United States
Reviews.Title: “Disapointed with rooms, staff and manager”
Reviews.Author: Javier C
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a nice time with my family on March 22nd, 2012. How embarrassed I was to find that the customer service did not find or acknowledge the travelocity booking. I had to complained to the manager on this and she finally found it. I asked the cleck if I could stay for another day and he said that would be a problem. They wanted me to call the reservation at travelocity to reserve the same rate or they were going to hit me with a full rate charge if did not. Again, I had to get the manager to help. When I went to the room the TV and phone were not working. My wife found PUBIC HAIR in the bathroom. I ran back to the manager and demanded another room. I got another room much cleaner this time. The next day after returning from the Disney Parks at 11:00 pm. I took a look inside and the housekeeping staff did the beds and here is the kicker they completely forgot to put any towels and toilet paper. I was furious and I call the front desk and spoke to the same manager. She gave me two rolls of toilet paper and told me somebody will bring me some towels. It took them 45 minutes and it was the security guard with an annoyed attitude who brought me the towels. NOT event once did the manager of Maingate Lakeside Resort apologized to me. The only good thing I can say about this hotel is that the breakfast buffet was very good and the pools were good. Other than that stay away from the front desk and the rooms. This hotel has a great location and a beautiful lake. This place needs new owners and new management that cares for the customer and the look of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Do not listen to all the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: hotelcandanrocks
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from maingate lakeside and we were dreading the holiday before we went because of all the dreadful reveiws on this site but fear not we had a fab room 250 there were no bugs the air con worked the cleaners cleaned every day and we spent 16 nights here they changed the bedding and towels every day the staff were friendly, attentive and helpful yes it is a little run down and could do with a lick of paint and an update but the rooms are clean and the beds are comfy and lets face it your not paying for a 4/5 star hotel you are paying for a 3 star hotel and thats just what you get we had a fab holiday and cant wait to return hulk roller coaster at universal was awsome also paid to go on safari to hand feed the giraffes at bush gardens a must for all animal lovers fab expierience and only cost $33 each money well . please please please please dont worry like i did about this hotel it is fine. Adef try bubba gumps shrimp house at city walk fab resturant and only cost $85 for 4 of us to eat 2 courses and drinks in soviner cups

Reviews.Title: “Older building with hidden fees”
Reviews.Author: Ridgerunning
Reviews.Content: This is a complex of several buildings. We only stayed overnight and they put us in the building farthest away from the pools, lobby, and resturaunts. They passed on a $7.50 "resort fee" that increases the advertised price so beware of that if considering booking. Rooms are older and show wear and tear. I will pick a different establishment in the area next time.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I didn't listen to bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: vacapal
Reviews.Content: Was going for a wedding and for Disney parks. I was very concerned after reading reviews. I am picky with cleanliness when I take my kids along. Our room was clean, bathroom clean. We checked mattresses for bed bugs and found none, thank god! I took my own sheets, pillows and towels just in case. The location is great, was very pleased with that. Heavy traffic most days but it was spring break but did hit heavy traffic since main road after exiting hotel. The a/c was not too cool. Would come back to room and sometimes was warm since it would turn off I guess after a while. Did have a musky smell but we bought air freshner, that solved the problem. Front desk very helpful at check in and check out. Good hotel if you're going to be out and about and use it just to sleep and bathe. Oh and since its pet friendly be careful stepping on dog poop especially at night when you cant see and don't expect to step on it. Guests or management should really take care of that since I'm sure there's specific areas where pets can go for that.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably bad service”
Reviews.Author: Andywatts74
Reviews.Content: It's a decent enough hotel, but the staff has ZERO idea of what customer service is. We had bugs in the room and a constant fight to get towels. After 5 days of ineptitude & excuses we came back from Disney around midnight with no towels in the room. After calling the front desk all we got was bad attitude, bad service, and bad excuses. After asking to speak to a manager my wife was hung up on by the front desk personnel. After 20 minutes of ridiculousness I finally asked "Where the (______) are our towels?". Then the aforementioned employee contacted the sheriff's department and told them I had made a scene in the lobby. I was not in the lobby, I was in our room, not the lobby. When they arrived, I told them what had happened. They spoke with the front desk and changed their story slightly. Although, we were given an option. They would send towels and let us stay IF I went to the front desk and and IF I apologized. I declined that offer and left at 1:20 am with my family. That night the officers apologized to us about having to leave and said that wasone of the most ridiclous things they had ever seen. I spoke with the manager the next day, she apologized for her staff and offered a free night's stay or refund a day from the stay. She tried to make it right, I'll giver her that. But, the garbage we had to put up with was unacceptable. Do yourself a favor and not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A family review of the Best Western”
Reviews.Author: Dan T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Lakeside for 2 weeks out of season and found the staff to be helpful, the food edible, the location good for park access and the rooms clean. Sure, we booked a room for 5 people and upon getting there discovered we'd have to rent an extra bed, this was something we would take up with the holiday booking company and not the hotel. The room was clean, not sizable or special but clean. And at the end of the day, all we were using the room for was to sleep in at the end of a tiring day so I'll actual time in the room was spent in a state of sleep for 95% of the time. The breakfasts were quite enjoyable, they had a chef that cooked omelettes to order which was nice but then breakfasts weren't included in our holiday price so we didn't commit to eating there each morning. There is a Walgreens next door and enough fast food outlets within the mile to keep you contented all holiday. What I really like about this hotel was the location. You had the Disney parks literally 10 minutes down the road and the Universal Parks about 20 minutes. You have a lake next to the hotel, a kids play park and parking right outside your room. I literally parked in front of our door. I see other people have questioned the security of the rooms and honestly, our door was secure and we had no problems or concerns with it. As for sugar ants, we had some but not enough to make us freak out. As I said, if your using the Best Western as a place to rest your weary head after a long day in the parks then you'd be fine staying here, if your looking for luxury and refinement then perhaps this isn't for you! Admitedly if I was returning anytime soon then this wouldn't be my first choice as there are other hotels along the strip, but it also wouldn't be ruled out if it was the only choice. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews”
Reviews.Author: DKrauter
Reviews.Content: The old, "You get what you pay for" applies here. I booked this hotel for my wife and daughter for a little weekend get away. They had to check in around 11:00 pm because of spending the day at Disney. The rude front desk clerk must have had a bad day when he interrupted my wife and demanded her ID. After they arrived at the room the keys would not work. So my wife waited at the door while my daughter drove back to the front desk to get the keys fixed. That scenario repeated twice. The rooms were ok but getting old and in need of a thorough cleaning and upgrading. My son drove over from Tampa and joined them. When they called down for a few towels they were transferred to housekeeping and....you guessed it...no towels were ever delivered. Saturday brought another room key issue and another trip to the front desk. Security is very important to me and when you can not get my family in their room there is a problem. Spend the additional money and get a nice place to lay your head. I have driven a stack in front of this hotel and will not stay there again. The location was great but I will take comfort and security over location.

Reviews.Title: “They got my kids clothes and did not returned”
Reviews.Author: Carla C
Reviews.Content: Im truly disappointed with this hotel, it has a musty smell and looks like it has not been properly cleaned. The front desks esp the lady in the morning shift is rude and snaps to frustrated guest. The worst thing that happened to us is while we are out during the day, housekeeping took my kids used clothes that was inside a laundry bag/ plastic bag and was never returned. I have followed this up on day 2 until day 5 but have never had any clear answer and did not even apologize, this has been reached the manager but he never help us. Don't ever stay in this hotel, if it was not for the time share, we have check out the next day. And anyway Internet access is so poor, towels are not being replaced!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here.. unless you have a dog”
Reviews.Author: Lora B
Reviews.Content: This resort has a small dog park and was useful to play rope or ball with the our dog to tire her out. However, the resort asked us only to confine our walks/play to this area which made us feel uncomfortable for taking our dog on a leashed walk. The dog friendly rooms were basic and smelt like urine. I would not stay here again. I would not stay here if I had children - it is tired and needs upgrading/renovation. The air conditioner leaked water all over the carpet and out the door. Our room had 1 towel upon arrival and we requested more but never came. The sheets were not fitted and there wasn't enough blankets to keep warm. The facility could be awesome as it is on a lakeside and my fiance went fishing a couple of times and the dog park as mentioned earlier. The staff were a bit rude and the restaurants were way over priced (buffet for $9.50 - just drive down the street and there are $3.99 buffets everywhere). The staff were not helpful and did not provide us with any information to make our stay special (i.e. never said there was a shuttle when we checked in, how to play mini-golf (where to get the clubs). The only thing I enjoyed was the sun and pool (I think one is salt water?). FYI they play movies once the sun goes down at the main pool (didn't know this - no one told us). Stay somewhere else to make your Orlando stay truly a special one.

Reviews.Title: “Stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Jeanne S
Reviews.Content: By far the most terrible hotel experience of my life. The hotel is old buildings with doors opening to the outside. There was no deadbolt on the door to the room- we wegded a chair to prevent anyone with a master key card from just walking in. The slide lock was bent out of shape and not secure. When we checked in there were 2 lines (both very long). One was for check in and the other to try to address patrons complaints. The complaints were no towels despite multiple requests. The lack of toilet paper in a new room. Two guests appreciated the coffee set up - but there was no coffee maker. The complaint of ants and bugs should have made me turn around and leave but we had already paid for the room. When we got to the room it smelled musty. The shower had a constant drip of water that was like chinese water torture. The linens were threadbare. Needless to say my daughter and I got very little sleep before her very important audition.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely terrible!!”
Reviews.Author: Cryssie C
Reviews.Content: This "RESORT" was a joke. First let's start with the cleanliness. The shower head was completely moldy and disguisting. The sugar ants where ridiculous. They blamed the ants on the fact that we had food in our room. Yes, we had PACKAGED food in our room and food in our mini fridge. They didn't care to fix the ant problem or even offer us another room. They did not replace any food that was swarmed with the ants. The ants were all over the sink and in the bathtub. The beds had very thin blankets and there were NO fitted sheets so we ended up throughout the night on the bare mattress since the flat sheet moved a lot. Also, we lost our water for a few hours in the middle of the day on our 2nd day there. We TRIED to call the front desk numerous times to get this fixed as well as the ant problem but there was no getting through. We had to walk to the front desk. They advertise Free Wireless Internet... Well they mean highspeed internet, not wireless... but you have to get the maintenace to come up and set it up for you. We planned on going to some of the disney parks and after waiting in line at the front office (we did not have a gps) they told me they did not know directions to the theme parks... The inside of the hotel room was almost appalling with the peeling wallpaper and dirty paint, the A/C smelled like mildew. Since we had our 2 young children with us, we were in bed around 9pm, but we could not sleep until well after midnight considering the cleaning people and maintenance pushing their carts back and forth in front of our doors about every 15 minutes or less... In the 5 days we stayed, there was not once a single towel at the pool for us. We had to request towels every time then wait at least 20 minutes for them to arrive. I know what your thinking, 'why not bring towels from your room?" Oh that's because they only supplied us 2 towel for 4 people... I tried to call and request more, but of course, no answer at the front desk. The HEATED pools are about 50 degrees. My 3 yr old's lips turned blue it was so cold. The cleaning lady even laughed when I asked her why this is called a resort. She said it is not a resort, they just throw that on the title. Wow, really? This hotel is terrible and not a single employee here cares whether you have an enjoyable stay or not. Please, look into ANY of the other hotels in the area, you can get something much more comfortable for a better price. The location is great, it's near everything, but the quality flat out SUCKS.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price and pet friendly!”
Reviews.Author: ladyhd
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice now and had a great experience both times. Its nice to find a place that is pet friendly for large dogs, has an area for dogs and priced well. Our room was clean, didn't smell like dog, and had a fridge. We will stay again. Check in was easy, quick and friendly and even got a late check out when requested.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: KellyWellyWoo537
Reviews.Content: After reading some horror reviews I was really worried about staying here for my trip of a lifetime for my 21st birthday. I had worked so hard and wanted it to be prefect. I found the check in staff very polite, friendly and helpful and I only had one negative experience of front of house staff but she was lone working around midnight - the phones were going crazy and there was a very demanding customer infront of me so I would have been annoyed as well. The room was clean, had a safe, wifi and a fridge with towels etc. provided daily. The housekeeping staff were very good and I had no issues other than forgetting toilet roll once but a quick call to reception and it was sorted. There were always maintence staff around and the place was very clean. We visited one pool with the pool side bar and found it to be very good. The location was perfect if you have a car - although it is on the 192 it may be quite hard to get to some parks unless you get a bus. It was 5 minutes away from Animal Kingdom and 10 minutes from all the other Disney parks - perfect! I will return 100% and am looking at booking for next year already. We only really used the room to sleep and have a quick relax in so if you want a proper spa, relaxing type resort this may not be for you - for Brits, it is comparable to a Travelodge but it was perfect for us. Thank you for making my birthday stay a great one.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: laurenbellamy
Reviews.Content: First off let me say that you can't expect much for a hotel that cost a little over $30 a night. However, this hotel is nothing like the pictures. When we checked in the staff was not very friendly. When we got to our room I was horrified. The place is filthy, the doors have gaps all around so the light comes through, and it smelled like urine. When we went to sign onto the "free wi-fi" there wasn't a network to sign on to. I called the front desk and the attendant told me I was in a room without wi-fi service. We asked if we could change rooms and he said we could. The Internet was so slow we probably shouldn't have bothered. We took the free shuttle to universal one day then decided to drive the rest of the week, it was too much of a hassle. The only positive things I can say about this hotel is that the pool is nice and the outdoor bar is decent.

Reviews.Title: “This place is disgusting!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kyndra R
Reviews.Content: When we pulled in I could already tell we weren't going to like this place.It looked nothing like the pictures! The front desk agent didn't even make eye contact, barely even spoke to me and gave me wrong directions to our room.Once we got to our room it was horrible! There were ants crawling in the shower,you could see underneath the door so we had to put a towel there to block it,there were dead bugs on the wall and flying around.The beds were gross.We had reservations for the next night but when we woke up the next morning we decided to leave.We went to the front desk to check out and they didn't even apologize or offer any refund! Very unfriendly! I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone and Hotwire shouldn't have this motel on their website!

Reviews.Title: “an average stay with less than perfect service”
Reviews.Author: Wayne S
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the motel this past weekend and was a bit dissapointed. the front desk personel were awesome. BUT told them we had cold water instead of hot when we left fri morning to go to the park and after 12 hours park hopping came back and had water that was barely warm. told the desk we can get someone to look at it first thing in the morning. they did they raised it another 1/2 a degree. the solution. give us our 7.50 resort fee back per night. really people why are you charging that to start with.

Reviews.Title: “Disney should be ashamed to have them as a "neighbor"”
Reviews.Author: Andrea B
Reviews.Content: Terrible service when we were here. Check in line was backed up when we got there- ok I get that. We checked in and decided we wanted to use the shuttle to go to Downtown Disney. Shouldn't be a problem since the shuttle runs there a few times. Went to the Guest Services desk to ask and was told that no the shuttle wouldn't take you there. So I questioned the girl because the shuttle info paper said it goes to all Disney properties. And she then told me oh, well maybe it does, I don't know this is my first day. So I had to wait in another line to have a Maingate employee tell me that there is no way to do Downtown Disney unless I call a cab. I asked is any of it could be walked and was told no it was too much of a mess to do that. Well we decided to hop on a shuttle anyway and see what we could find. And guess what? You can get therem quite easily in fact, from the shuttle. Thankfully the gentleman at Disney was much more helpful. Similarly the next day we asked about buying Disney tickets and another girl told us she didn't know anything about tickets because it was her first day as well. So helpful! Room was basic-not terribly clean. Best part was having a fridge and the 24 hour Walgreens right in front of the hotel. Can't get anywhere without a cab and even though there is a free shuttle, the times for some parks (7:30 am for Universal?) are inconvenient. Unless you know exactly what you are doing and how to get around, I would avoid this place. Also there is free internet but its really really slow, i.e. not worth even trying.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: kirsty w
Reviews.Content: we have been three times and it has been brilliant everytime and we enjoyed watching the alligators at night and we are going again in 2013.

Reviews.Title: “Ewe, Gross, Nasty”
Reviews.Author: Ree12_12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because our choices were limited. It was here or another more expensive hotel that were both "pet friendly." Our two small dogs are completely house broken. The smell of urine was so bad in our room it made me think of how unsanitary it must be. The door to our room did not close correctly and the bottom was cracked to the outside. There was garbage overflowing and laying on ground in the public walking area and dog park. Friends of ours stayed in a regular room...while their room did not smell, the lock on their door was loose. Neither of us had adequate toilet paper, tissues, or towels. We will never recommend this hotel to anyone. We thought, "its only for one night and we can stay here." I was wrong, I couldn't sleep because of the smell and the general creepiness of the hotel. We will stay at the more expensive hotel in the future, that has a five star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Very very average!!”
Reviews.Author: steveandstu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maingate Lakeside on a package holiday sold by Virgin Holidays in the UK. Because of this we were not charged the resort fee fortunately. If we had been I would have refused to pay for the "average" facilities here. The reception staff are friendly & cope well with the complaints they get. Our first complaint was that we did not have wifi in our room. They kindly informed us that in Block 1 there isn't any, but internet is available via a cable. Now this is fine if you have a laptop with you, which we did, but if you were using an iPhone you were not getting anything unless you go & sit in the reception area. The internet was also painfully slow. Our second complaint was the hot water. We struggled to ever get above tepid & that's not acceptable for a shower. We complained & suddenly we had hot water. Though still not reliable. Another thing that bugged us was the towels. There were 3 of us in the room & yet some days we had 3 towels, others 2. Surely if you take away 3 towels, you replace them with 3 towels. It's not difficult!! The rooms themselves are of a good size with a handy safe & a fridge that is very useful. The room was also kept very clean, as were the beds which were also very comfortable. It is noisy here, with other guests chatting as they walk past the doors. This isn't helped by the gaps under the doors which let in a cold draft on cool nights. Friday mornings at about 4am, both weeks, they seemed to think it was a good idea to empty the bins. This makes one hell of a noise. Surely the staff have ears & can use some common sense by leaving this job until at least after 8am. We paid for breakfast a couple of days & it was good value as kids eat free. We used Sizzler down the road most days & this was virtually the same price. The made to order omelettes were especially good. The swimming pool is a good size & warm. Our 7 year old swam most days. We did not use the mini golf, or the outdoor bar, but we were there in February, so not the busiest & earnest of times. We did not use the free Theme Park transportation, as we had a hire car, but the timings that we read we ridiculous, so I'd suggest having a car or using a taxi if you want to get to &/or leave at sensible times. Other than that our stay was ok. The location on the 192 is excellent for getting to Disney parks. I am very surprised that Virgin Holidays use the hotel as on previous holidays with them the accommodation has been much better. But I hear there may be a refurbishment due soon. Personally I would never stay here again, as I could get better for the same price, and I would never recommend it as it's too tatty. But if you are just staying 1 or 2 nights (not 14 like us) then it's passable. Maybe the refurbishment & the dropping of the ridiculous resort fee would boost peoples comments. Especially as the resort fee could be added to the room rate & no one would then know they are being charged it.

Reviews.Title: “I am here now...since I flew in, I wonder if I would stay if I had a car”
Reviews.Author: Gizmo_Ontario
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 4 times before when it was Best Western.. this time the outside walkways look like they need some pressure washing.. all the pools are NOT heated like I was told they would be.. as for the room, it does need refreshing, maybe steam clean the carpets.. I arrived really late on Tuesday night and less than 24 hours later, I found cockroaches in our room.. oh yuck... I phoned front desk for 10 minutes straight with no answer. Then I called reservation number and told them and they forwarded me back to front desk of hotel with no answer again. So off I went to the front desk with one of the critters in a plastic cup in a plastic bag to show them. First I logged onto google to see if it was indeed a cockroach.. yes it was.. I stood in line for 10 minutes as there was only one person at the desk. I got a sorry and we will have a maintenance man come to your room to look for others. My grandson has seen 3 others when I finally went to see what he was yelling about in the bathroom. The maintenance man was nice and in my room before we got back to the room. But alas, the others had "left the room" I could see spaces around plumbing pipes where they could hide.. So far, not pleased as I don't want to think about waking up to find others. The management has not done anything about it. I think I would look elsewhere if I had rented a car but this was suppossed to be a relaxing trip. They need to do some work here and it could be back to what it was before. As for dealing with customers problems, I don't know what I expect them to do but they need to do something about it when people find cockroaches in the rooms. I don't even want to look under the bedding, I don't want to know if there is anything else I might find. I do know I will be leaving my suitcase outside in garage for a few days just in case any of these little "travellers" decide to go back to Canada with me.. As you can see, I am really upset about this happening to me..

Reviews.Title: “OK as somewhere to rest your head”
Reviews.Author: Trishy37
Reviews.Content: We used this room purely as somewhere to rest our heads at night after a long day at one of the various Parks. It wasn't fancy but it was adequate and we got what we paid for. The room was clean . The beds were made every day. Towels were a bit hit and miss and so we had to ask for extra towels a couple of times during our weeks stay but they were very soon delivered. Staff were friendly and helpful when we asked. All in all it was adequate but no frills whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Luisa P
Reviews.Content: Over all it was a good experience...the only fault was the toliet and the slow hot water...if it wasn't used in a few hours I had to flush it 4 times to get it working, then it would be fine, there was hot water but it was very slow to warm up, once it did it was fine, other than these 2 problems my stay was fine. The beds were comfy, and the room was clean, the location of the hotel was good. For the money it was well worth the stay and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: MllePookie
Reviews.Content: Note: For all those who complain of the water in the shower not being hot, here's what I found. I spent the first 10 minutes of my shower thinking the same thing. However, I finally figured out that the shower knob actually turns counter-clockwise to warm up, as opposed to clockwise. I have NO idea why but got so frustrated and angry that I started fiddling around to see if I could get it any warmer. However if you turn it too far to the right, it goes cold again. There IS hot water but the knob makes NO sense so you really have to just play with it. It goes from lukewarm, to warm, to hot, to cold. We stayed at the hotel because we won the bid on Travelocity's top secret hotels... They have it listed as a 3 star with a 4 star user rating. However, I would have ranked it as a 2, maybe 3 star. It's clean enough but the facility is old and its age shows. Our TV remote didn't work and when we requested a downstairs unit with 1 king bed as opposed to 2 smaller beds, they were unable to accommodate us. We only stayed for 1 night so we didn't require much. There are no elevators in the 2-story complexes so keep that in mind if you don't want to lug your luggage up stairs. I wouldn't call this a Resort as much as a Motel. All the doors open to the outside and if you have noisy neighbors, you will definitely hear them (whether in or outside their rooms). With the mandatory $7.50 "resort fee" that they tack on to all reservations, it brings the price up to a rate that I would have rather spent elsewhere for someplace nicer and newer. There are plenty of better options in Florida. There is no free internet. There is no free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “For the Cost No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: rickcardo
Reviews.Content: good low cost accomodations......coffee in room ......no complaints............

Reviews.Title: “Decent room - get deals from groupon or roomsaver.com”
Reviews.Author: gaby_pa
Reviews.Content: We bought $99 Groupon coupon for two night stay in the pool view room including $30 food credit. We saw similar promotion for $39.99 per night from roomsaver.com (it is a hotel coupon book that you can find at the diners or restaurants -- see photo). It means you do not need to use Groupon to get deals. The room interior is decent but we like it. Mattress is little hard. Prepaid breakfast coupon is $8 which is not bad. If not prepaid, breakfast is $9.50. To take advantage of the food credit, buy breakfast coupons or food in the premises and charge them to the hotel room – do not pay cash. When you check out, you will get $30 discount of the total food purchase. It rained so we did not try the pool. Free shuttle to Animal Kingdom is at 9.25 AM and returns at 5.20 PM. Overall experience is good.

Reviews.Title: “just fine”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: This place was a good value for what I paid. My two complaints were that there was no hot water for the shower in the morning (Brrr!), and that there was no coffee maker in the room. The place is a little hard to find because access is a little road off the street with a low profile sign.

Reviews.Title: “Not a vacation”
Reviews.Author: nhdreaming
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January for two nights using a Groupon coupon for $99 for two nights lodging plus $30 food credit. Our room was located on the first floor overlooking the pool. The door didn't appear to lock securely, and looks like it easily could have been jimmied open. The room itself was very basic, with cheap furnishings. It definitely has the look of a room way beyond its prime. It was adequately clean, but everything just seemed grungy. The bedding was very sparse (a sheet, blanket, and paper-thin coverlet), and we ended up freezing the first night, as the heating/ac unit cycles, so it went from cool to chilly throughout the night. The shower never got warmer than lukewarm. We complained at the desk, and the person at the desk wrote a request for maintenance to come which merely said "shower". My husband left a far more detailed note in the room about what was wrong with the shower, but it was not fixed. The second night we were there, numerous kids were running back and forth past our room around 9-10 pm. Later on, there must have been a party or two going on nearby as there was shouting and music and mayhem into the wee hours of the night. My husband boldly put his head out the door and politely asked them to keep it down, but to no avail. We went to the breakfast buffet offered at the restaurant, as we had the $30 food credit. While there was a lot of food offered, it was nothing special, with the exception of the "egg man" who will make a custom omelet for you. That was really the only decent part about breakfast. With so many places to stay in the Orlando area, I would recommend you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for the price”
Reviews.Author: ChuckP22180
Reviews.Content: Since I was traveling "on my own dime" I searched for a bargain in the area. I found one of those deals (on Yahoo) where you have to pay up front first before you get the name of the hotel. However, I did see that the "secret" hotel was recommended by most of the reviewers so I figured it can't a total loss. For $22/night (+$15 "resort" fee) I took a shot and it turns out it's the Maingate Lakeside Resort. Location is EXCELLENT..walking to distance or very short drive to tons of shopping and eating. A very quick drive to any of the Disney attractions. The place is a tad run down and in need of renovation. Don't expect a high def flat screen TV but the free Wi-Fi worked just fine. The room appeared fairly clean with no signs of roaches, bedbugs or other unwanted critters. Bed was reasonably comfortable. I give it a thumbs up if you are looking for just a place to sleep and save some money to spend elsewhere. If you are looking for a fancy, classy place...look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Sufficient”
Reviews.Author: Suz259
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just one night as a convenient location for the airport and Disney. This is a motel style property, 2 floors. The room was clean (although I did find 2 plastic cups lodged behind the night table...so makes me wonder if it only appears clean on the surface), comfortable beds. Unfortunately our tub had issues with the water draining, but not a big deal. The walls are thin, so if you end up with neighbors who have crying/noisy kids or like to listen to a loud TV you may have a hard time sleeping. Also, being motel style you'll hear people out in the parking lot and walking past your room. The price did seem to be a good value though but be aware of the daily resort fee (they do have wi-fi though). They have an onsite breakfast buffet, which I didn't try and an onsite Pizza Hut. Pros: Conveniently located close to Disney Located right next door to a Walgreens for any last minute items you may have forgotten and within walking distance of many restaurants Mini-fridge in the room Resort like - pond, small mini-golf course and a couple of nicely heated pools Cons: Slightly older with some wear/tear and questionable housekeeping? Noisier than a hotel would be

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great room, perfectly clean”
Reviews.Author: Elisa R
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my husband and my two year old by September 11, 2011. I was worried about my stay after reading awfuls reviews, I didnt knew what to expect since I booked thru Hotwire.com, however, I was very amazed on how good the resort really is. We did a lot or tourism in our stayed, and when we came back to the room, it was perfectly clean, folded sheets, and new blankets and sheets every single day. Not to count on how awesome it was that they always refilled our soap, shampoo, hand cream and towels also. We stayed a full day on the resort, just wandering and enjoying the pool. And again, we return to a perfectly organized and clean room. Not to mention all the mess that my little one did every day. Just steps away is a Walgreens, Pizza Hut and Cici's pizza (where we ate two nights because it was so cheap). Overall, I definetly love our stay there, and will definetly go there again. At my checkout the front desk guy even let me take the keys of the room as a souvenir. Excellent staff! Really helpful people all around!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value but it's time for a refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeNWOhio
Reviews.Content: This hotel was selected for us by a well-known pre-pay site and was listed as 2 stars. I think it had more amenities than a 2-star but the place is definitely due for refurbishment. If the 2-star rating reflects condition, that's about the right number of stars IMO. I will give it 4-stars overall because it was a good value and the staff was friendly and helpful. Just keep your expectations in check with respect to the condition of the property. Check-in was smooth as we arrived about 3:30 pm. I had called ahead so I was prepared for the $7.50 "resort" fee but I feel like I'm being ripped off when I don't use whatever a resort fee is supposed cover. We used the beds, the sink, the toilet, the shower and the TV and I believe those are covered in the room rate! We did not use the pool, the safe, the coffee machine (was initially missing a part but was replaced after we dropped it off and went to dinner) or the phone which I discovered was inoperable when I tried to phone the front desk as we were leaving. The resort fee is obviously just a way to extract additional revenue, especially, from folks who use pre-paid room sites to get the room at a reduced price. If hotel management reads this review and wants to explain what we got for our $7.50, I'm sure everyone would love to know. The doors open directly to the outside. We were quite concerned when we first saw the door because it was very dirty and beat up. The door handle/locking mechanism was also a bit battered and ancient looking and it took several tries to get open because we couldn't figure out the proper slide, turn, push, open sequence for the very heavy door. The room was large with 2 full-size beds that were comfortable. The TV was ancient but it worked and there was a large mini-fridge that was very cold. There was also a table with 2 chairs. I swiped a wet washcloth across the carpet to determine the level of cleanliness because the stains give an impression of uncleanliness. Not too bad but I decided to keep my slippers on at all times. The AC/wall heater was old and worn. The control knob positions did not correlate to the settings printed on the panel. After some experimentation, I determined one of the mystery settings was "heat with thermostat" so we could keep the chill off but not cook during the night. There was free wi-fi that worked well and the water pressure in the shower was strong. If you have a noisy family, you might want to think twice about staying here. In the morning, we heard someone in the neighboring room announce it was "time to get up" which tells me the walls are a bit thin. We would stay again at the right price and I would recommend the room to anyone who can temper their expectations regarding the condition of the room. Pros - Staff was pleasant and helpful, excellent location, plenty of parking near room, large vanity area, comfortable beds, big and cold mini-fridge, mini coffee maker with 4 packs of coffee, good water pressure in the shower. Cons - $7.50 "resort" fee, stained carpet that gives the impression of uncleanliness, heating/AC unit controls that were a guessing game, 29" non-flat screen television (interesting trying to watch a bball game, tiny players), grungy entry door, tricky entry door handle.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than I Expected...”
Reviews.Author: AlumniGuy
Reviews.Content: My family and I typically do the unadvised and spend a day at one of the Disney parks between Christmas and the New Year. We've tried various local hotels (with varying degrees of satisfaction). This year, our Hotwire $35 purchase landed us at Maingate Lakeside Resort. We were treated well upon check-in, but upon arrival at our room, it was clear that it had not been cleaned. We called the office and within 3 minutes, a gentleman arrived and showed us to a room next door that was prepared and ready. It is a motel with exterior entrances and our room faced one of at least 2 pools on the property. It was too cold to use but looked nice. There was also a free small mini-golf course on site but again we were unable to enjoy it. The wireless internet was complimentary and worked well. Free breakfast was not included but we paid the $8/person and enjoyed a VERY nice buffet there at the hotel. It included made to order omelettes, a wide variety of fresh fruit, bacon, eggs, biscuits and gravy, oatmeal, grits, etc. If you stay here, don't miss it! This is one of the closest hotels to Animal Kingdom and that was our destination...very easy to get there (maybe 7 minutes) but do get directions for getting back as it is a bit tricky. They offer a free shuttle to the Disney parks and a couple other Orlando theme parks but the times they offered didn't work for us. There is a Walgreens next door where we were able to grab some ponchos and a variety of snacks for the Disney parks...I recommend it as we saved a bundle!!! There are also an abundance of budget and family friendly restaurants nearby. All in all, we were pleased with our stay (especially for the price). It's not a luxury resort by any means so if you come expecting that, you'll be disappointed. I believe there is new ownership here and they are working to make improvements. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful and so I give it a "very good" report for meeting our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY SMASHING!!”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl B
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews before we went i was quite peturbed as to what we were going to.... The hotel was dated but perfectly clean. The maid service was second to none and clean towels and toiletries etc were replaced daily. We had a card which told us that the sheets would be changed whenever the card was left on the bed but please consider the environment...fair enough and true to word our sheets were changed every other day. The beds were comfortable, the shower was great and the vanity area was more than adequate. The breakfast buffet was good value and we found all the staff in EVERY area pleasant and friendly. I did take note of a massive amount of reviews suggesting update to a pool room and did this for ten dollars extra a day and was not dissappointed. The pool was heated and very clean and after being in the disney parks all day was a great bonus as we could have a swim in the evening without freezing!! I think that the free safe was a great idea as i have always paid for this service on every other holiday. The air con was rather noisy but didnt bother us as we fell into bed exhausted every evening anyway! If we are lucky enough to be able to return we will definitely be staying here again as the value for money was second to none! Oh and not ant or cockroach to be seen.... Thankyou everyone who works there.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth B
Reviews.Content: Opinions are very personal. Two people staying in two different rooms in the same hotel can have completely opposite views of the place, simply based on their own personal expectations. My family and I spent 3 weeks here over Christmas/New Year and, having never been to the States before, had no idea what to expect. I read the reviews beforehand and some were good, some were no so good, but the not so good ones were for things like s in the carpet ......... well, it's a 3* hotel, are we really bothered about the stain - are they expected to replace the whole carpet for one stain. No, I'd rather pay a little less and ignore the stain or staff not being friendly. This hotel is situated on a highway, so not necessarily somewhere where you (presumably) have booked to chill at the hotel for the duration of your holiday, so if the receptionist isn't smiley and bending over backwards, does that really matter. Personally, I couldn't have been more happy with my choice. The staff were soooooo accommodating, I was gobsmacked. Any problem/query we had was addressed immediately and everything they did, they did with a smile and "no problem" or "you're welcome" which was completely sincere. I'm amazed that anyone would feel the need to comment "Terrible", but there's an example of differing expectations! My only gripe was the rollaway bed, where it was folded for long periods of time, the springs were distorted and caused lots of uproar with my children, all NOT wanted to sleep on it. We ended up returning it and buying a inflatable bed, but the hotel were kind enough to provide bedding free of charge and waived the cost of the 5 nights that we did use the rollaway. Basically, I think it's probably ok for a short stay over, but not a long one (3 weeks in our case). The two double beds were more comfortable that mine at home ....... if I could've fitted them in my case, I would've ;) Anyway, I would definitely recommend this hotel. Am sure you won't be disappointed ........ well, not unless you get ants in your pants LOL. PS: Hazel in Hurricanes Sams is a legend and Kathy on reception is a master in customer relations!

Reviews.Title: “another success”
Reviews.Author: poppo4daboys
Reviews.Content: this is my third review of this hotel. the first was not good but i have been very pleased since then. this visit, ilke the last one was done via a blind reservation without knowing the hotel being booked until it is done. This time i used travelocity's super secret reservations instead of Hotwire's plan. I really thought I would be staying elsewhere because I changed services but was pleased none the less. If you book via the travelocity secret hotels or hotwire, select a three star in kissimmee with a price in the low $20's. Most likely you will get this hotel. It is clean, comfortable, well maintained. The breakfast buffet is a good deal and a big time saver. I am sure I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Ants in your Pants? No, but in the fridge, walls, bathroom and bed? YES!”
Reviews.Author: Nickylegs
Reviews.Content: A wonderful welcome by the gentleman in a lovely reception area left us with great expectation for this holiday, following a wonderful flight and transfer with Virgin Atlantic. Unfortunately, the rooms didnt reflect the great start or the recption! Tired and unwelcoming, not cleaned properly, and then the discovery of ANTS everywhere. Not a good start- neither was the holiday reps reaction when we complained - there are insects in America she told us..... yes we know, but we didnt expect them to be getting board and lodgings with us! The hotel swapped us to another room but there were still ants, just on a lesser scale and we lost the connecting door facility which we had specified as we were travelling with a teenager. Also there was no way of avoiding walking through a smoking area to get to our room, horrid smelly area and not somewhere you want to walk through with your children. The hotel complex didnt feel safe - I think this was the dark and dankness of the place. The highlights - Golden Corall all you can eat buffet and the best food was at Sizzlers just further down on Highway 192. Friendly staff at all of the Disney and Universal parks - the UK could learn a lot from their customer service enthusiasm.

Reviews.Title: “stealing and crazy noises”
Reviews.Author: Victor H
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for 3 nights. The housekeeper (Debra) steal my phone charger and there was nothing the hotel can do. we call the front desk and complain about it but they hung up our calls. Finally they sent somebody to the room and asked what was going on but the person disappeared after knowing our situation. When we were checking out, we complained about the charger being stolen the front desk person (Brandon) ask us to fill out a form and didn't even try to show a bit of care. after we are done he said that we probably left it somewhere in our bags and he was sure that we were mistaken. It was a terrible service there. and through all 3 nights there were crazy deep noises all night. that really drove me crazy. otherwise, the bed was really nice, the room was clean, bathroom was really clean. the price is very reasonable. if you are planing to stay there just remember to lock your stuff even the smallest things. fyi, they do charged some extra service fee. even though it wasn't much but we were shocked. it was 22.50 for 3 nights. IF YOU ARE BRING AN IPAD - you wont be able to use it other than in the lobby. there's no wireless internet in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: ramon560
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Orlando the night before we were to check into a disney resort hotel. We needed a place to stay and found this property online. We were a little skeptical since it was priced on hotels.com at $39 per night, but we decided to take a risk. It was wonderful. The rooms were spacious, (larger than the room we had at disney) and it had a fridge in the room. We liked it so much that after we checked out of our disney hotel we stayed there one more night before we made our drive home. The only complaint I had was on our second night, there was mold growing on the ceiling above the shower, and when it came time to check out, the front desk seemed under staffed. I waited about 15 minutes before the 1 staff member checking people out got to me. There was another person at a computer further down the desk, but she wasn't assisting the guy, she was just working on her computer the whole time. I would recommend this place to anyone staying in the Disney World area.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping doesn't do their job & make up lies to cover.”
Reviews.Author: Danny D
Reviews.Content: After 1st day of NO housekeeping, we called & they told us they only serviced every other day. But then the desk manager said they changed sheets every other day, but towels & cleaning everyday. (not for us apparently). Then after 2nd day, the housekeeping crew put a "do not disturb" sign in the key slot so they wouldn't have to clean that day either. (they did this to my room & son's room next door.) Then housekeeping told the manager that the sign was there when they arrived. And he believed them over us. So I guess it would be a good place to be employed... You get paid, don't have to work, and get backed up by your manager. Bottom line, just avoid this place. If they lose business because of this review , it's worth my bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “cheap hotel low quality”
Reviews.Author: balaji b
Reviews.Content: Could not know the name of resort or hotel I was going to stay. Travelocity rated this hotel "Maingate lakeside resort" in kissemmee,FL as 3 start but in reality it is 1 star. I was given 2 full size beds supposed to be 2 doubles for me & my wife. pillows without covers. pillows and pillow covers completely worn out restroom is only 5' x 5', no microwave, onsite restaurant sucks $10 for buffet which does not include soft drinks or juices, there are many restaurants offering all you can eat breakfast for just $5 close by. even the soap, shampoo provided are horrible. Had to wait 4 hours to get couple of towels. Wireless internet not good reception. Clock / alarm does not work. Coffee machine was missing coffee tray, could not drink coffee. On top of this there is an resort fee of $7.5 / day. Could not use available safe because I was told an engineer has to come to the room to show me how to use it and I have to wait 20 to 30 minutes for the engineer.

Reviews.Title: “RUBBISH!!”
Reviews.Author: bethany r
Reviews.Content: After stay at this hotel for 3 days i hated it!!!!!!!!!!!!! After coming back from a theme park on the 3rd day we had been robbed the staff were not very helpful and not at all sympathetic. And there were ants and cockroaches in the room that came out from behind the wardrobe.. So will defiantly not be going back to this hotel ever again and i would certainly NOT recommend this hotel!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: flip8683
Reviews.Content: Spent the past three days at the Mingate lakeside and enjoyed the hotel and llocation. Also wanted to give a shout out to the bartender Cris who provided us with very good information on attending a Magic game while we were there. Hotel is located very close to Disney and seaworld and every fast food and restaurants on Bronson Highway. Breakfast buffet was good and staff was very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Good for a Cheap Hotel - Might Skip Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Anne S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is older but fairly well-maintained. I booked a room with two queen beds for $39, $50 with taxes. I opted for the breakfast buffet, which was no better or worse than a college cafeteria. They're very specific about only allowing one drink per breakfast - no refills. Also, you had to ask the waitress to bring milk for the cereal. The hotel is right by Walgreens, which was convenient. I would definitely stay there again, but I wouldn't pay more than $50/night.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money”
Reviews.Author: Miamiguy786
Reviews.Content: This place is disorganized. To say the least they may be pet friendly but they need to get the staff together and explain the policies because the staff was really ignorant and on Christmas Eve would not let us check in our room after we advanced booked a pet room and made several calls to make sure we would have no problems. The manager was not flexible or helpful and I hope nobody stays there with these people. In a word ... HORRIBLE!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For The Price & Location”
Reviews.Author: Andrew G
Reviews.Content: After spending 10 days over Thanksgiving 2011 at the Maingate Lakeside Resort (Old Best Western) I would recommend this hotel for the Location, Price and Quality for what you pay. It is not a 5 star hotel so dont expect the luxury, it was great for what we needed as when you are in Orlando you only need your hotel for bed and shower, We usually stay elsewhere on the 192 but would definately use the Maingate Resort again. The room was adequate with 2 beds, seating area, vanity area and bathroom. It had TV with numerous channels, a fridge freezer and coffee making facilities which was replenished every day, Also the WIFI in the room had really excellent coverage. The room cleaning was done every day usually in the morning apart from one day when it was at 4pm. The hotel has 2 large pools which were very nice with added touches of a pool bar and large TV screen for the evening, There was also a crazy golf course, childrens playground and basketball court over looking the lake. The only quims I have was the daily fee of $7.50 which I felt was quite high especially as I overheard other persons checking in were only paying $3.50 a day and I also requested a room on the second floor away from the carpark but didnt get this. When i return to the Maingate Resort I will pay the little extra for a pool view or lake view room as these seem to be the newest and away from the carparking. To sum up a great hotel for the price, quality and location for Disney

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: DavMick
Reviews.Content: I feel that after five stays at this hotel I should finally write a review of this hotel. This is without a doubt the best value hotel in the area. The staff are always accomodating, the place is always kept clean and tidy and the location is second to none. I will break it down into god bits and bits that need attention. Staff: Always friendly, always helpful. The pool bar manager Chris is a delight if somewhat indiscrete but that just adds to the joy of having a pre-dinner drink with him, you know you are going to be entertained and informed. He is also a font of local knowledge. Rooms: Good size with plenty of storage space, fridge, coffee machine, hair dryer, iron and board, A/C and TV what more could you want. We have always found the rooms are kept clean and well serviced and that the room staff are more than happy to supply you with extra towel, coffee etc should you need them. Location: This is the best bit, not only is it a very short drive to Disney etc the locale provides a number of excellent restaurants all within walking distance. Red Lobster, you couldn't buy prawns in the UK for what you get a lobster here for, Carabbas, excellent Italian restaurant, great food and atmosphere. Buffalo Wild Wings, big sports bar serving good food at great prices and if you are brave enough to try the Wild hot sauce on your wings you are a braver man than me. Shonneys for a great breakfast. I could go on and on but you get the picture. It's just so nice to get back from a day out and wander across the road for a good meal and a drink without having to drive to get there. In addition there is a big supermarket across the road and a Walgreens in the car park park for food and stuff plus all the usual souvenir shops within walking distance. All in all this is great hotel, three pools, bar, restaurant and a good holiday gym. Bits that need attention: This hotel is nearly 40 years old and is not the type of hotel popular with Americans. I think its something to do with the open plan nature of the place. My feeling is that they prefer somewhere more enclosed from a security perspective. That said the hotel is a good area with night security not that we have ver encountered any problems of that nature. Decor: The place could do with in some places a lick of paint but I understand that the new owners have an upgrade plan that was being started whilst we were there in November so hopefully this can be resolved. Resort charge: I just can't work this one out. You can add an extra $3.00 per day to your stay person for this but what is it for. I have asked but never really got a satisfactory answer. My feeling is that you pay for your stay and that should be it. The charge isn't hidden Ijust don't know what you get for it. In house food: With so much local competition I feel that the new owners really need to look at the pricing of their breakfasts and the on site Pizza Hut especailly when you can walk 50 yards down the road to CiCi's Pizza and get a 15" pizza freshly cooked for £3.50 or an all you can eat buffet for about £5.50. I feel that it would be of great benefit to the owners and patrons to compete with the local eateries than just hope that you will eat there because you are staying there. Air Conditioning: Boy is it noisy. Fortunately I sleep with the Gods so rarely does it disturb me but I have been told by the boss that when it comes on in the middle of the night it sounds like a helicopter is landing in the room. My personal opinion is drink Marguaritas and you wont here it. Seriously though I again think it ia an age thing but it does need addressing. Summation: Would I recommend this hotel to my friends and family. In the blink of an eye. Unfortunaely it is unlikely I will be returing in the near future as it is now difficult to convince my 19 year old son that "It's a Small World" is the best ride in Orlando and that he rally should queue to get his photo taken with Mickey Duck. Book it and it will make you holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Price / Quality”
Reviews.Author: MarkWijman
Reviews.Content: This is a somewhat dated hotel that offers very good value for money ($25 per night / per room). Rooms are clean, staff is "efficient" and location is pretty good for a Disney visit. In respect of what is paid for this property offers as much as can be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the price for the quality.”
Reviews.Author: Careree
Reviews.Content: I stayed here and thought it was fantastic. Great price! Wish the beds were a little better. But not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: adie c
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights late Oct 2011. Fantastic. Clean rooms, helpful staff. Close to all Disney stuff. Would recommend and would definately revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: Chexie21
Reviews.Content: Right next to EVERYTHING!! Minutes from Disney and has a shuttle that you can use to get to he parks. Huge pools and great rooms. They have movies playing at the pool after dark. There are alot of kids thst yell in the hallways in the morning but being so close to disney Its to be expected. Defiantly recommend and will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debbie W
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from staying at this Hotel for 2 weeks and was pleased with my choice. The rooms are very clean but basic. The Hotel was really quite so had most of the time the pool to ourselves. The transport from the Hotel to the parks was really good and we never had any problems with this.
