The breakfasts were very good and the children are free with a paying adult. The Hotel is well situated and everything that you needed was in walking distance. Would recommend the Chinese Buffet, TGI Fridays, Cici's Pizzas and Sizzlers. These restaurants except TFI are very basic but we found the food to be very nice. All in all we had a very good time here.

Reviews.Title: “No Longer Best Western but not a problem”
Reviews.Author: Hibby
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2009 so had no worries about returning. Even though the resort is under new management there were many familiar faces among the staff. It was very quiet during our stay and on the days we stayed at the pool, more often than not we had it to ourselves. On arrival there were problems with the curtains in our room that would not close but these were reported and sorted out very quickly. The rooms are in need of an upgrade and I believe that there are plans in the pipeline for this to happen. All in all, a good location with plenty of amenities close by and excellent for Disney and Orlando attractions.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: BarryR328
Reviews.Content: As we only paid c£30 a night (inc now reduced $3.50 per day resort fee), we got what we expected. Generally clean and free mini golf a plus for the kids. Shuttle works but has a limited schedule and is "First come first served". We ate breakfasts at Sizzlers (200m on otherside of road from hotel) using a "Kids Eat Free" card, which meant we paid much less than in the hotel. Only real gripe was that one day room was not cleaned, we advised the reception they came back (whilst we were out) and changed bins and left clean towels, but didn't make the beds, as we had left pyjamas on them (+ kids bedtime soft toys). Really strange rule ! Brandon Wilson (Asst Front Office manager) then resolved and even threw in a couple of complimentary drinks for the trouble.

Reviews.Title: “sue57,catterick,north yorkshire,uk”
Reviews.Author: Sue L
Reviews.Content: having stayed here before was expecting same great hotel but was very disappointed lights not working telephone broke door not closing properly asked for connecting rooms but none available didnt even have our rooms down for day we arrived 10/10/11 but next day 11/10/11 would really have to improve before we would think about staying here again

Reviews.Title: “as good as ever”
Reviews.Author: lordelpus
Reviews.Content: Check in was fast and efficient but when we got to our room we could not get in so i returned to reception and informed them of this, they said to return to the room and a member of staff would be there soon, when i got back there was a nice man called Donnie waiting for me. He let us in and then repaired the door lock. The room itself was spotlessly clean and had a great view overlooking the lake. Our usual house keeper was called Lela, she was a lovely lady with whom we had a few good laughs. The three pools were all spotless, tidy and with ample sun beds and parasols for all who needed them. If you want a place to stay that is central to all the attractions then this hotel would suit you well. this was our third visit and we will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for 1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: jobeis
Reviews.Content: I booked this with hotwire for a 1 night stay in December, 2010 before we checked into our time-share. The price was right for 1 night and we wanted clean and quiet. We got that in our room, it was away from the main road and from the huge group that was staying there. The room was clean and basic. Front desk service was not the greatest. The huge group staying there took up a lot of the space and also many of the front desk people's time. I had to wait about 20 minutes to check-in and it was around 6 p.m. There was either a Wal-green or something similar just in front of the hotel so we walked over and stocked up on things, which was handy. I checked out around 8 a.m. the next morning with the same group hanging around the lobby and causing another wait of 20 minutes or so. I would not book this hotel for more than 1 night or for more than $40. But it fit our needs at the time.

Reviews.Title: “hotel not what i thought it expected”
Reviews.Author: Andrew L
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel in october 2011 and found it to be very basic front door to room was rotten ,the room itself was very dark needed lights on night and day to see and very dated. room phone was broke 3 of the lights did not work and the hairdryer had to be relaced . the beds wernt that big either. the pool was not heated and the aircon in the room was loud.good job all we did was sleep their as i found hotel not to be welcoming .staff wernt to bad public coke machine was empty on arrival and was still empty on departure.

Reviews.Title: “they don't keep their promises”
Reviews.Author: Jetske K
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated near disney, and reasonably priced. But what you pay is what you get. The room did not smell nice, and the toilet seat was covered with something pink. We stayed 4 nights. The second day when we returned from a day in the theme park, everything in the fridge was frozen including a full glass bottle of whine. It had burst open, there was glass everywhere in the fridge. Someone came to repair the fridge, but they could not replace the bottle of wine. The next morning a manager gave me what I had paid for the wine, and she promised me she would have someone from housekeeping clean out the fridge. That evening, nobody had cleaned the fridge, and the toilet was full with dirt in the water. So if you look for a reasonably priced hotel, expect lesser service, and no cleanliness. I don't like people who don't keep their promises. Bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Basic stopover for resort visits”
Reviews.Author: researchassist
Reviews.Content: Good parking, easy location to travel from just off a main road. Short drive time from parks, and easy with a satnav. Food - absolutely terrible in my opinion (and my son's, who will eat virtually any junk). Fair opposite worth a walk to, but some scary locals there. Hold on to your bag! Front desk staff ranged from reasonable to rude. Swimming pool looked dirty, but plenty of people using it, so maybe not as bad as it looked. View from our room really nice over the fun fair opposite, and off into Orlando. I'd recommend this hotel if you just want a base, but not if you want to spend evenings there.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean rooms, allows pets!!!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaBarbie
Reviews.Content: I was very worried after reading some of the reviews. Pleasantly surprised!! Clean spacious room, lots of drawers, huge armoire, frig in room!!! Lovely pet park to let the pooch run! Minutes to WDW!! Service was pleasant and professional. Will definitely be back!! And we're used to staying onsite......this a perfect hotel especially if traveling with pet!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: churvapinay
Reviews.Content: I'm so thankful that we were able to book @Maingate Lakeside Resort. The room was super relaxing, clean, comfty, and environmental friendly! It's a center of everything...shopping...food....theme parks...I'm pretty sure..we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Does its job”
Reviews.Author: scalderin2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a resort, rooms are basic and not the cleanest. The price is great especially for the location. Again nothing special. It has a pizza hut on site , oh and beware , they charge a daily "resort" fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Chris W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here many times when it was the Best Western, Great hotel and great location! The layout is great and hurricane sams is a nice place to grab a brew.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills for Cheap Price”
Reviews.Author: anthrojason
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this motel for two nights while visiting disney. We got the hotel as a price line mystery hotel (we didn't know in advance this would be the hotel) Our room ended up looking exactly like the room in the photo with the blue bedspreads, although obviously a little less "perfect." This place is huge, but it is not really a resort. We were one of only a handful of the many rooms that seemed to be occupied which made for a quiet stay. There were only a couple of people in the pool when we went. It is close to Disney. The biggest cons for us were 1) there was only a bar of soap (and two bottles of hand lotion) in the room-- no shampoo or conditioner. A tiny bottle appeared the next day after the room was serviced. 2) There was a cricket in the room that we never did find, but it chirped all night, both nights. We told the front desk and were met with a blank stare and a what do you want us to do about it attitude. 3) The AC turns off automatically after running for 10 minutes. Then it's off for about 20 minutes and then it turns on for another 10 minutes. When it is on, you freeze. When it first turns off, you're comfortable for about 5 minutes and then it is uncomfortably hot for the remaining 15 minutes until it turns on again. We fiddled with all of the buttons and even tried turning it off and back on, but it seemed to have a mind of its own.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: floorlayer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the 3rd time in 4 years, we booked in 9th september 2011 for 3 weeks, we chose this hotel again because of the location and ease of getting around to Disney and Universal all within 15 mins drive. and plenty of restaurants all on your doorstep but at the same time a quiet and peaceful location. Yes the rooms are basic and could do with an update, but the beds are comfortable and the rooms have all the facilities that you would need and the rooms are cleaned daily. If you are used to staying in somewhere like a Hilton then dont expect the same quality for the price, we did feel that standards have slipped over the last couple of years but understand it is under new management and things are meant to be changing in a positive way. But with so much to see and do, unless you are a hermit crab, you won't be spending much time in the hotel room anyway, The hotel has 3 pools which are all heated and are maintained to a very high standard with plenty of sunbeds and parasols and areas of shade, they also have poolside bars which serve drinks and food, although these were not open at all during the whole of our stay but do realise that this was not peak period. There is a Walgreens shop 30 seconds walk from the hotel which is open 24hours, they sell everything under the sun, Imagine a mix between a mini Tesco, Boots, Co-op, Toys R us and you could be somewhere close. there is also a large supermarket approx 5 mins walk across the road similar to Tesco which is near a TGI Fridays where you can get an amazing meal with truly amazing service. Overall You can't go wrong with staying here and we will definitely be back again in a couple of years time. If you need to know anything about the area, there is a maintenance guy called Roger who is the most friendly,helpful,informative, amusing person you will meet, he really made our whole family welcome.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, clean, and safe”
Reviews.Author: kennyboy69
Reviews.Content: I Stayed here Sept 22nd - Oct 6th 2011 at first i had reservations about the hotel, after reading some bad reviews, and that they no longer were carrying the "best western" name but after excellent communication voicing my concerns before we went with the director of rooms Ellen - my concerns were took care of The hotel is dated, no boubt about that, the rooms could do with a make over and i believe they are getting one very soon. but my stay in the 2 weeks was excellent - the rooms although basic were clean, comfortable, and the maid service was very good, cleaned every day, fresh towels, and always extra cofee if we requested it. When we first arrived there was no plug for the bath, one call to reception and there was a maintenance guy knocking on the door to take care of it. the pool area was clean, and the pools were heated, and open from 7.00am - 11.00pm - so it was good to have a swim after a long day at the parks one suggestion for the makeover would be to stick in a Jacuzzi to realy soothe those aching legs the location is ideal on the 192 with numerous restaurants in the area with walking distance, our favourite without doubt was the orlando ale house about a mile from the hotel they had a kids eat free on tues including meal, drink, and ice cream desert, and a bucket of 5 buds for $7.95 and the place is wonderful, with a great atmosphere. we also liked buffalo wild wings, bahama breeze, sizzlers, ponderosa, golden coral, and many others closeby - which is why we never ate in the hotel one good tip i was given is to sign up the all the local restaurants email list and you will get loads of vouchers for free drinks, meals, and discounts which saved us a small fortune with a 14 year old that eats us out of house and home minutes from disney and good roads to get around to either universal, or sea world etc I will defo stay at the maingate lakeside resort again, i think if you do have any issues, they will be sorted quickly and efficiently, making you stay a memorable part of your holiday i get the impression that standards in the passed have slipped and maybe they had become complacent, but you can tell now that with new staff and managers thay are doing all they can to make sure customer service and quality is their number one priority - they certainly did it for us warm regards Ken

Reviews.Title: “Consumer Beware”
Reviews.Author: Carol P
Reviews.Content: The room was full of Florida mold. Other than the condition of the room, I was surprised by all the extra resort fees I had to pay which I was not aware of when I made my reservation. Upon checking out I was advised by the clerk the I had to pay a fee because I booked the room through the internet. Why not let me know about the fees before checking in. There are two additional fees charged to my credit card. I do not have any idea what these charges are for. I don't expect a clear explanation when I contact Maingate with my dispute.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: Lee H
Reviews.Content: We first stayed here in September 2008 and more recently in February 2011. Being just the two of us, we wanted to enjoy a Disney / Universal holiday with our hotel as more of a base camp than an all-encompassing focal point of our trip - and for that the Lakeside was a perfect destination. On both visits the rooms were immaculate, well-equipped for our needs, comfortable, spacious and pleasant. While it's not the Four Seasons, it certainly exceeded our expectations for the price that we paid. The hotel is very well equipped for everything - the on-site store in the main building was perfect for a morning coffee and for the little snacks to keep one going, the Pizza Hut on-site was excellent and really good value, Hurricane Sam's was a great place to watch sport and enjoy a beer, the pools were very clean and a nice temperature and the little things like the basketball courts, the miniature golf and the pool bars really add to the value. There were other services available such as stamps, Internet access, phones and laundry which while we didn't use, we saw they represented good value. We also rented a car from the onsite rental team who did us a great deal and were really helpful with everything. The staff were all very friendly and helpful from the moment we arrived. Rich, in particular, who worked in the Hurricane Sam's Bar within the main building was brilliant - really friendly and chatty, took the time to talk to us about the NFL and NBA, and mixed some excellent cocktails for us. He was a pleasure to deal with, remembering our names and faces when we went back some 18 months later. The location is a perfect base for a Disney holiday - if you rent a car then it is around 10 minutes to the main Disney entrances. If you don't rent a car (like us on first visit) then the hotel's shuttle service was fantastic - convenient times, friendly drivers and very clear and easy pick-up locations. They were on time every day and really are a great way to do the parks. Nearby the site are all the things you could want - restaurants and bars within a 5 minute walk, a Walgreens next door is literally a stone throw away, and just about every fast-food chain is within a 5 minute walk from the door to the room. While a car is handy for trips to Busch Gardens, Florida Mall et al, we went 2 weeks on our first visit wihtout one and it was never an issue. In addition to the shuttle buses to the park, there is so much within walking distance, and taxi fares are so cheap in comparison to the UK that if you are there for Disney you really won't need one. I'd reccomend this hotel to anybody who is looking to do Disney - but want the parks and the Disney experience to be the lasting memory of their holiday. Again, it doesn't try to be an all-out 5-star experience (and to be fair, you wouldn't expect that from the price) - however the staff, the services, the location and the convenience it provides as a base camp certainly earn it a 5-star rating from us. We are even going back for a third time in February 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty much what we were after - excellent location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: CaffTwo
Reviews.Content: Have recently returned from a fortnight's holiday here, having booked it as part of a package with Virgin Holidays. We stayed here a few years ago when it was the Best Western Lakeside and liked it, so booked it again on the strength of that and it's good Trip Advisor rating at the time. I'd been a little concerned about the recent falling rating and mixed reviews but have to say that we found it pretty much as we remembered it when we got there which was something of a relief! Our room was on the ground floor in Building 7 overlooking the car park, which meant it was really quiet, and had everything we needed including a fridge with freezer compartment, large safe, decent shower, ample space and free wifi which wasn't the fastest in the world but pretty reliable and fine for basic web browsing, checking email etc. Our room was made up every day, towels changed when we left them on the floor in the bathroom (if you leave them on the rail, they assume you're happy to reuse them), and overall we were pretty comfortable. We had an issue with the safe running out of batteries on our second morning but this was dealt with promptly after reporting it to reception so no complaints on the service front. As far as the rest of the hotel goes, we used a couple of the hotel's pools a few times, had cinnamon rolls from the hotel store for breakfast most mornings (they do a breakfast buffet but we were trying not to overeat too much!) and had dinner in the bar/restaurant several times during our stay when we'd had a big lunch or just didn't fancy driving out to eat in the evening - we found the menu to be simple but tasty (the deep fried cheesecake is fantastic!) and really liked the relaxed atmosphere in there, aided greatly by Richard who was fab and really, really friendly. We also used the hotel laundry halfway through our trip - a single load washed and dried cost $5 - and made use of other handy facilities the hotel has such as a stamp vending machine and post box for sending postcards. Where this hotel really stands out is in its location - as well as being a five minute drive from World Drive (I think as the crow flies it's closer to some of the Disney Parks than a lot of the Disney hotels) there's a Walgreens Pharmacy right next door which we found handy for picking up multipacks of Evian and a few other bits and bobs, and various restaurants within spitting distance including Cici's, TGI Fridays, Giordanos, Outback Steakhouse and Carrabba's Italian Grill. We did have a couple of niggles during our stay - the aircon units in the rooms are on the noisy side, we'd have liked the bedding to be a bit more substantial (we missed having a proper duvet/quilt to snuggle into), and we had an unfortunate visitor in our bed one night in the shape of a tiny bug which must have flown in from outside at some point and bit us overnight, although when we alerted reception to this they were apologetic. The hotel does need a bit of a lick of paint in some places, and it's not the sort of hotel we'd holiday in if staying in the UK (when most/all of the holiday cost goes on the hotel and so we want more in the way of luxury and mod cons), but if you're after a Disney/Universal holiday and just want a decent hotel with decent facilities in a good location then you can't go far wrong with this place in my opinion and we'd definitely consider staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the money”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Maverick182
Reviews.Content: The resort is only a few miles from Disney World and from all the tourist buzz, restaurants and souvenir shops. There is a small lake which is alright. Its called a resort but is more like a motel. The staff is decent. The room, sheets and bedding were clean. The room had a refrigerator which is always nice. There is a small resort fee if you book from one of the discount websites.Good, if you only come in here at night to sleep. All in all, decent for the money.

Reviews.Title: “great price, location and service”
Reviews.Author: smootje
Reviews.Content: we have stayed here several times and once again we are happy we stayed here. Price is great, only a couple miles from Disney and the service is wonderful. Rooms are remodeled and clean as can be. Great place for families or for couples

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the price”
Reviews.Author: Tutoo
Reviews.Content: This is categorized as a resort and it is though it is very dated but clean. We went to visit the attractions in Orlando and found a great deal for this on a travel website. The staff was helpful and the room was clean. No frills but the necessities. The hotel is spread out and we saw two pools, a mini golf course (which we enjoyed), a tiki bar and a basketball court. This place has a small convenient store and a restaurant that we saw serves breakfast, but we went to the breakfast buffet at Ponderosa. There was a resorts fee of $7.50 charged per day but we didn't mind this since even with this included, it was still very affordable. The only complaint is that I wish they had Wi-Fi instead of wired internet. Overall it was a relaxing stay with no complaints

Reviews.Title: “I would have say good for the price i paid for, but they charge me extra $10 per night”
Reviews.Author: Iluvtravel007
Reviews.Content: I would have recommended this hotel since i thought I got it for a very reasonable price( $35 per night), However, when I check out, they charge me for something call a mandatory resort fee for $10 per night. Well, I wouldnt say 45 per night is expensive, however, I wouldnt chose this hotel if I knew I would have to pay 45 per night. It is not a three star hotel by any rating. And there are a lot of better hotels around the area at that price. I had stayed in 1 star hotel they has better room interior than this hotel. The service is so slow. I have to wait around 30 mins for check in, there was only one person in front of me.

Reviews.Title: “We found dirty clothes under our sheets”
Reviews.Author: Amanda S
Reviews.Content: We will never stay here again. We booked via hotwire because it had a 65% recommendation rate, but it was the worst hotel we've ever stayed at. I have never written a review online before, but this was so bad, I felt I had to. Our first night there, we pulled back the sheets on the bed and found dirty socks and a hairpin, and there were brown hairs all over the pillows that we hadn't used yet. The sheets and pillowcases hadn't been washed or changed since the last guests stayed in the room. We tried to call the front desk, but our phone was broken! So we walked to the front desk and they said they would have security bring us new sheets. Well, they did... over an hour later. And he dropped them outside the door in a plastic bad and just knocked on the door. We had to undo and change the beds ourselves. Then we wanted to watch tv, but the tv remote didn't work. The lamp by the tv didn't work. And our door was somehow broken so that at the top it didn't close all the way and we couldn't latch the extra lock hotels put on the doors all the way because of how messed up the door was. I mean, light was shining in through the door, that's how bad it was. When we checked out to leave, they charged us the resort fee (but they took off 1 day for our sheets being dirty- they should have taken off all 3 days) and we left. Then we tried to buy something on the way home. Our card was denied. We used my phone to look up our balance and it showed a $150.00 fee from the hotel! We called the hotel and demanded to know what it was and they said "oh, its a $150 hold for incidentals. We do it to everyone". They didn't even tell us. We gave them out credit card to pay $15, not to hold $150. We will NEVER be staying there again and as soon as the manager calls me back (she wasn't in all 3 days), we're lodging a formal complaint. We're not picky, but dirty clothes under the sheets? That's just gross.

Reviews.Title: “checked out after 10 minutes”
Reviews.Author: CDNfamilytravels
Reviews.Content: In short, the deal was too good to be true. Our room had dirty carpet, a horrible smell, bugs, an incredibly tiny bathroom, broken lampshades and old worn linen. Told the front desk we were disgusted and going elsewhere, and they didn't even ask why or what they could do. Was told by 3 different employees (front desk and back office) that we would be refunded...still arguing with manager via email and phone. Pictures on website are supposedly taken earlier this year, yet the condition of the actual rooms and buildings look like it has been a decade of negelct. I wish we had taken pictures, but we just wanted to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - good location”
Reviews.Author: windrunr
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed here on 4 different occasions this year. Each visit except the last was pretty good. The location is outstanding. When we leave the disney parks, we are in our room in a very short period of time. The rooms are basic but all of the ones we have stayed in have a mini-frig and free WIFI. Many of the 'nicer' resorts in the area don't give you free WIFI and a frig so that is really nice. When you book the room, it says up front that those things are included. I don't like the resort fee but I can live with it if I am getting a frig and WIFI included. That said, on our last visit, the frig was not working, the clothes iron wasn't working and the WIFI wouldn't connect. They replaced the frig and iron in a reasonable time but never got the WIFI to work. I tried to get it working for the two days that we stayed but no luck. When I tried to discuss it with the folks at the front desk, they did write down my complaints but did not seem to be a bit concerned about trying to make it right or offer any apologies for the services included in my price not being available. I would not say they were rude, just indifferent. We are debating whether or not we'll stay here next time in favor of giving someone else a try. Overall my experience with them has been good. As always you get what you pay for. It is old and it is definitely not a resort but it is a reasonably clean place to sleep, close to the parks and is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Will NOT be back”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany H
Reviews.Content: We just spent the weekend at this hotel (August 12-14, 2011). This was our 4th stay at this hotel and it will be our last. On previous visits, the hotel was a Best Western but apparently it just changed hands last week. The first room they gave us the floor was soaking wet and the A/C Unit wasn't working properly, so we had to be moved (they didn't apologize or offer to assist with moving our bags to the new room). In addition, there were only 3 bath towels, one wash cloth and NO SOAP for a family of four. The 2nd room they gave us had a musty/urine smell. Here are just a few of the issues besides the smell: Nasty Floors, the A/C didn't cool very well, the TV reception was horrible and there was a cigarette behind the night stand. We were only there to sleep so we made the best of things (there is a Walgreens next to the hotel so we bought air freshener). This was such a disappointment considering we had three good visits previously. Not sure why the hotel changed from Best Western but it was not a good thing. We will not be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bigfoot stayed in room 295!!”
Reviews.Author: TheJaxSanchez
Reviews.Content: Or you would think so from the amount of hair we found in the room. There was hair on the tile floor by the sink, hair on the back of the toilet, hair on the edge of the bathtub. Additionally, the sheets were completely pilled and the top sheet was put on sideways, bottom sheet came loose after one turn. Overall, not a comfortable sleeping experience. To its credit - it was cheap and close to our destination, check-in was a breeze. It does have a pool available but we didn't use as we just needed a place to crash overnight after hitting Epcot all day. If you are traveling with a small family and are on a serious budget, don't overlook it. However, next time I will spend the extra $40 and stay at a Hilton nearby .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Hoosier667
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night before going into Fort Wilderness at Disney. Rooms were very clean, well equipped. Entire property was very nice and clean. Front desk is very helpful and quick to respond to your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Generally not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Midlands037
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two week stay at this hotel through Virgin Holidays. The hotel was in a good location, 5 mins drive from Disney, 20 mins to Universal Studios / International Drive areas. Reception was not the best, staff not very pleasant but that wasnt a major problem. The public areas are a little dated but serve the purpose, the restaurant serving buffet style breakfast was good value with kids under 10 eating free. Pizza Hut on site was good. The rooms were clean and comfortable and included a full sized fridge and safe at no extra charge. The pools were clean and suitable for all ages with three seperate pools and a pool for babies. Crazy golf and basket ball courts on site, again with no extra charges unlike many other hotels that would normally cash in on. Hotel is situated on the main 192 Highway, with lots of restaurants surrounding to suit all tastes and budgets, would recommend Carabbas and Olive Garden italian restaurants. Overall it's not a bad hotel and I would struggle to complain about anything really, it served the purpose of a package hotel and felt it was good value for money taking into account the facilities and location.

Reviews.Title: “pictures all lied”
Reviews.Author: lucky4me123
Reviews.Content: went there place was old and run down rooms where dirty rugs were dirty food left in the fridge cobwed hanging from ceilinghotwire said it was a 3 1/2 stars well they lied to maybe i say it was a motel not no hotel and you have to pay a resort fee for what if lucky i would give a 1/2 star so make sure you read the reveiws

Reviews.Title: “disgusting”
Reviews.Author: smitty151
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment. My problem started with a roach in our room only for my daughter to pick up a used fem product from the floor obviously housekeeping did not do there job. woke up to a flood under sink. Have put in many calls and noone has addressed my problems with my stay. Worst experience of my life gentlemen at the front counter had stains all over his shirt and tie should have known then it was a nightmare hotel. Do your self a favor pay a little more and don't stay at that hotel. I have even called corporate best western and they say they are no longer affliated with that one because of all the complaints they are not living up to the best western name. Wish i would have known that before i booked.

Reviews.Title: “much better this time”
Reviews.Author: poppo4daboys
Reviews.Content: stayed in April 2011 and swore never to return (noted in previous review). Booked room in June thru Hotwire and didn't realize until afterward that my reservation was at this hotel. I don't know if management problems were resolved because we had no interaction with management...and that is a good thing. Room was clean and comfortable with great amenities even though we didn't have time to use them. Through Hotwire, the price was excellent. Despite the problems we had earlier in the year, I won't be upset if Hotwire books us this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: BusyMom26
Reviews.Content: I read numerous reviews for this hotel. Some were positive and some were negative, but given the fact that we would be spending the bulk of our time at Disney, I didn't think the hotel could be that bad. I was wrong. Initial observation: One light didn't work, the indoor security lock was broken, the alarm clock was broken, there was a crack in one wall, and the Wi-Fi didn't work consistently. I could live with it. Then I tried to blow dry my hair...and the hairdryer and holder came out of the wall and landed in the sink. So many holes had been drilled that there was literally no drywall left to support the hairdryer. Then we tried to flush the toilet..and discovered that the flapper stuck so the toilet only flushed 50% of the time. We had to manually lift the lid off of the tank and manually push the flapper down. Seriously. I went to the front desk two days into my stay after discovering all of these problems...and because my key cards stopped working TWICE...and was told that I would have to "deal with it" because they were booked and had no other rooms. Within two days, the toilet stopped working completely and the phone died. I went back to the front desk and was FINALLY given a new room. I had to move all of my belongings and my three small children at 11pm at night to a new room. Thankfully, a maintenance worker (Donnie) was shocked by what had happened and helped us move all of our suitcases. The hotel manager that I spoke with said she would investigate, and they gave us complimentary breakfast passes for the last two mornings of our stay...as if that would compensate for a non-working toilet? Book a different hotel!!! Don't make the mistake that our family made!!!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE NOT WORTH IT”
Reviews.Author: pebbles921
Reviews.Content: this hotel has bed bugs, . customer service terrible, rooms dirty, will never return, check room first before checking in,

Reviews.Title: “We Were Robbed!!”
Reviews.Author: Shanrie
Reviews.Content: while we were staying in this hotel we were robbed--had to file a police report--there was no forced entry so we're pretty certain that it was the maid service--stole around $1500 worth of items from our room (we put some things in the safe but our laptops would not fit inside the small safe and that is what was stolen). we were one of at least three rooms that were robbed that same day. police have never been able to locate the thief and the hotel has been no help at all. they have been unwilling to take responsibility for this saying that we should have used the safe! however, we were told that the safe was busted open in one of the other rooms. we told them that it was too small for our laptops so we hid them in the bottom of the closet underneath things but they still refuse to help. if you stay here....be careful!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: Michimi
Reviews.Content: We were a little bit worried about the mix of amazing and horrible reviews for this hotel, but figured that's what you'll get for something at such a low price point. Overall, we were extremely impressed for the $60/night we paid. There were plenty of amenities throughout the hotel, including restaurants and bars, that would have kept us occupied throughout our stay if we had been on the property more often. They give you coupons when you check in to use at their facilities. More importantly the location is fantastic! The hotel is right beside a 24hr Walgreens, with several big-name restaurant chains just across the street. The drive from the hotel to Disney was fairly quick as well. I would definitely suggest getting rental car if you are going to stay here however, as the shuttle service is not very convenient and in no way worked for our jam-packed Disney schedule. Even with the cost of the rental car included, we still paid less for our vacation than we would have at the cheapest disney resort and had to ability to "escape" from the Disney madness. The rooms themselves were a mixed bag. The toilet had a hard time flushing, and the bathroom was a tad "icky" and in need of some remodelling. On the last day they forgot (or just didn't) clean our room. Our biggest complaint was the beds themselves. Luckily there were not any bed bugs (as one reviewer claimed, trust me I checked), but the beds are very old and saggy. My husband and I basically sunk into the centre of them every night and they were not very comfortable. On the plus side our A/C worked very well which was a god-send at the end of a busy July day in the parks! Although there were a few annoying and loud families staying in our building, the hotel in general seemed very quiet and relaxed. We only usually had to deal with screaming kids and parents for 20 minutes when they all got home from the Magic Kingdom at midnight, which was good because the walls are quite thin. The service we received at the counter and over the phone was excellent, although the front desk can get very busy at times. We booked through expedia and we were not charged any extra resort fees (expedia may have included them). Overall, we were very impressed for such a modest price-point and would definitely recommend it to others looking to save costs on their Orlando vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Very adequate - would stay again despite a few niggles (3rd 14 night stay)”
Reviews.Author: JDG1205
Reviews.Content: So far - only issue has been either 3 towels for 4 guests and on one occasion NO towels. Went to reception twice that evening after returning from the parks. Was advised that there was a shortage and some would be delivered (not) on another occasion the towels weren't changed. Rang reception at 11:30 pm and security guy brought more than we needed. I put some of this down to an incompetent maid. And yes I would stay here again. The Ritz? No, but all I want is a clean bed as we are out for most of the day. Oh and the Virgin rep was v unhappy about the missing towels and arranged a free breakfast for us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean and very Spaceous”
Reviews.Author: jigz_t
Reviews.Content: we wanted a hotel just to sleep in but we wanted it clean as i have heard alot about bed bugs and cockroaches in Florida. And i can safely say we saw non!! we asked for 2 single beds in our room and the size of the beds were like a UK double bed! room was cleaned every day with new towls in our bathroom. we were always out everyday all day and it was nice to come back to a clean large room. I cant really think of anything bad to say about the hotel.. my friend complained about the noise of the air con, as it wasnt the quietest but it didnt bother me as it was so hot there I needed the AC! Location was good, 15 mins drive to disney and about 20 mins to other places like Sea World and International drive. The 192 highway the hotel was on was full of tourist shops and resturants, so there was always somewere to go, and Wall Mart was a bus ride away. Finally the hotel provides a free shuttle service to the parks but they left too late on in the morning (for disney) so we just used to catch the public bus to disney so we could start the day early, which was very easy to do and only for $2! over all, pleasant stay and i would defo go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was fine, but service was terrible.”
Reviews.Author: faye2909
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel knowing that it was a "Disney Good Neighbour" hotel, and trusted the Best Western chain. I travelled with 3 of my friends (we are all 18) on the first holiday on our own. We were all very excited but on arrival all of our anticipation was crushed by the woman on the front desk. She was rude, did not look up from her desk, refused to answer our questions, charged us fees we knew we had already paid, and did not show us where our room was when we asked. Following such poor treatment we contacted our travel agents who complained to the manager, who then contacted us. She however basically did not want to know how poor our check in experience was and simply made excuses. Aside from the one incredibly rude check in girl, and incompetent manager, the rest of the staff were friendly and eager to help!! The hotel was fine (apart from the fact that in 2 weeks our sheets were NEVER changed!) and was what we expected for our money! It's a shame how the actions of a few staff can affect the hotel so negatively, as otherwise we would have had an amazing holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room & Pools, poor service though”
Reviews.Author: MrsMonk1010
Reviews.Content: This hotel was definitely understaffed. At the front desk, there was only 1 person checking people in or out & answering guests questions. Every time we were at the desk, we had to wait in line for 10-20 minutes! The rooms were small, but very nice. There was a fridge, but no microwave. (That was definitely a downside!) We were next to the smallest pool on site, but I LOVED it because it was very quiet and didn't have very many people in it! (We never did get a chance to play golf or on the playground.) The Breakfast Buffet was $10 a person and was very expensive seeing as there are other buffets in the area for less than $5/person and FREE for kids 3 and under. Make sure to be careful when you check in, if you have already pre-paid on Travelocity or Hotwire, make sure when you give them your card for the $7.50/day charge, that they don't recharge you for the WHOLE trip. We were refunded immediately but they said usually when that happens, it takes up to a week to get a refund. It could have really ruined our trip had it not been returned right away! Also, they said check-out is at 12:00 noon, but on our last day, the maid was knocking on our door at 9 am, 10 am and 10:30 am trying to see if we were gone yet. We felt so rushed to get out of there that as we were packing our car, they were waiting outside our room and as we were getting the last of our bags, they were already in the room cleaning! My husband forgot all of the things in the fridge and his wallet so we had to go back! Not to mention, anytime we needed towels and such, the maids didn't speak English and never knew what we were saying. OVERALL, it was a decent room, pools and atmosphere. Close to Disney, Old Town, Universal, Sea-World, Shopping Outlets and more! Would I stay again? Yes, probably. If the price is good. I will just know what to expect next time.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy and has bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: wood257w
Reviews.Content: After traveling all day from WA State we arrived to a dirty room. Toothpaste on the mirror and sink, urine all over the toilet, and dirty sheets. When I asked for clean sheets a man knocked on the door handed the sheets to me and walked off, I changed the sheets myself. At midnight my sister (staying in room 404) called me to tell me her room has bed bugs! When she called the front desk they told her to come get a key for a new room. My husband at midnight got the new key and moved her and her two kids to a new room. The hotel never APPOLIGZED and we asked to speak to the manager; she never got back to us. We took pictures of the bed bugs, dirty sheets, sink, mirror, toilet and will be sending them to the Better Business Bureau. Do not stay here. Horrible experience!!

Reviews.Title: “awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: wilmingtonmom
Reviews.Content: for my son's4th b-day, we have decided to celebrate in Orlando, checked in at Best Western Lakeside, lots of good restaurants around, great breakfast in site, rooms and bathrooms, needed update, but what impressed me the most was the staff, my baby's blanket was left at the hotel,after searching our luggages for 2 days, we, had to call the hotel, 2 days after hoping and praying,surprisingly, it was there, and was returned to us, even washed and bagged! It was an old blanket but it was worth , going back for it, thank you Best Western staff!!! We are truly grateful! Gillespie family Wilmington,NC

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: rebeccaScotland_11
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Best Western Lakeside with Virgin Holidays. Initially put in room overlooking car park. After 2 days requested a move, room very basic. Moved to Block 12 nearer pool, no problem. Room was so different glad we did. Often a wait at reception but nothing too much trouble. Ate breakfast in restaurant $9.50 per Adult and our 2 children ate free. Excellent buffet, made to order omelettes, eggs. Staff all very friendly and willing to pl;ease. Bus service to parks was excellent. Used it all the time. 10/15 mins from Disney. 20/25mins from Universal/Seaworld. Somehow twice as many would return from Universal as went. Drivers reorganised buses to accommodate. Plenty good value eating places nearby . Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Fun but lacking details”
Reviews.Author: Jamie_Cooley
Reviews.Content: There was no information guide in the room that listed things such as check out information, dining options (specifically breakfast information). The hotel offered a complimentary Disney shuttle but didn't provide any written information about times, parks, etc. Towels were scarce, when I checked in everyone was calling to request more towels. When we got to our room there were 3 towels for 4 guests. No pen or paper in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: grouphotelrates
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel staff to be very accommodating and super friendly. We moved from another hotel in the area due to cleanliness issues and found this hotel to be very reasonably priced and adequately maintained. Its an exterior corridor hotel that is dated but for the price, you can't beat it. Our only criticism would be the lack of WiFi. In our room, we had a network cable with access to internet. But it would have been nice to be able to hang out by the pool with our Ipads. Mini golf, large pool and clean rooms. You can;t ask for more from a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service and accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Eljucote
Reviews.Content: Doors did not shut. Access keys needed to be activated every night. No manager to speak to on sunday morning. Big commotion at hotel exit for double charge. And worst A/C shut off by itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KatieAmzid
Reviews.Content: So after reading all the bad reviews about this hotel me and my husband we very nervous about staying here for our honeymoon, however I am glad to report it was really nice! The hotels grounds and rooms were clean and spacious yes the on site food was a little expensive compared to other pizza places nearby but good if you check in to late to go anywhere else. The maid service is great room was cleaned and tidied everyday with plenty of towels and they were very friendly the few times we ran in to them. The free shuttles are ok but had a few problems with the shuttle bus back from universal as the company seemed to try and over fill them and the divers had to sort this out however this is no fault of the hotel. When we stayed a storm took out the guest internet but the reception staff were great and let us use their computers to access the web when needed I believe the most helpful was Kathy! Reception can get a little busy but this is due to the number of check ins but even at the busiest times we didn't wait long and check out was very quick. Anyone who complains about this resort fees clearly did not pay attention when booking the hotel or when you check in as it is on the bottom of the check in form which they read to you and you then sign! Had a great stay in florida and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wright4444
Reviews.Content: We were a little nervous on booking this hotel based on the reviews, but for a budget hotel I think it's good value. The rooms were cleaned regularly, clean towels daily and sheets appeared in new condition. The 3 pools were kept clean and the restaurant, pool bar were convenient, and reasonably priced. We went with 2 kids (aged 6 & 9) and the only negative is that only one room is provided with 2 double beds, so it would be difficult to get the kids to bed any earlier than us as we are there in the same room. We spoke to the hotel about this, and the only option was to pay for another adjoining room (quite pricey). We decided to upgrade to a pool facing room for an extra $10 per night, then sat just outside the room (by the pool) for an hour or so with a glass of wine. Very pleasant. If possible, get a pool facing room otherwise you could be looking out over a car park. Lastly the location of the hotel is superb for Disney, just 10 mins away. Loads of restaurants in local area, and in walking distance. Overall, I would highly recommend as a base.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad Hotel, but do do with getting rid of the lazy night staff”
Reviews.Author: Lady1_9
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and spacious, but basic. it had a refrigerator and a coffee machine. they was ample parking. The pools was nice, but did not always work, so you would have to go to one of the other pools on another block. There is a restaurant, but I never used it, because there are so much restaurants in the area I had a good choice. There is a 24hr reception, but the night duty staff tend to do the absolute minimum amount of work. for instance, i required a extra bed and had the money on me to pay for the one night hire, but they refused to take the money from me and billed it to my room instead, also when i checked in, the night staff failed to tell me that they would put a $10 per day hold on my credit card for incidentals, that just goes to show,that they were lazy and would do the bare minimum amount of work to get rid of you. on the other end the day shift would go out of there way to help you and are a credit to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gone down hill”
Reviews.Author: janie0032
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times, but sadly my last visit , I was very disappointed, We had booked the BW Lakeside as a backup to another hotel in-case it was not what were were expecting. Best Western Lakeside is sad and tired and needs a good clean up and items like beds and sheets need replacing, In my opinion there are now far better hotels with nicer facilities at the same price and even cheaper. I cannot understand why Virgin are still offering this a an option,

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, ok accomodation”
Reviews.Author: iloveholidays89
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in April with my husband and 2 teenages. The location was excellent, quick, easy drive to Disney and Universal, and a short walk to several different types of eateries. Reception were friendly and advised us well on where to eat etc. We didn't use the park shuttle bus as the times were not convenient, and it was much easier to drive. We did have breakfast there nearly every morning, which was good value and better quality than most of the all you can eat buffets. Our room was of a good size, but the carpets and curtains could certainly do with being changed. I think the rooms in general would benefit from redecoration, although it was cleaned adequetly daily, and all bedding and towels were of a good standard. We would definatly stay here again, simply because of the great location and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was fine...but DO NOT EAT AT THE ON SITE PIZZA HUT!!!”
Reviews.Author: motodiva
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel during Memorial Day weekend. I came in from riding through a severe thunderstorm soaking wet while waiting to check in, the front desk person was friendly, sympathetic and put me in a convenient room for my needs. The room was tidy and clean, the property is older but I have to give credit to the cleaning crew who go the extra mile to scrub and wipe, so although it is older, it is still clean. The room was also odor free and a decent size. I made the mistake of ordering a small pizza from the onsite pizza hut for my dinner, it took over 1.5 hours to arrive and when it did was cold and chewy, i shouldn't of ate it, but I was starving and did. Unfortunately i spent my next morning at magic kingdom taking a fun and exciting tour of disneys fabulous restroom facilities. I complained about the food and it's effects to management who stated that would need to be handled with pizza hut and it was closed at the time. NOT COOL. If a restaurant is IN your facility, I feel you should have some sort of quality control requirements. I also had a leaky toilet and this hotel had the FASTES engineering response i've ever experienced, even beat the 5 stars I've stayed at. Very friendly engineering and security staff. I would definitely stay at this hotel again, just won't be eating the food.

Reviews.Title: “WORST SERVICED MOTEL”
Reviews.Author: gop4
Reviews.Content: you got to tell management how they should clean your rooms as told by their front desk otherwise they are not going to change your bedsheets or vaccum your rooms if you have an multiple days stays. Ants in the bathroom. No supplies. Complimentry bus Services to the park approx 1 hr before closing, so expect to miss the fireworks/ parades as they are highlights of the park you are attending you do not wish to miss

Reviews.Title: “We never stay anywhere else!!!The time of our life.”
Reviews.Author: mamacoxx4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks in May of 2011. We had been here 3 times before and had always enjoyed it, so we decided to return. I was worried that time would have changed it, but we were thrilled to find it was still perfect for our needs. Our plane arrived at 9 in the a.m.we gathered our bags, van and got something to eat,but were still hours ahead of check in which is at 3 p.m. The service desk not only allowed us to check in early, but also gave us adjoining rooms poolside for no extra charge.(should be $10.each room,each night) The help at the desk was friendly and prompt. Our rooms were clean,quiet,comfortable with excellent cleaning service. A couple times we needed extra towels or washcloths(7 of us traveled and at times took showers twice a day) and when we called the front desk they sent more towels out quite quickly. The pools are huge, and spotless with plenty of chairs and tables. There are also places around the pool where you can sit in the shade.Even though we went to Disney and Universal,days at the pool were by far the kids favorite days. We traveled with a 6,7,9,17 and 20 year old and everyone loved it here. Super close to every kind of restaurant you could want..ranging from fast food to steakhouse. Less than 10 minutes to the gates of Disney..super easy access..and around 15 min. to Universal and SeaWorld.There is a Walgreens right next door and a CiCis pizza where all7 of us ate for $35!!!We budgeted $2500. for food for the 2 weeks there and didn't come close to spending it all because of all the economical places to eat. We also went to the super Target less than 5 minutes up the street for food and other needs. With the fridge in each room we were able to buy milk,soda and juice and other snacks. The prices were the same you would pay anywhere..not marked up at all.With this hotel, there is no reason to pay those crazy prices Disney charges..The landscaping is beautiful and its fun at night to walk down the strip at night with all the lights and gift shops.We went to see a timeshare, and although the rooms were nice, I have to say I would choose Lakeside over it.The only thing I think they could improve are the shuttle times offered to take you into the parks.It is a free shuttle, which saves you $13. a day in parking at Disney and $15. at Universal, but we like to be at the park when it opens and the shuttle picks you up around 10.Still for free, it adds to the savings for sure Also has free wireless internet..I talked to a man in Disney and he told me they were charging him $15. a day for internet, and he said his rooms were just ok...Don't hesitate for a minute to stay here...We only paid 1100. for 2 rooms for 2 weeks!!!Excellent deal. Thank you Lakeside!!We are planning our next trip already for Nov./Dec. of 2011 and we will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “"We always stayed here but not anymore!"”
Reviews.Author: schlagerboy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have stayed at this Best Western several times over the last four years. We have always been happy with the accommodations, pricing and especially the location and how close it is to Disney and Universal. We did our annual weekend trip this past weekend June 2- June 6, 2011. We arrived back at our room on Saturday evening around 8 p.m. to find a note on our bed stating that the water will be out for two hours. We thought well it must be on because who knows when that note arrived. I went to turn the water on and nothing. I called the front desk and they it should be on momentarily, 45 minutes went and nothing. My boyfriend called and then they told him a half hour. Honestly is your best policy. Anyhow the water finally went on and it was disgusting. We let it run for about 10 minutes and then it went off again. It turns out another pipe broke. I called the front desk and I asked them if they had a back up plan for their guests ie: another hotel and the front desk told me "we can offer you a free breakfast in the morning". I hung up called Disney, got a room with them and we checked out. It was a hot long day and all we wanted was a shower and to relax. When we checked out we did not even get a thank you or an apology. We learned that it is better to just pay a little extra and always be reassured that we have air, water, electricity, etc...

Reviews.Title: “Regretting it, Price not worth the hassle”
Reviews.Author: HDTygress
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal through Hot Wire. However, the customer service, accommodations, and amenties were lacking and now I am dealing with bed bugs. Not Cool. My friend, my 2 kids and I checked in on May 19th around 11 PM. There were 2 women behind the counter. They had loud vulgar music playing. One was probably in her 20's the other looked much older but behaved very immature (singing along and dancing to the music). Horribe customer service. No, "Hi, how can I help you?" I had to grab THEIR attention to get booked in. Not friendly whatsoever. Our room was extremely outdated, the door lock seemed iffy, there was 4 of us, we got 3 towells and 3 washrags on the 1st day. I immediately let them know we needed another towell, never got it. We stayed there 19-23. By the 22 we had 3 towells with NO washrags : ( Oh, and my favorite part was no hot water in the shower, I let them know the problem the same time as I made them aware we needed another towell. They NEVER fixed it, the shower would only get luke warm if you were lucky. I would have rather paid more. Each time I went to the front desk, same unhelpful lady. And the fun doesn't stop at the Hotel, much to my horror, my daughter found a live bed bug in My bedroom near where I stored my suitcase. BTW I was on the 1st floor of Bldg 5 facing the lake. Will NOT go back. Gaurentee that. They need to get new staff and clean their infestation, because $30/night is not bargain enough for what I dealt with, and certainly not for what I am dealing with now.

Reviews.Title: “Ok - but in need of a facelift!”
Reviews.Author: Sarahandandrew
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 10 days and finally chose this hotel as it was a Virgin 'favourite' in their current and previous brochures. What is great about this hotel is it's location. It's fantastic for Disney, you're literally on the doorstep. It is on the 192 so you are surrounded by gift shops and places to eat such a Denny's, Sizzler, Golden Corral, McDonalds and The Outback Steakhouse to name a few. There is a 24hr Walgreens which sells almost everything right next door, so no complaints there. The hotel staff were also very friendly and helpful. We had an issue with the safe in our room on arrival and within 10 minutes of asking a engineer was at our room and solved the problem. There is a mini market on site selling abit of everything which was also fantastic with friendly staff and a Pizza Hut express which would deliver to your room. There are 2 large pools which we didn't use but they looked quite clean. A pool bar which appeared busy everytime we passed and laundary facilities which were great and inexpensive. There is a bar called Hurricane Sams and Restuarant serving breakfast every morning but we didn't eat at the hotel as our breakfast wasn't included and it was cheaper to eat elsewhere. The housekeeping staff were also lovely and did a great job on our room each day. Our room was a good size with a clean and comfortable bed, slightly small though by American standards. There was a small fridge, electronic safe and hairdryer which all worked perfectly. The free high speed internet was a definate plus and easy to access and there was also free parking. What wasn't so great was the overall condition of the hotel. The exterior was extremely tired, paint peeling off everywhere and walls covered in damp. It looks awfully run down and was a disappointment when compared to what we saw in the brochure prior to our arrival. Not really what you would expect from a chain like Best Western. The carpet in our room was also tired with a few stains in the centre. The curtains were extremely old looking. The bathroom was ok but there was a damp smell in there constantly and some visable mold. The shower took hours to drain after it had been used. There didn't seem to be a blockage so i'm not sure what the problem was. There was a mini golf course which could also do with a revamp. Overall we probably wouldn't stay in this hotel again as you can get better for the same price but if they gave it a revamp we would definately reconsider.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Disney!”
Reviews.Author: disney27
Reviews.Content: My family and I stay here when we want to spend time in Disney World but don't want to splurge to stay on-site. It's usually pretty quiet when we go, and the pools are large and clean. It's not a 5-star fancy hotel but the rooms are always clean with comfy beds and a lot of times you can get really good deals. It's right next door to Disney World. We usually rent a car but they also have transportation to the parks. They have a little convenience store and they're right next to a Walgreens which is great if you want to buy sunblock or water bottles to bring to the parks that day. Just a great deal and location if you want to spend some time in Disney without paying a ton.

Reviews.Title: “Once again a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ChrisfromtheUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here again this year (2011) and as before it provides clean basic rooms - the bathroom was clean, if a little small, the room could perhaps do with a little TLC but nothing to spoil things The staff were fine as usual - we had to get the maintenance guy to fix a couple of things and he was great - I cant remember his name unfortunately. The hotel is close to everything - food and fun !

Reviews.Title: “Better the devil you know..... NOT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: x-missy-d-x
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel before and thought that it was good, clean and value for money, we decided that it's " better the devil you know" NOT... OMG.... the place looked tired, desserted and in desperate need of makeover!!! The rooms were dirty and the hair dryer was broken... that said the staff were quick to respond to our complaints. We were shown several rooms which comprised of dirty stained carpets with dried vomit eewww... bits all over the carpet and dirty bathrooms and bedlinen, in the end we decided on a half decent room as we were sooo tired. The best thing about the hotel was the pizza's and the choice of breakfasts. I don't consider myself to be that fussy and all I ask is for a clean room and therefore would not return to this hotel which is a shame as it in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location!”
Reviews.Author: kitzi_kat
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here and would definetly stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Donny1971
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 2 weeks at the Best Western Lakeside which we booked through Virgin. Having read some of the previous reviews I was quite nervous. We arrived at the Hotel and Checked in which took less than 10 minutes although there was only one receptionist on at the time. Got keys to the room which was in building 6 and opened the door.. The relief.... the room was nice and clean with two descent sized double beds and a Fridge that has small freezer compartment, TV. hair dryer and free safe. Only down side was the air conditioning which was quite noisy but I did get used to it after a few days.Over the 2 weeks heard no noise from adjoining rooms or from outside which faced the road. Richard in the Bar was great as were the girls at breakfast where we ate most mornings. We used the Pool near the main building on a few occaisions which was warm and refreshing after a day at the parks. Having decided to venture to Downtown Disney we appraoached guest services who arranged a Taxi for us and gave us loads of advice about how to get a good deal on a taxi back and free vouchers for Planet Hollywood. Hotel was a short drive to Disney Entrance. As mentioned in other reviews the hotel could do with a makeover but Overall I would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “not what i expected”
Reviews.Author: pooiscool
Reviews.Content: i would have liked a nice vacation with my pals but thats not what i got. the pool was freezing and the food was pants the rooms were ok but not good enough. the shuttle bus took for ever so we didn't use that. the reception was nice though.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: cupcake210
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 9 nights in June 2010 and we were very pleased with the hotel. The rooms are typical motel rooms, very nice but nothing fancy. The rooms were clean and the AC worked great. The Pizza Hut inside the hotel is very convenient after a long day at Magic Kingdom. Nice pools and laundry facilities. The breakfast buffet was okay, definitely not the greatest, but it was a good deal since kids eat free and we had 4 children with us. The location was great! It was within walking distance of tons of shops and restaurants. The only problem we had is my daughters cheapy digital camera went missing after housekeeping cleaned. They were helpful, but unfortunately it never turned up. We are planning a trip back to Disneyworld this summer and we would definitely stay here again! =)

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: karemore
Reviews.Content: My daughter, husband, and I LOVED Best Western Lakeside. We had a bad experience with budget lodging in the area last year, but we had no complaints with our stay here. From the minute I walked into the lobby to check in, I knew we picked the right place. The room was larger than I expected, everything was clean, and even the towels were thicker than I expected for the price we were paying. We loved the resort atmosphere. The pool area was great. My husband and daughter played the complimentary mini golf several times. We were disappointed that my daughter couldn't use the playground due to bees in the sand, but the pools and mini golf were enough to keep us entertained. We skipped the breakfast buffet due to our budget but it looked and smelled good. The table and chairs in the room were fine for the three of us to eat comfortably, and we carried some meals to the deck overlooking the lake. There were plenty of places to eat within walking distance or a short drive. The grocery store was a mile or two up the road. We bought suveniers at the Walgreens across the parking lot from BW and saved a fortune on Disney items. We also saved money on water by refilling our sports bottles in the lobby water fountain each day. The Pizza Hut is in a small store that sells fruit, juice,ice cream, sandwiches, salads, etc. It was very clean, the prices reasonable, and the atmosphere casual and charming. We enjoyed sitting along the windows and overlooking the lake while we ate. Inside this store/Pizza Hut they had a bookcase where you could borrow or trade a used book, and they had a collection of board games you could borrow. That would have been very nice on a rainy day. Most people used their own towels at the pool, but I did notice a bin with towels in a nearby corridor. We took advantage of these on our last day so we wouldn't have to travel with wet towels. I also discovered lockers in the restroom near the pool. You need to bring your own lock, but it's nice to be able to lock up your room key, camera etc if everyone in your party is in the pool. The bar at the pool was cute and you could order food there too. We were there Easter week and the theme parks were open until 1 am. It was noisy when families returned to their rooms, and also early in the am when people were leaving for the parks. This would have happened at any hotel. Getting to WDW was quick and easy by car. I am planning our trip next year and we will be staying longer at the Best Western Lakeside.

Reviews.Title: “Would not come again”
Reviews.Author: Orchid375
Reviews.Content: Bath tub filty Outside stairway dirty Quilt on bed misty and not clean Sheets on both bed had hair on them Coffee pot missing - water was in the top of coffee maker with a very very bad odor i am travelling with a young baby which makes it very difficult The aircondition however, is working fine Iron in room NO ironing board I stayed in Best Western in Portland Oregon in October 2010 and had no complaints- the staff there was exceptional-very helpful and kind.

Reviews.Title: “maintenance quick to respond; manager waived resort fee”
Reviews.Author: beachteach80
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the room the light did not work. Bloodstains (or juice?) on the carpet in multiple locations, although that's just circumstantial and might not represent the entire property. While using the bathroom, light went out. Called for maintenance who arrived quickly to change the light bulbs. Stiffest sheets I've ever felt, although I slept comfortably. Large, nicely decorated entrance, large amenities store (beverages, snacks, etc.), large breakfast area although I did not use it; they were charging $9 for a buffet which is not my taste. Hotel property is large and spread out amongst several buildings, grounds looked nicely kept, staff seemed friendly. Manager kindly waived resort fee in the morning upon my request at check out, after explaining to her that I used none of the services they were asking me to pay for. Only recommending due to the LOW rate, service and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Great”
Reviews.Author: bellachica64
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised when i arrived there, the staff was friendly, i must have arrived at the right time, because i could check in immediately after a long flight. I stayed in the main building, and the room was great, clean, had enough towels everyday, loved the pool area, and the bartender at the pool bar. The shuttle service to the parks was excellent, no issues. The breakfast buffet at the restaurant was very good, ate there every morning. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Routan
Reviews.Content: Check in for us only took 5 min - great value for money buffet breakfast - staff throughout the hotel very help full & friendly - hotel is only 10 min to Disney parks - would def go back and recommend

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for hidden charges upon check-in”
Reviews.Author: Caringmom1
Reviews.Content: Hotel was average, good value but watch out for hidden charges on your credit card upon check-in. My family and I had a 3 night stay booked and was told upon check in that nothing would be charged to the credit card until check-out but....Next day was not able to access money on my credit card due to the hotel holding over $200.00 which was not ever mentioned by the person checking us in, nor was it documented on any paperwork that was given to us. Of course it was on a weekend with no access to a bank to transfer extra funds to my account until the day of checkout (Monday)Kinda put us in a bad spot with no cash left on hand for food or other entertainment for the 3 day stay. When reported to manager on duty, she was not helpful or concerned about correcting the error, nor did she offer anything to offset the mistake. Would have been a great stay if not for that.. Was very cautious about extra charges(even on extra rolls of toilet paper) after this experience. Would have been nice if they acknowledged the mistake of not informing me of this nice hidden charge which was more than my bill for the whole stay. Sorry but most likely will not be staying at this hotel again and we are in the Kissimmee area every month.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Bartender!!”
Reviews.Author: LJoyG27
Reviews.Content: We visited Best Western lakeside for a quick Disney trip, and after a long day at the park, we went to the restaurant/bar bc the front desk had given us coupons. We had our 2 small kids with us, and there was no server, but the bar tender went way above & beyond to be helpful and accommodate our family. Our hotel room was very clean, looked like it had just been remodeled, and had a mini fridge. The hotel is a very short drive to Disney World. We purchased our room from hotwire.com and got an excellent deal! My only complaint was that check in took WAY too long! They need to come up with a new system for checking people in!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms, best bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: Manny36
Reviews.Content: Location was great about 25 min from everything , there's plenty of stores around to get all of your necessities. Rooms were great for the price no bugs very clean , do not eat at the hotel there are plenty of places to eat within walking distance, I man the burger at the food joint in there was 9.50..... Waow no no no not for a burger!......overall it was a really good experience .

Reviews.Title: “not a great hotel, rooms sub standard and service lacking”
Reviews.Author: Lynn B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a disney vacation and would not return. The rooms were not great, poor decor, chipped tiles in the bathroom etc. We had so much noise from next door we asked to move, the room we ended up in was just as noisy and no cleaner, we could not use two of the 3 drawers as they were broken and the bathroom looked very tired. The maid only made our two beds intermittently, often making one but not the other. She forgot to replace towels, toilet rolls etc. When I complained things were brought but no apologies were given. Would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain near Disney”
Reviews.Author: soxn7
Reviews.Content: As stated by others, tt is not fancy but it is clean, safe, conviently located and a great value. Would definately stay here again. Sheets and pillows seemed new. We booked a pool view room and had no noise from parking lot or any other room for that matter, and the place was almost sold out. The pool was large and clean with lounge chairs available. Also, it was only a ten minute drive to the Magic Kingdom from here. Only complaint is that they do not seem to have enough staff at the front desk. Both Check in and check out took a bit of time. Had the breakfast buffet at the restaraunt and thought it was a good value. Kids eat free with an adult.

Reviews.Title: “continues to exceed expectations”
Reviews.Author: travelsonceinawhile
Reviews.Content: this was my second stay here on Spring Break. The location is ideal, close to all the parks! Very affordably priced for the amenities they have. Two large pools with tiki bars! Bartender Chris was awesome!!!!!!!! Two other baseball families stayed here based on my recommendation and were very pleased too......Will stay here again next year. Nothing fancy in the rooms, but clean....

Reviews.Title: “good location long wait at reception”
Reviews.Author: john-suffolk2
Reviews.Content: reception seems to be always busy with not enough staff, a 40 min wait to check in after a long flight is not the best start to a holiday. hotel is clean and tidy, pool area was also clean with just about enough sun beds , the busy period is around lunch time. good location to drive to all the major attractions braekfast is very good value so skip the deals you see around as you only save about a doller or two

Reviews.Title: “After reading reviews I was apprehensive!”
Reviews.Author: terryO_10
Reviews.Content: I had booked my room before I read the reviews due to it being a Best Western and a 3 star. After reading the reviews I thought I made a mistake. I got to Kissimmiee way before check in so I headed to a different hotel where my kids were staying and was NOT impressed with there hotel! After 4pm I checked into my room and was very plesently surprised! My room was very clean and very accommodating! I have seen some bad reviews on the maid service, but I was there for three nights and every morning they were at my room around 10 am and did a very nice job! I would also like to add that it was quiet, I could not hear any people at night nor the mini golf next door. This was well worth the price of the room which was very reasonable. My only complaint would be the Wy-Fi. I could not get a strong enough signal for my netbook, I notified the front desk on Saturday, and when I checked out Monday morning they did say there was problems and there internet provider was to be there during the week. Also I wonder if there are relay Alligators in the pond, they have signs up warning of them, but I never seen any,,, this could be a good thing I guess! Thank you Best Western Lakeside

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for Disney vacation, coin-op laundry VERY useful”
Reviews.Author: tangsimon
Reviews.Content: Great location, 10 mins drive from Disney. Super Target and Cracker Barrel were both just down the street, IHOP nearby, Dunkin Donuts across the street. Walgreen's was in the same parking lot as the hotel. Cleanliness was ok. Not a big fan of the door connecting to adjoining room though since neighbours were a bit noisy (they woke up at 6:30am and we had to use earplugs). Concierge staff up at the front was a bit slow too. Cleaning staff was very friendly and accomodating. Free wi-fi and parking. Room was HUGE (big plus). In-room safe and fridge very useful.
