Could have also used a microwave though. Coin-op laundry was extremely useful since our vacation was 9 days and we used the laundry to wash our clothes after 4 days. Great hotel overall. Will go back to this hotel next time we visit Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and convenience”
Reviews.Author: shwagal
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my 18 year old daughter to Orlando for a one week Disney/Universal Studios vacation. We picked this hotel because we had stayed here in 2005 and found it was clean, close to shopping and restaurants and had a shuttle sevice to the parks. We were not disapointed in this visit as the hotel was updated a bit and still had all the amentities we needed. Our room was in building #2 room 111 and it was cleaned everyday. The beds were very comfortable, the t.v. worked just fine, we were able to connect to the internet on our laptop everyday no problem. We asked for extra blankets and they were brought up minutes later. The pool was clean, heated and open till 11pm which was great after a long day at the parks. I want to mention that one day we were in a rush to get to the shuttle and we not only forgot to put our laptop in the safe but we also forgot to lock the safe and left the door wide open. When we returned to our room the room had been cleaned and the laptop was untouched as were the contents of our safe. Our passports, hundreds of dollars in cash and medications were all still in the safe. Now that is honesty on the part of housekeeping!! I would definitly reccomend this hotel to families doing a Disney vacation. It is not fancy but it is clean, safe, conviently located and a great value. We will stay here again if we ever come back.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, good customer service, inconvenient hotel shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: flyboy12684
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose to stay at this hotel because of the location to nearby theme parks and the shuttle. However, we were disappointed during the stay that the hotel shuttle only did one round-trip to a each park per day varying from departing for a theme park two hours after they opened to a pick-up two hours before closing at some parks. We were mis-informed that the scheduled shuttle would have multiple scheduled drop-offs and pick-ups at each park, not just a single at a random time. Before our arrival, we purchased a Sea World/Busch Gardens package, where a Busch Gardens shuttle would meet us at Sea World. We ended up having to spend around $60 for parking, because we had to meet the shuttle early in the morning and also drive back to the hotel after the Busch shuttle dropped us off back at Sea World. We were very fortunate to have rented a car to get around Orlando, because we did not have the access to the shuttle like we thought we would. In addition, housekeeping did not stock amenities to the guest room...basic shampoo & soaps throughout the stay. I thought the front desk did an excellent job handling the sold-out hotel. We did not expect to get our room until 4PM, because of the craziness in the lobby. My wife and I did enjoy our time at thehotel in Orlando, we just thought the shuttle service was the only dark cloud on our trip. I contacted Guest Relations through Best Western. They assisted me greatfully and gave me email for the general manager. Two weeks later, I have not heard a response from the general manager! Investigate hotel shuttle before going to Disney, Universal, or Sea World with family and kids!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel , bad ammenities”
Reviews.Author: winegrammy
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel and the people. Problems which were minor were addressed immediately. Be prepared for there never being any towels at the pool, so we always asked for extra towels in our room. My biggest and most infuriating complaint came with their shuttle service to the parks! The pick you up at 7:00 in the morning, hours before the parks open. The bus was big and beautiful with televisions. But then it gets really bad the bus they send to pick you up holds only 50 people, they pick up 100!! the bus driver asked us if we know the person next to us please sit on their lap!!! are you kidding me?? The air conditioner can not cool this overflow, people were getting sick and crying it is an absolute nightmare. This was really enough to ruin our good time!

Reviews.Title: “OK For what you pay”
Reviews.Author: gostling
Reviews.Content: We stayed here once before a few years ago when it was run by Radisson. This hotel is in an excellent location for the Orlando attractions. Particularly The Disney Parks. On this occasion we were only booked in for one night having flown into Orlando airport on our way to another part of Florida. We got an efficient welcome at reception and were soon in our room which was a reasonable size, clean and well cooled by a slightly noisy A/C unit. The hotel itself is now looking a bit tired and in need of a bit of renovation. Having said that I still rate the accommodation as good value for money and suitable for a longer stay for people on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “happy and surprised”
Reviews.Author: dougmac54
Reviews.Content: on reading the hotels reviews i was happy to find that our room was clean and up to date and basily thats all i expect a hotel room to be. the staff i found were all friendly and helpful. the only thing i would complain about is there claim that u have boats on the lake which looked liked a pond. so would i go back of course its the second time ive been to florida and it wont be the last and yes i would use the best weatern again.

Reviews.Title: “First Class... DUMP”
Reviews.Author: TravelsRwe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a booking Virgin Holidays: arrived late in the evening after a long international flight and went to check-in. After a near twenty minute wait, we were served by a older gentleman who really didn't seem to know what he was doing. Once we arrived at the front door of our room, the card keys were not working and we couldn't get in, but judging by the door, one push and it would have caved in as it was so flimsy. Not being happy with this, returned once more to the recepition and asked for another room with a stronger door. Moved into Block 11 and after finally finding the light switch, walked into our stale, musty room. The stained carpets together with hairs in both the sink and bath was enough to put anyone off. The air-con (if you could call it that) was filthy and dusty. Bedding was tired and old, with wires hanging from the electric stockets. Amazingly enough, the telephone rang, and we were asked if the room was OK, which was a joke considering what we were seeing: explained we were going to speak to the Virgin Rep in the morning as this was not a "perferred room" as offered in the brochure. Was told they were fully booked that night but we would be moved the next day. Morning arrived and we went in search of breakfast: upon return to the room; the door was open for cleaning but with no maids in sight: started to pack as we were not going to stay and not once did housekeeping return (around 30 mins): was moved out of the hotel by our rep. Disgusting dump of a hotel. Best Western you should be ashamed: and why no managment reponse on this site to people's complaints - AVOID!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal! I got what I paid for!”
Reviews.Author: Bertie9396_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at BW Lakeside from March 26-April 1. I booked directly on the Best Western website and used the AAA/CAA rate for $33/night+resort fee. I am surprised others did not know about the resort fee. I booked directly with best western and it was quite clear. After a total of 24 hours in the car over two days of driving, we were very pleased to have a quick check-in process (around 4:30 pm on a Saturday night - I was expecting a much longer wait). While the man at the desk wasn't particularly cheerful, he was friendly enough. Got up to the room (Building 5 - Room 256) It was in the pet friendly area with a view of the "lake" and mini golf. When we first got there I heard a dog barking and got a little worried that we'd be hearing it all night long but never heard or saw a dog for the rest of our stay. Room was clean and I loved that the vanity area was outside the actual bathroom - real time saver not having to wait if all you wanted to do is brush your teeth and someone was using the shower or something. The TV didn't work well at all, but we really weren't in the room very often. The pool area was great. Mini golf was sad looking but our daughter had fun. The beds were comfy enough but the pillows were way too small. Maid service did not have a consistent service time. One time she'd be there and gone by the time we got back from breakfast (11 am) and on our last day she didn't knock on our door until after 3 p.m. But most days we were out and about at the pool or at the parks so it didn't matter to us. The lady who was taking care of our room even stopped me at the door as I was leaving the room and she was walking by to ask me if everything was OK and if we needed anything else. I was very pleased with that. Our very first night we did not want to go anywhere so after we enjoyed the pool area for a bit we just went to the Pizza Hut on-site and sat outside and relaxed. The bar area wasn't open until 5 pm I think and we went there once for a meal and it was OK. The guy working there was very busy but was friendly and while service was a little slow, it was reasonable for just one person working the dining area and the bar. We did not try the buffet breakfast there. The location itself was great. Very close to Disney and lots of restaurants close by. Target was a short drive away and Wegmans was in the same parking lot. Overall, it had everything we were looking for. We would definitely recommend this place to friends and family and will come again.

Reviews.Title: “Potentially great ruined by staff and greed !”
Reviews.Author: ExasperatedAgain
Reviews.Content: Except for the clerk at checkin, the staff was short and rude ! 3 POSSIBLE days to clean the room and it was not cleaned at all one day and only partially another ! There were no drinking glasses in the room but plastic cups which were not replaced. Requested extra towels and only received them once on special request at night ! The internet and printer are in the lobby ( no privacy ) and you must purchase token card by using your credir card in a ( fly by night operation ) unknown operators machine ( not Best Western ). Buses park wherever they want taking up many parking spaces instead of having a designated parking area away from rooms ! They will not give you a detailed invoice at checkout but refer you to your trip provider ! After rudely charging resort fee and trying to get you to do it by credit card ( paid cash ).

Reviews.Title: “COCK-ROACHES, ARE PRESENT HERE & NO ONE CARES!!! DON'T STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: voconnor602
Reviews.Content: Cockroaches were found in our bedroom, we complained 4 seperate times to 4 different front desk personel & no body cared nor showed compassion over this horrible event. My small children are now associating our 1st trip to Disney with roaches in our hotel room. Totally disgusting. I would never recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: chaseone
Reviews.Content: this place was a true JOKE. when we checked in it took over 40 minutes (1) new staff (2) supervisors and (1) manager to try to get it figured out. Both the rooms were very dated and musty. our room had one towel so we called down and 7 hours later when we returned sheets and towels were out side on dirty floor. we asked to speck to manager, but were hung up on, never spoke to manager, we were always directed back to our booking agent. ohh.......by the way our complete package didny included the resort fee which was another 160.00 at checkout. would not wish this nightmare on anyone. STAY AWAY. find something else.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed with management”
Reviews.Author: poppo4daboys
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. We were pleased with our first two days there. Instead of checking out, we decided to stay another day. Since the hotel was near sold out, we agreed to pay more and change rooms. No problem. First, were given keys to an occupied room. Then we were told that it would be later in the day. When we were done with the theme park, and ready for our new room, it had several serious maintenance and cleanliness issues. I worked for many years as a manager at a major car rental location. i know that everything will not be perfect all the time. It's how management addresses the issues. Except for the newly hired manager of housekeeping, nobody in management stepped up. They literally hid around the corner telling the counter people what to say. It took two hours to get maintenance out to our room. A complaint to Best Western corporate was answered by a Front desk manager who said he would discuss our issues with the General Manager and get back to us. We asked to speak directly with the General Manager and have heard nothing since. Management just didn't step up...and still hasn't. If a manager had talked to us and worked to correct our problems, I would have highly recommended this hotel. Our first two days were excellent. The room was clean and comfortable, the facilities excellent and the amenities outstanding. A retired marine told me once, "If you are in charge, take charge." It applies to hotels too.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds, served its' purpose.”
Reviews.Author: TATINEE
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights while house hunting in the area. Check in was smooth and our room was adequate for our needs. The beds were pretty comfortable. The hotel is obviously in need of some renovations. The room door was difficult to open and close, which showed its' age, but was good since we have a 3 year old who likes to open doors and run! We did not have housekeeping come in during our stay, but a housekeeper did come by one day to see if we needed anything. She did not speak English, but we were able to communicate ok. The resort fee is a joke. The mini golf would barely entertain a small child. The pools are ok. We didn't eat at the buffet, but there are other buffets less than two minutes away that offer a price of $3.99 compared to the $9.50 the hotel charges. Got pizza one afternoon - $7 for a personal pizza, three breadsticks, and a drink.. Probably the best deal they had, as a grilled cheese sandwich ran almost $6! Went down one morning to purchase a ticket for my son to get into Disney. The ticket saleswoman saw me coming from the ATM and walked away!!! Decided it was worth the wait in line at Disney rather than have any money go to the hotel for the sale. At check out, the employee barely spoke to me or the other customers - he was answering the phones and just pushing papers in front of people to sign. Even when he was off of the phone, he didn't make eye contact and just got me out as quick as possible. We got this on priceline for $27. I wouldn't have paid more and won't stay again. It gave us a place to sleep and was convenient to get to Disney, but that's about it!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, inexpensive, close to the parks”
Reviews.Author: falcomi
Reviews.Content: Like the title says, this hotel is clean (with a few minor old age issues, but what do you expect from a budget hotel?) We've stayed here 3 separate times now, with rates as low as $38/night. More or less friendly staff...Being right next to a Walgreens is nice too. No real complaints worth mentioning, we consider this place a great inexpensive alternative to the pricier hotels.e

Reviews.Title: “Budget yes, but save a bit more for something else”
Reviews.Author: MaggievR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Best Western 26 & 27 Feb 2011. The start of our 3 week visit to the US and thank goodness the accommodation got better after this start. Budget yes, but save a bit more and get something a bit better. Book-in and service in general very poor. You get what you pay for. Room was comfortable and clean, but the aircon made such a noise and could not be switched off as it would take too much effort to start again. The pub only opens at 5pm so if you are early for book-in, with no transport you are stuck. You can get a drink at the pool bar, but after an 18 hour flight from SA and another 5 hours before arriving in Orlando you would prefer a bit more comfort. All pools are well maintained, clean and sparkling. Lakeside - what lake? Breakfast buffet is great - if that is what you would like at breakfast time. Not many healthy choices. Definitely will not use this hotel again, so hope you will not either. Maybe they will get the message to revamp and make it a bit more quest friendly. Fore dinner, try the Wildeside restaurant/steakhouse, but make sure you know the gratuity rules.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN BUT IN NEED OF A MAKEOVER”
Reviews.Author: JENNY824431
Reviews.Content: We got what we paid for !! WITH OUR PACKAGE ( VIRGIN ATLANTIC ) DEAL. We travel to the states at least once a year, we usually choose a hotel with interior corridor's. This hotel's location was good,staff friendly , ample parking, good pool's , everything else you will need plus guest laundry !! If you are looking for value for money rather than, surroundings. THIS IS THE HOTEL FOR YOU AND YOUR FAMILY.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western ? Don't think so”
Reviews.Author: Triumph23
Reviews.Content: I'm afraid to say that this hotel is well below B&B'S that I've stayed in, in France . The moment we arrived we we're bombarded with buy cheap tickets for this and that, when all we wanted to do was get to the room and have a shower. We eventually made it to room 201, we opened the rather flimsy door and went inside. I doubt that the door would survive much of a pounding before someone got inside, but not to worry, the room is equipped with a good strong sturdy safe, attached to a, not so good strong and sturdy bedside cabinet, that 2 people would have no trouble walking out the door with. I always thought that a safe would be SAFER if it were attached to a wall ( Or is that common sense ). The overall appearance of this hotel, is that it is crying out for a bit of TLC. the electrical fixings were loose and to my mind dangerous. Family's with children be ware The TV was dated, and the fridge on a slope, inside the cabinet, under the TV.The coffee and tea making machine is an after thought. The one thing that was never sorted in the 14 days that we were there was the housekeeping, almost every other day we had to go to reception or phone up for, Bath towels, soap, cups, coffee ( No tea ) it was a joke. We would often try to guess what wouldn't be there upon our return. The staff were pleasant at all times and did their best. I can't say I'd rush back to this hotel. There are loads of hotels that you can choose from along this Highway. Take a bit of extra time to find another one

Reviews.Title: “Better Deals to be found”
Reviews.Author: evelynyeager
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to book this hotel, don't. There are better deals out there. They charge an additional $7.50 "resort fee" when checking in. To call this place a resort is like calling dog food a steak. It is old and run down. Check in was slow. The room was terrible. Bedding quality was very low. The sink was stopped up and disgusting. The plug looked kicked in and had a power strip running from it for the tv and table lamp, which flickered every time you touched the power strip. Put my feet in the pool. It seemed warm (not sure if it was sun warmth or an actual pool heater) but the pool area seemed decent. The "lake" is a joke more like a polluted mud puddle. The restaurants were too expensive so we ate elsewhere. Plenty of choices near by. This hotel is close to everything Disney. It did have shuttle service, which we didn't use. Free internet in the room was nice. No charge for parking. The mini golf course is something a child under the age of 9 might enjoy but it is nothing nice or special. The hotel accepts pets for a fee, so that would be the only people I would consider recommending this hotel to, people traveling with pets and having a hard time finding a hotel that accepts pets. I booked this dive on Hotwire and that will be the last time I use Hotwire. They have lost my confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, but good value and good location...”
Reviews.Author: Gordonashworth
Reviews.Content: The good things about this place- the rooms are spacious, it's in a good location, with lots of restaurants close by, and all the theme parks are within easy reach. The rooms are good value too. The bad things? The block I stayed in was very noisy, it was opposite the hotel laundry and from 7am there was a lot of vehicle noise. Luckily we were up and about early, but if you wanted to lie-in, you would have been woken by the noise. The room was not particularly clean, we found sweet wrappers from the previous guest on our arrival. We tried to phone reception but no reply. The reception service was very poor, usually only one person there and long queues waiting to be served. The reception staff were also not very friendly. No one seemed to ever smile and they seemed to be very stressed. We went to the guest services desk to enquire about park tickets, but the queue was so long we gave up and got our tickets elsewhere. For a best western, this place was pretty poor.

Reviews.Title: “Decent amenities but horrible rooms and slow service”
Reviews.Author: SH5547
Reviews.Content: The positives included heated pools (not all of them had working heaters, but at least one did) and a miniature golf course (poorly lit and pretty crude but at least it was deserted so no one to rush you!). The negatives...The room had visible mildew all over the walls and smelled so musty and mildewy, we could not stand it. It smelled like the carpet had been soaked in water and left damp for days. We were transfered right away to another room, which was better but still a little musty. My daughter was so grossed out by it, she slept on top of the covers, using our own pillow and blanket. The toilet clogged and I called the front desk and it rang for about 4-5 minutes and no one picked up. I called a few minutes later with the same result before giving up. I found a housekeeper out in the hallway and told him we had a clogged toilet and he said he would send someone. No one showed. Later we passed by him and he asked if someone came to fix the toilet and I told him no one did. But fortunately, it was our last morning and we were checking out. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel. It seemed inexpensive on Hotwire, but when we checked in, they charged an additional $7.50 per night "resort fee" which brought the price up. If you want a clean comfortable room, pick someplace else!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Traveller316
Reviews.Content: Overall this experience has been disappointing. I travel quite a bit so I know what to expect when it comes to the basic necessities of a hotel experience - cleanliness, good service and a nice room. Unfortunately Best Western Lakeside did not measure up to any of these markers. I chose this hotel based on the strength of "Best Western" brand but that apparently doesn't mean much. Getting to our hotel room we were greeted with overflowing trash bins and a building block that needed a good power washing to get rid of the accumulated grim on the passageway floors and windows on the exterior of the rooms. The interior of the room was dated but adequate although the mattresses were soft and needed replacement. The first indication of poor service was the fact that the carpet had not been vacuumed upon our arrival. That was followed by forgetting to leave towels in the room when it was cleaned to forgetting the room entirely on at least one occasion. To be fair, the hotel front desk was responsive when I complained, but is this really the way to run a hotel? The advertised amenities also did not live up to expectations. The outdoor "heated" pool was not heated and was without pool towels on a consistent basis. The gym had poorly maintained equipment, including a broken and mostly empty water dispenser, and was also without towels on 3 of the 4 times that I used it (probably taken from guests using the nearby pool). The "highspeed" internet was not fast and had a very, very weak signal that would fade in and out every few minutes, a very frustrating experience. On my next vacation to Disney World I will certainly not be staying here and I don't recommend it to anyone else until they get their act together.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the SSS”
Reviews.Author: tkmull
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of it's location and the $$. It is the best bang for your buck for this area. It is in a busy area but set back off the road where it is very peaceful and quiet. We requested a pool side room and very glad we did. We traveled with family who brought their dog and they were close to us but in a another building that is pet friendly. This property is made up of alot of multiple buildings and pools. It was difficult to find our room when we arrived but we liked the location once we were there. The room itself had 2 double beds that slept well but with small pillows. There was no comforter and it was very cool so i had to request extra blankets, after an hour they had not been delivered so i walked to the front desk and was accommodated. The room had a safe and small fridge but no microwave. The decor inside the room is pretty plain but clean. The pools are nice but the bar was not open and the water was freezing. There are alot of nice restaurants in this area and very easy to get to Disney from here. We did not take the shuttle because it only goes and comes 1 time a day. It only took us maybe 8 minutes to return to our hotel after a long day at Disney World. There is a pizza hut on property and they do charge a resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Sneaky Fee Hotel”
Reviews.Author: seniorvagabond
Reviews.Content: Another Orlando hotel that tacks on sneaky fees that they keep hush until their next traveler arrives. The web site said free parking but at check-in they told me the sneaky fee was for parking. The prices in Orlando mean nothing because they all add whatever fee they want when you get there. I had to wait almost 30 minutes just to check in.. The room was 2.5* quality. Minimum TV channels. "cozy" bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: shelley6x
Reviews.Content: If all you want is a bed and a pool and its only $33 a night go for it. Lakeside means a man made hole with water and cans & garbage thrown in it. Want an iron board to use with your iron wait time was 2 hours(three calls to front desk) to bring one. Maid service shows up around 5pm (nice women, only they have a couple working.)couldnt check in at 3:30pm rooms were not cleaned yet told to go site seeing & come back. Also they charge a resort fee: 7.50 extra a day. I didn't need a safe,shuttle or a stick to play mini golf on a made shift outdoor carpet but told everyone has to pay this. Im a platinum BestWestern member and this means nothing to them. Lots of hotel on this road to choice from. Love Florida and still had a great time left and went to a great condo at $79.00 a night but for those of us who like good customer service this is not the hotel. & I paid two nights for 94.00 total and still wouldn't go back , its that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: roccgirl
Reviews.Content: Two friends and myself went to Astros spring training last week. The location is great for Disney World but about 45 minutes away from Osceola County Stadium. The room was small and clean. We had to ask for coffee filters, toilet tissue and wash cloths because housekeeping didn't provide us with replacements when cleaning our room. They were delivered promptly. We asked for a pool view which we got. However, the pool view was blocked by trees and shrubs. We didn't complain because we were on the end of the unit which worked out perfect for us. All in all, it was a good value for the price. Would stay again and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay at this Hotel in a minute!”
Reviews.Author: psst4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found this Hotel a great deal for the money. The staff was friendly, rooms were clean, it was close to attractions etc. I would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for hotel off Disney property ...this is the place.”
Reviews.Author: walltractor
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews of MANY hotels...too many. If I could save you some time...look no more. If you are going to Disney and looking for a hotel to sleep at, this is the place. This is your average hotel. We stayed in building 2 which was close to the main building. We were on a second floor room and were very pleased. It was clean and not too old. Some rooms must be older than others after reading some other reviews. The room had two full beds w/ extra pillows. AC worked well. Plenty of towels. Doors were secure. Bathroom was large enough. Fridge was larger than expected. Internet was not wireless...there was a cable to hookup your laptop on the desk area...and we never had trouble connecting. Our family of 4 slept comfortably all 7 nights. Security personal was visible at night riding around parking lot in golf carts...never noticed any people on property that didn't belong there. The location was about 2 mile from Disney's World Drive...closer than we expected. Walgreen's pharmacy basically in the same parking lot. Hotel is at a light, so there was easy access on and off of rt. 192. Super Target one set of lights down the street...we also found a Cracker Barrell restruant and took a menu with us and ordered take out from there which was fresher than any fast food pizza joint....we even ordered off the kids menu for all of us. We did not eat breakfast...as we stocked up on food at Target. POOL...the pool was crystal clear and the bartenders at the outdoor bar were very friendly. We brought our own drinks to the pool area without anyone questioning us. I was able to do laundry and felt comfortable leaving my stuff in the wash while the kids swam. There were plenty of pool towels for you to use. If you have a pool view room on the first floor it is close enough to go have your coffee out there and read the paper in the am or have take out and you would be close enough to your room. The pool closes at 11. We never heard any excess noise late at night. We were satified with housekeeping which came every day in the afternoon. We had our own car so we didn't use the shuttle service. When you check in...they send you to another person at the same counter...this second person is the man that tries to talk you into discount tickets by seeing time share opportunities. I just told the guy we already had our tickets (which we did) and he was not pushy at all and never bothered us again. Front desk staff and maids were all pleasant. Easy check in and out. Kids loved the game room. I did a lot of worrying for nothing. If we ever return, I would not hesitate to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: sweetee713
Reviews.Content: Pros: near the amusement parks, shuttle is provided, beautiful pools, beautiful scenery, a 24 hr walgreens is right next door, wide selection of restaurants to choose from in walking distance, great for the family, arcade room, 2 playgrounds, basketball court, miniature golf, smoke-free rooms guaranteed as fines are enforced to purify the air, comfy beds, laundry rooms, room upgrade was graciously provided when I mentioned I needed a ground floor room because I had a baby w/ me, continental breakfast was good and had a lot of variety. Cons: no elevator (there are 2 floors), shuttle does not provide flexible hrs of departure or return, buffet breakfast was not complimentary, free internet did not mean free access to the computer--just free wi-fi, resort fee of 7.50 per day. The pros outweighed the cons. The whole family had a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “A True Review, happy to be contacted about”
Reviews.Author: cerebral-knievel
Reviews.Content: I've never bothered reviewing on here before but felt compelled to after reading some of the negative comments that have been made. We are from the UK and have stayed here 3 times so far, the third of which we held our wedding reception on the decking overlooking the lake, two of our friends have also taken thier families here on our recommendation, once where we all travelled together and once where they travelled alone. On none of these varied occassions over a 5 year period have we ever encountered a single issue with the staff or facilities at Lakeside, or heard any complaints from any other guests either. We were originally attracted to the hotel by a combination of the good value prices and the fantastic loacation, and frankly would have been quite happy with 'adequate' as we mainly wanted to use the hotel as a base for the theme parks, however I can't think of a single area where the hotel could be marked as merely adequate. We have always found the cleanliness to be of a good standard, both within the rooms and the hotel grounds as a whole, the hotel staff have always been bright, bubbly and helpful, the Pizza Hut is always popular with the kids and the rare occasions we have needed to ask for staff to come to our room (once to replace a lightbulb in the bathroom, once because we locked ourselves out) someone was on-hand in less than 5 minutes. Equally as attractive is the hotel's immediate location. a 24-hour supermarket with chemist/drug store is just across the parking lot, there are 3 well known chain burger places within 5-10 minutes walk, a great Crazy Golf situated next door and approx. half a dozen resteraunts also within a very short walk. The '5 minutes from Disney' mentioned in the UK holiday brochures refers to the entrance to the Disney estate as a whole and not to the actual theme park entrances, and while strictly speaking this is accurate I can understand how some people can find this misleading, however any problem people have with this description should surely be raised with the package operators who print the brochure and not the hotel. 15 mins door-to-door is a fairer idea for anyone who wanted a more exact timeframe. As mentioned earlier we decided to hold our wedding reception here on our most recent visit and the events staff could not have been more helpful and accomodating, the bar staff even arranged for us to catch a UK soccer match on the bar's big screen that was shown before the bars usual opening time. After 3 great stays here our family could'nt imagine staying anywhere else when we visit Florida, we will definately stay here again, would recommend this hotel to our friends and family without a moments hesitation. This is a genuine review from a guest, anyone who wishes to confirm this or ask after any other aspects of our experiences at the Best Western Lakeside is welcome to contact me and do so.

Reviews.Title: “A little dated but great service & location”
Reviews.Author: kickergirlOttawa
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered a basic room that was clean and provided the basic amenities required for a good night sleep. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The pools were beautiful and the poolside bartender very friendly. Hotel offers a breakfast buffet which we did not try and a bar that has an express Pizza Hut as well as other standard bar type food. There are so many restuarants around the immediate area that you really aren't too hard up for food at any time of day or night. The shuttle service to the Disney properties ran on time both to and from and the drivers were friendly. We opted to drive to the parks on two of the days and they are very easy to get to from the hotel. Literally just down the street. All in all a great deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the price”
Reviews.Author: made1024
Reviews.Content: Despite other reviews that I read on here, I went ahead and booked this hotel and I couldn't be happier. It was nice, clean, quiet and very close to everything on 192. The double beds are what I call a Full size bed not a queen as I thought, but that was my bad. However the mattresses were very comfortable. The pillows were rather large for my taste but they did their job. Room is a standard hotel room (we got pool view which was really nice) with coffee maker (one cup at a time), iron/ironing board, mini hair dryer, small fridge, safe (it didn't work at first but the problem was fixed within 10 min of my call to the front desk), tv, desk and table with two chairs. It has two pools that I saw, a kiddie pool too, a play area for kids and a pizza hut on the premises. Nice lake and all the bldgs are two stories (no elevators from what I saw), but the entire premises is very clean and well kept. The water pressure did drive me nuts, very little water comes out of the shower head and faucet in the sink, but they did have hot water so that is just a preference of mine, I'd say. Nothing fancy, just what we needed for a weekend trip at a very affordable price and a safe place to stay. Will definitely be coming back and highly recommend it to families on a budget. Oh and they have connecting rooms if you need them :)

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting and unsafe--beware!”
Reviews.Author: righteous_Crush_dude
Reviews.Content: Looked like a good deal on hotwire, bad mistake! Not a three star, not close to Disney...was a big sprawling 15 plus building complex in a rather ick neighborhood. First room had serious mold/mildew issues---we opened the door with our 3 year old girl and were met by a wall of nasty smelling fetid air as well as gum in the blanket of the bed, ancient dirty carpet---I wouldn't wish this room on anyone. We promply (10 minutes) received a 2nd room--better air, still funky but breathable. Same carpet, this one had no deadbolt, and the swing over security doodad had been smashed off....

Reviews.Title: “reasonable if you just want a bed, low quality rooms/service”
Reviews.Author: parkca01
Reviews.Content: Honestly the staff was the worst part. The counter service was horrendous- the gentlemen talked not only to me, but other customers very rudely. Additionally everyone there seemed to be inefficient at processing requests and handling accomodations. I was second in the check in line for almost 20 minutes. The rooms were comfortable; you don't get many TV channels, the beds are covered only with a sheet (no matress cover... we woke up sleeping on the bare mattress at points, pretty gross), and the room we stayed in had water damage to the carpets and walls. The door wouldn't shut and lock, we had to fenangle it to get it to stay closed. Then again, the room wasn't so crucial because basically we only used it for sleeping. We chose the Best Western because the prices were fantastic and they had a shuttle to/from the parks. We ended up only taking the shuttle to universal because the shuttles to Disney were way after the park opened and picked you up almost two hours after the park closed. The pools were spotless and the outdoor bar was very reasonably priced. There was a lot to do with mini golf and basketball courts.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family(3 adults) January 29th- February 5th. We had a good stay at this hotel. We arrived early and were able to check in early. The rooms are basic but clean. Really liked that our room had a fridge. We were told when we checked in that we would have a lake view room which when we got to the room we had a view of the parking lot. We never complained about this because we didn't really care just thought it was amusing that the parking lot was the lakeview?? We really only used the hotel room to sleep in and it provided us with comfort and was very quiet. It was close to everything, many restaurants, walgreens right on site, mini golfs, and super target. For the price we paid it was well worth it and I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Superb value for money”
Reviews.Author: johnnyfuggles
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Orlando and this hotel. We where so pleased on our first trip 3 years ago that we booked it again. The hotel staff are all friendly curtious and polite. Nothing was ever too much trouble even organising the ordering of flowers for my wife's birthday and putting them into our room whilst we where out. Hotel always clean room was always spotlessly cleaned each day with soft fresh towels and new stocks of complimentary coffee etc. Pool was always warm and the pool area clean and tidy. Only negative for the hotel was the buffet breakfast, what a waste. The selection was very small and quality not very good. Kids eat free with each paying adult but no juice included with the price. So by the time you add the price of the juice and pay for two adults it is much easier to go to the Golden Coral across the road. Probably the most expensive place for breakfast but the same price as the hotel (even paying for the kids) but the choice was huge and fantastic quality and service. Great Great location for the parks etc and lots and lots of restaurants and bars etc right on your doorstep. We also travelled to Miami for an overnight stay from here just 4hrs to South Beach booked using the superb hi speed wifi free in each room. 10/10 to the hotel and its staff and I would recommend this hotel to anybody. One tip though, book direct and not with Virgin Holidays as it is so much less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the stay overall”
Reviews.Author: J_S_Newmarket
Reviews.Content: The location is incredible - not just that it is 5 minutes from Disney, but also the fact that the property twists back off the main tourist stretch a little bit, whereas most other hotels/motels in the area are right on the busy main road. We couldn't hear any of that from our room at night, nice and quiet. And the bed was really comfortable. The rooms aren't for those who are looking for luxury, however I'm sure those people are not looking for a mid-range priced hotel. It wasn't terrible at all, but if it wasn't next to Disney World it would be $50/night less. As well we initially booked a king room, and after traveling all day, finding the place in our rental car, and bringing our stuff up the stairs to the room - it wasn't a king room. It was fixed right away - in fact the staff member was really nice and easy going, but still a bit of a hassle considering the lobby was packed and lined up. There's also a 24 hour Walgreens right on the property which is fantastic - especially considering each room has a small fridge (another frill that can make a big difference). And lots of restaurants within walking distance. It's tough to find a place you will be comfortable with that won't cost you some ridiculous amount in that area. I would stay here again knowing we would be comfortable, but would be willing to try somewhere else as well. Just remember you're traveling to that area to have fun away from the hotel anyway, so it's a good place considering the location and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Old Motel Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: motelh8r
Reviews.Content: To start off, the check in process was horrendous. After a computer glitch, I waited over 30 minutes for check-in. Then, I got to the room and the door was very flimsy and the lock took multiple tries to open. I was startled when I walked in and the light switch didn't work. I had to use the bathroom light to see. The bed sheets were not actually sheets. The bottom sheet didn't grip the side of the mattress like a usual sheet. It was just a top sheet draped over the mattress. The bathroom was very small and had hair all over it. The parking lot was poorly lit. The hotel charges a $7.50 per night resort fee which is unjust because it is a motel with outdoor hallways. This is a very outdated motel built in 1972. Stay somewhere else within the same price category.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels I've stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: JDubois0817
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hotel is the location - and that's only ok. We had reservations here for 2 days prior to our stay on the Disney property, and I cannot get over the waste of money that was for us. We attempted to travel during the snow storm that hit Dallas, so after 18 hours of trying to get to Orlando, and 3 canceled planes later we finally arrived at 1 am to the hotel. When our reservations were made online, our confirmation said that breakfast would be included, however when we checked in the RUDE woman at the front desk said "no breakfast is not included here" and just pointed to a sign that said all Best Westerns were indepently owned and operated so they reserved the right to change or modify services advertised. We showed her the confirmation and all she did was shrug her shoulders, gave us the print out and said "sign here." There are no elevators, and no one to help with bags so we had to lug a weeks worth of luggage + 2 two year olds up stairs in the middle of the night. When the door to our rooms opened, my heart sank. There were mismatched sheets and a scratchy top blanket on the bed and no comforter. The room smelled like something had died in it, the bathroom was dirty, and I wouldn't even consider taking my shoes off on that floor. Absolutely the worst two nights of sleep I'd ever had! Between the uncomfortable mattress & pillows and the air conditioner that was uneven at best and left the room horribly humid, I couldn't wait to get out of that misery. My son woke up early the next morning so I took him on a walk around the property - the "lake" is a nasty run off pond that smelled worse than our room, the playground equipment looked like it might fall over, and the pool wasn't much better. We walked to the lobby to get some information on the area and find out the best way up to Daytona for the day, and the two desk attendants spent a good 5 minutes chatting before I was even acknowledged to ask them a question. Our friends stayed in the room next door and we could hear every word of their conversation - and they aren't loud people! I'm shocked people have had good experiences here. I'm not even one who has been spoiled by the Ritz or anything - typically we stay at a Hilton or Marriott but I've stayed in a Motel 6 in West Texas that was better kept than this! With so much competition in the area, you'd think this hotel would do more to stand out. And the couple who said they honeymooned here??? Really??? I'm sorry but you deserved much better than this on your honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: EmmaKennedy1985
Reviews.Content: Myself and my new Husband enjoyed our Honeymoon together in Orlando and stopped at this Hotel for the duration Check in was smooth and quick, helpful staff on duty to answer any questions you might have. The room was clean and big, having a fridge in the room was very convenient. The bar and restaurants were fantastic, again all the staff very helpful and friendly. Pool was warm and clean, shuttle services to the parks was fantastic, saved on more expense of hiring a car. Would definitely return!!!

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL! STAY AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: j97elroy
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel I've ever experienced! I travel a LOT and always stay in mid-range places. I'm satisfied as long as a hotel is clean, safe, and the staff is accommodating. I CHECKED OUT of this place immediately! When we first checked in to the Best Western Lakeside and went to our first room, its lock was loose, the door jamb had been pried with a crowbar, and the deadbolt was bent (please see pics I'm posting). On top of that, there was hair left in the tub and when we turned the A/C on, black dirt came flying out of the vent and went all over the room (see pics). The second room we went to had the deadbolt hanging off the door from its screws (also see pics). The third room we were moved to was more disgusting than the others combined. The beds weren't made properly, huge stains were on the carpet, the electricity on one side of the room wasn't working, the lampshades were stained and crusty, there was dirt and hair all over the pillow, the divider curtain between the bedroom and dressing area was torn down, and there was a leak that dripped on the bathroom floor. The pictures are ALL posted here on TripAdvisor. Please do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere. The hotel is unsafe, full of sketchy characters, and clearly people are up to no good when two of the three rooms we went into had been broken into (according to the tell tale broken locks). The hotel is giving me a runaround when it comes to refunding my money now, too. I wouldn't recommend this DISGUSTING DUMP to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on 192 for the price”
Reviews.Author: DisneyMarc
Reviews.Content: We had always stayed at Holiday In Family Suites in the past and loved it... but the kids are older now and we just couldn't see ourselves going back there after a Nickelodeon Re-Theme change. Started looking around the Internet and found some good reviews on the BW Lakeside so we decided to give it a shot. We were not disappointed ! This place is great ! some highlights : *CHECK IN was quick and smooth *We asked for a ground floor room near the pool and the lobby and near a parking lot...we were accommodated *The Pizza Hut and Resort Buffet was great. We don't like Disney Dining or the prices that accompany Park Dining *LOCATION...OUTSTANDING ! short drive to Publix for groceries, Walgreens is practically in the same parking lot. At least 10 decent restaurants in walking distance *SHERBETH ROAD SHORTCUT ! only about 5 minutes to get to Animal Kingdom ! All other parks are easily reached as well with no traffic issues *Pools are clean, warm and fun *Room was clean and comfortable beds. Having a fridge and a safe in the room was very convenient *Great Price we will be back again for sure....would recommend this place to everyone who wants honest value and good service !

Reviews.Title: “A great break in Kissimme”
Reviews.Author: Ironside_11
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from 2wks in Orlando & stayed at the Best Western Lakeside in Kissimmee (Jan. 2011) . We enjoyed our stay as it was not too busy and provided an ideal location for the main theme parks (supported by a reliable free shuttle bus service to all the key parks). I'd strongly recommend Discovery Cove - the best water park by far. Hotel was also good for local restuarants & supermarkets (located on Highway 192). If you love Seafood (at reasonable prices with excellent service) would recommend the Red Lobster opposite. Food at the Hurricane Bar (in the hotel) was good plus the buffet breakfast offered every morning. All hotel staff v. helpful & polite. Good daily room service. The 3 swimming pools were clean & warm. Our lakeside bedroom was abit noisy (due to interconnecting doors). Please beware of one 'pushy' male ticket agent offering discounts in return for attendance at a timeshare seminar - just say no as it was a complete waste of a morning.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant and Enjoyable stay !!!!”
Reviews.Author: usabrit999
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the resort hotel over the New Year and thoroughly enjoyed every minute we spent there..Front Desk very helpful on arrival and throughout even when somewhat busy,Rooms kept very clean and tidy daily by the housekeeping staff.Warm outdoor swimming pools and compact fitness room. Good Buffet Breakfast at a reasonable price,Nice relaxing Sports Bar to return to after a busy day plus Pizza Hut restaurant,General Store along with a lighted 18 hole putt putt course and more. Excellent location with ample parking, What more can I say.....No complaints here !!!! Thank you Best Western for being part of a "Happy" New Year vacation for this family.

Reviews.Title: “Atrocious, Un-inhabitable, filthy, felt unsafe”
Reviews.Author: dorejam24
Reviews.Content: I am happy to offer praise and give my business to companies that make an effort to provide customers with a positive experience. I would, however, like to share my disappointment in the Best Western Lakeside in Kissimmee, FL. I never write reviews, but I believe that the filthiness and unsuitableness of this facility implores me to take the time to provide more feedback. Upon arrival to the hotel, we first noticed the poorly lit (essentially unlit) parking lot and the ill-kept condition of the property. However, having already paid for the hotel and with it having a 3-star rating on a discount travel site, I felt certain that the room itself would be suitable. When checking in, I was told that no king rooms were available. After explaining multiple times that I had booked this facility solely due to its offering a choice of bed on the website, the manager of the property was called to the desk, where she proceeded to somehow "find" an available king room. When we finally entered the room, we were put off by the overall dankness of the place, but hoped that a bit of time with the a/c on would help. It did not. The staleness and dankness never dissipated. Despite these warning signs, we were excited to get dressed and go out to ring in the New Year, so we attempted to shower. After turning on the shower and waiting for several minutes, we determined that we had no hot water. After a call to the front desk, someone from maintenance was sent to the room. After he examined the bathroom and sink, and ran the water himself for awhile, he concluded that the water was as warm as it would get. This seemed to satisfy the hotel, but it was not acceptable to us, nor would it have been acceptable in any hotel in which I have ever stayed. In the meantime, while waiting for the repairs we expected, we began to attempt to make ourselves comfortable on the bed and loveseat provided. After pulling off the very old, worn bedspread, we encountered threadbare sheets that, despite not being the appropriate size for the bed, had been simply draped atop a dilapidated mattress that had no pad or cover. This situation is untenable in a place where a mattress serves a multitude of people, and the state of the mattress was certainly not fresh or clean. Also, the three pillows provided were cased in unmatched linens, leading us to wonder if one or more of them had simply been left by another guest. I believe it is very reasonable to expect that a hotel provide its guests with a minimum level of confidence that they are not risking their health by staying at the property. Determining that the bed was unacceptable, we moved to the loveseat provided. As I turned on the lamp in the corner nearest the loveseat, I noticed the shade was severely stained. The stains appeared to be water stains, and given the mugginess of the room, and my experience in professional real estate investing and development, I began to suspect that the room had recently suffered a flooding of some sort. After turning on the lamp, I went to the loveseat. There is no way to describe my reaction, other than I was aghast at the condition and filthiness of it. The loveseat itself was threadbare to the point of seeing the cushioning at places, and in other places had stains that, while they may not have actually been, looked close enough to bodily secretions that we were extremely disconcerted. At this point, despite the front desk having told us quite some time ago that we would receive new bedding that never arrived, we determined that the property was untenable. Being that even the internet connection was not working, we were forced to set out on a last minute hotel search. The result of these circumstances caused us a large amount of stress, as we were unfamiliar with the area, and New Year's Eve is a particularly busy time for hotels. In the past year, I have spent upwards of 40 nights in various hotels and hundreds of nights over the course of my life, with these hotels ranging from Super 8 to Ritz-Carlton properties, with several Best Western facilities mixed in. I can say with confidence that this hotel was easily the worst property I have ever checked into. It is not only unworthy of three stars on any website, but it is not worthy of a Best Western flag. Perhaps it was simply the room we were given (since the manager had to "find" it, maybe it wasn't intended to be booked), but I can only base my comments on my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Wouldn't stay anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: RobynJacqueline
Reviews.Content: I was worried about staying in this hotel because of some of the negative reviews people were giving but having stayed there I couldn't honestly believe they were talking about the same hotel. Excellent location, any nearer the Disney parks and you would actually be in them. Buses to the parks from the hotel were really great. Drivers really friendly and run exactly on time, was a bit worried by not having a car and previous guests comments about not running to schedule. Nothing to be worried about at all. Staff were really great. Friendly, helpful and nothing was too much trouble. From front desk staff to restaurant staff and cleaning staff, all are a credit to you. Only thing I could maybe say was the bus to Universal/Seaworld left really early in the morning and left really early evening, meaning you miss out on late night attractions as it's quite far to get a taxi. But apart from that all was excellent. Wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else, cheaper or not, and that's why we can't wait to come back in August 11.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: siddarthrao
Reviews.Content: Hotel is average. Very Poor Service. No refill for Soaps or Shampoos provided. You may have to remind them twice and may get it after 1 hr. The bed is not comfortable. It scracthes you. Noticed that Mattress cover is of harsh material which scratches your skin. Better to remove it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service Reflective of Poor Hotel Management”
Reviews.Author: Skad00sh
Reviews.Content: We had a terrible experience at this hotel posing as a "resort". I don't know what was worse, the old rooms or the customer service by the staff. Oh, wait, the customer service was definitely worse. But being able to open my room door without having to kick the door in would have been nice, same with a comfortable bed and some shower gel along with the soap. They only have one person manning the front desk at a time, the other employee is either on lunch or break and they aren't clear how many lunches/breaks they have. Make sure to check out extra early because of this lack of staff. When you ask to speak to a manager the manager is always in a meeting. When the manager calls your room to leave you a message there is no message in the voicemail inbox, it is blank so you don't know who left you the message (except in our case, we were expecting a call from the manager and no one else had our room number). They refuse to give you a direct number to call the manager at - what is with the gate-keeping? When you finally get to speak to the manager about the poor customer service he just defends the employee rather than listening to you and trying to resolve the problem. They charge you with hidden fees (aka "resort fees") when you are checking in after you have already booked/paid. They promise you one thing and then change their minds. What happened to the "customer is always right?" I will never go back to this hotel or recommend it. It has stained my memories of our orlando vacation.

Reviews.Title: “They hold their own !!”
Reviews.Author: Love2travelHamptonNH
Reviews.Content: Each time I return here, I am always impressed with my room. Considering the size of this property, rooms always look fresh and inviting. Minor issues, no privacy card in my room this time and the outside stairs had cigarette butts that weren't cleaned up the entire week and the shower curtain had stains on it. They offered a special of $39.00 nightly but once taxes and the resort fee were added, it was a little more then $50.00 per night. Yes there are cheaper places on 192 but like the saying goes, you get what you pay for!! Location is great !!

Reviews.Title: “A large and pleasant hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TravellingPensioner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were visiting Kisimmee again after many years and this hotel fulfilled our expectations. It was large with many children and tourists (we're Brits. ourselves) but very comfortable and reasonably quiet. Parking was no problem.The rooms were of adequate size with comfortable beds. The $8 breakfasts were very comprehensive and good value for money. The hotel is very convenient to Epcot. There is a desk in reception selling cut price Disney tickets - but only if you are prepared to attend a 2 hour time share presentation first! Whilst staying at this hotel we found an Outback Restaurant (on the other side of the Highway) which provided good food at a reasonable price. Overall a pleasant and comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute disaster all in one place, no security”
Reviews.Author: Easties65
Reviews.Content: Never again! I'd rather stay in a dog kennel! Guest svc. was very slow except for Breakfast. There were never enough towels, pools were in lock down as well as the game room, there was no security whatsoever, I booked ther for the AYF National Football Conference because I had to, but as many times and places as I have travelled, I would never recommend this facility to anyone. Totally appauled!

Reviews.Title: “This is the worst Hotel I have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: caitjust1
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very dirty and have a musty odor to them. Not only did the toliet in the bathroom leak but the actual size of the bathroom is no bigger than a closet. The doors of the rooms barely lock and the sense of security is next to none. We have been here for four days and there has been 2 room break ins, a brawl, and trash cans set on fire. I can not wait to check out of this dump!!! Unfortunately we are stuck here until the American Youth Football National champions are over!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun but noisy”
Reviews.Author: fpotocnik
Reviews.Content: Early Xmas vacation is great this time of year. Alex is a great desk receptionist(front) who has a great personality,will accomodate you any way he can to make your stay pleasant. BEING AT THIS HOTEL many times, the only problem right now is a few kids football teams being booked now to play in football over at Disney Facilities. WHILE a little noisy duringthe day which is ok,night time noise at 1am to 3am is totally no good The running in the room and loud talking and a few kids walking the outside corridors of building 15 in the early hrs.WHERES THE COACH+CHAPERONES?

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel close to major attractions. (Disney alternative)”
Reviews.Author: FamilyVaca12
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this resort. The rooms are clean and the staff friendly. The front desk travel desk is a little pushy with their time share promotion. But they will leave you alone once you tell them you are not interested. The outdoor heated pool is clean. They have free Wi Fi. The best part is their hot breakfast buffet. I think it was $8 per adult and kids are free. The restaurant staff are extremely helpfull and friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel. I would consider this a great hotel in the three star category. Good, clean hotel with friendly service for visting the attarctions. The only part I did not like is the $8 per day resort fee they charge. I knew about this ahead of time so I was expecting yet. If they get rid of this resort fee I am sure their rating will jump up even higher.

Reviews.Title: “Sometimes... you get less than you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: JustATravelingMan02
Reviews.Content: For the money, it really wasn't too bad of a facility. The housekeeping left a lot to be desired as the rooms were never "clean". The beds were reasonably comfortable even having ancient bedding and drapes for a bedspread. The rooms were reasonably spacious but dreary and drab. The entire place needs a lot of updating. The pool was fairly nice and the grounds were decently kept. Our largest issues were with the staff. I found them less than accommodating. They were about the only people in Florida that didn't seem to love their jobs! Their Guest Services will just about drive you around the bend with their constant promotion of some Mystic Dunes Resort they were trying to sell to everyone who would listen and many more who didn't want to. My biggest complaint was their Internet... or their lack of it. Their wireless is non-existent and their LAN is just plain bad. For this reason alone, although their are many others, I would not stay at this hotel again. Please note the picture of the toilet included. This was how we found it when we moved in - and instead of complaining, we decided to just leave it and see if it was ever cleaned properly.... It looked the same when we left. Nasty. The sprinklers? Well, probably functional, but far from shiny. But it was a nice pool with nice grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: crystalLux
Reviews.Content: Nice and comfortable hotel. Good size rooms with all you need. Nice swimming pools too and practical for families with young children. Very nice breakfast buffet for a decent price. Only negative side, the day we checked out they only had 1 staff on duty that could check-out. She was very ill and did her best, but check-out took a really long time. I feel this should have been managed better at a Best Western hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location and base for orlando visit”
Reviews.Author: teddypip78
Reviews.Content: travelled with virgin holidays,rooms clean and functional, all staff very friendly. The breakfast buffet excellent value and service and within walking distance of bars restaurants and shops would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs, Dirty Hallways, Unacceptable Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: poweraap
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stopped here with our two children for one night. We were driving to Disney World and got there a day earlier than expected and were not able to check-in at our Disney property hotel. This hotel was recommended to us by AAA because of its affordability and proximity to Disney World. We arrived at the hotel at 11PM. I was immediately struck by how dirty the hallways and stairwells were. They haven't been painted or powerwashed in some time and it gave the hotel an overall shabby feel. When we arrived at our room, it was dark and outdated. The door to the room did not close well. We had to jiggle the handle several times to ensure that the lock was catching. The corners of the bathroom were dingy looking. I could have dealt with all of this considering the price and the short period of time that we would be spending there. But the next morning as we were packing up our things and getting ready to leave, I noticed 3 small bugs crawling on the bed that I had slept in with my 3 year old daughter. We called the front desk and maintenance arrived. They confirmed that these were bed bugs. We asked them what we should do and they told us to wash our clothes and dry them for a while at a high heat. They didn't know what hotel mgmt would do. The maintenance people left and we continued to pack up our things. Noone from hotel mgmt contacted us in the room. We loaded up the car with the intention of heading to the nearest laundromat and then I went to the front desk. I told them that I was checking out of the room with the bed bugs and I was told that they were waiving the resort fee of $15. I thought that they should have refunded all of our money. I inquired about the nearest laundromat and shared that I should receive more money off the cost of my room since I would now have to launder all of my clothes that were already clean otherwise. He told me that they have a laundromat but that if I wanted to get more money off I would need to speak to a manager. I said I would like to speak to the manager. I waited for close to 10 minutes and no manager ever came to the desk. The man at the check in finally returned to me with free laundry tokens to do one load of laundry. At this point, I just wanted to get out of there so I could tend to my clothes, head to a gas station to vacuum our suitcases and get my family to our Disney World resort which I assure you was 110% better than this hotel. Seven days after my stay at the Best Western bed bug bites have appeared all over my body. This has been a completely awful nightmare. I am praying that we caught the problem and have not brought these bugs back to our home with us. It is an abomination that hotel mgmt. never attempted to contact me and offer an apology. I understand that bed bugs are unfortunately a problem that many hotels are having but the way that this was dealt with is completely unacceptable. Please never give business to this property. And please, when you check in to any hotel, do a thorough check of the bed (mattresses, sheets, pillows, under the mattress,etc. I would not wish this experience on anyone. All for an 8 hour stay before what was supposed to be a stress-free vacation to Disney World. Also, as an aside, during the short time that I was there, I noticed that since the rooms were non-smoking, the guests would stand right outside their rooms to smoke. With no designated smoking area, it made for an unpleasant walk back and forth to the main building with small children having to walk through people's second hand smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, clean and inexpensive.”
Reviews.Author: Midwesterner007
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very good for our stay in the Orlando area. We didn't want to spend a lot of money for a place that we were, basically, just going to crash after long days at the parks. For $25/night (Hotwire) we were booked at this hotel--which provided a clean, basic room (with a fridge and safe). Everything worked properly. The property was quiet and housekeeping did an outstanding job keeping the room clean. They did charge a "resort fee" but we felt that we got our money's worth using the shuttle to get to Disney and the other parks (where parking is $12 and over). The shuttles were on time and no complaints (except slight overcrowding). The grounds looked fine and the kids loved the playground and golf course. We liked it OK and would recommend for those who want a decent (although not the fanciest) place to sleep for a short or longer-term stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Excellent Service - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sunshine02008
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days and had a wonderful experience. We often stay at the Disney resort hotels but the Lakeside offers everything Disney does at a fraction of the price. The rooms are large, comfortable and super clean. We enjoyed the hotel's free miniature golf. We did get rooms pool side and will probably not do that again as it is a little noisy at night.. The only problem we had was our smoke alarm went off during the night and we didn't realize we could have called to have someone come right away and change the battery and we waited until the morning. Dimitri kindly comped us a hotel breakfast for our trouble. Barbara cooks the best omelets and eggs made to order and there is also a huge buffet of assorted breakfast items. At the front desk Marylee and Alex were very friendly and helpful. Great vacation - this is where we will stay all the time!

Reviews.Title: “joy location to stay.”
Reviews.Author: jamespolmeer
Reviews.Content: My family stayed 3 nights. The Hotel had a kiddiePool, little playground and they were all utilised alot throughout our visit. The morning meal buffet was a large worth with a kind of foods. I suggest this hotel for any person on a allowance that likes a clean, joy location to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Get Real!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jake E
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before, both as a Gold Crown Member (with points) and by buying via Travelocity. The hotel is convenient to WDW, but charges a $7.50 per night "Resort Fee" (let's face it, it's a motel), and tries to push an $8 buffet breakfast (they say that's the discounted price) when Sizzler, across the street offers a much better option for $3.99 plus beverage. Unfortunately, this last stay included both bugs and a noisy!!!! A/C unit, not to mention five different ice machines that were empty or out of order.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding value with a lot of extras in a perfect location at Disney's Main Gate.”
Reviews.Author: Sean148
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the four star hotels that do not offer as much as the superior value at the Best Western Lakeside. Its location is perfectly situated to Disney's World Drive about one mile away set back from the main Route 192. The staff was very welcoming and you could tell they would do anything to make your stay enjoyable. There are three large U-shaped buildings all designed around a huge pool as the centerpiece for each with a kiddie pool also. Each night they put out a large projection tv and set it at poolside that offered sports and regular shows. That was a great way to stay with the kids, socialize with others and enjoy the beautiful weather after a long day at the theme parks. Also for children they had a basketball court, playground area and mini-golf. Our building was located with easy access to the main lobby that included a great restaurant, snack shop, game room for kids, and a Pizza Hut. Just out from the parking lot is located a 24 hour Walgreen's for all of your needs at lower prices. The hotel offered free wireless internet that at many hotels are offered at an additional daily fee. The rooms were clean, newly refurbished, and spacious enough for two double beds and a sitting area with a table and three chairs, along with a smallish new bathroom with the vanity area at the end of the main room. All of the furnishings appeared to be new. To receive all of this at a price in the high-$30's per night was the greatest value I have ever gotten in approximately twenty trips to the Orlando area. I am absolutely staying there every time I return and am still shocked at the price, convenience, perks and quality that outdoes many of the finer hotels. This Best Western Lakeside did everything right for weary travelers with kids and grand-kids and deserves a very high rating and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean hotel, friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Lili100
Reviews.Content: My partner and son stayed at the Best Western Lakeside in Kisimmee and we found this to be quite a good hotel that although decor wise was a bit dated, it was good value for money. The room was cleaned daily although sometimes the standard was better than others and the beds were changed and clean towels put in the bathroom. If reception needed to be called any querys were delt with promptly and efficently. The breakfast buffet was good value(around 16 dollers)for 2 adults kids under sixteen ate free, we tried other breakfast buffets and found the hotel to be of a better standard and again good value and tips were included in the price..my son loved the breakfasts and there was a cheff who would cook omlettes or anything you wanted fresh, the standard was very very good and tasty! We went one night to Hurrican Sams which is on the hotel premise and although the meal was ok(not outstanding or anything), the menu was very simple however the staff were extreamely nice and service was good. The hotel was a good base for going to the parks or anywhere we wanted to go, and it had a lot of fast food places around it and we walked to some of them which was handy, as my teenage son would not walk the length of himself normally.. The hotel pool(s) were good, nice and clean and there was a pool bar and lots of sunbeds and tables and chairs to sit around it, there was also laundrettes which were adequate to do the job. Like I mentioned before although the rooms were a bit dated and maybe in need of some refurbishment they were perfectly functunal and the staff were very helpful and pleasant, the only gripe we had was on our first night there one of the staff was quite pushy and insistant that we have a look and make a date to view a timeshare property, at first we did not know what she was going on about, but when she asked us lots of questions and asked for twenty dollers to secure our 'breakfast' and two hour talk, she also said there was NO preassure to buy and that we would get $70 dollers back..we were not interested but she kept going on..that was if anything, the only drawback and dissapointment for us(we were tired and just wanted our room keys..however dont think she was a best western staff member..I would definately recomend this hotel and aks people to bare in mind it wasnt five star ,but a perfectly decent place to stay with helpful staff and good location and if you have small kids it has crazy golf, basketball, sand pits, play parks, and free swimming toys in pool, we would definately go back! Thank you Best Western staff Kissimmee for a really enjoyable holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Virgin customers BEWARE !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Disney2000
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently booked a package holiday through Virgin. We had read mixed reviews about Best Western Lakeside but decided to keep an open mind. We arrived in Florida late Friday night and since it was the first time hiring a car we ended up getting lost, when we finally arrived at Best Westen we had almost been up 24 hours, we were greeted very warmly, but i believe this was with the intention of trying to get us to upgrade to their new rooms "for only $25 a night" after we declined and asked for our room key so that we could get some rest, she asked for a credit card incase we ordered stuff from the room, so being as tired as we were we just handed the card over. It wasn't until the next day that I thought we had better check if they had put a hold on the card, so when we enquired about this, the man at the desk said that they would hold $140 for the whole stay, $10 a night. I thought thats fine we'll just make sure we dont overspend. but later in the holiday when we were checking the balances of the cards it turned out they were actually holding $190, when we queried it she said the computer had done this of its own accord, we asked if she could release it and pay a cash deposit and she said that she did, however at checkout it turns out she didn't and blatantly lied to us about it. Anyway to get to the most important part if you have early check in like many Virgin customers do. My family and I went down to Downtown Disney at 8.30am with our suitcases to get them checked in, we decided that we were going to have breakfast out and then go back to the room and shower before we had to leave. We returned to our room at aprox 10.45am, we had been advised when we arrived that we would be required to check out at 12 noon, so you can imagine our distress at returning and all of our hand luggage, coats, toiletries and food and juice in the fridge all gone and the beds were all made for the next guests.
