I phoned reception and they put me through to house keeping, the maid and i assume her boss turned up at the room with our bags and what she said was all of our belongings, we checked all of the bags, my son had over $100 worth of lego in his bag and my daughter had her purse and dsi in hers, which might i add when returned were all open! Nothing seemed to be missing. I asked about our food and toiletries and she said they had all been thrown out, this consisted of juices and food as our flight wasn't until later that night. As if this wasn't infuriating enough the maid who i will not name thought this was hillarious. We recieved what she said was all the coats in a Best Western carrier bag and when i poured them out my coat was missing, I made sure the maids stayed until everything was checked and when i said to her my coat was missing she laughed and told me to come with her. I followed her to her trolly/cart where all the towels, sheets etc were kept, she moved a pile of towels to the side on the trolley and she had an Aladins cave of stuff hidden there, she actually handed me someone elses cardigan, I told her that it wasn't mine and pointed mine out to her. I was so furious i expressed my dissapointment at the front desk at check out and asked what their policy was regarding checkout time, the girl said that sometimes if a room looks vacant the maid will just go in and clean it, when i mentioned the amount of belongings in the room she had the nerve to turn around and say that sometimes people leave things, my reply to that was "you really expect me to believe that people leave four hand luggage bags, four coats, all of their toiletries and juices and food in the fridge?" i told her that we all expected to have a quick shower before we left but now that all of our stuff was gone this was not possible, this was not even responded to, i also followed on by saying that this would be fair enough if the maid went to the room after 12noon instead of going in mid morning. Her reply to me then was "what exactly is it you would like me to do?" I was so angry I had to just tell her to make sure that her staff wait untill proper check out time before going into the rooms and that she was lucky i didn't call the police. Thinking on it now i wish i had, i feel that my belongings were stolen and i had no way to make sure that we had everything as it was all gone. I feel like my trust has been violated. These maids were tipped every day, and it wasn't until at the airport that i realised that we had money sitting on the table and she'd taken the lot, we hadn't had a chance to sort it out before she took it. She must have thought all of her birthdays had come at once. I'm trying to think of a positive side because i know i was having a good time before this happened. The rooms were clean enough although i don't think they hovered the whole time we were there. I will not be staying here again simply because i do not trust them, i do believe she was keeping my coat for herself and she had gone through all of the childrens bags. I cannot express how dissapointed i am and i can only hope that nobody else experiences this kind of treatment. I would advise anyone who stays here just to clarify that on the day of check out you will not have a maid go in to your room in the morning while your out and take all of your stuff and to give proof of the amount of money being held on any cards. It would have been very embarrassing if we had overspent and our card been declined because we didn't know they were keeping $50 dollars more.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place”
Reviews.Author: lordelpus
Reviews.Content: Check in was fast and very efficient and they gave you a map to show you exactly where your room was. The room itself was spotlessly clean and the house keeping services kept it this way throughout our stay. The pools were first class with plenty of towels and plenty of sun loungers to laze about on. This Hotel is central to all attractions and is easy to find from Orlando International Airport. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone who i knew was going to the Orlando area. I shall be booking this Hotel next year for our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Beds But Very Clean room”
Reviews.Author: msparker
Reviews.Content: I booked here for a solo trip to Disney. Check in was a breeze, I had already paid for my room and all i had to do was check in. I had heard about the crazy overzealous timeshare people in the lobby so I avoided them by telling them I’d come and get my "special check in only offer" later. I was told that it was only valid at check in. I smiled and left, explaining that it was too cold in the lobby. (It was actually very cold in the lobby). I went to check into my hotel room and I was glad that it was very clean. I dropped my stuff off and when I was leaving to get dinner I noticed that the curtains did not shut all the way. I also realized that as I was walking along the corridor I could semi see into other rooms as well. I stopped at the pizza hut in the lobby and ordered a pizza (which is a great breakfast if you put it in the provided fridge). While my pizza was being cooked I went over to Walgreens across the parking lot and bought some safety pins to close the curtains, they worked wonderful! The Pizza was a bit pricey $17 for a medium. The beds were small; they say they are a double but honestly I don't think two adults could fit comfortably on one bed. the next evening when I came back housekeeping had left all the lights on in my room, which didn't bother me too much since it was nice to have that light when I returned from a long day at the parks. Unfortunately they also turned the air on super cold and so I had to turn the heat on, and in Florida the first few minutes that a heater is on, it smells. I also noticed that my dirty towels were gone, but housekeeping didn't replace them. There is the daily resort fee, so that adds about another $8 to your nightly hotel fee. I thought it was very nice and safe hotel, once you make certain the curtains are closed so no one can peek in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: uknews
Reviews.Content: Been to Orlando/ Kissimmee 3 times in the past 6 years and stayed at BWL twice in that time including Oct 2010 (just got back this morning). Perfect location, staff friendly and helpful, comfortable and clean rooms, fridge and safe in-room, and good rates. If you've ever stayed in a 4 or 5 star hotel anywhere in the world you would probably bemoan the fact that this hotel is 'basic' or 'downmarket', but the fact is that for reasonable money you get a nice base for your theme park shenanigans. Can't comment on food on site as there is too much to choose from restaurant wise off-site, and hired a car so can't comment on theme park shuttle buses either.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SonnersHull
Reviews.Content: A great location with free transport to all Disney and Universal parks. Room was a bit dated but clean with all facilities including a refrigerator and safe. Only downer was being talked into going to a timeshare meeting in order to get free tickets to theme park.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need - really great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dollygirl77
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay at this hotel and hopefully returning next year - we really like it here. Great to use as a base and has clean, comfortable accomodation at a great price and a great location - what more could you want? The rooms are clean and have all you need including TV, iron, safe, coffee maker and a good sized fridge. The air conditioning is very effective - a little noisy if you leave it on at night but I think that is more because we are not used to AC in the UK! The pools are a good size with plenty of sun loungers and towels and are never busy. Have never used the shuttle buses to the parks as we always hire a car, so can't comment on those. Never had breakfast here as we like Dennys for breakfast, but the breakfast buffet looks really nice. The onsite Pizza Hut is great - get a takeaway and sit at one of the tables by the pool with a beer. Plenty of places to eat nearby including TGI Fridays, Outback, Red Lobster, Macdonalds, Wendys etc. Big supermarket just over the road and a Walgreens right next door. Approx 10 mins drive from Disney and about 25 mins from Universal and Seaworld. Staff are very professional and accommodating. This stay we had a problem getting rental movies on TV so I rang reception and within 10 minutes a guy came and fixed it. If you are looking for luxury accomodation and like to be pampered, then this hotel is probably not for you, but if you are like us and you like to do your own thing and be left alone when on holiday, this place is the best!

Reviews.Title: “excellent friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: nice59
Reviews.Content: nice basic rooms,decent restaurant,great pool, good bar, perfect central location.

Reviews.Title: “great little place”
Reviews.Author: Dave8479
Reviews.Content: Very basic hotel, comfy bed, free wi-fi, very tidy and just out of the "really expensive zone" Just 10 minutes away from all Disney Resorts, but at a fraction of the price of hotels 5 minutes down the road! Surrounded by good restaurants and gift shops etc, this place was perfect for us on our Honeymoon, so much so, we are taking our friends' 8 and 6 year old boys in Feb.... Staff are friendly (but aren't all Americans compared to Brits!) and the pool is a great "wake up call" before hitting the parks! We didn't use the hotels facilities, but for no reason other than we wanted to spend long days in the parks!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: cksecrets
Reviews.Content: Basically you get what you pay for. The sheets on the bed were not clean. The photos of the hotel said one thing and the actual site is another thing. Could have been cleaner. Needs an elevator to carry your suitcase instead of dragging it up those steps. I ended up going to Target to buy sheets because I did not feel comfortable sleeping on those at the hotel. Also i think its more of a Motel than a Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again.......”
Reviews.Author: NotHappy09_23_2010
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 7 days at this Best Western. I travel frequently for my job and we utilize Best Western Hotels across the country, and I have to say this is the worst Best Western I have stayed in. I have learned thru travel to let the maids in every couple days or so, first to save money and to lessen someone touching my stuff, have a little OCD. The entire hotel needs a good scrubbing........it doesn't appear to have been updated in several several years. The staff was friendly but, you do feel hounded about the time share stuff, it seems every time you go near the front desk you get hounded. The rooms were not clean, the water pressure in the bathroom was pitiful, and the towels have stains on them, which creeps me out. The 50' breakfast buffet for $8.00 per person is not worth it, the better deal is the $4.50 to go container. My boyfriend and I would each get a container......would then get an omelet, english muffin, some bacon and potatoes, and for both of us it would be 2lbs........which is $9.00 plus tax, which is a lot better than $16.00 plus tip, plus tax.......and we would bring our own drinks, take our little to go containers and sit outside and enjoy our breakfast. Another little shock was the additional charge of $7.50 a day that was not included in the package I had purchased. I am sorry to say that I would not recommend this hotel, unless renovations are completed/ and or that scrubbing I mentioned earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit”
Reviews.Author: caitlinsdad35
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this hotel, and its sad to say the place is starting to look tired. But the staff are still extremely friendly, the location is awsome and its good value for money. Will we return? Not unless the place is refurbished.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel, it is what it says”
Reviews.Author: littleanna777
Reviews.Content: We spent 12 nights at Best Western Lakeside in Kissimmee, what a wonderful hotel. We had a huge room with a kind size bed facing the pool. The staff of the hotel made our stay even better (waitress Ana was lovely and helpful, Demetrius at the front desk kindly allowed us to check out later and our maid Emilia made sure everything was spot on in the room) The hotel is lovely, has its own transport to Disney parks and Universal (the only departure is at 7.30 am which is a little bit too early). You can take a free transfer, monorail or ferry to other Disney parks ad free transport to water parks. The hotel drivers are very helpful, but make sure you tip them and they going to tell you everything you need to know. Hotel swimming pool was huge and heated, so it was very pleasant to have a little swim early morning. As our holiday was off season, it was pretty quiet in the hotel and at the parks. Be careful with Mystic Dynes timeshare presentation which is offered to attend at the reception. If you decide to go for it and get some free tickets be determined that you can say no. Don't look too interested and they will offer you free tickets to some shows and free transfer to and from the hotel. Location of the hotel is great, close to Premium outlets and the parks, there are some lovely restaurants near by, buffet Golden Coral is amazing and great value. Would recommend this hotel to everyone, we had an amazing time and the hotel staff looked after us very well.

Reviews.Title: “second visit still a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: GaryUK19
Reviews.Content: Came back to the bw after our first visit in 2008 went so well. Like many others reading the mixed reviews we were hoping the standards at the hotel were as good as 2 years ago - we weren't disappointed! We were lucky enough to stay in the same room as last time which had been redecorated including new carpets. The mini golf had had a face lift and the pool area and grounds in general were all kept clean and tidy (even after the thunder storms). The staff were all kind and helpful and made us feel welcome from the start of our holiday. We had breakfast in the greenhouse onsite restaurant most mornings, fantastic value for money - both our 12 and 15 year olds ate free and we bought vouchers from reception in advance for myself and my wife. This meant we all ate a hearty breakfast for less than $20 compared with Shoneys poor breakfast across the road for $40! The bw yet again proved to be an excellent base for not only the Disney/Universal parks but most of Central Florida! Well done Best Western - hope to visit again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: ALteacherK
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a trip to Orlando. We spent one night at the Best Western Lakeside, and checked in early the next day to our disney resort. I got an awesome price on Priceline for the Best Western Lakeside and we were very pleased. We arrived around 7:00 PM and checked in immediately. We had a poolside room (It was one of the smaller pools) and the room was exceptionally clean and nice. We had zero complaints about it. The pool was also great; very clean, and we had it all to ourselves. The staff here was fabulous; very helpful and friendly. I gave this property only 4 stars because of the timeshare solicitation at the front desk. The man was really nice, but we didn't really want to see a timeshare. If you do go to the presentation, be prepared. The free breakfast that they serve you is not worth the two plus hours you'll spend telling a pushy salesman that you aren't interested. That said, I would definitely return to the Best Western Lakeside and I would recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded our expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: Shyjka
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this hotel. This was our first trip to Florida, and our teenage sons first trip to USA. From the moment we arrived we felt warmly welcomed, any questions were answered, and all staff were so incredibly friendly and cheerful. If only the sunny attitude of everyone was replicated here in uk! Our room was lovely and clean, regular towel and linen changes etc. There is a proper fridge in each room so we could stock up on snacks either from nearby Target or on site General Store. The rooms look a little dated, which is why i didnt score a 5 for them. All communal areas were immaculate, including a truly impressive guest laundry, with plenty of washers and dryers, meaning I had washed all our clothes for our onward trip to Ft Lauderdale. To summarise, this is a great place to stay, cant wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Another fabulous stay at Best Western, Lakeside”
Reviews.Author: jim1fun1
Reviews.Content: We came down in April and stayed for four days and came back again August 30th for four more days. What a bargain, nice clean room, pools, mini golf, restaurants, bar, game room and complimentary transportation to the major theme parks. All this on one facility and a great staff to boot. Marylee actually printed out my return plane tickets when the airline site wouldn't cooperate with me on the hotels free access computer. I'll definitely be back when I'm in Orlando. This hotel is definitely underrated on the travel sites.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel,excellent value>”
Reviews.Author: andyc6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in May/June this year, we chose it because it was very reasonably priced and in an excellent location to the Disney resort area. On arrival we were warmly greeted by the reception staff, check in was smooth and we were given a map to our room. At this point we did encounter the guest services guy who is a time share salesman in disguise, dont let this put you off-just say your not interested and you will be left alone. We found our room to be quite large, seemed to be quite clean however didnt really stand up to close inspection, it wasnt bad but it could have been better. We found our safe wasnt working properly, i put in a call to reception and it was fixed within five mins, excellent service. Amenities are very good here, internet access, mini golf, large swimming pools which were very clean, small kids play area to name but a few, also transport to Disney World, Universal, and Sea World is included as part of your stay, we didnt use this as we had a car, was rather relieved too because there were big queues for the buses but its there if you need it. Lots of places to eat nearby on highway 192, but we found the hotel itself was best for breakfast. One point to make about the housekeeping, the room was cleaned every day and towels changed as we needed them, however 3 days into our stay the maid stopped leaving us coffee/tea, i mentioned it at reception and they suggested tipping the maid at various times during our 14 night stay aswell as at the end, i tried this, i left a $15 tip after 4 days and guess what ! We had tea/coffee coming out of our ears, bizarre ! It does seem like the more you tip the better maid service you get. All in all i was very pleased with our stay and would both recommend this hotel to others, and would stay here again myself. Its just that you need to become a little bit "streetwise" about some things, but dont worry, you will !!!

Reviews.Title: “Relieved!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyMad_UK
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Virgin Holidays and I decided to read the reviews after the reservations were made. I will be honest, a lot of reviews seemed quite negative and I was worried. I am a born worrier anyway and our last Florida holiday was to Disney's Caribbean Beach, so I was beside myself, thinking of the disappointment that lay ahead. I even rang Virgin begging to swop hotels, but it was too late and too expensive. So we got on the plane and arrived hours later at this hotel. It is located on the 192, which is a bit tacky, but you pull right off in into the hotel grounds. Checking in was very fast and they took $100 cash as a deposit as I didn't have my credit card. The reception had internet access, pay phones, a Pizza Hut takeout, ideal little store as well as a bar and restaurants. The staff were friendly and efficient. We drove to our room, which was almost identical to the Caribbean Beach's rooms. It was very clean, with iron and board, hairdryer, coffee maker, cups, a excellent size safe, fridge etc. It felt better equipt than the C.B. Out side the room was a 24 hour laundry room...very useful, a gym, two pools which were nearly always empty and clean in a pretty environment. We were also close to a little waterfall feature and the grounds were actually quite pretty. I had been expecting a hovel, but I could not have been more wrong. The cleaner came daily and was flexible if we wanted a bit of a lie in, she'd come back later when we were out. Our belongings were untouched and our bed was changed a couple of time during our three week stay. The pizza hut was idealwhen we got home to late to eat out and we'd have pizza, cola and choccies while watching the Nancy Grace repeats. If any one out there is worrying about this hotel, please stop now. It was fine, better than fine. It matched the Caribbean beach in all but location and even that wasn't too bad. It was also very sadly near an IHOP, which contributed towards my recent weight gain. We had a lovely holiday and checking out was sad, even though I got my $100 back, which I wasn't expecting as I'd made local phone calls. There is a nightly resort fee, but Virgin customers don't have to pay this, so that was another thing less to worry about. Over all, go to this hotel, not expecting luxury of course, but we spent three weeks there and we'd go back again tomorrow without hesitation. Hope this helps any doubters.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel for twice the money...we were very pleased”
Reviews.Author: texasrose777
Reviews.Content: very convient to restaurants, min. golf, shopping plus all of disney....room was clean and in good condition...carpet was newer, staff is excellent, breakfast was a good buffet

Reviews.Title: “from England Third time here,still excellent”
Reviews.Author: BradfordGran
Reviews.Content: Really good location to everythingand has a pub,pizza hut,shop,free mini golf(been restored since our last visit) also a basket ball area which our grandsons really enjoyed(could do with a bit more light though) the staff were really polite and helpfull, the rooms are cleaned every day to a good standed all three pools are very well kept and the general area`s are immaculate.we have just one complaint the resort fee as doubled+ since our last visit from $3.50 to $7.50 which we were not aware of untill we saw it on the desk on check in, this eats into spending money when people are not aware, on a lighter note we would also like to thank Michell Fisher who we contacted to request a room area and also two rooms together,we were given both. Well Done Best Western Lakeside we enjoyed our stay as always

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ccicchetti
Reviews.Content: My new husband and myself stayed at the Best Western Lakeside from 26th July to 9th August 2010. We arrived to a twin room and swiftly rang reception to explain we were on our honeymoon and would like a kingsize bed. Reception happily moved us to a king room that was poolside, our original room wasn't. The loc ation of this room 185 was great as it was right in front of the pool and close to the amenities of the hotel, bar, rception etc. The room was very clean and quite large which was better than I had expected and there were plenty of towels for us. The room was cleaned every day and everything refreshed, so we never needed to ask for anything. The bed was extremely comfortable and the pillows, although slightly fluffed up, also allowed for a peaceful night. We didn't hear anything from our neighbours whilst in our room which was good, the only noisy part was the air con but you could turn the fan down at night. The weather was over 95 whilst we were there and very humid so we did have the air con on all day every day to allow us to feel normal in the room! The room had a large TV and a fridge which was large enough to fit in plenty of water and juice bottles. We walked over to the Walgreens in the parking lot and purchased a 24 pack of bottled water for about $4 which lasted us a good few days and meant we always had some cold in the fridge ready to drink. The pool was warm and always had fresh towels, which was good. It was never busy and stayed open until 11pm which meant you could go out for the day and still have a swim when we got back. The only major problem we had was the guy on the recreation/concerge desk who did try on several occasions to sell us a timeshare talk but we were firm and just said 'No' and he left us alone! The location was perfect, 5 minute drive from Disney and about 15 minutes from International drive which was ideal. We didn't use the free shuttles so I cannot comment on the service. We visited Hurricane Sam's bar nearly every evening and found a nice, relaxed atmosphere. We did notice however a few days in that a 18% gratuity was added to our bar bill every time and we had been also leaving a tip. We soon stopped this and were also dissappointed to find that some US travellers we befriended whilst we were there, were not charged this on their bill!!! Overall a great hotel, do note however there is a local resort fee payable on departure which we had already been informed about and was $3.50 a night. There was a sign on reception to say that it was $7 if you arrived direct to the hotel. We didn't eat in the hotel but there was a Carabba's, Buffalo Wild Wings, Red Lobster, Outback Steakhouse, Giorgiano's, TGI's all within walking distance and provided great food for our stay. Also for breakfast we stopped in at iHop, Denny's and Perkins all within a 2 minute drive of the hotel. We would definately go back to this hotel if we visit again and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: JohnandHelenLeeds
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and fantastic location as not to near to all the parks but near enough so not driving for hours. The rooms were a good size and had everything we needed, fair enough they were a little basic but on a holiday like ours we only wanted a base to sleep and weren't looking for 5 star accomodation. But the hotel is worth the 3 star rating. House keeping were great and always happy to leave extra towels if requested. The staff were so friendly and helpful and nothing was ever too much trouble. The food at breakfast and in the bar were great and excellent value for money- my husband fell in love with the omlettes and had them nearly every day we were there. Check in and out couldn't have gone any more smoothly. We have already booked to stay again in May 2011 and looking forward to 2 weeks of the same next year, even hoping if we call the hotel in advance we can stay in the same block and even the same room again- fingers crossed.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - good base for visiting theme parks”
Reviews.Author: Ellanora
Reviews.Content: My 13 year old son and I stayed here for two nights this past weekend. I unexpectedly had a few days off and decided to visit one of the Disney water parks, so we started looking for an inexpensive place to stay with good reviews; we found both with Best Western Lakeside. The base rate was under $50 per night, which was an excellent value for the amenities and location. The rooms themselves are standard-issue; two doubles or one king, bathroom, table and chairs, with sink and vanity area. They do have refrigerators and coffee makers in room, and most importantly, were clean and comfortable with everything in working order. The value comes with the amenities - two nice, heated pools plus a children's wading pool, mini golf, and a nice arcade room. Also onsite is a pool bar, a dinner restaurant/bar, a breakfast buffet restaurant complete with omelet station, a Pizza Hut Express, and an additional shop with a variety of food and drink options. The large main building is nicely painted and decorated inside, with plenty of seating for all of the food options. Also, there is outdoor seating along the water outside. All of the motel staff we encountered were friendly and helpful, and the motel itself is less than 10 minutes from Disney. They do offer a shuttle to the main Disney parks, but as we were visiting one of the water parks, we were not able to use it. Overall, I would recommend this motel as a great choice for a base to visit the parks from.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, comfortable rooms, wonderful food!”
Reviews.Author: levadne
Reviews.Content: Since we live in Florida, my family frequently comes to Orlando to vist the parks. We decided to choose a less expensive hotel and found the Best Western Lakeside to have more amenities (pools, gameroom, free shuttle service to the parks, on-site dining and bar/lounge, walking distance to mini golf, tons of restaurants, gift shops, and a Walgreens right next door) than the more expensive hotels & resorts that we've stayed in. We will definately use this hotel from now on when visiting the parks!

Reviews.Title: “July 2010”
Reviews.Author: DanaT_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 days. Pool was great (the boys loved it), clean, very nice. Only problem was the shuttle. People who were not staying at the hotel were driving and parking and then getting on the shuttle and my mother who is 61 and only 5 foot 1 had to stand (along with myself, my 68 year old father and two boys). My mom could not reach the hand rails and got shifted and hurt her back. She talked to the front desk who said they would talk to the transportation right away. I just got on here to check and see that as of August 2nd someone else has the same complaints! That was our only irritation was the shutle and overcrowding on it. A group of 8 teenagers jumped it and wouldn't let the elderly or anyone else sit. The drivers are amazing but do not check for hotel key at all. I liked the hotel, just not the transportation. The shuttles also pick up other hotels so if people are not jumping it, sometimes other hotel have large groups and others are left standing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice of hotel, location and travel company (Virgin Atlantic).”
Reviews.Author: nevleary
Reviews.Content: At check in, we were warmly greeted. Our room overlooked the lake, complete with "beware of the aligator" signs, though we never actually got to see one. This didn't stop our son keeping an eye out though (apparently the signs are there forthe benefit of the kids). Food was good, bar was excellent, swimming pools were always clean and tidy along with the towels that were provided at poolside. Our son loved the games room and took pleasre in posting the fastest laps on the sega driving game. Room cleanliness really was excellent. We cannot praise this aspect highly enough. Hotel location on the 192 allows access to the Disney area without having to queue to get in. Local food houses were all excellent, Pondarosa, Sizzler, Chi Chis etc. When we arrived, we went to Publix, bought us a 6 can fridge bag for about $6, and two ctates of 500ml of water. These crates cost us $3.50 each. Our room had a plug in fridge with a freezer compartment. Each day we took two frozen bottles and four cold bottles of water into the parks with us. The parks typically charge $3 for a bottle of cold water. We took 6 a day saving us over $200. Not so keen on the Pirates of the Carribbean show. The show was as good as the others, the food was ok, but the drinks were very expensive. However, it was a pirate show so I gues we should have expected that! Planet Hollywood and Rainforest Cafe were first class, as was the support, advise and guidance of the Virgin holiday reps. Genuinely first class people. All in all, a great holiday and looking forward to travelling with Virgin and staying with Best Western again. Hopefully, it will not be 100+ degrees next time!!

Reviews.Title: “Not rerally good.”
Reviews.Author: TheEffect
Reviews.Content: Seriously, I still dont know WHY and for WHAT reason this motel has 3 stars? I stayed here for 3 nights in September 2009 and count the hours to leave it. Its really not what I have expected, especially after reading all the positive reports about this motel??? Let me say that this one was not my first hotel/motel in the usa and I stayed at many hotels there so its not like I would expect Hilton. Its really dirty, really old fashioned and not inviting at all. And another negative point is that they asked 20 cent for a minute internet only, without printing services with almost 10 years old computers. Wow... I wouldnt complain if it was for free but not this way. In other hotels there is something called "Business Center" is usually for free, so BW in Kissemmee has to learn what is customer service. Thankfully I havent seen any roaches. Thats a only positive point about this motel. Will never stay again and cant recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: avilasl
Reviews.Content: After a long drive from Tennessee we arrived late and upon check in the Desk clerk was very friendly and knowledgable. They answered all our tourist questions and got us checked in for the week. The room was clean and fully stocked with towels, soap and coffee. The air unit kept the room nice and cool with temps in the 90's. The on site store and Pizza Hut came in handy, we ate breakfast every morning at the hotel and their cook made custom omlettes. The staff was friendly and helpful, our room safe was locked from the last guest and when we called to get it unlocked, within five minutes someone was there to fix it. The hotel is close to a Walgreens, gift shop and mini-golf course. Over all this was a great location and my family and I had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “try and get a seat”
Reviews.Author: cuttermac
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the bwl for 2 weeks it was our 3rd visit .the first and second visit were much better than this stay. Breakfasts were good and Ana is a star along with the other staff serving breakfasts. This hotel is very close to all the attactions House keeping was not so good we had to go to the front desk and ask for eg. fresh towels, cups ,coffee toilet rolls many times. we even had to ask for the beds to be changed. The hotel shuttle bus was free and more than the hotel guests were using it eg.a couple we spoke to lived in florida, parked their car up at the hotel and got the shuttle to save parking fees at disney parks .They said they done this on many occasions.and so did their friends. We spoke to somebody else staying in villas across the road.they were doing the same ,a family of ten turned up taking up them seats . They got on even though you were supposed to show your hotel key that was never asked for off the driver. Thats why the shuttle was overcrowded to the point of being dangerous . It didn,t matter how early you arrived for the bus there was a stampeed to get on the bus . .

Reviews.Title: “Good amenities, not very clean.”
Reviews.Author: lucyjg26
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in for two weeks in July 2010 to visit Disney, Universal etc. The hotel is in a good location, very close to the entrance to WDW and it was very easy to find our way around from here. We had a car and I would definitely recommend this as the shuttle bus only comes once a day. We stayed in a room with two doubles which was big enough and had a fridge which was handy. The air con was very noisy (as was mentioned in other reviews) but it was efficient and it didn't bother us too much. The room was in need of a little refurbishment but for the price we didn't find this too bad. However, we did have a few problems with the cleanliness of the room. A few days into our stay we found chewing gum on the headboard of the bed and a condom under the bed. After complaining we were given a free breakfast. We couldn't get the free wi-fi to work in our room but we could use it in the lobby. The pools were all very nice, although the pool we were told was adults only often had children in. That said it was also often empty so we weren't too bothered by this. We didn't use the games room or restaurant but as mentioned above we did have breakfast there one day. We found that the breakfast was a fairly good price but could have been slightly better quality. The eggs cooked to order were a nice touch though. Towards the end of the stay we found a small cockroach in the bathroom which was not cleaned by the room service. We then complained about this and we moved to a king room right by the pool so that the room could be fumigated. This room was nicer than our previous room and we had no other problems. I would probably not recommend the hotel due to the cleanliness. I felt that the housekeeping were possibly not given long enough on each room as the service seemed rushed and did not always reach everywhere. However, the amenities and location were good so if you have already booked a room here don't let this review worry you too much. Despite the problems we had we still enjoyed our stay very much and felt comfortable in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel... needs a little love”
Reviews.Author: Shorty808
Reviews.Content: My Dad and I stayed here from 22Jul to the 29Jul. The hotel is very close to I-4 and all theme parks are easily accessible. Universal Studios is the farthest away and was no more than a half hour away. It is right on 192, very close to restaurants and there is a 24 hour Walgreens not even five minutes away. The rooms were spacious. Big, clean, lots of storage space, and an excellent safe, that we used to store all of our electronics. It's big enough to fit a laptop, and lots of other items with tons of room to spare. The grounds are large, but we were about five minutes from the front lobby. They have three pools (all warm and clean), an arcade open until 1am and free mini golf. The Pizza Hut in the lobby was very good, and reasonbly priced. The other items on the menu were overpriced (onion rings for 7.50!). The only thing I would be on the look out for, is to make sure your room door closes behind you. We had to slam ours to make sure it closed and locked. Other than that, it needs a paint job (and there was a painter working on the front entrance), but that's it. I'd stay here again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: christimba
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this hotel last week. I was alarmed to see that there was a notice on our nightstand cautioning customers against ordering pizza from a business which was sliding flyers underneath room doors. Apparently they deliver something other than pizza and take your money. I was even more alarmed to discover that over $500 worth of small electronic items which were stored inside a drawer under some clothing (not in plain view) were removed from our room. So far, the hotel has not been at all responsive and has not addressed this situation. I would NOT recommend staying here or at least not bringing any small items of value with you. You may have to spend the money you save on the room rate replacing your belongings.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Price”
Reviews.Author: MomFromJersey
Reviews.Content: My review is a little late, we stayed at Best Western Lakeside back in March, but I just found this site LOL. I've read some of the previous reviews, and while I can agree that the hotel is a bit older and outdated, and the cleanliness level has some room for improvement, I feel the hotel was a good value for the price. It was close to disney, they had two large heated pools, a workout room, a mini-arcade, and pizzahut on site. My husband and I felt we got our money's worth and our daughters enjoyed the pool+golf more than Disney! I also believe the several scantily clad high school boys in speedos and tiny thong swimsuits played a large part in their liking LOL. We will definitely be coming back next year for vacation, my oldest daughter Lindsey already has it marked on her calendar! Over all, I give Best Western Lakeside a A-. Thank you and see you next year! :)

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT FAMILY HOTEL- mini golf, pool, bball, playgrounds, game room, etc”
Reviews.Author: jenthehennifer
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great!! We were very close to Magic Kingdom, which was the reason we were in Orlando. We got a room on the first floor on the corner of the building, right across from the pool, the playground, the basketball courts AND the mini golf. I was travelling with my 15 year old cousin, 12 year old brother and mom for my post college graduation vacation. The hotel has so many great ammenities, all those listed above, plus a game room and restaurants on site. The room was in great condition, the bathroom was quite small however, and the wireless internet was sketchy. Had to use the cable for a decent connection...and that was horribly slow. The beds were very comfortable, the pillows hurt my neck, though, and i didn't sleep with one, but it didn't bother me at all. The rest of my family didn't have a problem with pillows. The hotel is next to several restaurants. We went to golden corral and dennys, and they have a walgreens right next door. I absolutely loved the comfort of the beds/sleeping quality, and the fabulous outdoors activities. We played mini golf and basketball our entire stay. The older adults would enjoy the pool and tiki bar. Great family hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere - quality lacking and extra fees!”
Reviews.Author: mlotto7
Reviews.Content: The hotel charges $7.50 "resort" fee per day. Considering this, one could upgrade to a better hotel for the same cost. This is a very old hotel. The rooms are small, and the quality of things like towels, TV, stations, pillows, etc. are really lacking. My room smelled. The hotel also attracts an interesting array of personalities. The pool is open late and the noise is terrible, so don't plan on sleeping before 11pm. Simply put, the only positive thing about this hotel is the price, but considering they charge you nearly $10 per day extra...staying here doesn't make sense. The "business center" was a $.50 per minute to use a computer. Internet did work in the room but I was told it is not available in all rooms. If you decide to stay here, please keep an eye on your kids. I didn't like the element of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LOOK ELSEWHERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: kedemaxwell
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in July of2010 while visiting Disney World! I had Read some of the other bad reviews and went ahead booked my stay here! We arrived to the hotel and had no problems got to our room which had a bad smell and dirty bathroom. We went out and got cleaning supplies! I was feeling much better about our room once got it clean then we decide to stay an extra night but they would not let us stay in the room I had clean so we moved to a second hotel room right above are last one. Walked in and its was smelling better then the first one but walked into the bathroom to find the shower curtain cover in black stuff I would call it black mold! Had mold on the ceilling as well and the walls were cover in dirt and hair. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL!!!!! I will never stay at best western again and If you book your hotel thru another website other than theirs they will not honor you points! Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel, great value and staff”
Reviews.Author: sne1516
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. We ate at the breakfast buffet one morning, it was nothing spectacular, but good enough. In the room the surface areas were clean, but if you looked under the desk there was a large layer of dust on the items plugged into the outlet. (only looked to plug in phone charger; it was pretty gross). Overall, for what we paid per night it was not a bad place to stay. The pool was clean and we swam each day.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice for Price!”
Reviews.Author: FromKentucky859
Reviews.Content: Very Clean. Great price and nice resort. Had a nice pool (didnt use it but looked nice) and the location was great. It was like a hop and a skip away to Disney! The wifi didnt work in the rooms was the only downfall.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ukienomad
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favor and book somewhere else. It was dreadful....dirty, dingy, old, smelly and you can hear everything outside and next door...the only thing okay was the person at the front desk. The 50 foot buffet breakfast was inedible...awful. I hate to write reviews like this but this was pretty bad and we do a lot of traveling. It was a last minute decision to stay the night and boy did we pick the wrong place to stay. Honestly, this was bad!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value. Great service.”
Reviews.Author: JimmyMainprize
Reviews.Content: My family spent 7 nights here in early June while we visited the Parks. The hotel was amazing value for money, within walking distance of loads of places to eat on an evening and was in a great location to get to all the Parks easily. There was a free daily shuttle to all the Parks which we used several times. Pools were nice to come back to relax in after a hot day enjoying ourselves. Most impressive of all though was that we left a brand new Ipod somewhere on the hotel premises (kids eh! Couldnt even say where we had left it.). We contacted the hotel about a week later after our return to the uk. Didnt expect to see the Ipod again. Amazingly, the staff at the hotel found the Ipod and posted it back to us. I am genuinely amazed by the honesty of the staff involved. Thank you! We had a great stay and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “hope the reviews are right”
Reviews.Author: peruanany
Reviews.Content: after booking my vacation package from expidia and choosing the "celebrity resort" in orlando as my hotel i decided to check the reviews here,i almost had a heart attack couldnt wait till morning to called expidia and change my reservations to the best western hotel had to paid more but what can i do i rather paid than stay in hell, hope its worth it

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Easy to get to the Theme Parks and Close to local restaurants...”
Reviews.Author: JS2209
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the whole two weeks of our stay in Florida and we don't have any complaints, the room was clean on arrival and cleaned daily with new towels and freshly made bed, the bathroom and sink were also cleaned. The room had TV with a number of channels, two double beds, shower/toilet, free safe, air conditioning and a very helpful fridge/freezer unit along with plenty of storage for clothes. Our room was quiet on a night and we had no problems with the location. Upon arrival we found that the bathroom light wasn't working, we informed reception who immediately sent someone to fix it. On site there were three swimming pools (although we only used one) which were clean and a great temperature for cooling off in! Although they're not the biggest pools they each service a different area of the hotel which meant it was never very busy at the closest one. The breakfast buffet was included in the price we paid on Expedia and was fairly nice with a variety of food provided - cereal, fruit, toast, cooked breakfast and omelettes to cook fresh when you wanted. We did notice they were charging other guests $8.99 for it which was very overpriced for the content (especially when there is a Ponderosa and Sizzler within 10-15min walking distance offering a $3.99 buffet breakfast) in addition to this price you also had to pay for juice which should be included in a "free breakfast included" option!! There was a Pizza Hut on site which again was overpriced considering there is a CiCi's nearby (within 2 mins walking distance) which was amazing value! We got a 15" cheese and tomato pizza for $4.27 (inc TAX). We made good use of the free shuttle services to the theme parks, the Universal and Seaworld shuttle bus left at 7:30am, which although it was early, was great for beating ride queues and enjoying an empty park. Unfortunately the return time was 6pm for Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure and 6:15pm for Seaworld which did mean you missed the fireworks. The times for the disney parks were 9:35am/10:10am and 11:35am which were nicely spread out across the morning and from each park it is easy to get to other disney parks via the free buses. There was also a shuttle at 5pm to Magic Kingdom. It would be nice if they provided a bus to one of the disney waterparks as these are slightly more difficult to get to using the disney bus service. (Blizzard Beach can be accessed from Animal Kingdom) although Typhoon Lagoon can only be accessed by going to a disney hotel first. The return times were also nicely spread out with 5.20pm, 8.30pm, 9.25pm and 10.45pm meaning you could watch the fireworks in all the parks. They also put on a later shuttle at 11.30 when Magic Kingdom was open until midnight. Overall, our stay was lovely, the staff were helpful and the amenities were never too busy meaning we didn't feel like we were staying in a large haotel. I would recommend it to a friend, however I would suggest that you stay in a room not overlooking the pool as it's open until 11pm so can get noisy when lots of kids are in there after getting back from the parks.

Reviews.Title: “just like extended family”
Reviews.Author: kyriacouj
Reviews.Content: i have stayed at the best western lakeside 4 times in the last 4 years and as a travel agent can be really picky were i stay. the reception staff are really helpfull down to the fab cleaners that look after us so well, we try to have a pool side room as my daughter loves the location, the fact that you are so close to disney and the other attractions is a bonus but to me its the people that make us return,the pizza hut on site and the bartender in hurricane sams all help complete the hotels facilities really well. best western lakeside isnt a posh hotel your not paying posh prices so you more that get your monies worth. already booked for may 2011 and cant wait !!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Everything You're in Orlando FL for.”
Reviews.Author: CentralNJKeith
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here during her business convention being held at the Gaylord Palms nearby. Although many of her fellow associates chose to stay there, we decided to save some money and stay elsewhere. Orbitz and Best Western didn't disappoint with this selection. Our room was comfortable, cool (great A/C but for one evening after a severe storm knocked out power) and so close to everything. On a couple of occasions we were able to go back to the rooms at the Gaylord Palms and ours was just as nice except they had a flat screen tv. I can live with a functioning tubed tv set. We did not get to use any of the pools, but they seemed popular and we found them clean when we walked around them. Our only disappointment came during our first night when we decided to stay on premises for dinner. As we walked into the bar, the bartender told us someone would be with us shortly. Unfortunately, after 15 minutes no one did. When I tell you your choice of eateries is unlimited in this area-it's an understatement. So we left for a meal at the Shoney's down the street. We will certainly be back to Orlando soon, and this will be at the top of places to stay for us when we do.

Reviews.Title: “plesent, helpful, frindley, clean, profesional”
Reviews.Author: fyvie088
Reviews.Content: I would highly recomand this hotel to my friends. I booked this trip through hotwire and so far everything is going very well . The car, flight,and the hotel are all better and cheeper than I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Very Friendly! Wouldn't hesistate to stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Anc96
Reviews.Content: We arrived 1 day early for our 3 week trip to Orlando. It was the first time we drove (an 18 hour drive!), and I didn't want to get there late. We were to spend 11 nights in a villa, and the last 8 at the Best Western, Downtown Disney. I got the BestWestern Lakeside hotel from hotwire at a $29 a night. I did identify the hotel before I purchased it, and I purchased it because of the good reviews. Check in was a breeze.. it literally took 2 minutes with Mary Lee. She was very friendly, and made us feel welcomed. She gave us a quick run down of the hotel, checked us in, and we were off to our room. Clean, was the most important factor to me.... and it was very clean! It was not modern or terribly updated, but is was very nice. Bathroom looked new.. the beds and bed clothes, neat and clean. The TV was large, but not a flatscreen, but who cares. We never turned it on so I can't say about the reception. There is a refrigerator, that was a great plus! And the usual, hair dryer, iron/ironing board, and room safe. Everything was in great condition, and everything in order. We went to their in-hotel store to use the mircrowave, where my daughter proceeded to make a mess! She's a bit clumsy. The girl there (I didn't get her name) ran over to clean it up (although we were trying), but she was all smiles and giggles with my daughter. She was very friendly and chatty, and kept telling us not to bother trying to clean. Mind you, this is stuff we did not purchase there, we were only using the microwave, but it didn't matter. She even got us some utencils to use, and plates. She was very sweet. There was another man there, who when another family was waiting to use the mircrowave, immediately came over to show them where another was located (across the hall) so they wouldn't have to wait. He was also extremely friendly and nice. In the morning, we went there again for coffee and some cookies they had there... and the man (a different one) was also sooooo sweet and nice! The manager, Raul, was there in the morning. We chatted a bit, he was very knowledgable and friendly. I told him of my disappointment in seeing the Best Western, Downtown Disney, where we were supposed to be staying our last 8 nights. We had gone there the day before and asked to see a room... and it was HORRIBLE! Raul was very sympathetic and offered to help us switch our reservations to there. And although we really did like it there, it wasn't enough of a facility for us to spend a long vacation. We ended up completely cancelling the reservations for th BW DTD,, and extending our villa stay by 5 extra nights, and booking the Double Tree Universal for the last 3 nights. The Best Western Lakeside is a clean and comfortable hotel, very reasonably priced, and an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - needs to fix basic maintenance problems”
Reviews.Author: sunshine02008
Reviews.Content: Great location on Rt 192 - right near entrance to Disney World and restaurants and shopping nearby. There is a. Walgreen's right in front. We had a AAA rate and it was a great value compared to Disney hotel rates and the rooms were big and nicely decorated and very clean. However, the key card constantly had problems, the sink filled up and then slowly drained and there was NO hot water the first morning we were there. The second morning the hot water would go from hot to ice cold back and forth during the shower - very annoying. I would think they could fix that problem and I know they have had it for a while Our friends had an air conditioning unit that would make so much noise every time it came on that it kept waking them up all night..They did give us a free breakfast for our trouble, and the breakfast was great. The woman making the omelets was very friendly and an awesome cook - make sure you try them if you get the buffet which is a little pricey, but I think it is worth it. The hotel has free miniature golf and we played twice and had a lot of fun. There are several pools that look to be very nice and several other places to eat on site that we didn't use. Even with the problems that we had, we really liked this hotel and will go back and hope that we have hot water next time.

Reviews.Title: “This is a cheap and dirty hotel!”
Reviews.Author: OTM330
Reviews.Content: This hotel is dirty and old. There were attempts to renovate because the counter tops are grantie and the shower insert looks new but everything else is old. The comforters on the bed were stained and the walls are paper thin. Each time someone in a connecting room uses the sink or toilet you can hear it in your room. You can also hear other guests walking above your head and rolling their luggage. However, the air conditioning works well and the front desk staff were polite and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit to the 'Lakeside'”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Helen_10
Reviews.Content: Twenty years ago we got married at the Sheraton Lakeside, our visit this time was the second part of our holiday having spent 6 nights in New York. We returned to this hotel to rekindle our memories and for its size, location and value for money. Even with a name change the hotel still gives all you could want from a budget stay, very close to WDW and easy access to anywhere in the Orlando area (by car). Because it has 3 pools one afternoon we were going for a relaxing dip only to find lots of kids playing (as they do) luckily we were able to go to the next pool which we had to ourselves for quite a while. The maid service was excellent and the staff were very helpful too. My only sadness was my wife sent the hotel an email (whilst we were in England) to ask if we could have the same room as before, we didn't get a reply and that room was already filled when we arrived, that said we still had a wonderful time !!

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to the BWL.”
Reviews.Author: connotations
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife are coming from the UK and staying at the BWL from the 16.07.10, thanks for your reviews, we cannot wait for the holiday after reading this. Tim

Reviews.Title: “Good base to sleep if you are doing the theme parks”
Reviews.Author: h0lidaysf0rfun
Reviews.Content: It was clean, tidy, each room has a hair dryer we took our own but as it is 110v, it didn't work very well so don't bother taking one. There is also a fridge with a small freezer, we froze bottles of water and took them out with us for cool 'cheap' water, topping them up with the water fountains dotted about the parks. Swimming pool is good and clean, just a bit salty. Staff were helpful, responded by sending someone to our room within minutes when the hairdryer broke and we couldnt open the safe. Beds were comfy. If you are doing the theme parks and don't plan to spend any time in the hotel, then this is the place to go, we always go to travelodge's and oliday inns so cannot compare to a swanky hotel, you get what you pay for I guess, but it was just a bed to sleep in for us. Also situated in the middle of loads of restaurants on the 192, reccoment Golden Coral buffet (£35 for 4 inc drinks) and cici's pizza buffet (£18 for 4 inc drinks) Used coupons found in booklets that are everywhere, to get discounts. Disney parks were 5-10 mins away, universal was about 25 mins away. Make sure you take a sat nav. It was also quiet, wasn't disturbed at all and the air con unit was a bit noisy but did its job well. Our room had free wi-fi which wasn't great on an ipod touch. They also have free wi-fi in the reception. We didn't eat or drink in the restaurants in the Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Floridaa”
Reviews.Author: LuciaGalati
Reviews.Content: My family and myself stayed at this hotel back in 2008 and Were welcomed by the very friendly staff in the lobby , Our room was nice and clean with 2 double beds, and a single bed the room consisted of a refridgirator , coffee machine , hairdryer and a television , In the hotel there was a small shop , pizza hut , a bar and a eating area there was also a games room . The room was clean and tidy and was cleaned every day . Just across the car park is a wallgreens store which sells almost anything you need which is very convenient and helpfull.there are lots or malls near by and all the amusment parks are near by which we traveled to with free transport of the morning bus which came with the virging holidays package. There is a swimming pool , which was nice too have there. i would recomend it to any one Going to Florida ! We will definatley be using it Agian soon : ) !!

Reviews.Title: “The good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: biznesschic
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via Expedia back in March of 2010. My Granddaughter and I arrived around 11PM and encountered a very rude clerk at the front desk. When I inquired about alternative transportation to the Disney theme parks, her answer was to take an expensive cab, not how to navigate the Disney transportation system. When I pressed further, her answer was "I dunno know", without bothering to find out. The next morning after breakfast, I checked my bank balance and discovered around $300.00 missing. She had put a $340.00 hold on my debit card, for a room I had previously paid for through Expedia. I spent 2 days trying to straighten this out with my debit card company. All in all, this is a great hotel if you are traveling with children. They have a clean swimming pool, a game room, and putt putt golf that my granddaughter absolutely loved. The food is good, and after my first night incident, the staff was gracious. I do recommend that if you decide to stay at this hotel, check to see if they placed any holds on your account.

Reviews.Title: “Nice basic accomodation”
Reviews.Author: ChrisfromtheUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 11 nights and found it to be a clean comfortable basic hotel. Its situated close to Disney and a short drive to Universal / Sea World. There are plenty of places to eat within easy reach. The cleaning staff for our room did a good job. I would recommend this hotel. .

Reviews.Title: “Very good, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: dillydot
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with Virgin Holidays and as it was one of their cheaper hotels we were a bit worried but we pleasently surprised. The Hotel although not a new property was clean and well maintained. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. The room was quite large with two double beds. I would say they were 4' not 4'6" we slept in the one bed and had no problems. The sheets and towels were changed every day and the the coffee etc was renewed too. There is a fridge, hair dryer, iron, ironing board and coffee machine also a safe at not extra cost. We had breakfast there most mornings and had a couple of meals in Hurricane Sams, all good food and reasonable prices. There is a Walgreens next door which sells loads of stuff, also a Pizza Hut which we didn't use. We decided not to hire a car and used the free shuttles to the parks etc. For the most part these were not too bad, the earliest one left at 9.35am and went to Animal Kingdom, we used that one most of the time and if we were going to a different park that day we just used the Disney free transport to transfer to where we wanted to go. The shuttle to Universal went at 7.30am which we found a bit too early especially as the return shuttle was at 6pm. I think it would be better if there was a return in the middle of the day. We booked some Mears shuttle vouchers from Virgin which we found very useful and would recommend. This hotel is ideal if you are visiting the parks, if you have a car there is plenty of parking space and a very short journey to the various parks. If you don't want to hire a car there is plenty of places to eat and shop within walking distance and you have the shuttles too. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: ymcafl
Reviews.Content: We went to disney so did not spend alot of time at the hotel. Room was clean and the beds comfotable. They do charge a resort fee and we did not use the amenities. Great for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: timdh1
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I really enjoyed our stay here. It was great that there were multiple pools; it helped keep the crowds down. We got this hotel at a very inexpensive rate and we were very happy. They do have a $3.50 a night resort fee, but you could generally get this hotel for so cheap that it doesn't matter. Also, if you usually use flat pillows, you might want to bring your own from home (I'm from Florida, so it was an option...too bad no one gave me this tip). Their pillows are somewhat on the larger and firmer side. Overall, great value and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, convenient, pleasant place to stay, beautiful pool, good value.”
Reviews.Author: floridaforever09
Reviews.Content: Nice convenient place to stay. In town to attend Wide World of Sports-Disney AAU basketball tournament. Beautiful pool, laundry, refrig. in room. Good value - perfect location - took shortcut to WWS - only 10 minutes away. This is the second weekend we stayed here and all was fine. If I had to say there was a con it would be I had to ask cleaning lady (who didn't speak English) to clean our room before she went home at 4 pm. The first weekend the room was never cleaned. I guess they figure if you stay more than one night, they can skip making the beds, leaving clean towels etc. But it was cleaned after I asked for it. Front desk personnel very nice & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We keep going back here - Great Location - Great Amenities - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: rasbray
Reviews.Content: We have gone to stay at Lakeside now on four occassions because the amenities are excellent - the staff and their support are excellent too!! - rooms are above your normal standard and well maintained - and the locations is superb for all you want to do around Orlando

Reviews.Title: “Good price, service and location location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JCFamily43
Reviews.Content: Is good resort; the only thing is you have to get tickets for the food in that way is more cheap but is excelent breakfast; housekeeping does good job but they should do better; i think they need more supervision in that area, and pleaseeee they need a good gym; but is what it is, what you paid is what you get! and if I back to Orlando, Disney or Cocoa beach I'll stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for family on a budget”
Reviews.Author: bdmkma
Reviews.Content: If you are not fussy regarding your accomodations this is a great place for the price. Nice pools, mini golf. Rooms are not fancy but are clean and adequate. The fridge in the room is nice. Conveniently located close to the parks. There are a lot of restuarants within walking distance from the hotel. We didn't take the shuttles to the parks but I am sure they work out OK. Only one departure and return for each park so you don't want to miss it. We had a great breakfast at the buffet (children eat free). Be careful about buying tickets at this hotel. We bought water park tickets here and they said that they were cheaper than at the park. In fact they were one dollar more. Do not trust these people.

Reviews.Title: “Good Bargain Motel”
Reviews.Author: CentaurNC
Reviews.Content: We went to Universal Studios and booked this hotel because of the rate and proximity to the park. Overall we liked the hotel; there were plenty of places to eat in easy walking distance and the drive to the park was easy. We thought the room was a good size and it was clean. There was wi-fi but the service was spotty. One of the three pools was right outside of our room which made it easy to swim and lay out. There were a couple points on the downside: the walls were thin and we could hear the kids playing in the pool until midnight; when I checked out, there were unexpected "Resort Fees" added to my bill...[resort, is not really what we experienced]; and finally, I didn't care for the hard-sell for a time share when we checked in. We liked the hotel and would book there again, but now I would know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Ok...”
Reviews.Author: Clare_e_2000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an excellent position for trips to Disney. There are plenty of restaurants and shops in the local vicinity. Having stayed in many best western hotels, I believe this to be the worst standard of all of them. The hotel was clean and tidy (very important to me) but was quite dated and shabby in places. The room was very basic and smelled quite musty. The windows were very thin which meant that we were woken every morning by kids running past the room or even just people talking outside. We had a pool view room and although I thought this would be nice when we checked in, I later discovered that the pool was busy right up until gone midnight (even though it was meant to close at 11pm) meaning an early night was out of the question. The air conditioning was also very noisy and kept waking me during the night. The bed was small. Following other reviews, it is definitely not a double, I would say it is a 3/4. Admittedly there are two of them but being on a holiday with my fiance, it meant that the holiday would have lost a little sparkle if we'd've had to stay in separate beds. The housekeeping service was fantastic, they made the bed every day (including on days when we stayed in bed past midday) and refreshed the towels and coffee stuff. They even placed the teddies that we won in competitions on the bed which I thought was a sweet touch. The people on the front desk were a little frosty when we arrived but there were various people on the desk throughout the holiday who seemed nicer. The breakfast place was nice. Food was good, good value and plenty of it. The bar/evening place wasn't so good with very little choice on food and slow service. Just for those who think having the pizza hut on site sounds great, it would've been great except that the prices were huge and then they added on tax, and a gratuity (i.e. charge for room service). It was very expensive and so we never bothered and just drove to the pizza hut down the road instead. I was very pleased with the free wifi internet and free parking. To be completely honest, next time I would probably pay a bit more and stay in something slightly nicer.

Reviews.Title: “I would come back -- it's a really nice hotel to stay at ...”
Reviews.Author: OnTheGoAgain123
Reviews.Content: Very, very nice place to stay. Great value, really CLEAN room, good location and great Customer Service !! I was very satisified with my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Def would stay again for the price”
Reviews.Author: cmommy4
Reviews.Content: I was leary about booking this hotel after reading the reviews on Travelocity, but was nicely surprized upon arrival. The grounds are well maintained. Check in was easy/quick, the room was cool and clean, nicely re-modeled. The breakfast was great. The pools are heated and the kids swam every night, late. If you plan on getting to the parks early, plan on driving as the shuttles here come too late. I wouldnt pay more than 55 a night for it, but def worth that.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing........”
Reviews.Author: paluc502
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Lakeside for one night enroute to Miami on March 14, 2010. We met with extended family who were staying there prior to a family cruise. The stay, was at best, disappointing. First of all, I found the rooms to be very worn, accumulation of dust bunnies in the corners, and the washrooms needing some TLC - we would lock the door and struggle to unlock it, dirty grout, etc. We were "upgraded" to a room that overlooked the pool but it was littered with leaves, etc. that particular evening - there was significant wind earlier that day so that may have caused it. Good luck using the internet - I was told to bring my computer to the lobby! What disappointed me the most was the service received at the front counter. I stood waiting at the counter for approximately 5 minutes while 3 staff members chatted among themselves. An employee named Edwin finally served me and I felt that it was a burden for him to provide service. He couldn't find my reservation at first and really didn't speak to me during the counter experience. After asking, he explained to me how to get to my room. I just felt he could have been more welcoming. I stayed at a Residence Inn the night before and was wowed!! I'll try somewhere different next time.........

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, comforts, and lovely surroundings”
Reviews.Author: jessxo
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in nice location that keeps happy surprises coming, and the price was right! Disney can't be more than 2 miles away! Our small kids have enjoyed swimming in the clean pools and playing in playground, and there is adequate seating for all on the patio. The entire lobby building is covered in pretty murals, and is clean. The staff have been available and professional. Breakfast buffet was a nice spread and with kids eat free, terrific value for family on a budget. I was thrilled to find clean laundry facilities with working machines!! Rooms are basic but serve purpose, and was happy to find a refrigerator hiding in a cabinet in our room -- came in nice and handy! Everything I have wanted has been there... I would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “The #1 Hotel to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Driveabout
Reviews.Content: The front desk checked us in quickly and answered questions that we had. They are very knowledgeable. The room was clean and fresh. Housekeeping does a great job everyday. The location is close to theme parks. We visit relatives and friends nearby. We've been staying at this location every year but two years since 1993. What I like best is the Greenhouse Restaurant. Barbara cooks the best eggs.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if your visiting theme parks!”
Reviews.Author: SAL311
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 diffrent nights and both were great! Check-in was easy, rooms were clean and finding a place to eat dinner was very convenient. If you are here visiting theme parks this place is great for a bed and shower. Of course it is not a 5 star resort, but after walking around Disney for 9 hours we didnt care!

Reviews.Title: “What a nice place to stay and visit.”
Reviews.Author: graytruck
Reviews.Content: Well now;About your (dot rateting) I wanted to rate your hotel with 4-dots and your service with 5-dots for some reason i could not put the dots in the rite circle.Now; At Bestwestern,My stay was real great.It was quite and located just rite for me .I came for the Daytona Bike Rally.But i also have family who lived in parrish.So i called my brother to let him know that i was at the hotel and if he could help me with my bike shows,so he did.We both had a nice time.I check out and stayed at his house for 2-days.and then headed for home But not without ( A first place trophy) A real nice Trip .. and thank you to everyone who made my stay nice. Edward Provencal ( MR ED )

Reviews.Title: “Your experience will depend of expectations and the room you get”
Reviews.Author: dabcape
Reviews.Content: Let's clear...there is no lake, there is a large, steep-sided drainage area next to the highway...no chance of water sports or swimming. I found the help to be very nice, sometimes busy but all in all very nice. Housekeeping was...well....odd. I left a $5 tip the first day thinking that would be huge for this place and I would be showered with seing kits, bottled water and gallons of shampoo..I was rewarded with no replentishment of coffee but 10 new sets of sugar/creamer/straws...no shampoo or any such item for my entire stay...(not sure if any rooms get that stuff), and no refilling the empty tissue box (at all in 4 days). On the plus side, the room was pretty clean and my stuff undisturbed. This is a huge old-school 2 story motel complex, rooms open to the outside. It has a small bar, a decent sized breakfast buffet and a little sundry store...all you really need plus the Walgreen next door. Some rooms (and entire buildings it appears) have been rehabed recently and some have not, some are next to dumpsters and some look out a nice pools and landscaping, some you may have to walk a long distance through parking lots out in the open toget to the office and food service. I paid $26 a night through Hotwire...I'm sure others in the complex were paying closer to $100. Had I paid $90 for my room I would have been pretty disapointed but at $26 it was a bargain. Breakfast was $8.95 for an adult and a child and pretty much something for everyone. If you are paying more than $50 a night you want to make sure you are getting a new room that fronts on a landscaped area. Otherwise head elsewhere, there are a lot of inexpensive rooms within a half mile. As other have mentioned, good location.

Reviews.Title: “poor staff”
Reviews.Author: WORLDTRAVELLER2711
Reviews.Content: nice location, but by making a new reservation for 2more days the front desk has forced me to pay an upgrade otherwise i have to change my room iven the hotel was not booked more then 50%. really not guest friendly. for staying in the same room i have got to go 3 times at the frontdesk and lost 3hours of the day!!!!! and then 20$ extra charge. next time its faster to change the hotel. the housekeeping has asked us directly on first day for leave her a tip???!!!! i for my part have worked for years in our family hotel but a staff wich leave waiting a guest and send him away 3times from frontdesk then ask him to change room and must bring out first his personal belongings before they will give you the key for the new habitacion only to force the guest to acept the upgrade is realy poor. there where wto staff member at the reception desk. i think a new one" raul" really friendly and helpful and a young one who comported like a "king" arrogant and unhellpfull (an african american) dont remember the exact name (ieremiah???), 3times sended away then forced to pay upgrade and at least not fixed the save in our room upon request, so from this site 0 points for guest service. the girl by checking in was also nice but the next day has turned over the whole impression. pool area ok, minigolf area a shame-dirty brocken not well treated. I THINK THE MANAGEMENT SHOULD INSTRUCT HIS STAFF TO BE MORE HELPFULL AND NOT WHISPERING ON THE CORIDOR TO THE GUEST TO ASKINGFOR A TIPP AND ALSO TO THE FRONTDESK TO BE HELPFULL AND NOT TIME STELLING TO THE GUEST. I THINK IT NOT WORTH FOR 20$ TO MAKE A GUEST A BAD IMPRESSION IVEN WHEN THE GUEST STAYED 3 TIMES AT FRONT DESK AND BY THE FIRST STEP HAS ASKED IF IT WILL BEE OK TO STAY IN THE SAME ROOM SAYING YES AND FINALLIY KNOWING THE GUEST WILL NOT LOOSE MOORE TIME FORCING HIM, WHEN NOT WILLING TO CHANGE, ROOM TO ACEPT THE PAYMENT AS AN UPGRADE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Clean, Safe”
Reviews.Author: ryanprint
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beyond expectations for the price. Like many hotels in the area, it was worn, and there were many layers of paint; but the rooms were clean and the linens new. The pool was heated and very clean. The area was well lit, and seemed safe. There was a Walgreens conveniently located across the parking lot. It was incredibly close to the Disney properies. The staff was very helpful, and addressed our needs promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay until we checked out and nieces Ipod Touch left and maid claimed it wasn't!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pondsat302
