Reviews.Content: We arrived to find our 3 rooms had been assigned in separate areas due to "overbooking/soldout" and we were asked if we would mind staying the first night in these rooms and promised assistance with unloading that first time and told we could head to Walt Disney the next morning and all of our stuff would be transferred for us while we were at the parks. Late that night when we returned true to Mary Lee's word everything was just as promised! The rooms were excellent and the hotel was in a great location 10 minutes from Walt Disney World. I was extremely pleased with the room and service until after we left and my 11 year old niece realized she had left her $200 Ipod Touch plugged in charging for our return trip home....I immediately called the hotel and spoke with the housekeeping department (who in turn spoke with the housekeeper responsible for our room) only to find the maid that cleaned our room, of course, claimed it wasn't there. We had even left gratuities all week for her and such dishonesty leaves a terrible impression of an otherwise terrific stay! If you choose this hotel make sure to place all valuables in the safe (which we did) and double check the room completely (which we also did...not sure how we missed the Ipod) upon checkout because if you forget anything valuable it will not be there!!!! This is the only reason I would not recommend this hotel, otherwise it was really great and it was our fault for forgetting it....I just hate dishonesty.

Reviews.Title: “Would have stayed at a motel instead compared to this”
Reviews.Author: patrick2ed
Reviews.Content: Our room was nasty when we first walked in. The shower was full of black hairs and dirt. Our bed had blood stains and brown stains. The t.v was broken and could have not ben fixed. I got woken up to screaming people a few times each night. When we told the hotel staff they were rude about it and sent a man up to change our sheets that told us a sad life story. I would have stayed anywhere else..

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased! Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Rob_F250
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for a week. It was clean and tidy. This is a great location. Having visited Florida many times it was central for us. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Why would I stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: sioux100
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights with my adult son and returned the next week for a week with my husband. Between the two visits I've stayed in three rooms (this time we changed rooms to be nearer the "alligator pond." The very helpful front desk representative explained there are actually small alligators (up to four feet) in the pond, but when they reach 4 feet the state Fish and Game Department removes and relocates them. For both of my visits, I arrived directly from a stay at the Sarasota Hyatt Regency, a beautiful hotel costing exponentially more than the Best Western Lakeside. Each time, I was struck by what an excellent hotel this is for the very modest price and how well it compares in cleanliness and attractiveness, if not high style. Nice pools, exceptional cleanliness, fastidiously clean and cheap guest laundry, friendly and helpful staff from the front desk to the housekeepers. I travel frequently, and find this hotel an excellent bargain. I would especially recommend "inside" rooms; those surrounding a pool or the pond. Truly a wonderful value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cliff_Evans
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to Florida for ten years now, we both wish that we had found this hotel befor. Great hotel in every way, will absolutly be coming back to this hotel forever

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice and Clean”
Reviews.Author: hougland09
Reviews.Content: My husband and I usually stay at Bed and Breakfasts, but when we travel with all of our children, then a hotel is pretty much necessary. We think this hotel was pretty nice due the cleanliness ( no weird odors), peaceful and quiet atmosphere,and the staff is helpful and pleasant. Now, the rooms to me are little small and cramped, but we are here to visit Disney Attractions, so it served its purpose well for rest and sleeping. However, we will be staying at a hotel with a fully equiped kitchen when we come back, we could have used a microwave to go with the refridgerator that this hotel provided. Over all, it is a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with how new everything seemed and the cleanliness.”
Reviews.Author: Ruby2s
Reviews.Content: There were many pleasant surprises from how new and modern the room appeared and especially how very clean everything was. There appeared to be quite a few families staying near the room where we were but we never heard any noises from outside or from adjacent rooms. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and professional and was quite impressed with the help they were offering another guest who appeared to be having some difficulties with other aspects of their trip. Would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to family, friends, and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Accomodations, and Service”
Reviews.Author: johnbhoy04
Reviews.Content: My wife and I brought our son to Kissimmee to visit Disney World. The Best Western was an incredible value with comfortable and clean rooms, many amenities, and a friendly and helpful staff. In particular, I would like to thank the concierge who guided us to the Green Meadow petting farm on a day my son napped too late to get full value from Disney. He had more fun at the petting farm than he had the previous day at Disney. Thank you for making our stay very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “pick holiday inn instead”
Reviews.Author: poohspoohs
Reviews.Content: we arrived 10:30pm tired and exhausted from driving for 2 days from ny to enjoy our stay in florida. Only to be awakened by screaming children in the next room. The hotel staff could careless. Security was called. The children still wouldn't quiet down. I asked to be moved to another room at 1:00am. Poor service. I would never stay here again. We left after 3 days. The bathrooms were dirty. Dirty tile floors. Cleaning service was poor as well.This hotel tags on every little hidden fee to your bill. They don't live up to hotel coupons either. They fight with you over false advertising. The heating system smelled like mildew. We had to shut that off in order to try to get some sleep. The breakfast for$9.00 is a rip off. This hotel isn't worth the money. On the way home we stayed at the holiday inn express. Great price,great service, very clean rooms. I will book with this hotel forever!!!! They know how to take care of their customers in everyway. This hotel needs to take a lesson from them.

Reviews.Title: “$21 a night, can't complain, but if I'd paid more . . . .”
Reviews.Author: movinmikec
Reviews.Content: The Pros were the proximity to Disney, price, and amenities. Cons were hidden costs, dripping noise in ceiling (tick tick tick), no fitted sheet, replenished coffee and cream only after requests, mold in bathroom (ceiling) and cracking caulk, not many outlets, under bed had many dust bunnies, and miniature golf course was ragged. Cons explained: I got this room for $175/wk (21/night) off of Priceline. But there was a hidden hotel fee of $3.50/night for “amenities”. This is becoming a more and more common trend, and I think hotels should be “outed” for it. They use their pools, spas, golf courses, and internet to woo your business as part of the nightly rate, and then tell you, after the fact, that those things, while on property and pictured with your booking, are only included at an extra cost. So, we ended up with $25 (equivalent of an extra night) in fees for using the internet for a few hours and the mini golf course once. Not to mention that we paid Priceline’s “fees and charges” that were supposed to be for the hotel’s “fees and charges” only to be charged more “fees and charges” upon arrival. And don’t get me started about the airlines’ “fees and charges.” It rained, and there came a dripping noise in the ceiling. The maintenance folks said that’s because a roof drain runs between the rooms at that location. It doesn’t really matter when you’re trying to sleep after 10 hours at Disney. Water torture is water torture. Another trend: no fitted sheets. So, if you toss and turn in the night, you end up sleeping on the surface of a mattress that god-knows-what has happened on, with a wad of sheets and blankets under your breaking back. Does it break a hotel to have a fitted sheet? The miniature golf course might pass a little time, but it’s not likely to be anything you play more than once, due to its aged condition and peeling surfaces. The rest is no big deal. The pros explanation: This place has a backroad that goes straight onto Disney property after about a mile (Sherberth). It’ll take you right near Animal Kingdom Lodge. It’s about 10 minutes from the Disney lot to the hotel parking lot. LOTS of good eating nearby. In good weather, there were a lot of things to enjoy at the hotel: heated pool (no hot tub), paddle boats and golf, etc. And like I say, for 21/night, it was a 4 star at that rate! Walgreens is right next door, too, for chips, lunchables, toiletries, etc. Overall, a great stay for the rate, but if I paid more than $35/night for the stay, I would have been really disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vinbar
Reviews.Content: We did not know anything about this hotel before arriving, so alittle anxious about our stay. We had nothing but pleasant surprises all the way. We actually extended our stay a couple of times. The hotel has 3 pools, all clean and warm. Tike bar is open everyday except when it rains, there is also a bar in main lobby that opens every night at 5:00. Very nice breakfast buffett every morning for $8.99. We found the service to be excep- tional. This is not a Ritz,or high end hotel and I am not writing this review as if it was, it is our believe that the hotel for the value is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for price and location”
Reviews.Author: NJTravelmama
Reviews.Content: We're not super fastidiuous, but we've stayed in many luxury, four- and five-star hotels. However, for our teen daughter's frequent field hockey tournaments, we usually stay in a Best Bestern. We're at BW Lakeside now for her nat'l. tournament at the Disney Sports Complex 8 minutes away. The location couldn't be beat, plus because I'm in the Best Western Rewards program, two of our nights are free (the remainder of this trip and one more stay will entitle us to more free nights).. Granted, this is not the Taj Mahal -- towels are a bit more threadbare, only one pillow to a person (although our request for another one each was qucikly accommodated). The Housekeeping staff and Front Desk staff couldn't be nicer. The grounds are beautifully maintained, and despete the honky tonk of the highway strip out front, pleasand to look at. The heated pools are larger than your typical hotel pools, and for a cool February week, not bad to swim in -- but brrrr.. . watch when you get out. I would have killed for a hottup or jacuzzi! Only lament is that they skimp on the toileteries and other amenities (no tea, only coffee in room) and the, cherrfully vibrantly colored bedcoverings show in the website photos have been replaced by drab, blackish/blue ones - not great for putting one in an "I'm getting away from the cold, cold north" feeling. (which may be depressing later if we're stuck in our rooms, as we've just heard there's a tornado watch for tonight.) However, we come to this tournament every year and will probably stay here again - in fact we stay at Best Western'sfor all of our daughter's far-away tournaments, both in Fla., Calif., and Pennsylvania.because of good price/value and bonus nights (what's the point of getting cushy romantic room if you're sharing it with your child!). We'll save the fabulous B&Bs and inns for a romantic getaway. I've heard others lament about the bed size at the Best Western Lakeside, but I guess it really deepends on how large you are. My husband and I slept comfortablly in full-size bed, but we're on the thin side (although what woman doesn't feel she couldn't do without losing a few pounds?!). We do have to admit that as nice as it is to have a large vanity outside the bathroom, they have definitely skimped on the bathroom size itself, making it a little dicey when changing, etc. (as we were traveling with teenage daughter). We were also in the older of the rooms, and did detect a musty smell at fist. Fortunately I anticipated that and brought a small contrainer of light linen scented air freshener, which took care of the problem; later, as air conditioner kicked it, the musty smeel .disappeared. We were also sorry breakfast wasn't included free, as is growing more customary.. We just wanted a light breakfast of tea and perhaps toast and yogurt. We definitely are not the type to benefit from a 51-foot buffet! (In contrast we loved the Best Western in Lancaster, where we were served an above-average breakfast for free. But perhaps the 51-foot buffet is a good deal for those who could eat all that food and not gag. Beware if you're not into kitchy -- there's lots of garish gift shops along the stretch of highway near the hotel. We didn't find the prices that great for the stuff offered, but got a kick over it -- especially the one whose facade forms the shape of a gian mermaid. Food choices at restaurants are "fat, fatter and fattest." You're not going to find a Whole Foods around here, or must else in the way of healthy food choices. There is a supermarket of sorts down the road, where we purchased fruits, light cheeses and crackers. Wish there was a place selling decent herbal teas. Dining out: So far, had one dinner at Black Angus - husband and dauther had NY Strip state (not the cheap - $10.00 -- house version which, we understand, is a tougher than shoe level, but the $17.99 12 oz. variety. I had chicken that sounded promising -- I supposed to be covered in sauteed spinach, but what I got was chicken breast topped with glopply cheese and specks of green tha I suppose were spinach flakes. I couldn't eat it. Also, mashed potatoes seemed to be from the box, so stick to rice of baked potato. I suspect all of the restaurants are in that category or in the false food category. If you plan to dine out or take a boat ride, or whatever, do ask the front desk for a coupon book. There are discount coupons everywhere except for the 'Disney Parks - which we' done and seen a few times aleady. Tonight we're going to see if we can order a pizza from on location Pizza Hut on site and ask for extra tomatoes and basei topping and NO cheese -- it's actually quite good and in eliminating the cheese, you're eliminating most of the fat. Hope this is helpful. Keeping our fingers crossed for tornado to pass as we have a 7 p.m. game to play, rain or shine. Things to do: If you're looking for a welcome reprieve from the whole Disney think (and we definitely are) taking an airboat ride out of Kissimmee is something we hope to squeeze in. We also thought we'd visit old town Kissimmee, which seems to have an old-time carnival atmosphere and shops, restaurants, etc. he beaches -- Daytna and Cocoa Beach -- are about 45-100 drive from here. We're hoping to wake up early Sunday morning to find a good spot to view shuttle launch at 4:30 a.m. Sunday, assuming we could swing it.

Reviews.Title: “good time”
Reviews.Author: culwick5
Reviews.Content: we have stayed 6 yrs in hotel generally over Christmas for 3 weeks we are more than pleased . we ask to over look lake and they have always obliged staff very pleasant and helpful I have left money and jewelry out and never been touched with a note from cleaner to put in safe .rooms cleaned every day it is not the Hilton we will be going again in December with luck

Reviews.Title: “GREAT value for your money!”
Reviews.Author: ScoutMontana
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 14 days in January 2010. Hotwire had it rated as a 2.5 star hotel but this place is very nice and has a lot to offer for the low price. I stayed in room 242 and can't complain about anything with the room and the hotel overall. Cleanliness throughout.................. Overall, I would give them 3.5 stars :)

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Value!!!”
Reviews.Author: char42ru40
Reviews.Content: For the price, it can't be beat. Have stayed here on our last four trips to Florida and will certainly stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Tale of two rooms: Poor”
Reviews.Author: udayverma
Reviews.Content: We booked through hotwire for 1 night and 2 rooms. Okay representative at counter okay ,the hotel was not properly cleaned. Now tale of 2 rooms. First of all this hotel should not be 3 star at all but not more than 2 star. Rooms 1: Okay ,very basic,bed,tv perched high on top of table underneath is closet kind thing which to our surprise next day houses refrigerator.This room managed to be as good as any 1 or 2 star room. I can't recollect but they don't have body lotions or other basic bottles. Room 2: Basic like other room but had golden long hairs as gift for us under lamp on the phone.After 1st person took shower next day ,it choked and was full with dirty water so nobody else could take shower. Location is very good to disney parks but you have so many other choices. I complained to manager next day .Manager was very rude at the time of check out.He didn't even bother listening properly to me and apologizing for inconvenience caused to us and once I got done told me I am good to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great starting point for a Disney vacation”
Reviews.Author: jtolson32
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights at this hotel using Hotwire. It was really cheap and in a great location for easy access to the Disney parks. It is only about 1.5 miles away from the Animal Kingdom. It is located just off of a highway that contains a ton of restaurants. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking for a cheap place to stay near Disney. The hotel is broken up into many separate buildings. The lobby was very nice for this class of hotel. The rooms were pretty much what I would expect from your average Best Western. The only real negative I have was the fact that I could not access the free WiFi from my room. So if you need to use WiFi, make sure to mention it when you check in. The hotel charged a very minimal $3.50 per night resort fee beyond what we paid on Hotwire. This seems to be pretty common for this area so it seemed fair.

Reviews.Title: “it's ok - you certainly get what you pay for !!!”
Reviews.Author: londonlfc
Reviews.Content: We stayed with Best Western Lakeside for xmas and new year. We made an advance request for pool facing rooms that were inter-connecting and were pleasantly surprised the request was followed through. The hotel is relatively clean, our room could have been cleaned better, the maid does come in everyday and provide clean towels which is excellent but a pile of dirt was on the floor for entire 2 weeks so cleaning leaves lots to be desired. The pool was clean and well maintained, the water was heated. The rooms were fairly comfortable. The restaurants and Deli are all in the same location, food in Hurrican Sams was terrible but staff were lovely. Heavy smell in the air that tells you a really good clean is needed in that restaurant area too !!! We normally stay in more upmarket resorts but thought we would give this hotel a try, on checkout we were presented with a bill for $329.00 plus tax for the privellege of the pool facing room and local taxes (never paid these costs before in better resorts). Thought it was really cheeky and it ended up costing the equivallent of the better resort - you live and learn. Tips: Dont get pool facing rooms unless you want to pay for them. Eat elsewhere, restaurant food is very poor and the pizza express food was cold. Great location, only 5 minutes from Disney

Reviews.Title: “Do not need one sentence, just one word: DISGUSTING!”
Reviews.Author: Ellie1031
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the hotel and felt a very strong urge to write a review. Do want anyone else to be fooled, by the hotels 3 star rating! The carpets in the Hotel were filthy and the room smelled musty/dirty. The bathroom toilet and floor were not very clean, the phone in the room was not working, there was no microwave available and you could hear everything your neighbor would say or do through the walls. Not to mention how extremely uncomfortable their bed was! So do yourself a favor and stay at a different hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and low quality”
Reviews.Author: Cybermirth
Reviews.Content: I can't really recommend this hotel to anyone. We booked it on a discount site for an incredibly low price that seemed to be too good to be true, and it was. The front desk told us we got a great deal and that the rooms usually go for four times what we paid; that sounded great at the time, but the room was underwhelming once we saw it. The hotel is old and the room felt dirty. New carpet, new beds, new bathrooms would be great. New sheets would be nice. The exterior of the motel-style units did look well manicured, and the outdoor pool was quite large and beautiful. If only they had spent more time updating the rooms. My partner and I asked for a king size bed at check in, instead of the two double beds in the room that our discount site had given us, and the hotel charged us an extra $10 to give us a room with a king. I thought that was pretty lame since the room wouldn't have been booked anyway. Also, no free breakfast, which I expect in a competitive Orlando market. All in all, we slept well, but I refused to stay a second night and we booked another hotel in Orlando the next night. Best Western can and usually does much much better. The room was so grungy that I checked the bed for bedbugs before I slept in it - luckily I didn't find any!

Reviews.Title: “"Hello Housekeeping, you forgot our room, again."”
Reviews.Author: Kimber_jewel
Reviews.Content: We really can't complain too much because we booked this hotel for $35/night through Hotwire. The hotel is located in the Disney Maingate area. Perfect for visiting any of the parks. The area is safe and offers many restaurants, convenience shops, and fast food. The hotel itself is pretty dated.The room was not the cleanest and the bathroom fixtures were rather scary. Hoping that housekeeping would give the room a little extra cleaning after our first night we left a pretty decent tip. We returned that evening to find the tip missing but the room in the same state we left it. The bed was not made and the towels on the bathroom floor. funny enough new towels were hanging on the racks and the room curtains were left wide open. Called the front desk and was told this was not normal and it wouldn't happen again. The next day we return to the room in the late evening after a day in Disney to find housekeeping had never made it to the room. A couple other things make me cringe when I think about our stay at the Lakeside: 1. The TV remote did not work 2. We could hear the conversations in the room next to ours. 3. The carpets were very dirty, our socks turned brown after only a couple hours in the room 4. Our bed had no fitted sheet, just a flat sheet, not even tucked under the mattress 5. While this is suppose to be a non smoking hotel people still smoked in the walkways. We did enjoy some things. Got take out from the Pizza Hut and it was pretty good. The front desk staff was always nice and courteous. The location is great,. For $35 a night this hotel is ok. I wouldn't pay anything more for it though.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place. Have stayed at this property for years!”
Reviews.Author: LTT63
Reviews.Content: At least once a year my children and I go to Disney. Either the first week of May or the first week of December. I usually pay around $50.00 a night. It's literally 5 minutes from the Disney entrance. The rooms are clean and being renovated in sections so ask for a newly completed room. There are three pools, the smallest one is the best, nice and quite and CLEAN. The breakfast buffet is awesome and kids eat free. There is a market and a pizza hut and a lounge where you can get bar food. There are quite a few buildings but they are only two floors and the way they are situated is very nice.Get a room with a garden view. Also you can walk to Wendy's and Walgreens. There are also tons of restaurants within a 3 minute drive. Everyone there is very nice too. The only issue I ever had was a really loud A/C but the front desk changed my room without question. This hotel has never dissapointed me. When you are spending HUNDREDS of dollars to get into Disney it's nice to find a hotel that is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: pavacaky
Reviews.Content: It is cheap. But that is about it. It is a very run down hotel and I could not believe it is ranked 3 stars. The room has very unpleasant smell. The bedding sheet is stained and the mattress is very saggy. The front desk people do not seem to want to serve people. We originally booked for 5 nights and decided to move after 1 night without any hesitation. You will be better served to spend a little bit more to preserve your orlando experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good clena, place to stay and value for a quick stay”
Reviews.Author: dnvrsierravista
Reviews.Content: We arrived and found the hotel room clean, although a little bit of stale air since the room likely had not been used recently ---- this is a large multiple building 2-story hotel/resort, so not all the rooms will be used all the time. The pool was close by - our bldg/room overlooked a pool and kids playground in the middle of the trio of buildings. There are restaurants and Florida gift shops and activities nearby (helicopter rides, miniature golf, etc). There is a drug store right at the front of the resort entrance so it is easy to go pickup something you forgot. Grocery stores a few miles to the west.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic base, no frills, clean with everything you need”
Reviews.Author: T16GEM
Reviews.Content: We chose the Best Western Lakeside based upon price, it was cheap, seriously cheap. When we got there we didn't expect much but it was fantatsic. Great place to crash after a long day in the theme parks. Our room was clean with everything that you need, free wifi, fridge, coffee making facilty and basic bathroom, A/C and two double beds. Lots of storage too. We used the laundry room a couple of times and found it fine. The only thing I would say is that you are very close to Disney's Animal Kingdom and we happened to be there on marathon weekend, it was VERY VERY loud, we could hear everything that the announcers were saying and it all started at about 5am. I would check that there are no huge events on at DAK as it was a very early morning for us that day!! Overall a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: gotta_travel_9
Reviews.Content: 2 teenagers and I stayed one night for a Disney World vacation. I was very pleased with the rates (AAA) and with the service. I had trouble with the TV remote, called the front desk and within 10 minutes they brought me another remote. This is a older hotel, but the rooms were much bigger than I thought they'd be. There's a restaurant for breakfast with either a buffet or order off the menu and these prices were very reasonable. And, the breakfast was very good. There's also a pub/grill for evening meals and a Pizza Hut express on premises. We didn't use all the amenities such as the exercise room or the mini-golf. The hotel is very close to Disney on Highway 192. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME STAY”
Reviews.Author: mwaynecribb
Reviews.Content: This is an EXCELLENT CHOICE for anyone staying in Orlando / Kissimee. We stayed for 10 nights and loved it. We were a family of 2 adults, 3 kids and 1 infant. The only problems we encountered were a very pushy time share agent who about got yelled at, a leaky toliet and a dirty spoon under the couch from a previous guest. They need to spend a little more time cleaning the guest laundry But what we liked was everything else. Connecting Rooms, The Pool, The Playground, The Pool Bar, The Breakfast. Rooms 171 & 172 are the Perfect rooms if you have kids. Directly in front of the pool gate, putt putt golf, mini bar and playground. This hotel has a Wal Greens in the Parking Lot that is open 24 hours a day. We have already recommended this place to 4 people.

Reviews.Title: “average accomodation”
Reviews.Author: mcfamily09
Reviews.Content: we stayed from 9th nov -16th,rooms were cleaned every day but found cobwebs and dirt behind safe and shower water was leaking into the main room soaking the carpet, which made it smell horrible.location to amenities was great,but u needed a car to get around.food was also great,we will return to kissimmee again but i dont think we wil stay here again

Reviews.Title: “going back again 2010”
Reviews.Author: BradfordGran
Reviews.Content: first time there 2006 after a carnival cruise just my husband and myself, second time we went with our daughter and husband plus 2 grandsons age 10-12, everything was excellent, rooms very clean,service very good,all 3 pools and outside areas very clean great location for all Disney parks,it as a pizza hut, a shop that sells hot coffee pastries, hot dogs.sweets and sandwiches to order.The pub comes in handy after a long day at the parks,They do a eat as much as you can breakfast which is very good but you can eat a little cheaper outside,All in all it as all you will need to make your stay enjoyable thats why we are going back 2010

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: skukatie
Reviews.Content: The buffet was good in the morning. The room was clean and the staff was nice. Overall it was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for exploring Florida but reception not friendly !”
Reviews.Author: Scorpionsholidays
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd visit to Florida and i must say the best hotel so far. The room was excellent, they are either ground floor or 1st floor, ground floor is best as you can park your car outside your room, so best to ask for a ground floor room. The housekeeping was excellent. Clean towels etc each day, even on the days we had a lay in and didnt leave the room till the afternoon. Nice coffee maker with coffee and tea left each day. Fridge, tv, phone, hairdryer, iron, internet access. The only reason we didnt give this hotel an excellent rating is that on our arrival, after the usual long haul flight etc etc, we were not greeted well by the reception staff. Just a 'How was your trip' or such would have been nice, but no, just given room details, shown on a map of the hotel, and then directed to another receptionist who tried to get us to go to a time share meeting. I explained to her we had just travelled a long way and just wanted to go to our room and that in any case time share was the last thing we wanted to hear about. She was quite put out. We then had to find our own way to our room using the map. Why cant you be shown to your room much nicer and worth a tip ? During our 2 week stay we had nothing more to do with the hotel reception Our room maid was very friendly. My only other involvement with reception was when we checked out. Again not so much as a 'Have a good trip home' ! However everything else was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: david_quantum
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a good location. The price was reasonable, pool was awesome and on-site restaurants were nice. There are also many other dining options in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel with great amenities”
Reviews.Author: Kerrie L Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at BWLakeside three times and always found it to be very good value for money, great service,amenities etc. The rooms are cleaned everyday with fresh towels, we found it very handy having a fridge in the room, not many florida hotels seem to offer this facility. The room safe is easy to use. The pools are lovely two large ones, and a smaller/quieter one. The laundry rooms are convenient and cheap enough to use. Parking is safe & plentiful. Walgreens is a few safe steps away...Excellent cappucinos!!

Reviews.Title: “Mom and 19 year old daughter would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: theelementaryteacher
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went downstate to celebrate our birthdays at the Magic Kingdom. I remembered staying at the same hotel many years ago. When I searched for a hotel on the internet, I was looking for 3 things. 1- Rates of less than $55.00 a night, 2- Close proximity to Disney World and Hollywood Studios, and 3-A shuttle to the theme parks. I got the best room rate from using the Entertainment book. While I live in Jacksonville,Florida, this is the first time ( in more than 20 years) that I have driven further than 40 miles to a destination. We did not check in to our hotel until after 9 p.m. the first night. Our room was in building 10. I had no anxiety about the location of our room. I appreciate the fact that the room had a refrigerator. I brought breakfast cereal and disposable plastic cups with us from home and purchased a half-gallon of milk from the 24 hour Walgreens that was across the parking lot from the Hotel office. We did order a pepperoni pizza from the on-site Pizza Hut the first night, and we enjoyed it in our room. On to the room...the room was clean, and it cooled very quickly. It was somewhat musty, but I had packed a small 1.5 oz can of room spray from Bath and Body Works in anticipation of this. The room, bathroom, vanity, sink, tub, and toilet were all very clean. Be sure to close the bathroom door before you sit down though because the bathroom is small. However, I have experienced much smaller bathrooms in the U.K. and Venice, Italy. The towels and linens were the typical bleached white cotton. They were spotless. Horizontal surfaces were free from dust and grime. I did see some stains on the carpet, but my carpet at home has some stains on it too. I did not plan to sit or lie down on, or eat off of the carpet. Our housekeeper tidied our room each day. I never saw a tip envelope, so I never learned our housekeeper's name. We left her a tip the day we checked out. The young woman at the front desk told me that if you took the shuttle (earliest time was 9:15) to one Disney Park, you could catch a Disney bus to one of the other Disney Parks. This was useful information. We took advantage of this on the third day. Even though I had planned for us to use the shuttle for both days, we only used it for the long Disney day when we were there from 10-10. Bottom line- If you want a room that is clean, with cold a.c. , a bed to sleep in, and close proximity to the Disney parks, then stay at Best Western Lakeside. If you want posh, then stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, friendly, helpful staff. Would recommend to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: Floridaoct2009
Reviews.Content: My 17 year old daughter and myself have just returned from a two week stay at the Best Western Lakeside. I had stayed at this hotel in 2000 and my daughter stayed there with her dad in 2006. Even though the hotel has changed ownership a couple of times in this time period, everything was as I remembered, although the reception area and the rooms have had a lick of paint and a freshen up. The hotel is in the best possible area for access to Disney but it's only about a 20 minute drive to Universal and SeaWorld so well positioned for everything.The hotel does have shuttle buses to the attractions, but I was driving so we didn't need them. Very comfortable room with all the usual conveiniences. TV, fridge, coffee machine, iron and ironing board, hairdryer. Beds made up and clean towels every day, courtesy of our maid, Martha. Mary Lee on the reception desk made us feel very welcome on arrival and was very helpful when we couldn't get the safe to work, because the previous occupants had left it locked. There was non of the Time Share pressure that I had read about on previous reviews. She always seemed to be on duty and always gave a cheery wave when we passed by. She is a credit to the hotel. My daughter and I were travelling alone, which was quite daunting but we felt very relaxed and at ease. We did the parks, (boy did we do the parks!) but the crazy golf next door to the hotel was fun for a couple games too and the hotel games room was fun for a short while in the evenings. We didn't use the pools, although the pool areas looked in good order and the gardens were lovely. The choice of places to eat nearby is massive. We've got to recommend the Ponderosa because we've been eating there since we started going to Orlando 13 years ago. Even more so when Daniel, our waiter, remembered my daughter from last time she had visited! Brilliant. Golden Corral is also a great place to eat, the desserts looked amazing but I just couldn't manage one! Ultimately, we had the best holiday, and would definately return to Best Western Lakeside anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value”
Reviews.Author: lanajean1126
Reviews.Content: We traveled on a budget and thought this hotel was a steal of a deal. They had a lot to offer and we loved the fact that we didn't have to rent a car while we stayed. We used the shuttle service to Disney and Universal attractions and the bus drivers were so nice and helpful. We had a great stay here and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money with minor flaws”
Reviews.Author: IdoTLV
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Great prices - Rooms are comortable with all the amenities you need (except microwave) - Location is quite good - a few minutes driving to Disney and Universal - Plenty of restaurants around (including Pizza Hut at the hotel) - Nice pool Cons: - Not so clean - A lot of lizzards and bugs around the hotel building (we didn't see any in the room) - No elevator to second floor Conclusion: overall the hotel offers value for money. If you spend your time at the parks all day and just come back to the hotel for a sleep, this hotel would be a good choice

Reviews.Title: “a very pleasant hotel to stay in”
Reviews.Author: gezza41
Reviews.Content: 3rd time we have stayed at this hotel and cannot fault it for the money we paid, the staff were always helpful, the restaurant area was always clean, service sometimes a little slow if busy. We have noticed a lot of maintenance carried out between our stays, all to the greater good to improve air con system and decor improvements, the hotel; for us is well situated as we prefer the quieter life whilst away, even though the hotel is situated of the 192 highway it is still quiet as setback, good for disney trips and all other attractions plus of course the shops and restuarants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Price, Wonderful People”
Reviews.Author: pattygirl16
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised by the service we were given at this hotel. People were nice at the front desk, and in the morning while we had breakfast in this hotel. It is not your average hotel. It is broken up into different buildings giving a more private feel. It is rather large which is nice. They offer on-site breakfast that was delicious. It was 9.99 a person (children probably less, and you can get the bread buffet which is only 4:99 I believe. Either way, it is a great deal, considering why leave and go somewhere else for breakfast when you have it right at your fingertips. We had a great time, and we are even staying there this weekend. We have stayed at the expensive chains and never received great service like this. Thanks Best Western!:)

Reviews.Title: “fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: prentoprincess
Reviews.Content: I have to say i was a little concerned about the reviews on here, so much so i tried to change accomodation. I was unable to change so worried for three months that i was going to stay in a hell hole. I was very surprised! we had a blast, the accomodation was totally fine and im really fussy. The rooms were big and airy, the beds are so comfy and it was spotless clean, the cleanliness was maintained throughout by our housekeeper she was fab. The pool was nice and quiet and the pizza hut was fab with good deals at happyhour. I will stay here again the location was great and we came home well rested. we were not harrassed by staff, we felt annonomous which is good for us on vacation, we like to do our own thing. The area was safe. Overall this wee motel does the job. Please ignore the negative comments as its a wee jewel. ill defo be back next year. jacqueline prentice scotland

Reviews.Title: “Stay at your own risk!”
Reviews.Author: Kels75
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks at the Best Western Lakeside last Christmas and up until the day before we left, we didn’t really have any complaints. We left our room at approx 9:30 to head off to our last Disney Park of the holiday. We arrived back to the hotel at around 7pm to find our huge fully packed suitcase along with all the brand new bags of shopping we had bought a couple of days before missing. We reported it to reception who phoned the police. A police officer came and went through the motions, dusting the door down for prints etc but he was most unhelpful and basically said we should be more careful, when we first arrived we found the door didn’t shut properly so always made a point of slamming it! My husband then decided to see how easy it is to get into the rooms and within one minute, managed to gain entry with a Disney photo pass! Because there were no signs of any forced entry, the insurance company said we were not covered so we lost over £2500 of stuff as both sets of house and car keys for back home were in there as well as our flight tickets (which cost us a further $1750 with Delta but that’s another story). I also had some debit and credit cards in a purse in the case that I wasn’t using on this holiday, they had been used at a gas station by 11am, just an hour and a half after we left our room. Very suspicious! Best Western have basically said they are not responsible so we have lost everything apart from the fraudulent purchases on the credit cards which the bank have refunded We have been left with a very bitter taste, we will never stay there again and advise anyone who is going to stay there to be very cautious, the rooms are not secure and there is no CCTV! Was this simply a chancer or someone at the hotel who had easy access to our room and already knew what was in the suitcase? You decide and stay at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location can't wait to book our 3rd visit !”
Reviews.Author: klhocking
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Orlando and there was no hesitation when choosing our hotel. Our flight had been delayed so it was already late when we arrived at the hotel, reception staff were friendly and even got security to drive us to our block as it was pouring down with rain and dark. Our room was on the 1st floor which we had requested in an attempt to avoid noisy people walking past. The only fault was that we seemed to have been placed in a room between 2 single sex groups who were on the landing late at night and even phoned our room in error 2 nights running, they left after a few nights but were unfortunately replaced by a basketball team of some sort who were bouncing their ball at all hours! This however cannot be helped in a hotel which caters for so many different groups. The rooms are basic with 2 queen sized beds, a fridge and safe, the hairdrier was broken and a guy came to fix it within minutes of reporting it. We ate breakfast in the hotel nearly every morning and only found it extremely busy on 1 occasion, the choice of food was excellent and the kids ate free. Kids also ate free in the bar/grill when staying as a Virgin holidaymaker and the free welcome cocktails went down a treat. There is also a pizza hut on site which came in very handy on some evenings. Staff at this hotel are very friendly and nothing is too much trouble, on our first night we were so tired and the guy had forgotton to put through our pizza order we didn't even complain and he still gave us a full refund with our fresh pizza !! Transportation however was more of an issue on this visit. We didn't hire a car and because we utilised the free transport last time didn't foresee any problems. However the transport is now shared between at least 2 other hotels and although our hotel is always the first pick up the journey home can sometimes be a squeeze if you end up at the back of the queue. This hotel is ideally located on the 192 and situated minutes away from the Disneyworld resort. There are so many restaurants nearby it was hard to chose. We did eat at the TGI fridays across the road which was amazing . Despite a couple of issues this time I would not hesitate to stay at the hotel again and am already saving for Florida 2011 !!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and simple”
Reviews.Author: annaFortMyers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and simple. Great economical option for those who are looking to spend money on entertainment rather than hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best for the price - Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Rmontale
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a low-budget yet decent hotel, this is the right choice for you. Considering you won't be in your room for a long period, because Orlando is full of attractions, there's no need to pay more for a room. You get all you need in Best Western Lakeside. Its amazing location is what catch your attention first: There's a 24 Hr open Walgreens almost in the parking lot of the Hotel, and a few meters away you have a Wendy's, a Burger King, a Denny's and a Mc Donald's. It's 10 minutes (or less) away from Disney Theme Parks and it's also relative near to the excellent Orlando Premium Mall. The room itself is good, with everything you can expect from a 3 star hotel. It's also very clean. The front desk personnel and the restaurant servers were very pleasant . The breakfast is a traditional american breakfast buffet, but non Americans don't need to worry because they also offer fruits, cereal and bread. You may also try the restaurant at night. It's like a sports bar and they serve drinks and Pizza Hut's Pizza. I stayed there for 9 nights and I'd most definitely stay there again if I went to Orlando in another time.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and clean”
Reviews.Author: soapsuds22
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Room was clean and bed was comfortable. Bar prices were a bit high but staff was very friendly. Grounds clean and the location was convenient. I got a great rate and was pleased with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: allgrlband
Reviews.Content: We arrived late and were pretty tired from traveling. The front desk personnel were pleasant enough. Our room was clean and comfortable for what we needed it to be for one night. It was located conviently to stores and restaurants. I would recommend to friends if only staying for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star resort??????”
Reviews.Author: RACINDIVA
Reviews.Content: This place was a mess. I arrived late and was assigned a room that looked like it was from the 1950's and the air conditioner sounded like it was on it's last leg. I went back to the front desk and was assigned to another room and the lock on that door did not work. The third time I went to the front desk due to the look on frustration on my face and and the tone of my voice I was up graded to king room on the second floor. This so called resort should be rated 1 1/2 star, 2 at best, there are no frills and the place just did not feel safe. It need a lot of work, and if you book thru Hotwire you are given the worst rooms on the property.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: evette_eve
Reviews.Content: This room was booked through Hotwire. It was cheap, so I did not expect much. I was pleasantly surprised when I entered the room. The room was very clean, smelled great. I was a little concerned from all the bad reviews, but I enjoyed my stay. The staff was kind and very helpful. The room was right next to the pool, thankfully no one used the pool the entire stay, so it was quiet and peaceful. The morning leaving, the smell of chlorine was very over-powering, but did not seep into the room, so I did not notice it while I was there. Only bad thing I can say is the bathroom is really small and it felt cramped trying to get in and get out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location & breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: ClassyCanuck
Reviews.Content: Stayed 9 nights beginning July 24/09. Hotel location was a few miles west of congested carny atmosphere in Old Town area but in quieter area with good restaurants, shopping & attractions & 5 minutes west . Hwy 4 & World Drive to Disney less than 5 minutes to the east. Staff was friendly & helpful. Ana, hostess & waitress in breakfast area, was exceptional. Pool area very relaxing & clean. Room was large & kept clean. Would recommend to anyone, anytime. One caution....our room was in one of original 3 buildings & was not 'wireless' but ethernet cable should be on the desk in room. If not, check immediately with front desk. We always carry one of our own just in case.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Bilbotraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at BW Lakeside with our two grand children of 16yrs and 6yrs, the location was spot on with only a five minute drive to all Disney theme parks. Plenty of eating places within walking distance and a 24hr Walgreens pharmacy/general store onsite. The staff were friendly and the service they provided was exceptional for a budget priced hotel. Breakfast in the hotel was a little more expensive than outside options but we considered the cost outweighed the hassle of going offsite. The buffet breakfast was enough to satisfy any hungry traveller and there was a discount for over 55's and kids 16 and under ate free if you booked with Virgin Atlantic. Pool areas were kept nice and clean and there were saftey gates to stop small children from wandering in un-attended. The mini golf area was a little worn in places but as there was no charge we were quite satisfied with it. The in room facilities were ample with hairdryer,tea/coffee maker, iron and board, tv,radio,safe(no charge) and telephone with free local calls. All rooms were air conditioned and constant hot water to the bathroom and vanity unit. All in all this was an ideal base for Disney and all local attractions and we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Reconsider”
Reviews.Author: Optiscor
Reviews.Content: We just came back from staying here while on our Disney vacation. I had read reviews prior and decided to give it a go...I wish I had listened to the reviews. First of all...you get what you pay for. Check-in was a breeze, but when we got to the room, the carpets we stained everywhere...seeing as we had our 2 yr old with us and I didn't want her crawling all over it, I called front desk and asked to be relocated. They did no problem and upgraded us to a poolside room for free (normally 10 dollars a night). The new room was better but still had a couple stains on the carpet. The room was fine...your basic hotel room. Not very modern, looks old and tired but does the trick. The hotel grounds were poorly maintained. The air conditioners from the room leaked all over our carpet. On 3 different occasions, we were locked out of our room because the swipe card wouldn't work...not so fun after a long day at the parks. The pools were nice, but when I went to buy a drink for my wife and I, the bartender would not accept out-of-country ID unless it was a passport. I didn't like that seeing as I don't carry around my passport to purchase alcohol. Speaking of which, there is a safe in the room to keep valuables. Our wasn't working at first so I called the desk and they set a security officer over to fix it, the next day it was broken again so we never got to use it. The maid would clean the room daily, but never vacummed. The TV in the room is old but seemed to have enough channels, however, we never watched it. The tub would not drain properly. After I bathed my daughter, it would take about 1 hr to drain. All in all, this hotel sucks...but it's a good price to pay if you want convenience (close to everything including the parks). Also, it appeared to be the best looking hotel on the strip. If I do it again, I will pay a bit more and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3 Star Hotel - It's a BASIC 2 Star Tired Looking Motel”
Reviews.Author: Alco3
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week long stay at the Best Western Lakeside - I'll be as unbiased in my review as possible: Pros: -Fairly good location - easy access to Disney and Universal, free shuttle provided by the hotel (but only once a day for Universal); Excellent AC, which is great considering the heat; Somewhat clean (and large) pool Cons: -Overall (particularly the rooms) the hotel is a 2-star property, definitely not even close to a 3-star! Rooms look very tired and "motel-ish". If you ever traveled on an interstate highway (such as I-95), and stopped at a random motel for a night, you'd understand my "motel-ish" analogy. Everything looks as if the motel is 20+ years old; Staff is not very friendly, request a $10 surcharge for a king room or a room facing the pool (aside from the $3.50/day "resort fee"). Overall: If you are looking for an absolutely BASIC 2 star motel to sleep in-between parks, it may be a good value property for you. However, you will not feel comfortable at the hotel, as you would in practically any 3-star property. I would not recommend this property, and would suggest you book any other 3-star property, probably paying the same as you would for this motel. Hope this is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Basic accomodation but is adequate for exploring Disney”
Reviews.Author: sarah5320
Reviews.Content: I always try to be positive and write fair reviews, can't stand people moaning for moaning sake, so forgive me if I come across a little negative. Before I start I must say that this hotel offers value for money and is a good base for exploring Disney and Universal. If all you want is basic accomodation then this property is great, as you'll probably be out all day any way and spend minimum time at the hotel. The rooms are adequate, clean but rather small and dark. They have two small double beds, a large safe,, fridge, hair dryer, iron, coffee maker, free wifi and air con. The bathroom is rather small and basic but is sufficent. The maids do come every day, not sure how often the change the beds but they were always made when we came home from the parks. My major concern with the rooms were that they often over look a parking lot and this didnt make me feel very secure. There is no balcony just a window (which we always had the curtains closed for privacy as it overlooked the parking lot) hence why the room always felt dark. The hotel has three pools, which are ok, some days are quiet whilst others are noisey (depending on how many other people choose to have a relaxing pool day the same day as you). As a couple we found the pool areas a little too noisey but would be great for families and children. But we cant grumble as Florida is a family destination so we accept that. The pool areas seem tidy and clean but with little shaded areas, more parasols would have made a big difference. The pizza hut express on site is good and you can get pizza delivered to your room, eat in the restuarant or around the pool. The buffet breakfast is rubbish, there is a better and cheaper buffet breakfast across the main road on the right called the Golden Corral, has far more choice, fresher and cheaper. The location of the hotel is good; on site is a Wall Greens, you can buy anything you could possibly need from here. Also along the main road to the left is a Wendy, Mcdonalds, Pizza Hut, Taco Bell, and numerous other restuarants such as chinese and Indians as well as Steak houses and seafood buffets. An absolutely gorgeous steak house is called Key W Kools which is left on the main road. Right next door to the hotel is a great mini golf place, definately worth a go. There is also a pizza buffet called Ci Ci's next to the golf, which we never visited but wished we had as it looked lovely. The transport from the hotel to the theme parks was good but I would reccommend getting a car, we didnt but wished we had. The hotel puts on a shuttle to the following theme parks; Universal and Seaworld 7;45 return 6.00 Animal Kingdom 9;20 return 5;15 Magic Kingdom 9.50 and 5.15 return 520 0r 10;45 Hollywood studios (MGM) 11.30 return 8.30 Epcot- not sure what times as we didnt go Busch Gardens also departs daily at 940 returning around 9pm but needs to be booked through Mears travel. With regards to any of the disney parks, if you wanted to go to Hollywood studios a little earlier for example, you could get the 9.50 bus to Magic kingdom and then use the Disney free transport over to Hollywood studios, same with any of the others. Parking at the parks is $12, however taxis are expensive and if you want to return home from the parks earlier than the scheduled transport it would cost you; Magic kingdom- $30 Animal kingdom -$15 Seaworld- $35 Universal- $55 A car would you give you flexibility to come and go as you please and allow you to make most of the shopping malls. Also Universal City Walk and Down Town Disney are worth a avisit in the evening but this is difficult and expensive without a car. For Down Town Disney we cheated by getting the 5.15 shuttle to Magic Kingdom and then used the free disney transport to Down Town Disney. Again you can do the ame for your return journey and get the 10.45 shuttle back to the hotel from Magic Kingdom. Just a word of warning guest services at the hotel will offer you cheap Disney tickets if you attend a time share presentation for 2 hours. The money you would save is a matter of $70 which when you covert this to English money is hardly worth it. I recommend you buy your tickets before you come. Not sure how authentic the other outlets are that claim to sell cheap tickets as when you buy them from Disney you have to give a finger print scan when you enter the park, saw a few people get turned away looking rather angry and upset. Overall the hotel is a good location, good free transport but a little run down and shabby looking. I normally add photos but they are just the same as whats already on here so haven't bothered this time

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfast, great pool and so close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: Belsole
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a week at the Best Western Lakeside and it was just right. My son and I enjoyed the all the hotel had to offer. The room was clean, air conditioner worked well, The hotel offered a great breakfast buffet (free for the little guy). We appreciated the free shuttles to Disney, Universal Studios etc. We especially enjoyed cooling off in the pool every single day. The hotel is located to numerous restaurants and has a pretty good menu if you want to stay in. Staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Situated-Value hotel on the192”
Reviews.Author: no1ChipnDale
Reviews.Content: this is the third time we've stayed at this hotel and has not disappointed us yet. we had a room right at the rear of the (245) complex, and it couldnt have been better. the room looked like it had recently been refurbished, the mattresses were really comfy & looked new. Everything in the room was cleaned spotless everyday (fridge,Sink,Shower,Carpets,Windows). We use this Hotel to travel around the Local area (upto 3hrs away) & it is idealy situated for most major roads, as well as all the attractions. as all the revies cover, there is ample eateries nearby of a good standard & value as well as major shops (Target, Walgreens, 711's). we only saw the staff to book in & out over our 14days, which i think is the indication of a Hotel, as the less you see of the the staff, the more they must have right. if you do happen to stay near room 245 (very quiet area, no pools & near the maintenance work shops) park upto the fence at the back, & your car will be lovely & cool in the morning, as its been in the shade. also if your on the upper level, have a look at the skip in the maintenance yard at around 22:15hrs & you'll catch a bandit going in most nights.

Reviews.Title: “It is a very good place to stay an enjoy any vacation or trip in the area.”
Reviews.Author: aangelpr
Reviews.Content: Its well located and the sorrounding areas are very good if you like to go out to eat and buy anything. All the employees are very friendly and offer a very special treatment to the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and disappointing - pay a bit more and go to a proper hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 5Trippers
Reviews.Content: Our family with three children of 8, 10 and 12 stayed here over Xmas 2008 for 2 weeks. We realised that it wasn't the Hilton we were booking but have stayed at many Best Westerns in the UK and expected a similar good standard at 3.5 star. We were very disappointed from the time we arrived. It was clear that this was a basic motel and not a hotel as we had expected, full of the facilities for a family. The hotel lobby, restaurants, rooms and stairwells are very 'run down' and tired and it all desperately needs a good makeover. The crazy golf course was in dire need of repair. The pools, bar and the breakfast and breakfast waiters were the best things about the hotel. Our room was well cleaned but it was cramped and had a strange arrangement with part of the bathroom being curtained off. There was a problem with the free transport - no booking or queueing system - and people just turned up and barged their way onto the buses (some from other hotels). Due to this problem there was a punch up on Xmas Day in the 'queue' ! This was the only time the reception staff got involved, despite being told there were continual transport shortages.The poolside bar was closed until the day before we came home and apart from the bar and pizza hut there were no evening meals which we were expecting as a family friendly hotel, as the restaurant was closed. One of the aspects that worried us the most with young children was the openess of the hotel or motel as it actually was. The stairwells were very grotty and dirty and were open to the car parks - there was no security to stop children from leaving or undesirables from coming up to your bedroom door. Sorry for going on, but I wouldn't have gone if I had read this sort of review before I booked. I am very surprised that Virgin have kept this 'hotel' on, and it has put me off booking Virgin again if that was supposed to be a 3.5 star. It may be ok for singles/couples who are travelling, but I would strongly recommend families to go elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Great value, spacious room, lots of plus points. And we did it without a car!”
Reviews.Author: LC2009Glasgow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 14 nights in July 09. It was my first trip to Florida. When I read the mixed reviews I was slightly apprehensive, but really didn't need to be! Hotel is great. Is definitely more of a motel, but we found this a bonus as it meant you were more independent and didn't need to pass the Guest Services every time you left the building! Beware, as other reviewers have noted - Guest Services purely want to sell a time share to you. They will dress it up by saying they can offer cheap Disney/universal tickets. However, there is actually a representative in each morning to sell these tickets and as soon as you decline interest in the time share, Guest Services have nothing else to offer! We requested an upstairs room, to limit noise from above, and this was a good move. The ground floor rooms are a bit noisier, as there are lots of kids running about and the pool is close by, dependent on the building you are put in. Room was spacious, air conditioning a god send, cleaner in every day keeping the place very tidy. We decided to do it without a car, and this worked out OK. There are shuttles running to each Disney park every day, though there is usually only one shuttle going to and from the park per day. Earliest pick up is 9 for disney parks and 7.45am for Universal/Sea World. Pick ups are from 5pm onwards, so there is no chance of returning to the hotel during the hot part of the day, unless you take a taxi. We found some days quite long, but manageable. The Disney internal shuttle is handy as it means you can transfer to different parks/Downtown Disney with no cost. If you are going to Downtown Disney, you have to take a bus to one of the Disney resorts then get a bus to Downtown Disney/Typhoon Lagoon. We used Pop Century Resort from Hollywood Studios. Also, we fancied going to Florida Mall, but never got round to it. We did notice however, on our last day, that there's a Lynx bus goes from Magic Kingdom to Florida Mall, so you could get a shuttle there if you really wanted to go to the mall. I think the number for the Lynx was 111. There is a bus to Busch Gardens that can pick you up at the hotel. This costs $10 each and will be arranged by the hotel, if you buy your tickets there. However, I think the Flex ticket is pretty good value and you can buy that online before you go. The free shuttle the hotel offers to the Lake Buena Vista factory outlets is well worth it. You get a lot of discount coupons. I spent a fortune in Gap, Aeropostale and the Nine West outlet! If you like clothes/shoes, go here! Restaurants in the area are pretty good - there is an Outback Steakhouse, TGI Fridays and supermarket across the main road, and several fast food places on the same side of the road as the hotel. The breakfast buffet is OK and if you are planning on being out for the day, is good value as it means you may not need to buy lunch in the park. Pools at the hotel were great - clean and cool, after a long day at a theme park! There are poolside bars and happy hours between 12-2 pm and 5-7 pm. These are all points that I would've liked clarified before I went. Hope my pointers help you! If you want nightlife, I would definetely hire a car though, unless you have lots to spend on taxis or are happy with the hotel bar!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Does exactly what it says on the tin.”
Reviews.Author: andyrae1971
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, nothing fancy but clean and the staff were friendly. well placed for all that orlando has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, fantastic location, lovely staff, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: nikkibabes27
Reviews.Content: First off, I really don't understand how people can fault this place, if you want the Ritz go to the Ritz. This is a 3 star, good value, quality hotel with super location. Disney World was just off the 192 about a 7 minute drive, Universal was around 15-20 minutes. This hotel really has it all. There is an onsite pizza hut (good value for money), three swimming pools, mini golf, laundry room, games room, restraunt and bar, internet, wallgreens in the car park(expensive but has everything you need), tons of restraunts within walking distance - red lobster, CiCi's, Taco Bell etc. The staff are all very helpful, but like some others have said stay away from the ticket seller, you will be guided here once you have checked in, but just smile politely and refuse there free offers of money and tickets - it will save you two hours of your holiday. The Restraunt on site Hurricane Sam's is excellent although can be a little pricey, however the waistress always has a smile and some banter for you. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable. Again like others have mentioned the beds are on the small time, but take one each if two of you and you have plenty room. There is a great sized fridge, television, safe, hairdryer, coffee machine (great little gizmo), iron and air conditioning(on the noisy side but works a treat). The grounds of the hotel are well kept and look good. There are a couple of gripes. We were in building 7 which backs onto the noisy laundry unit so we could hear the industrial washing machines and drier throughout the night however it was not a major issue. The water pressure of the hand basin tap was a trickle but again not a major problem. So not really a gripe just a few annoyances. Please do not hesitate in booking this motel, it has everything you need for a trip to florida to visit the parks and see the sites. I would also highly recommend the 'Sky Coaster' at Old Town - 4 minutes from hotel by car, what a rush :)

Reviews.Title: “love the pizza hut”
Reviews.Author: sd_donuky
Reviews.Content: Love the facilities at this hotel. Pizza hut on site with a good value $6.99 meal deal, Hurricane sams bar also does nice food and drinks not too badly priced although I bought some small bottles of wine from the shop/pizza hut express and drank them out of the pizza hut plastic cups since all the shop/bar and pizza hut is joined together . Which meant I only payed $2.50 instead of $4.50 from hurricane sams. Cleaning staff excellant and friendly. My only concern is the staff who sell you the theme park tickets. They do not belong to the hotel so this is not an issue with the hotel and yes they do push the timeshare but that does'nt bother me I still wanted to buy my disney tickets since they were cheaper than the gate price. After spending over $800 on tickets there was a discrepency of $50. Just be extremely carefull and perhaps use a credit card to pay since my $50 was never found... Marian!!

Reviews.Title: “Closest to Disney with Maximum value per Dollar”
Reviews.Author: hoernla
Reviews.Content: As most tourists, we found ourselves in the situation of wishing to visit Orlando and esp. WDW, but were a bit deterred by the astronomical pricing for staying in the Empire of the Mouse. Searching for accomodation close to Disney World, we came across this hotel. I can sum up the experience as impeccable. 1. The prices were at a bargain (we stayed for about 60$ per night). 2. The rooms were spacious, friendly and in excellent condition. 3. The hotel was located at a main thoroughfare through the Orlando area. Anything you wish was within reach. 4 . This includes WDW, a 10 minute drive to the astonishingly well organized parking lots. The breakfast was a bit on the expensive side, so we decided to rather go to one of the breakfast buffets available along the Highway. Our pick was at the PONDEROSA steakhouse which was a good mile away on the direction to WDW.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay...pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Cozzmo
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect location for the night before our Disney stay began. We got an excellent rate and the kids had a blast. This place is huge! However, the pool that was nearest us was very large and not that crowded. Room was good size for a family of four. Only negative was that the putt-putt golf course is in desperate need of repair. Otherwise, a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: lgregory87
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as it rated high on the list for our budget. I have to say we were not dissappointed. The room had 2 double beds and a fridge, Playhouse Disney on the TV which was good for the kids. Loads of clean towels and the bedding was changed frequently. Great maid service was always polite and helpful. As we had a fear of our 2 year old falling out of bed they gave us a bed guard which was helpful. The reception around check out time was busy but other than that the staff were always on hand. My little boy ran off in the lobby and hid and three staff helped me look for him - thankfully he was found by a member of staff in PH.It had 3 pools we used one for our 2 and 4 year old and it was warm without having the sun on it and had plenty of sun loungers. In the local it had a playground with soft sand to land on. Laundry was clean and had ample washers and dryers and a godsend with two small ones. Parking was just outside the room. Security patrolled all the time and whilst we did not feel it was needed it was nice to know it was there especially when coming back from the Laundry room at midnight!!! Location was good for Disney a short drive and you were there. Big Target Supermarket opened as you turn right out of hotel where we stocked up on provisons for 2 weeks but there was a Walgreens for emergencies like chocolate and ice cream. Red Lobster and TGiF right across the street and a Pizza Hut on site but we never used it. IHOP and Mcdonalds a short walk along the road for a quick meal. Tacky souvenir shops too but no Designer shops save that for the Florida Mall or Premium Outlets. Overall the Hotel was great and we have stayed in many along that stretch of I-192 and this was by far the best and we would use again. Had enough things for the kids to do for a little while to give them a rest from being Micked out.

Reviews.Title: “Good Cost Effective Base”
Reviews.Author: PT4171
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a basic 3 star hotel under the "you get what you pay for" banner. Rooms were big enough for 2 adults and 2 children and generally clean. Only complaint the bath: looked well worn and decided to shower for the fortnight rather than risk it! Towels needed to be requested on more than one occassion but these were the only issues of complaint. The bar was great with the staff extremely helpful when called upon. We ate in the hotel bar on one evening and I thought the food was better than I thought it may have been. The pool was ideal for the kids, with this plus the play area and free crazy golf keeping them amused whenever we were not racing around the parks. Location wise, with a car, it was ideal. Close to Disney and easily accessable to Universal and all the other major highlights with the car. Overall relatively pleased with the experience. I've previously stayed in the All Star Resort, with this hotel being of a similar standard but a more cost effective option

Reviews.Title: “before you stay read my review”
Reviews.Author: thepiedpiper1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is now very old and very rough around the edges. It has never been maintained as it gets older it an it needs to be redecorated. The staff are inexperienced and customer service was very poor. When we arrived at the hotel we were told that we had to pay $3.50 per day service charge which our travel agent confirmed was optional. We gave them a copy of the travel agents letter and they said they would look into it. 2 days later they were knocking on our door at 11.30pm asking for the extra $3.50 then they rang the room as well. When I complained in the morning they really werent interested. When we got to our room it was clean on first inspection but when we looked more closely it was very dirty. We found hairs around the bath and bath handle and the floors were very rarely mopped up. The air conditioning units in the hoel are very old and very noisey so we were unable to have a good nights sleep. The shuttle service is very limited and in the end we hired a car. The crazy golf area was old and all ripped up and the restaurant for breakfast was very poor. All in all dont expect too much even at the low price you pay for booking it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: kat1Scotland
Reviews.Content: We read a lot of mixed reviews on this hotel before we left scotland on 23rd june for a 2 week stay!! there are only 2 downsides to this hotel..The reception staff are very depressing and look like they really dont enjoy there jobs, but the upside is that the hotel is so great you dont really need to talk to them!! we seen them 3 times check in...to ask about a location of a bank and check out!! Someone mentions about the corrodors of the hotel needing a good clean, i agree with that but it is not that bad that it botherd us at all.. So that is the only negatives.. This hotel was PERFECT For us..we have 2 kids a boy 4 and a girl 7..there is 3 very very clean pools, they are constantly getting cleaned...there is a little park that has sand in it where the kids can play with buckets a spade..the grounds of the hotel ar gorgous, expecially at night...there is a pizza hut which is lovely, the staff there are so nice..there is a restarant where you can have breakfast buffett for $8.99 and kids under 12 eat free, it is really nice and again staff are lovely..crazy golf area in the hotel ius great, it is also free..our kids loved it...Our room was very clean, beds are nice and comfy, we did not have enough pillows and left a note for maid and when we returned they where there..awesome service!! we hired a car and the parking was great!! this hotel really was great, it is not the hilton but we are not paying hilton prices..But i was talking to a man at the hotel who has been going to that very hotel for 17 years, he said that the best western lakeside is the only hotel other than the disney hotels he will go to in that area..we will deffinetly stay there again anytime we go to florida. also accross the street is sizzler, pondorosa etc..highly recomend them as well.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: MikeC1001
Reviews.Content: I was expecting so much more from reading the reviews but I was kinda taken aback when we arrived and saw the premises. But what can I expect for $45 a night ? The place is old and it shows. The building walkways could use a good pressure cleaning and a bit of paint. Although the room was pretty clean it still had a very musty smell to it and we had to get a candle to freshen it up a bit. Check in was a breeze and we were helped quite fast. Just don't get taken in with the "Free Welcome Package" at check-in. It's nothing more than a sales ploy to get you to commit to wasting 5 hours at a time share seminar for a free ticket somewhere. I'd rather pay for the ticket. On the plus side it is right in the middle of everything. Just a few miles to Disney and Old Town and there are a ton of restaurants nearby. A 24 hour Walgreens and a Burger King share the parking lot which is a plus. It's certainly nothing fancy but if you just need a place to crash for a night or 2 then it's OK. I wouldn't want to stay any longer than that.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: hydonian
Reviews.Content: As most people will of read reviews about hotels on here i.e the purpose of the web site I will write about our experience as we saw it at Best Western Hotel Lakeside in Kissimmee Florida. The hotel was in an excellent position on Highway 192 just after marker 6. Was really easy to find assuming you go the correct way. Before you go make sure you print off a map unlike us which had to guess where the hotel was. If you looked on google map it is spot on but the entrance is on Highway 192 right next door to Cicis pizza and a large crazy golf place. The hotel is really big as there is 15 buildings in the complex. Our room was really really clean and was cleaned every day throughout our two weeks stay. The cleaners were friendly and also all the staff in reception etc were really helpfull. We did see the people selling timeshare but we rarely had to visit reception so was easy to avoid them. We didn't have an iron in the room so left the cleaner a note to bring an iron and was there when we returned to the room.
