Our room was upstairs and had two double beds in it even though there was only two of us. Really spacious too. Really big safe and working fridge/television/shower was really warm and controlable. The location in proximity of disneyworld parks is brilliant. To be truthfull they are 10-15 minutes away by car. My advice is to hire a car. There is every conceivable eatery in this area except KFC. We went to Golden Corrall quite a few times as they had a buffet style bar and must of had about 100 different types of foods. Most edible but not all depending on tastes. There are lots of local shops near the hotel selling towels and fancy goods etc. Petrol is cheap too compared to UK. Overall the holiday was exceptional, of course an holiday is what you make it but on this one I couldn't find fault or critiscism.

Reviews.Title: “Found no fault”
Reviews.Author: Elvislover57
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband had a 2 week stay and found it great. Room clean, housekeeping excellent. A good base for visiting other parts of Florida. Our only complaint were the prices of drinks in Sam's Bar - tended to fluctuate!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: mandkandkids
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last June and were happy overall. I would say you get what you pay for. Its location for the Disney parks was excellent but a car would probably be best. Universal further away. It was as said before in a great location for Walgreens and many restaurants. The breakfast was good value ( free for kids). The shop, pizza place and KFC were all added benefits. The pools were lovely although you don't get much time to use them with all the theme parks on offer. We thought the crazy golf was a litle run down. Rooms were an average size but bathrooms were a little on the small side. Our only complaint was that our air conditioning unit was faulty and it took maintenance ages to come and eventually fix it. Overall pleased for the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches in room and Shuttle to the Park was sporadic”
Reviews.Author: MickeyMouseToronto
Reviews.Content: The carpets were filthy, covered in stains. We wore shoes or slippers the whole time we were in the room. We found several dead cockroaches along the baseboards and two live ones on the floor in the sink area. When we brought them to the front desk in a plastic bag, the manager offered to give us another room or have it sprayed. We already had all of out stuff unpacked, so opted to have it sprayed. When we returned, the room stunk of bug spray and made us cough. That was all I could taste in my mouth for the next few days. The pool was dirty with sand and leaves at the bottom. The manager did offer us a free dinner, but only after I asked about compensation. The shuttle bus was only available to certain parks on certain days of the week and at a very specific time of day. If you did not get in line early for the bus, plan to stand on the bus all the way to the park.

Reviews.Title: “Do you need a car at the Lakeside?”
Reviews.Author: JeremyBond
Reviews.Content: Just read a review whereby someone mentioned they were unaware of the Busch Gardens bus. My family stayed at the Best Western Hotel back in August 2008 and I reported on one element of the hotel’s complimentary services - the shuttle service. Here is my report again for those who missed it! - Before I begin I would like to say the times etc given are based on August 2008 and may have changed sinced You will have heard both good reports and bad reports of this service, and I will have to say it would be easier if you had an hired car….but as I am one of those people who wanted to let someone else do the driving, and not worry about tackling the roads in Florida and to save some money from the additional costs of a hired car like insurance, petrol and tolls etc. For those who are not aware, the cost of parking your car at Disney is $12 a day! Therefore within the two weeks I took full advantage of the hotel free shuttle service and the public transportation system, and I thought I would share my discoveries with you. Visits to Disney… The hotel schedules shows trips from the hotel to Animal Kingdom (9.15am), Magic Kingdom (9.50am), Hollywood Studios and Epcot (11am) and Magic Kingdom (5.30pm). Then the bus returns from the Magic Kingdom (5.45pm & 10.30pm), Epcot (6.00pm & 8.45pm), Animal Kingdom (6.15pm) and Hollywood Studios (8.30pm). Once you arrive at a Disney park, you can easily take the Walt Disney Transportation system to the other parks….so you don’t need to wait until 11am to get to Epcot, just catch the 9.15am to Animal Kingdom and take the Disney bus to Epcot arriving at the park at around ten. The same applies to the return journey, if you want to leave a Disney park at 5.30pm make your way to the Disney’s ticket and transportation centre (outside Magic Kingdom) to pick up the shuttle. To get to Disney’s water parks or Downtown Disney, it can be a little bit more complicated as there are no direct Disney buses from either of the four theme parks. The way around this is to go to the Disney Park as normal, and then get a Disney bus to one of their hotel resorts. For example, to get to Blizzard Beach, we took the 9.15am bus to Animal Kingdom and then we caught the Disney bus to Disney’s All Stars Resort, and from there we took the bus to the water park. One last thing to mention, and that concerns the taxis. We left the parks early on a couple of days to spent the afternoon at the hotel before catching the 5.30pm shuttle back to the park. If you want to return to the hotel by using a taxi during the day, I recommend you take a Disney Bus to Animal Kingdom and go from there. Animal Kingdom is the nearest park to the Best Western Lakeside and the cost was under $10. I believe the cost from Magic Kingdom is $24. Visits to Universal Studios and Sea World. The hotel schedule shows trips from the hotel to Sea World and Universal Studios is 7.45am, returning at 7.30pm (Universal) or 7.45pm (Sea World). This is going to be a long day…as the parks do not usually open until 9am and so you have to wait for up to an hour before the park opens. Some families found the days too long, especially the day at Sea World (With Universal you can spend a hour or two walking around Universal’s City Walk, which is like Downtown Disney). At Sea World if you want to return early, I would recommend you go across the car park to the Renaissance Resort and go to the bus stop marked ‘32’ on the same side as the hotel. A local Lynx bus comes every 30 minutes (No 50) which will take you back to the Disney’s ticket and transportation centre (Magic Kingdom). The price of the bus is a couple of dollars. If you arrive before 5.45pm, you can catch the free shuttle back to the hotel, or if you arrive after this time, take a Disney bus to Animal Kingdom and catch the taxi. If you want to take the local bus from Sea World to Best Western Lakeside, you will need the No 50 to Magic Kingdom, then the No 56 to Kissimmee Old Town and then the No 55 from the Old Town to the hotel….this will take a while! Visit to Busch Gardens Tampa. This year we went to Busch Gardens. For this we used the ‘Busch Gardens Shuttle Express’ which is a daily round trip transportation direct from the Best Western Lakeside. The cost of this service is only $10 per person (free for 5-park flex ticket holder). You just call 1-800-221-1339 a couple of days before you depart to reserve a space on the bus. The bus will come to Best Western Lakeside at 9.40am and collect you. You arrive at the park at approximately 11am. The bus leaves Busch Gardens at 7pm (depending on the park closure times) and returns to the hotel. Visits to Shops. Best Western Lakeside offers a complimentary shopping shuttle to Lake Buena Vista Factory Stores, which is a nice little trip. However, this year we wanted to take advantage of exploring the famous international drive with the various shops associated with this. We took the 7.45pm shuttle to Sea World. From here, you can get onto the I-Ride Trolley, this is a bus which takes you up and down the miles that make up the International Drive Resort Area. We used the ‘main line’ and when paying you must have the exact money on you. The cost is $1 per person per ride. Most shops open at 10am, so you may want to get a coffee somewhere before tackling the shops. We had a ‘all you can eat breakfast’ at Slizzers on stop ‘24’. The shopping centres I would recommend to you are at stop ‘1’ Prime Outlets International, stop ‘2’ Festival Bay Mall and stop ‘41’ Orlando Premium Outlets’. Once again if you want to get back to Best Western Lakeside during the afternoon, just catch the Lynx 50 bus from stop ‘32’ to Magic Kingdom. One thing I feel I have to mention is the I-trolley bus is advertised as arriving approximately every 20 minutes. At one part of the day (it was a Saturday) it took 45 minutes of waiting in the hot heat for the bus to come and then there was heavy traffic causing a delay in getting back to Sea World. If we had a car it would have taken us 30 minutes to get back to the hotel. That afternoon it took almost three hours! However a couple of days later we used the I-Trolley and it was fine. I hope you have found my comments useful and fee more relaxed about the idea of going to Orlando without a car.

Reviews.Title: “Visiting for conference at Disney's Contemporary resort”
Reviews.Author: wboo75
Reviews.Content: I went to attend conference on Disney property. This was in a decent area about 10-15 minute drive to Disney. Taxi was $20-$22 each way to the contemporary resort, 24- hour walgreens was right across the parking lot and a wendys next to that. Very convenient location. Refrigerator and room were clean. The 3 pools were nice and never crowded. Free shuttle service to disney properties was free, but crowded and parked in the middle of a huge lot rather than at the gate.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, great location”
Reviews.Author: Gibsonclan
Reviews.Content: Good Bits! For value for money you cannot fault this hotel. Staff were always friendly and ready to give you advise. Location is great as it provides free shuttle to most of the parks. Tip. If you want to go to Down Town Disney just use the shuttle to get to Magic Kingdom then hop onto one of Disneys free shuttles to get you there. You don't need parki hoppers to utilise the free transport so just use the hotel bus then hop around as you wish. We didn't have a car and taxis were expensive so we relied on the buses. Tip if you have tickets for Busch Gardens arrange a couple of days before transport to pick you up, reception will do this for you and they pick you up the same place you get the shuttles. We didn't know this and ended up going to Aquatica instead! Rooms were cleaned every day and fresh towels were given if required. We did eat a coupl of times on site and the food was ok, nothing to rave about but if you like Pizza Hut then your laughing as there is one on site. Near to the hotel and within walking distance are loads of eaterias, best we found was Red Lobster and a nearby Steak house, my sons favourite Crabby Bills! Think we put on a stone or 2! The hotel is spacious with a couple of large pools. Bad bits. Hotel grounds could of been abit tidier, there was a towel left near the crazy golf that was removed for about 3 days. Abit more money could be spent on the gardens but overall for a 3 star its highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel all around, Location, service and value”
Reviews.Author: Aramom
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel. The location was perfect. Close to theme parks and attractions. Plenty of places to eat and shop all in walking distance. The service was great. Check in and check out were very fast and anything needed in between they were glad to accommodate. I asked if they had a newly renovated room available and they were happy to give me one. also I bought my son a toy that need a screwdriver to get it out of the package and they called maintenance right away and two guys came within five minutes and gladly got the toy out. I only used the one pool by the mini golf course and it was very clean and relaxing. There was tiki bar that was open during the day. My son loved the park and especially the mini golf course which is free to play whenever you want. The room was a decent size and very clean. There is a restaurant that serves a breakfast buffet, a pizza hut, a general store and a bar on premises. All the staff I dealt with at the hotel were very friendly and pleasant. I am planning to go back again in May and will definitely be staying there. Also if you walk across the parking lot there is a walgreens and Wendys right there. Great price, Great location, Great hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Very Clean, Excelent Location, Rooms have great space”
Reviews.Author: romanalex
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was suuper clean, very comfortable, the personal was very professional and very helpful. The room was always clean and has a great space. The Pizza Hut inside the Hotel was a Plus for us and also the buffet on the restaurant was very nice, we enjoy it. The location is suuper nice; it has a Walgreens at the parking and IHOP and many other stores and attractions near by. The travel distance from the hotel to Disney, Universal Studios, Island of Adventure are about 5 to 10 min. The hotel really worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KarriRoberts
Reviews.Content: My husband, two children and I stayed here on the way to Disney World. We stayed one night at the Best Western and then we went to a Disney value resort and then another night at Best Western. I have to admit that our room at Best Western was bigger, cleaner and nicer than what we got at Disney. The beds were larger and more comfortable too. My kids loved the huge pool, the playground and the free mini golf. I would recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Hibby
Reviews.Content: Along with my wife, son, daughter in law and two grand daughters we stayed here for 2 weeks from 19th May. The hotel is good value, the staff are all very helpful and the restaurant and pool facilities were also very good. There are many restaurants close by and the Disney attractions are very close. Access to the I4 and Orlando with its many attraction is also simple. We had a good time and would definitely recommend this hotel and we would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome trip, no complaints!”
Reviews.Author: Alisina
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews before booking here, but in all they seemed OK. We got a package at $490 CAD for flight, hotel & car rental for 7 days so it was a sick deal. When we got to the hotel, we had no issues checking in, they gave us the option of upgrading to a king-size bed with a pool view for $10 extra per night, but we declined. They also gave us the option of the top floor or bottom, we chose top so we wouldn't hear anyone above us. I have no complaints about the hotel room - it was clean, the beds were kind of small to share with someone, but for a week, it was easy to live with (and there were 2 beds, so you can have your own if you're just 2). There were no loud noises to speak of, I didn't have trouble sleeping at all. The only thing I would improve is the water pressure - kind of weak but not a huge deal. Maybe it was just our room. The fridge worked, the AC worked great, there is free high-speed internet but it's not wireless - they provide a cable in the room. I suggest if you have a laptop to bring it. It's useful for planning your days and getting info quick & easy. The reception has computers you can use but it's way more convenient to have access in your own room instead of having to leave & go all the way to the front desk. The fridge was great - we bought about $100 worth of breakfast & lunch food in order to save some $$. There is a supermarket really close to the hotel, in the same complex at Giordano's. We ate supper out every night, our food budget was $400 and it was perfect. We did eat at the breakfast buffet once at the hotel but it wasn't anything special, don't waste your money there. There is also a safe in the room which was very convenient and we had no issue with. It's digital - when you arrive you create your own code. There is an exercise room but, um, I didn't make it there! So I can't comment on the facilities. We went to the pool a few times & the poolside bar is convenient but the bartender made us show him our passports to prove our age, which we thought was really unnecessary & weren't very impressed with. The Walgreen's next door is awesome, I bought many of my toiletries there upon our arrival to save room in my luggage. We got our coffee at the 7-11 near the hotel every morning, very good coffee - better than Starbucks. Our vacation wasn't a Disney one, we stayed at the hotel but had a car and did a wide variety of activities - zipline, airboat ride, a day of bass fishing. We went to Silver Springs (great time) and Gatorland. We got tickets for $70 each for 1 day at Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure - it was worth it. If you are interested in bass fishing, our guide, Kenny, was AWESOME, we were so pleased with our day - you can contact him at kenny@boatclub.com to book a day. All in all, this hotel was great, it exceeded my expectations & we actually didn't run into any timeshare crap so that was nice. I have NO complaints, would absolutely stay there again & would absolutely visit Kissimmee again! Message me if you have any questions!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Halen25
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place to stay. Had a lot of ammenities and things to do for kids, good pool area. A 3 star hotel so don't expect 4 or 5 star services etc. Rooms were clean, but the beds could be replaced, a little flimsy. Would stay there again for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Mystic Dunes tour and hire a car! Please read.”
Reviews.Author: jbkai
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from the best western lakeside in florida, we had a fantastic time. On arrival at the hotel we were given a worn welcome, and were sent round to see Carrie (dont forget this name), she was helpful when speaking about the parks, she is a sales person at the hotel and asked if we wanted tickets to which replied no as we have flex tickets and disney park tickets bought in advance, would recomment this as it gave freedom to enter the parks as much as you wanted over the two weeks, she then asked if we would be interested in seeing the arabian nights show which we were. She told us that the usual prices were 56 dollars each and that if we took a visit to a local " sister hotel" for a possible future hotel to stay and that we would be given a lavish breakfast we could have the tickets for 40 dollars total..... sounds good we thought. Bad idea! I would strongly suggest you dont make the same mistake..... its a big hoax, sure you do get the tickets if you attend but it is a time share sales pitch. We were given a terrible breakfast, not good image for the mystic dunes straight away, and then given a tour of the hotel which of course they took us to the pent house etc.... Back from the tour she tried selling us timeshare which is around 7000 dollars deposit! and a further 27000 or so dollars to be paid off monthly... a terribly stupid idea plus it is a fortune to have the hotel maintained which they forgot to say about..... we obviously said no but number two sales man came to the desk who was a big man from newcastle who tried to give the deposit after a lot of us saying no for a dollar! they are obviously desperate for a sell.... he was exteremly rude and i cant explain how pushy he was, we still sat strong and said no no no, i was getting very annoyed by now and he went and along came number three!! to which we said no just sign the reciept so we can get the dinner show tickets... again very very rude man. sure enough we got the tickets and enjoyed the show however they are only in our eyes worth 40 dollars total anyway becuse everyone is asked at the end of the show to give 10 dollar tip each! That was the bad bit, again dont do it, unless you want to lose about 5 hours of your holiday! The hotel was clean, rooms cleaned everyday, pools nice and the lake very relaxing....look out for gators was quite fascinating... Use your free buffet ticket but use it once and then go elsewhere... there a far better breakfast buffets walking distance from hotel such as ponderosas, golden coral and the sizzler... i would recommend ponderosas as was really nice food, plenty of choice, clean and polite staff and only 3.99 each! plus coffee. next door to hotel is walgreens, good for sun tan lotions, drinks etc but would definately recommend a car for several reasons.... walmart...its great florida mall all the outlet centres and all the parks, it may say they are close but the shuttles a very few and far and i believe a taxi is a fortune, peterol is so cheap out there, 20 pounds filled a 2.4 ltr car ! We also took a drive to clear water, would recommend that. Driving is easy out there so go for a hire car! All in all a great hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location,nice staff ,perfect for a sunny getaway.”
Reviews.Author: greenekids3
Reviews.Content: My husband and i came for a getaway from kids and work and had a great time.The staff was nice , the shuttles were on time, the breakfast was great and we were close to everything. We didn' t need to rent a car everything is in walking distance , the pools were big and clean and the beds were very comfortable.All in all great for disney trip or just a getaway to lie in the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel, clean and nice. Don't rely on the shuttle service.”
Reviews.Author: pr_littlemermaid
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Very clean and spacious rooms. We had a DB Room. It has plenty of space to put your belongings. It has a TV-not too many channels, a table with 2 chairs, and a refrigerator with freezer. No microwave. No unpleasant odors and very quiet. A/C was fine. May be no one was next door, but it was quiet. The bathroom sink area is big with a curtain, which I like, to divide that area with the sleeping area. So, you don't bother sleeping people with the light if you wake up early in the morning. I don't believe it has internet connection in the rooms, but you may want to contact the hotel directly. The staff is very nice although they try to convince (push) you to go to a 2 hr Next door Resort Orientation. They sell park tickets also on the lobby for a discount. It is a huge hotel, plenty of parking. It has 2 swimming pools, laundry area, Mini-golf, fitness center, game room, playgrounds, and restaurants on site. There is a restaurant on site which offers breakfast buffet for $8.99 per adult. Children are free with paying adult. It has fresh fruits, hot and cold cereals, scramble eggs, eggs made to orders, assorted breads and pastries, breakfast pizza, sausage, potatoes, french toast, pancakes. It includes coffee, tea, milk, but not the juice (you will have to pay extra). Breakfast is from 7AM- 11:30AM which I found nice. We didn't use the transportation which they offer, since it is not good. Shuttles have a very strict schedule, and you must be at the stop 10 minutes before departure. Like the last bus to depart from MK is at 10:45PM from the ticket center. If park closes at 10PM, with the long lines to take the Monorail, to take the tram to the ticket center, you'll miss the bus. If the park closes at midnight, the shuttles departs at 11:45PM, so, you'll miss the fireworks. Yes, rent a car if you are staying at this hotel. Check the hotel website for details on the shuttles if you want to take the risk to try it. Customer Service is very fast by email. Hotel is very close to the parks. It takes like 10 minutes to get to the entrance of MK. Less for the other Disney parks, more to non-Disney parks. It is located in an area with plenty of restaurants. Just drive east and you will find a lot of places to eat. It has a 24 hr pharmacy next door (Walgreens)-within walking distance. We reserve directly on the BW website, we found a very nice deal $59 incl. taxes for a Saturday night, and we had no issues with check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is awful, shuttle service is awful, rent a car!”
Reviews.Author: Mickey_Princess
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked through a travel agent who has sent clients here for years and was shocked by my disappointment in my stay here. First of all, when this hotel was booked (3 months prior to the vacation) I was told that renting a car wouldnt be necessary since the hotel provided compliementary shuttle drops and pick ups to Disney. Since we were also going to Universal I had to purchase transfers in advance with another company in order to secure a ride to the park. We checked in around 1230 and automatically asked when the next shuttle was heading to Disney World so we could get started as soon as possible. The next shuttle was not schedule to leave until 500pm and would pick up at 830pm. We were told that if we wanted to go early that they would call us a cab. After getting our bags to the room, located on the very back of the propery, we decided to go ahead and have them call a cab for us. The cost to take us to Animal Kingdom was $15 through the checker cab that was dispatched for us. Animal Kingdom closed at 5 so we rode one of the Disney buses to Hollywood Studios in order to catch the Fantasmic show at 9pm. The last shuttle leaving Hollywood Studios was at 8:45 so we had to take another cab back to the hotel this time it was $25. The next day was scheduled for Downtown Disney as we had reservations to the T-Rex resturant for lunch. There was no shuttle that would take us directly to the location we needed and didnt have enough time to chance the lines for the buses at the Disney Parks. Once again we had to take a cab. This is the part I find VERY interesting.. The hotel allows only one "transportation" company to shuttle their guests and allows cab drivers from the company to sit in the lobby waiting for guests who missed the shuttle or need to be taken else where. I knew, based on the previous day's experience/'expense, that checker cab was cheaper to take and requested a cab to be called. I was told since the company had men on site that they would have to take me and the hotel could not call a different company for me. I asked how much it would cost for us to go to Downtown Disney and I was told that it would be $30. At that point we decided to be late and just take a the bus from Animal Kingdom and asked the driver to take us there instead. He said that he would have to charge me an additonal $20 for the gate pass he had to purchase in order to drop us off at the guest drop off location. He began driving and talking toward our destination. I thought he was speaking to me and asked if he could please repeat and he got upset becuase he was talking on his bluetooth. He never hung up the call and took us to Downtown Disney anyway, charging us the $30 fare. The return trip cost $18 with the checker cab we found. One other review I read spoke about a man pushing a time share tour on them while they were guests. This also happened to us and we signed up only for free ride to the park since we'd already paid so much in cab fares as it was. The next morning we were to be picked up at 930am and taken to the resort for a complimentary breakfast and a short tour. The same "transportation" company was supposed to pick us up but they were running late (go figure) when we checked in w/ guest services on where the car was. 10:10 the driver finally shows up and takes us to the resort. and told us to check in at the desk inside. The line at the desk was literally out the door and my son was starving since he hadnt eaten breakfast yet. We were told that we would have to stand in line and check in prior to him being able to eat. We stood there for 15 minutes and none of the lines moved. We left shortly after so we could feed our child breakfast and just went straight to the park which did turn out to be a free car ride to Magic Kingdom but the driver spoke on the phone the entire time and ran a red light while turning left. Hoping to catch the complientary shuttle at 1045pm (the earliest shuttle after the 9:00 fireworks show) we took our time and enjoyed the park. At 7:30 it started pouring rain and my son was shivering. We'd never make it back to the pick up location in time to catch the 745 shuttle since everyone was leaving at the same time. There was not another shuttle available until 9:30. Stuck in the rain, child shivering cold there was no way that we could wait another 2 hours so, once again, had to take a cab. The next morning would begin our time at Universal and the shuttle passes that were purchased in advance were wonderful. All I had to do was call them an hour prior to pick up and they were there waiting, as a shuttle service should be. Most of my frustration with this hotel was based around the shuttle services but the rooms were not very clean and when the maid did come to straighten up didnt do much. The beds were uncomfortable and had a flat sheet drapped (not tucked) across the bed for a fitted sheet. The water pressure in the shower was so weak that you had to check if the water was still running. There were people in our building that would party late into the evening and were very, very loud drunks. I will NEVER stay at another Best Western hotel again just based on this experience and will ask that if anyone is planning on staying here to please reconsider.

Reviews.Title: “Good value clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: gilmourrachel
Reviews.Content: We booked through Virgin and reading through other reviews before we left, I tried to change this hotel, but to no avail, so off we went in search of dirty rooms and bed bugs. Having just returned from 14 nights at the BW Lakeside I am very pleased to report that our room (224) was spotlessly clean every day, Minerva the Maid even made a point of dressing up my daughter's teddy every day to her delight. The rooms are spacious, clean the safe worked, the fridge worked as did the coffee maker and hairdryer (although the electrics were a bit risky). The only 2 problems we encountered during our stay were exceptionally noisy American neighbours one night and after 2 calls to reception to complain they were finally silenced and the only other problem was that our key card stopped working but that was easily sorted. The guest services were very helpful with directions and tickets (don't waste money on the Pirates Dinner Adventure as it wasn't that great and Busch Gardens was a long drive for not much when we arrived....stay in Disney or Universal. Apart from the rain for the last week we had a great time and wouldnt hesitate to recommend the Lakeside, it's handy for Disney and 20 mins to universal up the 192 and onto the I-4. Eating out around the hotel wasnt great but the Golden China across the lake does a bargin all you can eat buffet which was really good.

Reviews.Title: “would never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: lynnmcdon
Reviews.Content: the location for going to and from the parks is very good. being on the 192 has its advantages for dining, shopping etc. we have been to kissimme several timew before but always stayed in a villa. this time was time for a change. the room was a good size and the beds comfortable. the safe was broken, so was my dads in the room next door. he 'bathroom' was so tiny with no wash basin in it. there is a vanity unit with basin off the bedroom but it is straight off the bedroom and has no door or screen to seperate it. the worse thing was the noise. it didnt let up alll night long! cars coming and going through the night, wagons delivering to the hotel and other shops etc around, bin men in their trucks at 5am 3 times a week. we have come home exhausted. i suppose if you're only there a few nights its ok but 14 is way to many

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Ottawaresident12
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean, fridge and safe were great to have. Pools were heated and grounds were very nice - way better than having to take an elevator all the time. Service was great - had a noisy air conditioning unit, told the front desk - within 10 minutes it was looked at, within 10 more, it was fixed! Breakfast buffet was very good and convenient. Location was fantastic to get to parks and restaurants. Yes, rooms are dated, carpets are not spotless, bathrooms could use some work, but we paid less than $65.00/night, so we didn't expect 5 star accommodation. We were just there to sleep and relax in the pool after long days at the theme parks (and pools were open till 11:00 so it was very convenient). Would definitely stay again! We didn't even make eye contact with the time share guys, so had no experience with them. FYI - we ate at the Cici's Pizza at the mini-putt in front of the hotel - DON'T!! We thought we would try it one rainy night as it was easy - big mistake!

Reviews.Title: “relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: healthworker
Reviews.Content: great vacation, clean comfortable hotel, lovely pools, plenty of towels, well maintained grounds, plenty of places to eat within walking distance, rooms clean and beds comfortable. The only two complaints we have are the bar which has very little atmosphere, the lighting is too bright and resembles a cafe although the bar staff are very friendly and look after their customers very well. The second complaint is at the check in desk where there is one particular young gentleman who has forgotton how to smile and treats customers as if they are a nuisance, this is the second year we have complained about the same persons attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Eh”
Reviews.Author: Saint03
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on TripAdvisor, i thought this hotel was going to be really nice for the price. I was a bit disappointed. It the outdoor grounds were fairly run down. It had obviously been re-vamped a few years ago, but has not been kept up since. The decor was a bit tacky as well. When we got to our room, there was no toilet paper and the coffee machine was missing a few pieces. On the plus side, it was inexpensive, and it was pretty clean inside the room, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Complimentary Wi-Fi! There is definitely better out there for the price

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay In This Dirty Dog Of A Place!”
Reviews.Author: RelivAmbassador
Reviews.Content: I agree 100% with the review that talks about this place being worn and dirty. When we first walked in, we were struck by the stale smell and the worn/scuffed furniture, but we could live with that. Then as we set our stuff down, my daughter noticed a large, dark, oily-looking spot on her pillow. Then we saw the many stains on the green carpet (One of them was a disgusting brown stain). The sink was dirty and the toilet had a short, curly black hair on the middle of the seat. We had had enough at that point and called Expedia to get us out of that place! The customer service lady at Expedia called the manager, who hung up on her. HUNG UP ON EXPEDIA! She called him again, and he insisted on charging us for the first night, even though we had disturbed nothing, and had been there less than 10 minutes. Fortunately, Expedia then offered to give us a credit. We left and got a room at the Ramada across from Celebration, and it was wonderful. Don't get caught at this place like we did. Expedia needs to drop this hotel from its listing as quickly as possible. Dirty, smelly and uncooperative.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money - clean, great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: DonnaPSwindon
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from 9 nights at the best western Lakeside. You will see a lot of varied reviews but I think what people need to remember is what they are paying for - we paid £50 a night through expedia including breakfast. For the money it was fantastic - the breakfast ordinarily was $8.99 per person - great buffet all you could eat and the chef would cook extra eggs if you wanted. The room was large very clean and they came in and serviced it every day. There were 3 pools all heated and also very clean - you would always see staff through out the day cleaning the pool and the pool areas nothing was too much trouble. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone - if you are looking to pay £50 and expect a room that would normally cost you £150 a night then this is not the hotel for you. It it very much a motel but with lots of extras of a hotel ie breakfast, shop on site, Bar on site, Pizza Hut on site, golf on site. The location on the I-92 was fantastic - you could walk to a number of restaurants and shops - disney was only 10 mins away - many of the evening shows are actually located on the I-92 so again a short distance in the car. Will be using again .... Also had free high speed wireless internet which to us was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and great pools”
Reviews.Author: NiagaraFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for six nights as a part of our 10 days visiting the parks. It was a very nice experience. The rooms are clean, the pools are warm, and the location is convenient for everything. The only negative for us was the size of the bathroom. With our family of four with two teenagers, it was a bit of a tight fit. The value for the dollar made that small inconvenience not a big deal. Many other reviewers have commented on the prime location and convenience to the parks and restaurants. The three pools are all nice and plenty of towels are made available for guests. We played mini- putt a couple of times and to quickly summarize, we found the overall feeling at the Best Western Lakeside is that you are in a good, safe, clean,affordable place. By the way, we spent the last 4 nights at the Sheraton Vistana Villages as a part of a timeshare offer...that was a mistake. It was my first and last time to save dollars this way. 90 minutes of presentation; followed by 90 minutes of badgering to buy...no thanks. We would have preferred to stay at the BWL and will probably return their sometime again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “There is a price for the cheap park tickets”
Reviews.Author: Tricia6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Lakeside for 2 nights. When we checked in we were offered a room near the pool on the ground flour for $10 extra per night which we took. As soon as we checked and were given our room key we were ushered over to the Guest Services. The young lady there called Carrie offered cheap park tickets for "just visiting a new resort". Before we knew it we had handed over our visa for the tickets and then we realised what was happening. She was definitely a good sales person. She said we would collect our tickets there and get breakfast. It was of course a timeshare development. The breakfast was disgusting. We met someone who appeared nice but we knew how they work. We politely agreed to view the model but made it clear we weren't interested in buying. They come up with every answer if you have any reason not to buy. After a lot of aggression to get us to buy, we told them straight we weren't interested and had to resort to nearly causing a commotion. We had to be very rude in order to leave and get our tickets. The Best Western Lakeside is a good hotel for a good price. Just be ready to be conned at guest services. It is worth just paying the full amount for tickets than having to be subjected to this. I would go back to this hotel though and it helps if you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Nice time at the Best Western Lakeside but with one or two minuses!”
Reviews.Author: clive165
Reviews.Content: Had a fairly god time at the Best Western Lakeside in April.The hotel is set out resembling something of a spanish theme and is set round 3 pools.The Bedroom was a nice size with a table too.The bathroom was the smallest we encountered on our travels although there was a separate vanity unit which also had a coffee machine on it.The room was very clean and service was good.We found that the water was not draining to quickly in the wash basin,when we rang reception they sorted this out straight away,and on another occasion my wife rang for some extra coffees and again they came over straight away.Loved the pool which was very clean and a nice temperature too. The hotel is in a great location,with plenty of restaurants around and a super market across the road which was cheaper than a lot of other supermarkets we went too.Right by the Hotel is a Walgreens which my wife seemed to spend a lot of her time in for some reason or another! There is a resort fee at this hotel of $3.50 a night per room,which although is,nt expensive i still wonder what we actually got out of this.When we checked in the receptionist explained this was for local phone calls and also for the shuttle buses to the theme parks.Firstly we didnt make any local calls and as we had a car never used the shuttle.When i looked at the leaflet they gave us which had the shuttle times on it i dont think i would have bothered using it,if you wanted to go to Universal for eg,you could get the shuttle at 7.45 am but the last one was 6.00pm,so that would mean an early finnish at the theme park and no time for Universal city! However my main gripe about this hotel are the guys at reception who try to get you to go to time share presentations.There always seemed to be 4 people at reception,the 2 guys to the left are ok but the 2 to the right are a pain!We first encountered this on our first night,we enquired about tickets for Universal.The guy told us they would cost us an arm and a leg and wrote down the figure of $240,then he started writing down all sorts of figures,we both hadnt got a clue what he was doing but then he told us he could do us 2 tickets for half price and do us an even better deal if we wanted tickets for both parks.This would have meant a two and a half hour presentation,we were only in Florida for 5 nights and i didnt fancy wasting time!Even when we checked out one of these guys called across and asked us if we wanted cheap tickets for one of the parks.I told him we were on our way back to Atlanta,but still he persevered with we can give you $80 back on the price of the hotel and then even that we could stay a night for free at the resort(Which name escapes me)which they are trying to sell you. Overall the hotel is lovely and i would stay here again,although next time if i kept getting pestered at reception by these guys ,i would tell them politely where they could stick there presentation!

Reviews.Title: “From check in, too check out and in between, staff and location GREAT”
Reviews.Author: LMoran
Reviews.Content: Pleasent staff, helpful with our needs (directions), convenient on site resturaunt, pizza parlor,all in the main check in, (this way no noise by patrons could be heard in the outer buildings were rooms are located)

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, but dont attend the tour for the mystic dunes”
Reviews.Author: rubensol
Reviews.Content: we have just arrived back from our holiday to florida where we stayed at the best western lakeside in kissimmee. on arriving we were checked in very quickly, and asked about a room aroundthe pool, which we were told was going to cost $10 per night extra, but we decided against it as we were close enough to the pool and didnt feel like spending the extra money as we were there for 2 weeks. we got a lift around to our room as we had quite a lot of luggage, and we didnt know where we were going, ( i cant read maps!!). the room was nice with 2 double beds, a tv, safe, a sink area just outside the bathroom, and a bath/shower and toilet. the bathroom was quite small as there were 4 of us, but we made do. the room was clean, and was cleaned daily by the time we arrived back from the theme parks. the pool was great as was the bar near the pool, there was a kids playground which my children loved, and a crazy golf behind this, which was a bit dirty, i thought they might have kept it tidy as it was one of the amenities for the kids, but anyway, it was ok. the breakfast was nice, it was the same every day, but we didnt mind that as we had an early start every morning and just wanted something to eat before heading out. there was also a pizza place at the hotel a shop and a bar. the location of the hotel was great for the parks, and for eateries and souvenir shops. but if you wanted to go to international drive or to any of the malls its quite far, we didnt hire a car, so we were left getting taxis a couple of times to get to the malls and it cost us $40 each way. but there are a lot of lovely eatieries nearby, youve got cicis, the sizzler, the black angus, tgi fridays, and my favourite, the outback just across the 192 behind the red lobster. we agreed to go on the tour of the mystic dunes as we were offered cheap tickets to the pirate dinner show which my kids wanted to go to, they offered us 3 tickets for $50 which was cheap, but by the time we attended the tour we wished we had bought them for full price. we were taken to the mystic dunes and they gave us breakfast which was horrible, then they took our kids to a play room whilst we were taken around the resort on a golf cart. the tour was great, what wasnt great was the bullying we received afterwards to try and get us to give them an enormous amount of money. no matter how many times we told them we needed to have time to think about it, the more they pushed, and pushed. i was emotionally drained by the time we managed to get out of there, and will never attend another tour like that again, it was horrible. but the best western lakeside was nice, and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location”
Reviews.Author: bromleybrain
Reviews.Content: 4th time in Florida - 2nd time at Best Western. This Hotel is idealy located for all families wanting to spend most of their time in Florida visiting the parks. The Hotel is easily located and if you are driving all Disney Parks can be reached within 10 minuits and all other parks except Busch Gardens can be reached within 20 minuits. The Hotel itself had clean rooms, which were serviced daily and for my wife, child and myself were easily big enough. After a hectic day at the park, coming back to the hotel and visitng the friendly bar staff at Hurrican Sams Bar which is located within the Main building for a nightcap what more do you need from a hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value & great location”
Reviews.Author: PaulMUK
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel in a great location. We got a very good rate via the Best Western Rewards scheme, some of the rooms are a little dated, ours was a ground floor room at the rear of one of the parking lots and it definatley looked a little tired. I would advise you to get a room away from the swimming pools - lots of families & kids stay at this hotel so it can be a little noisy around the swimming areas. On site restaurants were good, excellent breakfast with kids eating free with paying adults. located very centrally in Kissimme so easy to get to the attractions, lots of restaurants nearby, Angus steakhouse is excellent/

Reviews.Title: “Great - Buy & Happy Trip”
Reviews.Author: extrasec
Reviews.Content: We booked last minute and our stay could not have been better. The front desk did his best to handle our request regarding location of our room and tried very hard to please. The breakfast was awesome and my granddaughter was free. The rooms were very clean and the bathrooms were spotless. The beds were comfortable and the parking near all of the units was plentiful (Easter week trip). You can compare the rooms in size and type to those of Disney's All Stars and Port Orleans. The pool bar was a nice feature too. It's a great location to Disney too. It was better than expected. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Lakeside”
Reviews.Author: debkay68
Reviews.Content: I just returned from an 8 night stay at BW Lakeside with my two teenagers. I booked this hotel last summer and have been reading the reviews regularly since then to make sure I hadn't made a mistake in booking here. First, I'll comment on the negative points to our stay. Upon walking in the bathroom the first time, we discovered several dried urine spots on the toilet seat. Yuk! I cannot imagine how housekeeping missed this! I immediately called the front desk and reported the problem. They sent someone to clean it in less than five minutes. Not 15 minutes later we discovered the sink drain was broken. Again, another call to the front desk. They said they would send maintenance. We left to go to one of the theme parks and the sink was repaired while we were gone so that really wasn't a big deal. Now, the single worst thing about staying here: the beds. They are literally hard as a slab of stone. Only Fred and Wilma Flintstone would find these beds comfortable. We would wake up in the morning stiff and hardly able to move. The only other thing I had to complain about was a bunch of rowdy teenagers in the pool way past the pool's closing time. They were yelling and screaming so loudly, you could hear them over the air conditioner (which is loud). I really tried to deal with it, but as long as they were yelling and carrying on, there would be no sleep. I finally calledl the front desk and asked them to send someone to quiet them down. Fifteen minutes later, nobody had showed up. Yet another call to the front desk. After telling them that they could either take care of the problem or I would expect a discount on my stay, they promptly sent somebody to clear out the pool. The rest of our stay, everybody had cleared out of the pool by 11:00 so that was no longer an issue. Now, the positives. The single best thing about staying here is the location. You can't beat it. It is close to everything! It is located on a busy, very touristy stretch of Irlo Bronson Highway. Lots of restaurants, gift stores, etc. line both sides of the roadway. Animal Kingdom is literally 3 minutes away if you use Sherberth Road (assuming you don't catch the stop light at that intersection). All the staff I encountered was friendly. We checked in at 2:30 (posted check-in time is 3:00) and there was no line whatsoever. We paid $477.12 including taxes and the mandatory $3.50/day resort fee for eight nights. You can't beat that. There are flea bag type hotels in this area that cost more than that. This property IS an older property, but great care has been taken to keep it up. I've stayed in brand new hotels that weren't as well cared for. I'd recommend this hotel to anybody needing a good, clean, well located hotel. If and when we ever decided to go back to this area, I'll book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Fantastic, Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: WiltshireMalteser
Reviews.Content: My husband, me and two girls (aged 12 and 6) went to Florida for 2 weeks Oct/Nov 08. Great Hotel, very friendly and helpful staff but beware the lure of the "free breakfast". You are whisked away to another hotel, subjected to a long timeshare presentation and then almost brow beaten into buying. Just say no to that free breakfast and everything will be fine. Lovely, clean, comfortable hotel. Staff very friendly and helpful. Pools excellent. We didn't hire a car but used the shuttle buses from the hotel to get to the parks. Drivers very pleasant and friendly, please remember to tip them. Parks amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, staff helpful when we needed help with sickness.”
Reviews.Author: flavor777
Reviews.Content: My husband, I and our 5 year old stayed at Best Western Lakeside for 10 days. We asked for a quiet room and we received one on the 2nd floor, in building 4, facing the parking lot. We were very pleased with the room. It was cleaned well daily. Building 4 was right next to the miniature golf, playground, large pool and tiki bar. If you walk across the pool you'll be right into the building where the front desk is, not much walking at all. We planned on being at the parks 5 days, and splashing around the pool the other 5 days. My husband and 5 year old love pools. However it didn't work out as we planned. We arrived on Friday, spent Saturday at MK, Sunday we spent at the pool, and Monday went to AK. By late afternoon we noticed our 5 yr old might be comming down with a cold and late Monday night we noticed that our 5 year old had developed a pink eye. That fricked me out. We called the front desk and asked for advice. They gave us a number for 24 hr doctor assistance where the doctor comes to your room. The nurse told us what to do to wait it out till morning when the office opened, or receive a doctor's visit at 3 am. Since our 5 year old never complained of any pain, plus was already asleep, we decided to not do anything till the morning. Walgreens, which was right next door to Best Western, had a care center. We took her there at 8 am, when it opened, and a very nice nurse gave us a prescription for the pink eye and advised us to not do anything for 24 hrs, because our 5 yearl old could be contagious. The care center took our insurance and we only paid our $15 copay. Without the insurance the visit would've cost $75 which would not have been a big deal. We stayed in our room all day on Tusday till the following morning, than decided to go to Sea World. We also spent the rest of the vacation going back to the parks. We did not use the pool again, a little disapointed about that, but neverless had so much fun at the parks. We also played the miniature golf a few times, and our 5 year old really enjoyed it. The playground was also used several times, and we once ate at the buffet breakfast, which I was not very pleased with. Not many choices. We ate breakfast buffet at Golden Corral, cheaper, and many, many more choices. The hotel is walking distance to everything you can think of. Tons of restaurants all around, plus a couple of large grocery stores right accross the street. All in all it was a very enjoyable vacation and we were please with our hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: banjo60
Reviews.Content: Just finished staying for 3 nights at the Best Western Lakeside. I, like you are doing right now looked over reviews of hotels before heading to Disney. This was by far the cheapest motel I could find with the best reviews. Most of the reviews seemed overall positive with some negative mixed in. Upon checking in I was greeted with a decent sized line. There was 3 people working the front desk, but with 500+ rooms and coming in around check in time it was obviously the busy part of the day. The front desk gentleman who checked me in seemed a bit disinterested. I booked using my AAA discount, he of course asked for the card upon checking in...I showed it to him and he saw the expiration date of April 1st and immediately returned it and said my membership was expired, I then had to show him the expiration date of 2010. I was given room 617 in building 14. I didn't realize how huge this property was....I believe it had around 15 buildings in total and even tho the gentleman at the front desk gave me a map and showed me exactly where my room was I still got lost. The location was good, we got a 2nd floor room with a view of the pool. If you have a choice definitely take the pool view, its the only good view you will find unless you prefer a view of the fence or parking lot. I felt very safe at this location which is always something I look for in reviews...the parking lot is very well lit. Be prepared to have to search for a parking place if you get back to the motel late at night. We got back at 1am one night and had to park really far away from our room. The room was very basic. We weren't planning on being in the room very much since the whole purpose was to go to Disney. But even with that being said, I didn't care for the room at all. We had stains on the carpet, the beds were hard as a rock and small which I guess I should've expected since we had 2 double beds. We found 2 bugs in each of the beds, which from what I hear may not be surprising with Florida but it wasn't comforting to find bugs crawling around the bed. The bathroom was very small and almost uncomfortable to be in and the toilet got clogged up a few times. Housekeeping didn't service the room the first 2 days of our stay...finally on day 3 we did come back to find it cleaned, altho it looked like they were in a hurry and missed a few things. The TV only had 28 channels on it, which wasn't a big problem since we weren't in the room much but did take note of it. We did use the wireless internet which was excellent, the only thing I found I had to do was sit near the window because the signal strength wasn't the greatest. We didn't take advantage of the pool but like I said we had a pool view and everyone seemed to enjoy it. It was never that crowded either so don't worry about that. The best thing about the motel was the location. It was very easy to get to Disney from the motel. In fact one day I made note that from the time we walked out the motel door, til the time we parked the car at Disney and got on the tram only 20 minutes had elapsed which was a huge plus. This hotel has to be the best bargain in the area...like I said earlier I used my AAA discount and paid a total of $219 for 3 nights including tax and everything. Overall would I stay here again? Probably not. I didn't find the motel rooms to be that clean. But some people might not mind it for the price and other factors. With the age of the motel and the amount of guests that come to this motel I'm sure management does the best they can with everything. Whatever you choose I hope you enjoy your time at Disney, we had a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location and Great Price !!!”
Reviews.Author: TripJacksonville
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location ten minutes down the road from Disney World. Resturants, grocery stores, and activities all over. If you like walking you could walk to most things they are that close! The hotel offers some great amenities. Kids under 12 eat breakfast for free, free minature golf on sight and you are provided with great coupons at check in. They have resturants, a bar,deli and game room on sight. The rooms were nice in size and clean. The employees were ALL very nice. My son and I really enjoyed ourselves.The price was very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: madmads
Reviews.Content: I prebooked a holiday which included 6 nights here last September and all was prepaid through my travel agent. I was asked to present a credit card for incidentals when I booked in and 6 months later the hotel have debited my card with the full cost of the room as they had not been paid by the American intermediary company used by my agents. I am currently fighting for a refund.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation”
Reviews.Author: NCtravelingGirls
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through an Online Employee Benefits site that I have through work. The reviews with that site were mixed but we took the chance and were more than pleased with our stay. The hotel is literally around the corner from the main highway leading to the Disney parks. Rooms were clean with plenty of room. We had 3 adults and 1 child in our room and were very comfortable. It was also quiet for us, although we were afraid the neighbors might complain because we were laughing to loud. We had a view of the parking lot but honestly didn't really care. Of the 8 days that we stayed we were only at the hotel during the day for 1. We didn't eat at the hotel, however, the refrigerator in the room was great. It's one of those "dorm" size refrigerators but it worked out great for us. We kept needed food on hand and were able to pack a lunch to take with us each day to the parks. There are plenty of restraunts, shops, and drug stores close by. All in all, I would gladly book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Pleased”
Reviews.Author: CliveEngland
Reviews.Content: After trawling through numerous destinations to stay in Florida we came across 'Best Western Lakeside' - Reviews were mostly good so we booked it and have just returned from our two week holiday (March 2009). The room was clean and beds were very comfortable, maids came in every day and replenished sheets / towels etc Hotel has three heated pools and a couple of small kids splash pools (we only used the one directly outside our room which was excellent and big enough with lots of sunbeds tables and chairs) Shuttles to and from every park including Universal/Busch Gardens/ Seaworld were available from hotel (at no extra cost) and had morning and evening travel/pick up times. The resturant in the hotel was excellent (breakfast was all you can eat for $9.99) and very good. Pizza Hut inside hotel was also excellent and a medium pizza was eight slices and very tasty (approx $12.00) Bar inside hotel was good too (food including steaks / salads etc, pool table, jukebox, large screen t.v's (even opened up at 8.00am so i could watch english football) staff very friendly. small crazy golf (for laughs) Small park (climbing frame, sand pit and a slide) Arcade Shop in hotel for snacks, papers, drinks, sweets etc (staff very friendly) In a nutshell we gave the hotel 10 out of 10 and this is our 5th visit to Florida and we have stayed at Travelodge, Quality Inn and last year at Disney's Coronado Springs resort and we will definately go back to Best Western Lakeside which is very similar to Coronado Springs - just not as big (less walking) and half the price. Clive Rimmer - England

Reviews.Title: “Clean cheap hotel next to Disney!”
Reviews.Author: OSUtravelerater
Reviews.Content: I found a great deal for this hotel online. It was so inexpensive I was pretty worried the place might be a dive. However, I found out it was a great steal. They allowed me to check in 4 hours early. Awesome! Check in took just a few minutes (same with check out). The room was clean, quiet and comfortable. The housekeeping did a great job cleaning every day. The pools were also very clean. Location near Disney parks was great. Loved the free wireless internet and safe. Maybe the only thing I didn't like...the bar Sucks. Also, I didn't rent a car, so I was completely dependent on the shuttle service. The shuttles were always on time and worked out perfectly. Note: the times listed on the hotel website are not up to date. Get a schedule at the front desk. Quick tip with the shuttle...To get to Magic Kingdom, Epcot and Hollywood Studios early take the Animal Kingdom shuttle and then use Disney transportation to move on to the park you want to go to (Magic Kingdom and Epcot are a quick monorail trip apart). Overall, I think the hotel is a great value and will definitely stay again. ...don't waste your money on more expensive places. You'll find it has everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money.”
Reviews.Author: pr0pel
Reviews.Content: For the money we paid, which was pretty low since it was via an online site, this hotel is a great bang for your money. The room was clean, and everything was functional. I'm not sure what others complain about but if you want luxury, stay on WDW property! For what we paid, I couldn't have asked for much more.. except free coffee in the lobby. This resort charges $3.50 per day as a resort fee for the safe, fridge, and "coffee" in the room. I'm sorry but I haven't found one in room coffee maker to be adequate so luckily, I brought my own. I just wished they offered guests hot water or coffee in the lobby but they don't. Breakfast is about $10 but if you drive a minute or so around 192, which runs right adjacent to the hotel, you can find breakfast buffets for $6. Other than that, my wife and I had a great time. We are close to WDW and coming back home after a long day at the parks is a huge plus. If you can get a good rate, take it!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: drjohnk
Reviews.Content: I booked here based on positive reviews, both from this site and from Frommers.com, and was extremely disappointed. Our room had mold around the door, the bathroom smelled of urine, the toilet leaked, and the pool area was run-down and depressing. We checked out after one night and moved to the hotel where the conference I was attending was taking place. The old adage, "you get what you pay for", certainly applies here, but I at expect at least a clean, non-moldy room at any hotel, regardless of price.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: WDW1971
Reviews.Content: Our overall stay was pleasant enough. The room was clean although in need of a makeover. The bathroom was a bit too small and there was some kind of black mildew (mold?) on the outside of the tub. We weren't really worried about it because mildew is common in Florida. Pluses about the hotel: Nice size pool in each building quad; nice bar/grill/lounge with friendly staff; close to WDW; cold AC; nice welcome center with eat-in places and mini-mart; in-room internet. Room rate was reasonable. Minuses about the hotel: only one entrance; property looks a bit run down; front desk staff not always friendly; no elevator to 2nd floor; small bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Denmothe54
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at B.W. for three days, before we met up with family at a resort.Knowing now how nice it is, we would have been happy to stay there for the whole ten days we were in Orlando. I would advise anyone to take advantage of the free breakfast buffet.They serve the same food every morning, but there are so many choices, that we ate something different almost every day. We rented a car at the airport, and the B.W. was very easy to find from there. Our room was with a view of the pool.This would be a great room if you have children , especially older children. It was only steps to the pool, and we could see it from our window.Parents would be able to keep an eye on older children without leaving their room.The only thing we would have liked, would have been to be able to sit outside our room, but there was no room for chairs. But , there was lots of lounge chairs around the pool, and no problem getting one to use. It was noisy one evening as some people were talking outside our room.You have to balance the chance of this happening against the convenience of being so close to the pool. The one thing we wish that was different was the size of the beds..there were two doubles. We would have liked Queens. A little hint..have quarters on hand anytime you go traveling around Orlando, as there are tolls on some highways. B.W. is very close to all the Parks, shopping , restaurants etc...if you plan on shopping, there are some great Outlet Malls.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Deal”
Reviews.Author: markthisup
Reviews.Content: Best Western Lakeside is in no way the resort they claim it to be, with that being said it was an absolute steal at 44 bucks a night. My girlfriend and I just returned from our trip to Florida and we could not be more satisfied with our stay. While in Florida we planned to "do Disney" and best western lakeside was the perfect lodgings for our trip. The room was extremely clean and smelled wonderful every time house cleaning cleaned the room. The maid service was excellent when they showed up. A couple days out of the week the maids just didn't service our room which was weird but not the end of the world. The location of the hotel is just a stones throw away from Animal Kingdom, if one wanted to walk to the park it wouldn't be out of the question. The shuttle service to the parks was a great feature of the hotel, but the times of the shuttles were somewhat inconvenient (pickup times hours after parks closing). The hotel also offered free wireless internet which was a huge plus. The tv only has 20 or 30 channels, but we didn't come to Florida to watch tv. The hotel was an incredible value at 44 dollars a night and I would definitely stay there again. If you plan on enjoying the hotel more than the parks than go somewhere else. If you plan on using the hotel as a place to relax and hang out when not at the parks, then this place is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “CLose to Disney world better off in Disneyworld”
Reviews.Author: Bakerfair
Reviews.Content: Kissimmee which offers extreme close proximity to Disneyworld offers probably the worst what a resort has to offer. Every hotel and resuraunt along this strip is dated ,messy and mostly unappealing. If i'm comparining to Anaheim and its Disney surrounding resort areas it is night and day If u can afford it go to Orlando instead or stay at the resort

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pensfan29
Reviews.Content: Me and my 2 sons planned our first ever trip to Disney. I had read a lot of reviews about this hotel and decided to book my stay here. The hotel more than exceeded my expectations. The rooms were clean, pools were well taken care of, the location was excellent, and the price was far less than what I could have gotten elsewhere. We had a couple of minor issues when we first got to our room, but the staff were quick to resolve them. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, clean rooms and close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingIFA
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in some of the nicest hotels in the world, I was somewhat apprehensive about my credit crunch budget holiday. Arriving with low expectations really stood me well because the place is actually very nice indeed! Registration was quick and whilst the desk clerks try hard to ensure they can try and sell you some tickets they aren't pushy at all. The room was very clean and had two small double beds, probably 4ft beds rather than a usual 4'6". Small bathroom and table and chairs were most handy as most mornings i would pop down the road for a McDonalds breakfast and bring it back as this is a 2min drive away. On site you have a huge Pharmacy called Walgreens but this is better than most of our Spar shops back here and you can get everything you need here. Next door is Wendy's burgers, and all within a 5 minute drive are dozens of restaurants and shops. Maid service was daily. The hotel had a surprisingly warm pool, with sunbeds and chairs around if you just want a day off. Pizza hut on site was convenient but VERY expensive. Hurricane Sam's bar was ok too, with a friendly barman and waiters and you can relax here with a beer and watch Sky sports. Disney is about 2 miles away and the access to the Interstate 4 is only a 5 min drive so access to the rest of the sights and beyond is on your doorstep. We drove down to Miami for the weekend, took about 5 hours of leisurely driving thru the everglades. Also went up to Blue Spring National Park which is def worth a visit if you like nature as nice walk along the spring seeing wild Manatees that you can swim, scuba dive and canoe with. All in all, was very impressed, would def return here if coming back to Florida, and would recommend to singles, couples & families.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: serialholidaymakers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in January for two weeks. We have stayed in a number of hotels in this area and this was one of the best. The rooms were very clean and the ladies who cleaned every day couldn't have been more helpful. Our room contained two double beds, a table and chairs and a small bathroom. A picture window led out onto a walkway, but we were never disturbed. There were great staff on reception who supplied anything we asked for in super fast time. Extra pillows were delivered to our room before we could walk back there. There were three pools on the site and two of them were empty every time we went to them. Some of the rooms look out over the car parking areas, but that didn't matter to us as we found it very convenient. Others looked out over the lake. The hotel is on a large site and the gardens and pools were well looked after, even in January, when there were very few people about. We are regular Florida holiday makers so we know the places to eat that are value for money. Try breakfast or dinner at The Ponderosa or Golden Corral for real value. The hotel restaurant was quite expensive. Breakfast was twice the price of Ponderosa and the pizza place on site was expensive. Cicis nest door was real value. We didn't use the hotel transport as we had a hire car. The hotel is very close to Disney, only about ten minutes away and the rest of the parks, ie Sea World and Universal are easy to find. We would certainly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lodgings OKish”
Reviews.Author: RoadRunner456
Reviews.Content: My family of 4, 2 young kids and 2 adults spent 5 nights at Lakeside for our Disney vacation. The hotel is reasonably priced and was 10 - 15 minutes drive from the parks, no issues there. The room was smaller than I expected and wasn't very clean. There was a build up of dust behind the television and in the bathroom vents. The carpet was stained; evidence of some water damage was at the door. I complained to the staff and they were very helpful. They offered to move us to a different room. We looked at two rooms which had the same carpet stain at the door so we stayed put and took the offer of a "VIP clean" instead. The hotel has several pools and the one near our room was surprising clean and warm. Despite the friendly staff and nice pool, I wouldn't stay here again. Stained carpet and toddlers don’t mix well.

Reviews.Title: “It's a 3-star place for a 2-star price.”
Reviews.Author: AnyplaceOnce
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this place for convenience and cleanliness. Staff was friendly, location was good. We swam in the pool which was clean, nice, and warm. If you are pursuing the elusive perfect place for a bargain rate, and don't quite get people who'll spend $200 a night, you'll be glad you found this place. Restaurant breakfast was a good deal since kids eat free and buffet is the fastest option on the way out the door.

Reviews.Title: “we want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: stlt
Reviews.Content: this hotel was ideal, however to get the best holiday it was worth our upgrade to a room by a pool as initially we didnt have the best room overlooking the laundry which was also noisy. it is a perfect place to retreat to after a day at the parks, it has quiet clean pools with towels provided the room is basis but very clean and with past experience in florida we were happy the transport provided to the parks is excellent it saves alot of money, there is usually a charge if i remember of around 11 dollars to park your car. shops are located next to the hotel but well away to be a problem just trying to work out how we can repeat our brilliant holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: KatjaH
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Best Western Lakeside for one week with my 9-year-old son and really liked the place. Rooms were clean, staff was quite friendly, and the pool area was clean as well. We had a room at the ground-level which I liked since it was easy to go out and have a cigarrette ;). Location of the hotel is brilliant and we used the free shuttle bus service to the parks almost daily. We also liked the game-room a lot and free wireless internet was excellent. Restaurants were ok; prices were a bit high and tip was already included to the receipt which we didnt notice at first. Taco Bell was across the street which was great and I would also recommend Red Lobster restaurant, located other side of the street as well. Cici's pizza buffet (all you can eat) next to the hotel was very affordable and pretty good quality. Walgreens was also next to the hotel and you can buy almost anything there! I would recommend this hotel to people who are not looking for luxury but comfort and bargain prices.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic For A Motel”
Reviews.Author: HarryBathe
Reviews.Content: Can't fault it for location or service. Our AC made a bit of noise but apart from that is was supurb. Pizza hut is supurb and the bar staff are very freindly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a Great Price!!!”
Reviews.Author: stacygh
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 9 night stay at this hotel. Just a few miles from the Disney Main Entrance, this was in a great location! Right next door to a Walgreens & several restaurants, it offers easy access to food & shopping! While it's not fancy, the rooms are clean & convenient. The hotel property is big & offers a variety of activities there. The restaurant was good & the deli offered a nice selection of items including pizza! We really had a good experience at this hotel. If you don't want to spend a lot of money & aren't planning on staying around the hotel too much, this was a great place & so inexpensively priced!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pam1511
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Lakeside for one week.Travelled alone and wanted a room near the main building.The staff were very polite and helpful and allocated a poolside room on first floor which was superb.Room was clean and spacious.The breakfast in the hotel was good,but also went to Cracker Barrel just along the highwaywhich was great.Plenty of restaurants nearby.I had a taxi from the airport cost $70 which was steep but managed to get the virgin shuttle going back for $18 and excellent service.The bar staff in Hurricane Sam's were great.Would definately go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Holiday. Shame we did'nt have longer...”
Reviews.Author: Mick28
Reviews.Content: This is a place where we always wanted to stay as we stayed in the hotel opposite 6 months prior at Quality Hotel. When we got there, We was greeted by very nice staff. When they knew we came with VIRGIN, They said that VIRGIN customers get special treatment. We got a lovely room. The room was facing the lake and crazy golf. Not so crazy. The best bit was the small signs right next to the golf which said "don't feed the Aligators". Pool area was nice and there is a small bar. In the car park there is a large 24hr Chemist for those necessities like milk during the night. Wendys is also in the car park too. Wendys is open till 2am and is a little like MacDonald but alot better believe me. Square burgers and stuffed jackets. Highway 192 is the best place to stay. 5mins from Disney and 55mins to Busch Gardens. Golden Corral is an EAT AS MUCH AS YOU LIKE. Prices are $10.99 for adult. Here you can choose from different sections of the restaurant. There is a Salad Bar, Grill Bar,Vegetable Bar and Dessert bar which is where all the kids tend to gather. Ponderosa Restaurant is also on the same side of the road. This too is a buffet style restaurant. The only trouble with this place is that you have to order your main course first and put the buffet on the same plate but by the time your meal comes to you, you are too pogged to eat it. Back to the Hotel. There is a great bar where you can grab a drink and a bite. The bar is Hurricane Sams. The Bar staff was a little arrogant but you can't have it all i suppose. Becare in the foyers. There's loads of sales staff trying to sell time share. If you have time to kill. Go to a presentation for about 90mins, then say you are skint and in recession and they will then give you free tickets to theme parks or dinner show tickets.
