We did it and got to universal for a day free of charge. Enjoy. Can't wait to go back...................Are we there yet dad?......No not until next year.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT deal!”
Reviews.Author: chicago896
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week at BW Lakeside...got a GREAT deal on room and air via Expedia. Room clean and big, grounds clean and big, staff friendly and plentiful. A special request made was granted and cheerfully so....neighborhood safe, secure, well lit...Walgreens next door, lots of eating choices and shopping. Shuttle prompt and friendly...pool clean and refreshing....can not ask for more especially at these incredibly low prices.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: xstacyx
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel thru virgin holidays. We arrived at the hotel on the 5th Jan for 2 weeks. We had to get a taxi from the airport which was like $78! But check in was quick. We were in room 109, right opposite the shuttle bus stop. The room was nice. Only wanted it to sleep in. Had 2 double beds, tv, a good size bathroom. Free internet which was handy and fast. Didnt see any bugs at all in the room. Room was cleaned everyday. Towels changed everyday and bedding. Had a nice good size safe which fitted my laptop inside. Had breakfast in the hotel a few times. It was ok. $8.99+tax. Hurricane sams bar was brill. Richard is the nicest person in the world. Made us feel so welcome. The onsite pizza hut was ok. cisi's pizza was great! $5.99 for all you can eat buffet of pizza, pasta, salad and pudding. If you wanted a takeaway pizza it was $3.99 instead of paying $15 in pizza hut at the hotel. We never went to the virgin welcome meeting. We only found out from next door that virgin customers get a free daily mail paper everyday and they get a meal voucher for somewhere in citywalk in universal. The shuttle buses to the park were good. There was one driver who liked the lion king, he was brilliant and lovely. The Universal and seaworld bus picked us up at 7:45am and then to take us back home at 6pm....was a long day! And when the park was not busy at all we had finished everything by 2pm! Would stay here again....hopefully coming back feb 2010!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel - good value”
Reviews.Author: klpawl
Reviews.Content: Not much to say about the hotel. Pretty plain vanilla - rooms were clean, everything (except for the shower head) functioned as expected. Good location for just about everything - stores, chain restaurants, WDW. Universal was 10 miles away, but not a bad drive. Free internet in the lobby for 10 minutes (great for boarding passes or quick info check). Other terminals in the lobby are for rent. Complaints: no phone book in the room; I shake my head at the "resort fee" of $3.50 per night as I'm not sure what the "resort" is. The fee gives you unlimited local calls and some other things you'd normally expect to be part of your room rate. I'm all for unbundling your pricing, but when you do that I expect to be able to pick and choose my services. Check in took a while as they were VERY busy when I showed up and some customers just took longer than normal.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: yvonnefov
Reviews.Content: Stayed 11 nights over New Year. I don't really like the old motor inn style but it felt safe and was clean Rooms and furniture are showing their age but at $50 a night what can you expect Location was good but wse hired a car and ate further out as the food around was not as good Enjoyed BJs brewhouse and Texas Roadhouse near the Loop and Bonefish grill at that location was excellent We just used the hotel as a base so it was ok- but there is better around

Reviews.Title: “Bargain quality stay for Florida at a sensible price”
Reviews.Author: JIB&CO
Reviews.Content: great value for money- * rooms clean,tidy,comfy bed, effective air con free huge lockable room safes, big tv nicely laid out villa style hotel, not tower blocks which is good. * 3 pools, 1 heated i think, nice pools loads of loungers * location great, nearby to parks and loads of restaurants * restaurant and shop on site * laundry on site summary great hotel, bargain price,free coaches to VARIOUS PARKS AVAILABLE IN THE CAR PARK, SEE THE DESK INFO POINT FOR TIMES DAYS ETC. great tip, keep a loads of quarters in the car as there are toll roads dotted about if your driving and parking eats a few too

Reviews.Title: “Worst dump”
Reviews.Author: SunfunSC
Reviews.Content: We have traveled extensively and this hotel was the WORST we have ever encountered. After several attempts of seeking assistance from the evening hotel manager we were cursed at and threatened if we did not leave. We were trying to print boarding passes for our flights and apparently they did not want other guests to know problems existed. We reported this incidence to the day supervisor who also refused to be of assistance. This hotel must be run by relatives because no where in the world would anyone allow this to happen to customers. Not only did the equipment not work but the hotel was dirty, pillowcases were used by previous guest, ice machine inoperable, and grounds were filthy. Due to our worst ever hotel experience we discovered all Best Western hotels are independently owned therefore you have no recouse to report incidents to a supervisory level. BEWARE OF DUMP WITH THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place..”
Reviews.Author: ryan74London
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 4 nights in Dec and after reading the reviews didnt think it was necessary to hire a car, dont be fooled, the hotel does offer a shuttle service to all the parks but if you wish to do some shopping along International Drive at the Outlets then you will definately need a car, public transport is very unreliable and no-one seems to know much about it. Say hi to Richard the bar manager for us, what a great host !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Good Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: asty
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel on Christmas Day, and the first room we had was terrible. It smelled really badly, someone had stuffed coffee bags into the grates of the aircon! However we were moved and our room was much better. Very clean and basic accomodation. We could always park, and the drive to Disney was quick. We had no problem with timeshare sellers. Some guest were still sat by the pool and making generally a loud nosie until well after midnight, which is the only problem with this type of hotel, with all rooms around various pools. Yes it was a basic hotel, but we got a very good deal, our entire holiday was only £700 each including car hire and flights! We therefore got what we paid for, and would return for a cheaper holiday.

Reviews.Title: “not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: glassmen007
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Best Western in December 08 for 5 nights. Hotel staff were great, rooms cleaned daily and pretty much most of the area was cleaned-guess its a big site for the outside cleaning people to get round so will allow for the sometimes left rubbish. The you would think that common human decency could get the people who leave the rubbish just to put it in bins provided-damm lazy some people. Did'nt have a problem withany time share issues-just dont bother to speak to that part of the front desk-if you dont want to hear that sort of crap then dont bother to waste your time-you can pick up leaflets from around all hotel, resturant lobbys, and park tickets are in logical sence best purchased on line before hand. Time share place are littered in and around the 192 especially-unless you really want to waste hrs of your vacation time for a hard sell and then sometimes not the promiced tickets then just avoid them-I have done since our first Orlando visit in 96-a polite no thanks is all that is required. Anyway back to the hotel-good stuff on site-never used any of the food areas but all looked good and heard good reports from others. Car for use during the stay is much easier-even if you just have it for a few days-shuttles are never that good. In all enjoyed the hotel and what was offered and would stay again..

Reviews.Title: “Theres some bugs that bite at night”
Reviews.Author: lolllla
Reviews.Content: Overrall its a good hoel for the price. But there were a few problems the rooms are kept humid even when the air is on. At night you might get bitten by something and may cause a rash.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat Visitor”
Reviews.Author: ExplorerAP
Reviews.Content: I have read mixed reviews for this property and we have had mixed experiences ourselves. PROs=location (just off the 429 toll road on 192, plus well-marked directions to Disney) and amenities (breakfast buffet and well-stocked general store) and a Walgreens next door.... CONs=poolside rooms with revelers past 11 PM; no apparent enforcing of pool times) This time we had a lakeside room with good parking, an easy, well-marked walk to the main building, and quick response by security when our room key did not work! We have always had polite encounters with counter staff. When we are in this area we are only looking for a clean place to sleep! since we are usually at attractions or shopping destinations all day. Refrigerator, iron and ironing board, all lamps worked! :-) This is a huge property with several buildings; I will always request non-poolside rooms in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: victoriasmom98
Reviews.Content: What can I say ---- we loved this place! My 10 year old daughter and I stayed here from December 3rd through the 15th. This was our 3rd trip to Orlando together and I've stayed at many off property hotels. This is above and beyond the rest! The rooms are very spacious, well lit and clean! I booked this online and got a very reasonable rate ($54/night). Before we arrived, I contacted the hotel to give our preferences (1st floor, as I do not manage stairs very well, 2 double beds and as close to the bus stop as possible, as we were not renting a car and relying on the hotel shuttles to get us where we want to go.) Every single one of my requests were granted and we were put into room 101! Perfect room, perfect location for us! The pool was around the corner, as was the game room and restaurant!!! I couldn't have been more pleased! By all means, go to the restaurant for breakfast. The most wonderful staff will take care of you. Hats off to Zack, Ana, John and Britney! We already miss you guys so much! The first day my daughter wanted "Mickey" pancakes and Ana went back to the cook to ask for them and he did it for her!!! That was above and beyond good service. We also were able to get a "kid's size" portion of the spaghetti dinner at the little store. It was not on the menu, but when we asked, they said no problem! That's good service! As most of the other reviewers said having Walgreen's right there was wonderful for sodas & snacks. My only inconvenience was with the shuttle system ---- it doesn't run often enough and you do miss out on some of the late night activities at the park, such as Illuminations and the Very Merry Christmas party. It also does not leave early enough so that you are there when the park opens. There is a Lynx stop (Bus 55) across the road but I still don't know if it runs north, south, east or west. If you can figure that one out, you'll be ok. Make sure you have the correct change to take the bus! Once you do get to one of the parks, you can use the Disney Transportation system for any other Disney park/hotel. Many restaurants within walking distance and our personal favorite was the Golden Corral. I swear we ate there about 5 times! The lunch buffet is less expensive and they start serving the dinner buffet (including steak) at 4pm, so if you are in there before 4pm, you pay the lunch price and can eat steak after 4pm. Delicious! Fred, the steak chef, was a riot!!! We loved him! OH, and we even got to see little geckos hanging around the pool sunning themselves! All in all it was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but quite acceptable, and very convenient”
Reviews.Author: mojave_ben
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights on a long Disney weekend, thanks much to the reviewers here for all your great comments. I will mostly just echo the other positive reviews here. Very convenient - Sherbeth Rd. is your friend (about 5 minutes to Animal Kingdom, 12 to Magic Kingcom, without much traffic). Room was fine, good mini fridge, and enough room for three (with the provided chairs) to eat a meal around the table. Our Disney travel style (get to the park EARLY!! and stay till you drop) had us eating quick breakfast in our room and one dinner from supermarket deli. There is a Publix just a mile or two west on 192 - good grocery store. The often mentioned Walgreens is convenient too. Little traffic noise, and sometimes very quiet, but noisy from passing kids, roller suitcases, and early morning dumpster collection made us leave the room fan on overnight. Heating/AC/fan unit was fine and not too noisy. Grounds could use a bit of cleaning - some food trash left outside by some guest was not collected during our entire stay. Staff was friendly, though we dealt with them only for check in/out. I would certainly come back here if staying off-world at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Above The Norm”
Reviews.Author: leebegeebee
Reviews.Content: Stayed 14 nighs with wife and grandaughter. After a 9 hour flight and 1 hour transfer we didn't appreciate the time share hard sell we encountered at reception. Our room was basic but clean. Clean bedding, towels everyday. Air conditioning fantastic. Tv stations on offer were above average. Disney, Cartoon Network, TNT plus sport, news, weather and documentary channels meant there was always something to watch The in room safe was excellent as was the fridge.A cold beer, soft drink or sandwich was just an armslength away. Service was excellent. We had a power failure one morning which we reported and was fixed within the hour. Breakfast was all you can eat and was fine although the tip was added to your bill which we found a bit cheeky. The instore mini market and Pizza Hut were a real bonus as was the bar Hurricane Sam's where we enjoyed free cocktails and the service and food was fantastic. Complimentary shuttles went to Disney, Universal and Lake Buena Vista Shoppng Mall which again is above the norm. Most hotels just do Disney. The Pools ( 3 + 2 paddling pools ) were heated and clean with ample sunbeds, tables and parasols. Playgrounds were very basic. Just a slide and climbing frame. Swings are needed. The games room was excellent as was the on site launderette. Ice machines in every block. Just outside the hotel was a 24 hour Walgreens which sold just about everything. Very handy. Nearby Wendy's, Taco Bell, Golden Corral, Ci Ci's Pasta, Chinese are just a few of the eateries within walking distance. Wal Mart is a 5 minute bus ride away. All in all an excellent hotel at a very affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: tigs2699
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Lakeside is a great deal. It was only $50 including all taxes, for a 2 bed room. We actually weren't in the room long at all (doing the Disney thing), but for the short time we were, we were pleased with the experience. Clean room, easy to locate (though the hotel is HUGE, the rooms all have outside doors). I do have to comment on the front desk. The woman we checked in with was extremely nice. It was midnight and she was still super cheery and friendly. I thought it might be just her, but when I came back the next morning to check out, THAT woman was just as helpful and kind. This hotel is also a perfect location to Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Still a Best Buy”
Reviews.Author: FloridaRoadwarrior
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we have stayed at the Best Western Lakeside and was not disappointed. I hate staying at high rise hotel or a hotel when you walk out your door there is a 4 lane highway 10 feet away! This is not one of those hotels, we prefer quiet. The hotel consists of multiple buildings located on about 25 acres set back from the main road and is usually very quiet. The lobby is attractive and clean, and check in was fine. There is a bar, a small food store for snacks and pizza, and a restaurant on the premises. There are 2 nice sized pools and a free small dinky miniature golf course. There is a much better one in front of the hotel and across the street that is not free! The room was recently updated with new fixtures and furniture, the AC/heat unit was new and quiet and the maid service was excellent. The room was cleaned very well every night that we were there and the beds were acceptable. As I said in my last review, the location is great, you don’t have to get onto Route 4 and battle the traffic to get to the Disney Parks. The exit is about 2 miles from the hotel. If you prefer there is a free shuttle service to the parks. The only drawback I found with the shuttle service was on the return trip, multiple stops and a lengthy wait for the bus at the return pickup point. There are a few Restaurants across the street in walking distance. Outback, Red Lobster, Chinese and an Italian Restaurant. This is not a new or fancy hotel but all in all a good choice for the budget minded traveler that doesn’t spend much time at the hotel. I will return here for my 4th stay. If you are an Entertainment.com member, we got the lowest rate we ever had when booked through them. As some of the other reviews have said; To all who are not frequent Florida travelers and to our foreign guests, please stay away from the cheap Disney tickets advertised whether at the BW or at one of the local restaurants as they are a high pressure sell for a “Time Share” or a “Vacation Resort” that you just might regret buying when you wake up the next morning!

Reviews.Title: “value, value, value!!!”
Reviews.Author: kjl4
Reviews.Content: we arrived at the best western lakeside early afternoon, check in took 2 mins, we were then directed to guest relations where we were given a free welcome pack, containing, coupons, toothpaste, shampo etc.. the man gave us a hard sell on the timeshare there but we politely declined and it was fine. the room was spacious, the complex is very large and can take some people 10mins to get from one end to the other. in the room we had basic cable air con and a heater tea and coffee, a hot power shower, marble sinks and two comfortable double beds, all clean and housekeeping was daily and reliable. the hotel is hardly ever busy, it has three pools one for children main pools are big and shallow and then very deep. there is a free mini golf on site in the hotel, which is pretty average but would be good for familys and kids to use in the day. th hotel restaurant is ok, pizza hut offer room service and is good value, the bar was clean tidy with tv's and music and empty and fairly priced, the hotel shop/deli is very expensive, there is a mini supermarket across the road, 30secs away called walgreens which has everything u would need. free shuttles to parks leave at 9.15, 9.45 oand 11am to the parks, to go universal or sea world its 7.45 and you get to each park 45mins before they open but u can get on all the rides with little or no queue. pick up times vary from 5.45 to 6.45 and are very reliable. drivers are quite rude, they only speak to you if u tip them otherwise forget about it. staff at the hotel are very helpful and friendly. parks are all within 30mins from being picked up by shuttle. to et to old town from this hotel u just go to the bus stop which is located opposite the hotel and get on the lynx 55 bus, which stops all the way down hwy 192. this will cost u $1.75 per person per ride. eating in this area is amazing there is everything for anyone. make sure u look thru the coupon books as everywhere has a coupon for a free starter of 10% off your total bill. closest to the hotel is wendys which is a burger joint, then burger king, dennys and mcdonalds.i personally recommend the golden corral buffet it is 11.99 plus drink, has pizza, steak, chicken, roast obeef, burgers,chips,salad bar, desserts galore and free coffee afterwards.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice hotel”
Reviews.Author: alibaz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two weeks here during October,. After reading good and bad reviews we checked in with an open mind. We found the guy on check-in was as helpful as anyone could be. We asked for a second floor room away from the pool .He gave us a room in block 12 Manatee, which was nice and quiet, with the exeption of a couple of times a family in the neighbouring room did not seem to be able to control their children. The room was clean , as was the bathroom and the bedding. The shower was a little temperamental and on a few occasions we had to shower in, fairly lukewarm water. The room was attended to on a daily basis. We did not get stopped once by the discount ticket/timeshare people in reception. The location for Disney was great, about 10 minutes drive to the entrance. The Walgreens shop and Pizza Hut on site was a big plus. We did not eat at the hotel, however the restaurant and bar seemed pretty busy on the occasions we passed. There are a lot of restaurants close to the hotel, our particular favourites were Houlihans, Red Lobster and Golden China Buffet, and quite inexpensive. We reccomend the baby back ribs at Houlihans. Overall a clean comfortable hotel, with a great pool, good efiicient staff and lots of places to eat out around it and an excellent location for Disney.

Reviews.Title: “AS GOOD AS EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: HuntersReach
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights as part of a three centre holiday, have stayed here before and have to say it was as good as expected. No gripes, no grumbles, good value for money. Pool excellent, staff polite and friendly, room good. Not busy, infact the bar etc really really quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, But Nice for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Lifetraveler1
Reviews.Content: I flew down to Orlando at the last minute to attend a political rally of my favorite presidential candidate. Did not want to spend a lot of money, so I went online and got a car/hotel package deal. Total price for both $77. The hotel was the Best Western Lakeside, in Kissimmee, FL. It is located on a major hotel road, Irlo Bronson Hwy. Physical proximity to the entrance to DisneyWorld is about 5 minutes and about 15 minutes for Universal Studios. With the great price that I got, I was surprisingly pleased how nice the hotel was. No, it is not fancy, all hotel room doors face the outside. However, the quality of the rooms and the sense that it has been updated makes a good impression and 'value' comes to mind. The check-in was painless, the staff was nice and there was plenty of free parking. The 2nd floor room was modern enough and the beds were fine. The bathroom appeared to be updated and the curtains were in good condition. The room also has a safe in it for valuable, which comes in handy. If I had paid $77 for the room itself I would have thought I had gotten a good deal. However, getting it and a nice little compact car for $77, well, that is a great deal. For a single person, couple or family, who wants to enjoy the Orlando area without spending a ton of cash, I would say the Best Western Lake was definitely a good bargain. I took two photographs of the rooms that I was in, so you can see what it looked like. I booked it on Hotwire, once I landed in Orlando. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Extra extra Extra!!”
Reviews.Author: just11
Reviews.Content: After driving up from Miami to Orlando, we stopped along the way at the road side tourist tickets offices, the first we were skeptical at the price ( $50 per night plus taxes) as we had 2 weeks to kill (and not our bank account) we knew we would be able to find cheap accomodation in orlando. What we did not expect to find was that the Best Western was as good as 4 star resorts we have previously stayed in. My main priority was to have internet access, the staff put uin block 14 over looking a garden, quite and close to the laundry (the cleanest i have ever encountered), and next to a tiny gym, nothing to write about here, but able to get your hearrate up and lift some weights, still it is there if you work out and is fine. Free wi fi if you have your own laptop! could not believe that, Secondly , there is a free safe included with the room, 1st time for that too! so your valuables (big enough to put computer in), daily maid service, Brand new shower curtains and lovely clean bathrooms( small), built in clothes line in the shower handy for washing underwear and drying, great size rooms and good tv selections, bring clothes hangers as i always do any way , and own toiletries. we go to target and buy a $20 electric kettle and instant coffee for good hot coffee in the mornings, but is a tiny coffee maker, fridge is a decent size, 3 shelves, we also go to walmart and buy a $6 cooler and keep topped up with free ice from the end of our block and keep our sodas/beer in it instead of taking up fridge space. air con great, but the best thing is as we love fresh air and most hotels in the states you can't even open a window, here it is quite and we leave the door open to the outside, no inside corridors, and even though we are smokers, who NEVER smoke inside, it is great to have a nice smelling room, and we simply step outside to smoke. so booking on the side of the road was the best thing we had ever done! we are not here for disney, but had read other reviews about time share things, we haven't encountered any thing like that at all. hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Nice n Easy accomodation”
Reviews.Author: brits
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the B W Lakeside from the 30th Sept - 13th Oct. I emailed and asked for a second floor, quiet area - and that was what we got - Block 13/Manatee. Beds - Comfortable Room - Clean Bathroom - Small but clean, no mildew. Vanity area - no curtain for privacy if you are 2 friend's sharing! Maid service - Every day Pools - Two larger (more children) - One smaller (quieter and shallower) - Clean and pleanty of lounger's. A few parasols and table n chair's Pizza Hut - Handy for a snack Restaurant - Was not open when we walked past - don't know if we missed the opening times but, it was not a problem to us as meals were served in the bar. Bar - Open after T time - Richard the barman is brilliant. Food we had in there was fine. Reception - Staff OK but not outstanding. Internet - We bought a plastic card for $20 and used that as and when we needed to - about 8 PC's to use and a printer. Car Hire - Office within the Lobby. Walgreen's right in front of the hotel. Kathy - Is the lady who tries to get you to go to the Condo viewing - she is very nice but veryyyyyyy full on! Just say No thanks and walk or you will be there foreverrrrrrrrrr :) Tranportaion to the Park's but we did not use it. Kid's play area on sand behind the pool fence. Crazy Golf - FREE - We paid $11 pp at the CG near to Winn Dixie - at CC's pizza I think it is $12 and you get a meal with the game - We live n learn!!!! Link bus route is on the main road, a two minute walk from the Lobby - cross the road and wait for the bus there and it will take you to the WalMart - bargain's galore and a Liquor section. We liked the laid back time we had here at the BWL - being able to eat n drink around the pool, unlike Spain etc where you are expected to NOT able to bring even your own water around some self catering pools!!!! We had breakfast buffet's at Golden Corral and Pondarosa - prefer GC and it is just a 10 min walk. Had a normal size breakfast at the Cracker Barrel - 10 min walk to the left as you come out of the hotel, a nice shop section here for some "american" type gifts etc. The room's at the BWL are being refurbished - this did not intrude on our holiday at all. So if you are booking now e mail and ask for the lower number blocks - 1/2 are already done and the carpet n bedding look nice and there is a curtain on the vanity section!!! All in all we had a great stay here and would go again

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Digby9
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Best Western in September 2008 to 'do Disney'. Having read previous reviews, I was aware that there might be an attempt by hotel staff to convince me to attend a 'timeshare' presentation for the promise of cheaper theme park tickets. However, the staff offered this in an extremely underhand manner, offering cheap theme park tickets and also offering some great properties but failing to mention until confronted that the tickets were conditional upon attending a 3-hr 'presentation'. Also, they pounced every time we asked something at reception, which was a little aggressive and made me a little angry. The staff are obviously paid commission for any referrals and this detracts from their integrity. The hotel itself is not in a bad location and the pools are nice, safe and clean. The set-up is a little basic, but fine if that's what you're expecting. I would probably not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Lenajean
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel for one night in Orlando before checking into our condo. I found this hotel on hotwire for $29 and booked it. I wasn't sure what to expect for that price. The room was awesome. It was a nice sized room with a refridgerator. We ate dinner at the hotel and breakfast the next morning and both were good. They had a nice sized game room, which my 8 year old enjoyed. The pool looked really nice, but we didn't have enough time to swim. There was a nice playgound for smaller children. They even had a 18 hole minature golf course for FREE. I was not a fancy course, but we had a blast. The rooms were quiet and there was plenty of parking. My only suggestion is to check the hot water. I had to take a cold shower the next morning, but everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: paulo30
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Best Western for 3 weeks end of July through to August, 2 adults 1 child aged 7 and baby 23 months, well woth the money. Hotel is clean pool areas clean, rooms are cleean and tidy and the maids did a great job daily.Will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time or money”
Reviews.Author: Blackula
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Florida for the first part of our vacation, and were planning on visiting Disneyworld. We got to the hotel fairly late, as we had to find a shuttle to get there (the hotel did not provide airport pickup). When we checked in, the clerk did provide us with our Disney passes - and that was about the only thing positive about the stay here. I wasn't expecting a five-star hotel, but I certainly wasn't expecting a one-star, either (this hotel has a 3-star rating). The beds were carelessly made (sheets not tucked in), the bath had mold on and under the caulking, the toilet was so temperamental that it made you fearful to use it. The water would not go beyond lukewarm for either cold or hot. It had a unhygienic feel to the whole place. The restaurant's food was lackluster, bland, and overpriced. After that experience, we found other dining establishments - usually at the park. The shuttle service used to transport guests to Disneyworld was a joke. So many people were trying to crowd on the shuttle that people were standing in the aisles and on several occasions some were left behind (they would not send two shuttles for one destination - evidently it was not cost effective). It was uncomfortable for those standing, as well as uncomfortable for the ones sitting; if we took a corner a bit too quickly, you could end up with someone (literally) on your lap. I apologize for no pictures of the hotel, but I really didn't want a reminder of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: C0428R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Roach hotel for almost 2 weeks. If I could go back and do it differently, I would suck it up and pay for a better hotel. We had to change rooms several times because each one either smelled like bug spray, bleach or the front door did not fit the molding. Light would shine through the bottom or side of the doors. Hmmmm, you would think they would fix that. Finally they sent us to a room that I delt with. I had to because I booked through expedia we couldn't get our money back right away for a different hotel. I couldn't sleep. The air conditioner was really loud. After we were there for a few days we started finding ants. Red ants crawling on the shower curtain, not little ones either, they were huge. The best part of it all, when we got home my daughter found that she carried a friend home in the suitcase! YUCK! On a lighter note, the pool was nice. Housekeeping did a good job. It was cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fabb3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ideal location for visiting DisneyWorld and Universal. The hotel looks nice although the motel style was a little offputting at first. Check in was relatively quick and staff asked if we were driving. When I said no they changed my allocated room to one closer to the shuttle stop - perfect! I stayed in room 284 overlooking one of the smaller pools which we enjoyed. The rooms were a good size with a useful curtained off wash area and a quite small bath(shower over)/toilet room. I was very impressed with the size of the safe - it was big enough to store my laptop, paperwork, gifts, kids DS's etc and with plenty of room left! I was expecting wireless internet but it turned out we had an ethernet cable in the room which was still fine - it was free after all! The fridge was also a good sized half height fridge with an open freezer bit at the top. The air conditioning was fairly noisy and it took a good week before we could get it just balanced to keep us cool but so it clicked off every so often to give us some peace. The maids were very pleasant and made the beds and changed the towels everyday. I think the sheets were changed once a week. I did notice the bath and sink area wasn't cleaned very often. The complimentary shuttle service was great although it could be overcrowded and not always punctual. It did always come though and the drivers were very courteous. We missed the shuttle one evening from Magic Kingdom so got a taxi which was only $24 inc tip. We used the pizzahut delivery service a few (too many!) times which was good. There were plenty of restaurants within walking distance and there was no need to cross the extremely busy road if you don't want to risk it. I'd be cautious about the chinese restaurant next door though as the place was very dirty inside and the food was just warm and appeared as though it had been recooked. If you do eat there the sweet & sour chicken was nice and fresh, probably because it was a popular dish with a better turnover. The Walgreens in the hotel carpark was useful and aswell as selling toiletries and medicines and a small range of gifts/t-shirts, they sold sandwiches and drinks. This is where we got large bottles of water and decanted them into our waterbottles to freeze for the parks. Overall this is a great value, convenient hotel which I would definitely stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “UGGH!!! Keep On Looking!!!”
Reviews.Author: tiggermm
Reviews.Content: I had originally booked almost two weeks at this hotel to arrive the first night and be extremely disappointed. They advertise it is on a "lake" which is actually a minute' swamp. The staff was very curt and unfriendly and didn't speak very good english. When I called the hotel to get directions, the woman was very rude as well. The room had long black hairs on the bathroom floor, the sheets were not tucked in on the sides of the bed so it made me wonder if they had even changed the sheets! The bathroom door wouldn't shut! and when I went to take a shower the next morning the bathroom smelled like someone had locked themselves in it for a week smoking cigars and I thought I was going to throw up! (by the way, I don't mind smoke under normal conditions) I called Expedia and fortunately they were able to cancel the rest of my stay there and transfer me to another hotel (Orlando Vista) which was awesome for the price! and the staff was so acccomodating and friendly! I am so glad we changed hotels when we did so as not to ruin the rest of our vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: Annabellina
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on other reviews and were glad we did. The room was very clean and the hotel was close to Disney. We had few complaints with this property -- the bathroom was small (barely able to close the door without climbing into the bathtub), and it was noisy in the morning (people walking along the exterior balcony/hallways woke us up). Even though we booked a standard double, when I asked at check-in if we could have a king, the clerk upgraded us to a pool view room with a king bed. We spent three days in Orlando - two nights at this hotel and a third night at The Peabody (three times the price). Although some of the amenities at The Peabody were more luxurious, we were happier at the Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value.good all rounder hotel with pizza express.”
Reviews.Author: nina76
Reviews.Content: Best Western was good value for the money.as this was a last minute trip we didnt want to spend a lot on the hotel, and this served purpose. Clean, big breakfast, big pool and shuttles . Bit motel-y but got used to it very quickly, nice family feel to hotel.ask for a room overlooking pool, not parking lot and u will feel more secure.Lobby bit tired looking, rooms basic but we were hardly in it so it didnt matter. Free Shuttles to all theme parks which is a bonus, massive walgreens shop across road where u can bottled starbucks for 70pence-along with all sorts of medicines , newspapers, shovels,! u name it..v.handy. U will need caffeine to keep u going...! internet acess in reception, at a small cost. Breakfast-lots of choices.very filling, hot and cold buffet. pool good size and you can treat yourself to a cocktail from the bar at the poolside after a day at the parks. The biggest perk as far as my husband was concerned was the pizza hut pizzas in the hotel that u could take to your room and eat .Perfect if u exhausted. Other good restaurants nearby, Dennys for massive cheap breakfasts, Steakhouse for blueberry cocktails and grilled chops the size of your plate, and Taco bell acros the road.Lots within walking distance. Crazy golf beside the hotel too. Also if u are cat lovers this hotel has a few adorable ginger kittens lurking in the bushes.very wary little cats but appreciate it if u leave food out for them.so skinny, i found myself buying catfood along with my starbucks every morning.its so cheap and they were so grateful..if u not a cat lover don't worry u will hardly ever see them.Lots of hotels have a few to keep mice away, so its a good thing.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: JustHelping-FL
Reviews.Content: We are Florida residents (Tampa) and stayed at this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews. There are a ton of hotels in the Orlando area so it's always difficult to find somewhere affordable yet nice. We were going to Hollywood Studios and this Best Western was about 3 miles from the park. It was a nice hotel. We got in one night at 1:30am and we saw hotel security driving around which was good to see. Good location. Very convenient to restaurants and shopping. Nothing special about the rooms. They were clean and comfortable. This was a great value if you just need a clean, safe place to crash at night after spending the day at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, comfy beds, great pool, great location”
Reviews.Author: del_boy_bloomer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 14 nights from 30/7/08 to 13/08/08. we paid £300 for both of us ($600) I can honestly say I was extremenly impressed with the hotel. When we arrived we had a standard room. we went to this, but looking at the 2 beds decided to upgrade to a single king size bed. This was the best decision we made... The room was freshly renovated with a new mattress which was oh so comfortable. We were located in building 1 on the ground floor by the pool. I thought we may have problems with noise, but can honestly say it was nto a problem. Walgreens was great, we didn't bother with the hotel shop. We loved breakfast at Denny's and coffee and donuts in the morning from Dunkin donuts! There were several good restaurants nearby (Key W Cools served the best steak I've ever eaten!) The concierge was fine nce we explained we already had tickets, they were not pushy towards me at all. Housekeeping were very efficient, and several days came in the afternoon when we put the Do not disturb sign on the door. This is not a premium hotel, but what it offers it delivers very well. We are planning on returning there when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: soccermomTennessee
Reviews.Content: The landscape around the hotel looked very nice, but the room desperately needs to be updated. The carpet was old and stained and the bed linens were very old and worn. The beds are double beds that were very hard and uncomfortable. We did not spend much time at the hotel because we were at the theme parks from open to close each day, so I can not comment on the pools, restaurant or other amenities. The air conditioner was very loud and the ice machine did not work on the first floor. I would not recommend this facility to anyone that is planning to spend any time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in fantastic location for parks”
Reviews.Author: LoyalroyalReading
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 2 weeks in september 07. for the price it is very good. parks are close by, the pools are clean air con worked like a dream and staff are friendly and helpful. plently of parking, giftshops,resturants are on the 192 which you can walk to from the hotel. we had a car ( i would highly recomend car hire) so we could go when and where we pleased, rarther than using the hotel shuttle bus to parks. sea world, bush gardens, wet n wild are about half an hours drive from this hotel, also there is a great shopping complex off the i-4, well worth a visit for lacoste, armarni clothes etc. i went with a friend and had a fantastic holiday , this year i've booked up again at the same hotel, im taking my 2 kids this time, i really can't fault this hotel for the money and location.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Beds, Free Wireless Internet”
Reviews.Author: Healthy11
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7/4-7/6. Had 2 double bed room. Room was standard, included a dorm sized refrigerator that was turned off when we arrived. Took quite a few hours to cool down for drinks to get cold. Free wireless internet for those with laptop computer. There is no ethernet cable, so if you dont have a wireless card you are out of luck. Pools are good sized and clean. Many lounge chairs around, dont have to worry about getting a chair. The bed was the hardest one I have ever slept on. If you are not used to a hard bed you will have a bad sleep and wake up with a back ache. The 2nd night the bed seemed a little better. Housekeeping was unreliable. When we arrived the wrong sized sheet was on one bed, we could not get anybody to change it. The second day we returned at 4pm, yet housekeeping has not arrived, had no clean towels, etc... The A/C was cold and colled the room very quickly, the sink water pressure was very low, shower took awhile to warm up, but had good pressure and was more tha hot enough. The hotel is on the main road US192. Next door is Wendy's, and a walgreens. Walgreens has good prices on water, drinks, etc. Many restaurants, tourist traps within a 1-3 minute drive. Only a 5-10 minute drive from the theme parks, very convienient. Check in and out was fast and hassle free. Overall I give it 3 1/2 out of 5 as I paid $55 for each of 2 nights during fourth of July Weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: ArcticGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April and again in June. Paid less than $60.00/night both stays. Property is what most would consider to be motel style as opposed to hotel style. There are several two story buildings with parking stalls in front. Rooms are basic but very nice; each having a mini fridge/freezer and coffee maker. Most important, housekeeping does an excellent job of keeping the rooms clean. Best Western Lakeside is, well as the name implies, located next to a small lake. It is quite nice as you can see a variety of wildlife on and surrounding this lake. Location is perfect if you are doing any of the Disney theme parks! Universal Studios and SeaWorld are a bit of a drive; between 30-45 minutes depending on traffic. There are several restaurants within easy walking distance as well as a 24 hour pharmacy almost on the premises. The only thing I did not like about this property was the agressive concierge trying to trick me into attending a time share presentation to receive discount theme park tickets. I will avoid this "help desk" during any future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Holiday”
Reviews.Author: IrishBabe22
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel back in March. We thought because we booked it cheap it wasn't going to be that nice but we were wrong. The staff were helpful and friendly and it was close enough to Disney but it is more further away from Universal studios. We had some problems with the room on the first day it wasn't very clean and the toilet got blocked up a few times and overflowed but we then asked to move rooms which was much cleaner. The rooms are small but as you wern't there that much you were in the parks. It is very close to restaurants and lots of gift shops are near by. The pool is opened till late at night so you can go when you come back from the theme parks and there is a pizza hut that opens late.It is good for the kids as there is mini golf and little play parks. It was great value for money and we had a wonderful holiday. I would definatly request this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: eyecancun
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. No complaints. Clean, affordable and basic. We didn't spend much time at the hotel, just slept. We never actually saw the pool area, just our hotel room and lobby. One good thing was the fridge had a small freezer area. We bought large bottles of Gatorade from Walgreens and froze them overnight. We carried them in our backpacks at the parks. This saved us a lot of money! The cost for drinks at the parks is crazy! Skip the $8.99 breakfast. Go to the Golden Corral. It is $7.99 each for the breakfast buffet (50 cent off coupon in local coupon books found everywhere). It includes coffee, tea or juice, and has a great selection. Custom made omelettes, waffles, and a huge assortment of anything and everything you could imagine. We made the mistake of going to Ponderosa's $3.99 breakfast (add $2.00 for beverage), it was horrible. As for going to the theme parks. My advice: GO EARLY!! We were at the front gates at opening times and went on the most popular rides with NO LINE UPS!!! Later in the day some of these rides had 60minute wait times. We basically walked right on first thing in the morning. All in all, I'd highly recommend this hotel if you need a good clean place to stay while you are spending the days at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3 star rating”
Reviews.Author: teach2nd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a motel. You have your own entrance from the outside and you must walk the property to get anywhere. Parking is outside your door and there is no elevator. This property is a good cost for the budget, but we experienced many problems, which I must admit the hotel/motel manager took care of for us right away. This site needs a total remake, which I gather is in the process. The rooms were run- down and lacked good housekeeping. Buy the breakfast with your package, because it is a good deal and the buffett was nice. Shuttle service is limited. Our family rates this hotel/motel a 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “good with kids”
Reviews.Author: ttaf
Reviews.Content: This place was well equipped with all amenities. It had stores and restaurants as required to obtain donuts/pizza/milk. Walgreen store was very closeby(within the premises). They had a nice play area/pool and golfing area to keep kids occupied. The room wasn't impressive, but sufficient if you plan to be out most of the time. They had a refrigerator and a microwave in the store for the occupant's use. Housekeeping was good, in the sense, they cleaned every day. However the room had a weird smell due to some freshening and the cooler was pretty noisy(you had to get used to this). The room can be used only if you plan to spend most of the time outdoors.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: NCD0003
Reviews.Content: I went to Florida last week with a church group. We were staying at the Best Western Lakeside Resort for the entire week so that we could visit Disney World. We arrived past check in time but there were no problems and check in went smoothly. The layout of the hotel is a bit confusing as the building numbers do not correspond with the rooms. We were in building 8 but our room was 660. The room was comfortable and large enough for 4 people (my parents, my daughter and me). We had double beds, fridge, nice size tv, shower, and a nice view of the pool. There are several pools on the property and it has the whole Florida feel with palm trees and beach style setting. My daughter got to play in the kiddie pool made especially for little ones that cannot swim. It only had a foot of water in it. It also had a playground with sand in it for kids. The hotel has restaurants inside and a good buffet breakfast. There's also a Pizza hut inside that delivers at late hours. The fitness room is a little small but it does have several treadmills and workout benches. There is miniature golf there on property that guests can play for free. In our room, it was clean and made up daily. The only problem we had was the hair dryer and light were out over the sink. I called guest services and they sent someone over in about 30 minutes but he had the wrong supplies. He returned some 2 hours later but fixed the problem. The hotel has an efficient shuttle to Disney parks that were great. Hotel staff were friendly and if you can't afford to stay on property, this is a great place to stay for convenience and price. The hotel is also near many shopping places and fast food places. Also, we stayed in the same building with a bunch of loud teens but could not hear them once we were inside the room. It was very quiet and peaceful the whole week. The property is very clean and taken care of. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Arkansasgranny2
Reviews.Content: Good location for Disney travelers--hotel provides great shuttle service{ shuttle goes to Universal and Busch Gardens } rooms are good-table, desk ,refrigerator--NO MICROWAVE kiddie pool and playground fitness room-adequate good location-min. golf,carnival like rides for the family nearby Walgreens and Wendy are a stone"s throw away within walking distance-all kinds of eating places-Burger King-Red Lobster steakhouses, Chinese,Golden Corral etc internet is NOT FREE--available in the main lobby hairdryer broken-replaced almost immediately

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: Joannabanana
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fortnight at the Best Western Lakeside in Kissimmee. The accommodation was spacious, roomy and brightly decorated. The room comprised a safe, fridge, A/C which is all payable with the resort fee of $49 for two weeks. The room felt safe and secure as did the whole of the motel complex. As it is such a large resort, there always seemed to be someone coming or going! Excellent direct service to Busch Gardens from just outside the lobby doors, (free to those with flexplus tickets). Rooms cleaned to a very high standard, though we did realise second from last day of the holiday we had been rather over generous with the tipping! The walkways contained ice vending machines, and drink machines. Hurricane Sam's restaurant served a selection of dishes as well as Pizza Hut. In addition, the bar area has a pool table and touch screen quiz style machines on the bar. The service was good from the staff, and the 50ft buffet Breakfast was always popular. We enjoyed two games on mini golf, which again is already paid for with the resort charge. Whilst not being the newest mini golf in the area, it was still fun, challenging (to some more than others!!!!!) and kind of charming! The on site shop was good with a selection of fuits, pre packed salads, sweets and snacks available. The poolside bars do delicious frozen Pina Coladas also!!! All round enjoyable stay at the best Western Lakseide. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again, and would recommend to families and friends! Location wise, around 25 mins to Universal and much closer to Disney. The motel is Situated off a busy road, the 192, which contains an abundance of 'themed' tourist shops, restaurants, and breakfast bars, Bob Evans being a fav! Perfect location, great for families, and couples and an excellent price!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: robertian
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Best Western Lakeside from the 8th till the 22nd of May . From checking-in to my departure every minute i was in the hotel was a pleasure , having been to Florida numerous times staying in villa's and hotels this was definately the best and i would quite happily book the Best Western Lakeside again . The front desk personnal were really friendly and professional , the cleaners did a fantastic job of making sure the room was clean and tidy everyday . The facilities at the hotel were first class . There was a great variety of restuarant's and store's close to the hotel . Sitting here writing this i'am trying to think of something to complain about and i can't think of anything . So if you are planning a trip to Kissimmee and want a clean and friendly hotel believe me you can do alot worse but not much better than the Best Western Lakeside .

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dia21
Reviews.Content: Well what can i say . We loved it , After reading some of the reviews we were dreading going to the best western . The room was clean and fresh towels every day . The staff there were fantastic especially richard who is a great bloke . The pool was nice and it was quiet there most of the time the only problem was the fly`s but you get over that . Back to the hotel room there was 3 of us and the size of the room was great . Tea , Coffee , Fridge and a safe , You even get a hair dryer and iron and ironing board so no need to take your own . Air con was good but very noisy . Vending machine with ice despenser on the groundfloorof of each block . The shop was very handy and the bar serves a great burger and chips but ask for it done medium other wise they bring it out burnt . Lots of shops locally , Walgreens very cheap for having photo`s developed ,Hotel very expensive for breakfast , the best place was Ponderosa it was $3.99 each plus drinks but it was eat as much as you can and endless refills of drink . The parks very close by but would recommend anyone going to sea world fantastic . Would stay here again any time , rooms are going to be refurbised in the near furture

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: stonebrigger
Reviews.Content: I can only echo what most other people are saying. The location is excellent for all the Theme Parks. We used the free shuttle for Busch Gardens but drove the 10 minutes to all the Orlando parks. Facilities are very good, we ate in Hurricane Sam's and used the Pizza Hut. The Pool was great for cooling off after a long day at the parks. Wallgreen's being so close is a bonus. The rooms are adequate and have Tea & Coffee making facilities which is fairly rare in this type of accommodation in the States. I have recommended The Best Western to many friends who are planning Orlando vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Great again!”
Reviews.Author: ILIKEMOANING
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my son in 2006 and loved it so we came back this year and loved it just as much! It is an excellent location for disney - no need to hire a car as the complimentary shuttles are great, they are modern, clean, comfortable and on time. Disney is literally no more than 10 minutes away and if you want to stay after 11 a taxi is an average of $14-18. There is a walgreens next to the hotel which has most things you need and there are several restaurants nearby - TGI fridays is 100 time better in the USA than it is in the UK - the food was fab! The rooms are big, clean and comfortable and the staff are really helpful - any time day or night you can ring for towels, pillows etc and they bring them to you within minutes. There is a laundry near the pool which is really handy and the pools are heated so you can swim at night. I would go there again and again, I love Disney - universal has some great rides nut it'll never compete with Disney's magic!

Reviews.Title: “Best western lakside was ok”
Reviews.Author: LeedsRach27
Reviews.Content: Just come back from spending a week in this hotel. It's suitable if you are spending all day at theme parks but you wouldn't want to spend long there. The room was clean however you have to pay an additional $3.50 per day for the service. This is on top of what you will pay for the room. On arriving at the hotel it looks like a big motel, very different to the pictures on the website. I was slighty uneasy about this, which was not helped by the chilly reception we received on arrival and it took 2 days for me to start feeling more relaxed in the room. The rooms are basic but that was fine as we weren't there very much. The location is fantastic though, really convenient for Disney (about 10 mins away) and the I4 which provides access to all the other main theme parks, It took about 20 mins to get sea world and 25 mins to get to Universal. Not sure we would stay here again but it was really good value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Limey1
Reviews.Content: If all you want is a base to explore Orlando, this is good value. It is very well situated for Disney and there are a few restaurants within walking distance. The room was clean, although small and basic, which is also a good description of the pool. The staff were always friendly, although I resented the attempt at a hard sell on one of these "come to a sales presentation and you get free tickets" affairs. Worth bearing in mind that on top of the room price they charge a $3 per day ammenities charge.

Reviews.Title: “Once again...a great place for little money!”
Reviews.Author: Pattypete520
Reviews.Content: Second time at this hotel and probably not our last. Great amenities for a low price. Great pools, great food, great service, clean, clean, clean. Two items worth mentioning -- pillows are like pancakes and front desk staff was somewhat unpleasant during our stay from 4/26 thru 5/2. I'm not a fan of a little bit rude by front desk staff so the hotel manager needs to address that. I did see that many of the rooms were receiving brand new mattresses so that's a plus. This Best Western certainly cares about its customers.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Base, but.........”
Reviews.Author: Skeletonjack
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the first two weeks of May 2008. My first impressions were of disappointment as the room looked decidely dated and not at all what I expected from a "recently reburbished" hotel. I wasn't in Orlando to sit in a hotel all day long though so this wasn't a major problem, and after a few days I started to feel fairly comfortable there. Be warned that the rooms are VERY noisy (at least mine was). I stayed in an upper floor room in a building away from the pool and heard everything going on around me from people walking past, cars parking up outside, neighbouring rooms showers and toilets flushing and of course the sound of a very loud air conditioning unit: even if you turn yours off you'll still hear the air con from the surrounding rooms. EAR PLUGS ARE A MUST. If you've been to the parks all day though the beds are comfy (ours was brand new as it was changed to a new one a day or two into the holiday) so you should be too tired to care and will no doubt fall asleep pretty quick (with ear plugs). House cleaning was of a good standard, as was maintenance. One morning the handle of the shower came off in my hand. I reported it to the main reception and within 15 minutes the guys were there to take care of it. The hotel pool is nice enough although there wasn't much chance to use it. The hotel also offers internet access for 20 cents a minute and 70 cents a print off. If you just want to check your e-mail there is a PC right in the corner that offers free access for 10 mins at at a time. I didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on the food. Be aware that on arrival Guest Relations will try to get you to attend a timeshare presentation by offering you cheap tickets to a dinner show. Yes the tickets are cheap, but is it worth sitting through a timeshare presentation to get them? I'd say not, so be firm with them, these guys are quite pushy! Also, there is a resort fee of $3.50 a night that is payable on departure. We were made aware of this on check in and were told it was to cover the room amenities such as coffee maker and fridge, although to my mind these things should be standard in the room and not an additional extra. There are many diners, buffets, restaurants and fast food joints nearby, so if you can resist spending money on food in the Theme Parks you can find many cheap places to eat on the evening. Next door to the hotel is a Walgreens Pharmacy which sells practically everything you could want during your stay. The hotel itself is on a highway so other than the eating places and some very tacky gift shops (who on earth would want to buy an alligator head or a shark in a jar?) there is little else in the area. The main reason I chose this hotel (apart from its cost) was the fact that it has free shuttles to all major Theme Parks (Magic Kingdom, Animal Kingdom, Epcot, Hollywood Studios, Seaworld and Universal). The shuttles ran on time and served us well. From the hotel it was about 10 minutes to the Disney Resorts, and around 15 minutes to Seaworld and 25 to Universal. Things to consider about the shuttles however: If you are going to Seaworld or Universal the departure time is 7.45am which gives you plenty of time to get there before it opens, howevwer the earliest Disney shuttle is 9:15am to Animal Kingdom which means whichever park you go to you won't be there for opening time, which is a bit annoying especially if you are hoping to get there early to beat the crowds. The other shuttles to Disney Parks leave later so my advice would be to travel to Animal Kindom and take a Disney operated bus to the other parks from there. The latest shuttle back to the hotel was from Magic Kingdom at 10.30pm. The bus leaves from the ticket and transportation centre rather than from directly outside the Magic Kingdom (you need to catch a monorail to complete the journey). This makes watching the 10pm firework display practically impossible so this is also worth bearing in mind. The shuttle from Universal returns at 7.30pm so you won't be able to enjoy the Universal Citywalk or any of the evening entertainment it offers unless you find your own way back of course. Although the shuttles are free, each bus states that tips are part of the drivers salaries! Overall then the hotel was a good place to rest your head after a busy day at the parks. If you want free transport and don't mind a bit of noise it's ideal, if you want all of your home comforts then this probably isn't the place for you. As the old saying goes you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: DagenhamDuo
Reviews.Content: Our room was cleaned every single day, the staff were very attentive and we had a really lovely room in a quiet corner. The breakfast buffet was excellent, just right for a day in the theme parks. We will cetainly be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Clean”
Reviews.Author: shog1414
Reviews.Content: We took our girls to Florida for the first time and was looking for an inexpensive hotel close to Disney. We booked our trip thru Expedia and picked the Best Western Lakeside. When we arrived, check in was fast and easy. They do try to sell you tickets to the parks, but we already had tickets so they didn't spend too much time talking to us about it. I loved that the entire hotel is non smoking. All the rooms have outside doors and there really isn't a view, but we didn't come to Florida to stay in the hotel. There are some stairs to get to the rooms and no elevators. The first night we were there we did swim in the pool which was heated. It was nice but the towels they provide at the pool area are tiny (like hand towels). I also thought they could have had more vending and ice machines. They do have a mini golf course and a shuttle to the parks but we did not use them. We had a rental car and drove to Disney and to Cocoa Beach. If you are going to drive around make sure you bring plenty of change for toll roads. We do not have tolls in Missouri so I was pretty shocked to see how many there were. The room was clean and comfortable except for the tiny pillows. The room was always cleaned and stocked when we returned for the evening. We basically just used the hotel to sleep, shower, and store our belongings. If you are wanting something luxury then stay at a Disney Resort. If you want to save money then stay here. There is a Walgreens next door which was very convenient. They also have a variety of Florida related items to purchase less expensive than the tourist traps. It is also close to any restaurant desired and minutes from Disney and Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: ADM12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 days at the Best Western in April 2008. The property is well maintained and situated in a good location, easily accessible to alot of restaurants! The Walgreens was convenient to get many little items... The rooms were basic. They cleaned them everyday and replaced towels etc. There was a stale smell in the room however, but wasn't unbearable. The bathrooms were small but functionable. They also provided a coffee maker with coffee, cream, sugar, cups which were replaced every day as well! We didn't use the restaurant and bar on site because there were so many others close by! This is a good hotel to stay if you're planning to be out alot visiting the parks or shopping etc! We didn't have any problems staying there!

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Lakeside is the Best”
Reviews.Author: ActII
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent pick. Rooms were very clean, staff was very helpful. Make sure you take the breakfast option, they make you fantastic omlettes!! We will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “perfect base for disney”
Reviews.Author: samboBoston_lincs
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 10 nights at best western lakeside in Kissimmee. It is a perfect location for exploring the disney parks. It took exactly seven minutes to get to animal kingdom! We requested a pool view which we got and it was ideal. We could see our daughter swimming from our room. Lovely really warm pools, pizza delivery service is wonderful after a tiring day at the parks. the room was very spacious and very clean with maid service daily. Fresh coffee every morning using the machine provided, ice machine was welcomed for drinks which we kept chilled in the room fridge. Loads of restaurants just a walk over the road. All in all a great base for disney.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised how clean and nice it was!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: IndyStuart
Reviews.Content: Location and price along with inviting outdoor pools was our lure to try this hotel. I was a bit leery because I knew the property was quite old. We arrived and experienced quick and friendly check in. I did not "bite" on the free tourist packet as I had read that the time share sales was frenetic here. No problems with that at all. We had a great room that was clean and very well maintained. The grounds were exceptional and everything was open (tiki bar) at large pool etc. This place was a steal for what we paid!! I would highly recommend anyone that wants to be in the middle of everything in Kissimmee and minutes from Disney to stay here. We did not eat on property, but I wandered through that area one morning and found it to be inviting. Lots of people in the buffet restaurant so you might want to catch it at right time. Pools and lake very relaxing and clean. I would and have now recommended this place to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sooze1956
Reviews.Content: We read all the reviews and thought, let's see for ourselves. Not only were all the staff at Best Western Lakeside friendly and helpful but the hotel itself was perfect for our needs. There was 2 adults, 2 kids, one 12, one 10. The room was spacious and always spotless. A table for sitting and eating if required. Bathroom facilities perfect. Separate toilet from the sink area for convenience. We did Disney and Universal (12 hour days), the room was immaculate upon return and we had everything we needed. The coffee maker only makes one cup at a time, but if you need more coffee (it was really good by the way) the maids will gladly provide more as you need it. There was a fridge where we could store milk, juice, sodas and any takeout foods requiring refrigeration, just turn it up when you arrive as it is basically off until you adjust it and it takes about 12 hours to get really cold. Ice is right around the corner of your room if needed. The pools are fabulous, poolside bar accommodating to whatever you like to drink. Breakfast brunch in the restaurant is wonderful, bacon, eggs, sausage, home fries, all kinds of toast, bagels, croissants, cereal, omelets made to your liking, tons of fruit, coffee, tea and much more. Juice, milk, etc. is extra but the buffet is $9.00 each and kids ate for free when with a paying adult. There is a 24 hour Walgreens within walking distance of 1 minute right next door. Souvenier places everywhere, restaurants everywhere all within walking distance if needed. Shuttles to Disney and Universal are available at scheduled times for free to and from the sites. We ate at Wendy's, Bob Evans (all homemade food and really good and reasonable), Pizza Hut in the hotel (part of the restaurant), Chinese Buffet, MacDonalds, etc. Many, many other places we just never had the time to try. If you find you are exhausted after Disney or Universal (you will be), you can always grab a cab instead of waiting for your shuttle. It was $20. from Disney, about $35. from Universal. We drove to Clearwater one day, it took about an hour, 15 minutes. We went past the public beaches and down the coast to Indian Rocks where it was gorgeous and uncrowded, free to park along the beach walks. I have stayed in 5 star hotels and the Best Western Lakeside was not only accommodating as I stated previously, but comfortable and customer friendly. We couldn't recommend it more. Feel free to e-mail any questions I haven't covered. One piece of advise though for anyone not used to the sun (we came from 4 feet of snow and lily white skin), use your sunscreen immediately on the tops of your feet, ankles and neck, ears, face. I burned the top of my feet and ankles and they swelled up so bad, it was a nightmare. Didn't think to put sunscreen there and I never burn. Have fun. We would book this place again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: merlinUnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent value considering its location, 5 minutes from Animal Kingdom, 15 minutes from Magic Kingdom. Rooms are on two floors, top floors less noisy, there are three swimming pools and there is ample free parking. Staff very helpful especialy the staff in the restaurant at breakfast where you can eat enough to set you up for the day. Initially put in wrong rooms, not as requested, but while we went to the parks they moved all our cases to new rooms. Only thing is expect an account at the end of your stay for use of safe and coffee machine etc. in your room

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: liloldme
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel, clean and comfortable, Hotel offers alot too, Mini golf, pool, bar, pizza hut etc. Most of the Hotels have complimentary buses to all the parks so the location doesn't really matter, we hired a car tho so we did find this very useful. I would recommend this hotel plus it was very reasonable priced i'd give it a tumbs up for families or couples.

Reviews.Title: “cheapest rates”
Reviews.Author: thebrickwfc
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at lakeside on a number of occasions and we are returning in August this year, Basic but clean and some were to drop to sleep after a hard day round the parks. This year after numerous searching for the right deal we booked with travel City, and the cheapest rates on an extra room direct was at ulookubook.com a good £150.00+ less than the advertised hotel suppliers.

Reviews.Title: “Good All Round Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LakelandGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over christmas 2007, we are a family of 5, 2 adults and 3 kids. When we arrived the staff were polite, not overly friendly but polite so thats ok. When we got to our room we had only 2 double beds which didnt suit our party size, so we went to reception, no problem a rollaway bed would be sent round. This almost won us back to the room! There was ample space to have the 2 double beds and the roll away . The room was fine, not luxury but clean and it had a fridge and a safe, iron and board, tea/coffee making facility and reasonably quiet air con. We were happy enough :) we didnt use any of the eateries as there were so many to choose from, it was useful having Walgreens almost in the car park and a publix not far up the 192. We used the Sherbeth Road short cut into disney and could be in animal kingdom within 10 mins, the hotel does provide free shuttles but we had a car, if you wanted to eat at disney and have a drink you could use the internal transport to animal kingdom then a taxi from there back to the hotel was under $10. The kids loved the small play area, it had a spiral slide and climbing frame on an area of sand so they were happy, it was right next to the pool bar and the pool. The room service was efficient and on christmas day they still came around with clean towels although it was a less service on that day ( with advance warning). All in all this hotel served us well, it was a clean and convenient base for a holiday that i wouldnt expect to stay in the accomodation much anyway, for the price i would def go back. It is what it is, dont pay budget hotel price and expect miracles. This hotel did everything it said on the tin,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: waterparkmaniac
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 week stay at the hotel(13-27 march).we had no problems at all,the rooms were clean and tidy(we had room 163) and was big enough for 2 adults and 2 children and was cleaned every day.check in was quick,staff were helpfull.There are coffee making facilities that are restocked each day,safe,a/c and fridge.If you have booked with Virgin you do not have to pay the $3.50 resort fee you read about in other reviews The hotel offers a buffet breakfast for $8.99+tax,(the tax is added to everything you buy in shops and eating places),a store for basic food and drinks,a pizza hut and bar. The pool was heated and there was plenty of recliners to use. There are all sorts of food available in walking distance of the hotel,we mainly went for the buffet style restaurants.pick up some of the discount vouchers that are in magazines and booklets for free child meals at some places Overall i would recommend this hotel and would stay there again for the price you pay

Reviews.Title: “This is not a resort.”
Reviews.Author: MrBrit
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel at the last minute to visit friends who were in Orlando on vacation.We (wife and 6 yr old son) usually stay at Disney property but this being Spring break good deals were hard to find on one days notice.Read reviews on this web site decided to give it a go. We will not return. Dirty outside appearance, uncomfortable beds, room smelled like some kind of carpet deodorizer was used to excess, breakfast buffet was pretty poor, server seemed to cop an attitude when my wife asked for a menu.This hotel charges a $3.50 resort fee,which I thought was funny because there is no way this place is a resort. A tiny little kids playground, a worn out putt putt area and a retention pond that is called a lake (the lake in "Lakeside"). Hotel seems to pretty much cater to the package tour crowd , Virgin airlines rep was there one morning. As an ex pat Brit it seems that parts of Orlando are the new Blackpool. I will not be back to this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: BillyPinky
Reviews.Content: We paid just over £20 a night for a room so wasn't expecting the Ritz but what we did get was very good. A large clean room with two beds, a good size TV, fridge, safe , A/C, coffee maker. Ice machine in every block, vending machines, Three pools with hot-tubs, mini golf, Pizza Hut, Pub, breakfast restaurant, and Internet in reception. Across the car park was a 24 hour Walgreen's for all you soft drinks and snacks. A few minutes drive in both directions are every fast food and restaurants chain you would want. Close to Disney and about 30 minutes drive to International Drive. This is the best value motel I have ever stayed in. OK it might not be the most modern or stylish but what do you want for under $45. You will be very hard pushed to find a better motel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay!”
Reviews.Author: live4vacati0ns
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from March 12th until March 17th, 2008. I picked this hotel because it was part of a package that I selected through Spirit Airlines. I was a little leary because it was a good deal ... $1100 for three flights and 5 nights accomodations at a hotel that claims to be 1.8 miles from the entrance of Disney. However, I was pleasantly surprised. Although they are not 1.8 miles away (maybe, the way the crow flies) but are more like a 20 - 25 min shuttle bus ride away, everything else was A-ok! The room was sufficient for our needs. It had a fridge, safe and all of the amenities. It had a complimentary mini putt and the pool looked nice, although we didn't use it. It had a great breakfast buffet for $8.99 per adult and kids ate free under a certain age. They had a Pizza Hut onsite and computer access if you needed it. We purchased our Disney tix at the front desk and complimentary shuttle service is provided to the parks. They are only provided at certain times so you have to work around their schedule but keep in mind there are shuttles at the parks as well, so if you go to one of them you can transfer while at the park.
