We got ill while there and since we weren't from the area, we needed information on where we should go for medical attention. The front desk was quite helpful on this front as well. They also arranged the taxi pickup the morning of our checkout for our early morning flight. (Airport to hotel will cost approx $60) There is a drug store across the road and plenty of restaurants as well. The towels in the room did have an odor of chlorine but if that is the only complaint then that's not bad. All in all it was a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and affordable!”
Reviews.Author: td397
Reviews.Content: Really a well kept property. This place is huge and has three pools and courtyards, beautifully landscaped, excellent large rooms that we found very clean, and quiet! The hotels lobby features a nice bar, excellent restaurant, pizza hut, sundries shop, and Disney World/Sea World tickets/customer relations center, and a game room. Very nicely kept property! WE APPROVE HIGHLY!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, awesome courtyard, pool”
Reviews.Author: flyingtetas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. I booked it through priceline, so i didnt' know what i was getting, and paid $40 total. I was very pleasantly surprised. Super clean, roomy, comfortable, and the outside amenities are fantastic. Large pools, lots of people around, outside tables to sit at, very fun atmosphere. I would recommend if going with friends/family.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the value”
Reviews.Author: yellowb
Reviews.Content: I was able to book this place for about $69 a night. The place is very standard and the rooms are clean, in some places. I found a couple of pistachio nuts behind the cabinets and under the air conditioner. Other than that, the towels were changed on a daily basis. For the price you can't go wrong. There were shuttle buses to Disney (and all the parks), Universal, and Seaworld. They had a couple of times early in the morning for each park and a couple of return times too. Also pretty good. Around the hotel, there were a tonne of places to eat. Most of them are walking distances and there is a 24 hr walgreen 2 mins away. Plus a rental car service as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean Standard Motel”
Reviews.Author: JulieTurner007
Reviews.Content: We booked Best Western Lakeside through Virgin who gave it a slightly over optimistic three and a half star rating. We found it to be a clean, comfortable and very ordinary Orlando Motel with slightly above average accomodation in that it was cleaner and fresher than some I've stayed in, it had a hair dryer and iron and ironing board , coffe maker, fridge and colour TV in the rooms. (There is no microwave) .The pools looked clean and were in use by residents but we didn't bother, there were plenty of sun beds and tables and chairs.The rooms are the standard layout two double bed style ones any Florida traveller must be used to,there is a very nice breakfast room on site (Set price for breakfast buffet) which provides a very good breakfast and a believe kids ate free with an adult (we didn't take any children). Beware the concierge services whose main aim in life is to sell you time share, they can also sell you park tickets but I really dont believe they save you anything, be careful and unless you really want to spend hours being sold timeshare dont get sucked into the "quick" presentation. The reception staff were not really very helpful and just tried to fob you off onto the concierge people. The free transportation to Disney was useful and there were a few times to choose from to travel to and from Disney, this is helpful if you dont want to spend every waking minute in the parks . The transportation to Universal/Sea World only went at 7.45am amd back at 7.45pm which we felt was too long a day so we didn't bother. The free transportation to the small mall laid on by the hotel daily was very good, excellent "Fossil" out let store. There is also a "World of Denim" and many good eating places in easy walking distance of the Hotel we recommend the "Golden Corral" (just across the road if you dare cross it). There is a 24hr Walgreens just next to the hotel where you can buy basic grocery needs, milk, PG tips, bottled water, yogurt, shampoo etc. So for position (very close to Disney, shops and restaurants) this is a great hotel. For style and comfort its slightly above average. We had a great holiday, but we dont spend all day at the hotel we were out there in the parks or shopping (We love the Florida Mall but there are plenty of shopping opportunities), if you are someone who likes to spend plenty of time at your hotel perhaps this isn't the right one, but it's a perfectly acceptable base if all your going to do is sleep have breakfast and then get out there. If your going to Orlando that's probably what you've got in mind any way ! so go ahead book with confidence if it sounds your type of place, we'd stay here again . The only thing we really missed was a comofrtable seating area in the room, no sofa , but we lived without a sofa for two weeks and we could do it again .

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Wrong At All”
Reviews.Author: StokeMark
Reviews.Content: Nothing amazing but perfectly adequate. Rooms a decent size (we had five in and managed just fine) always clean and tidy and location is VERY good (whatever the last reviewer says) you can be at Animal Kingdom in 3 minutes if you go down Sherbeth Road. Always felt very safe, had a nice pool view room (ask for one over the 3rd 'small' pool as you get peace and quiet with a nice view) and the kids really liked all the pools which were always clean with towels at hand. If you can get a good Disney hotel for a few more dollars, consider it - otherwise remember that youve come to Orlando to bet out from early morning until late at night so why the hell pay $$$$ for a room you just get your head down in ?

Reviews.Title: “it was o k”
Reviews.Author: inspecting
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the reasonable price of 50.00, or 60.00 with taxes and resort fee. The property is quite dated as was mentioned but for this price that's what I expected. The pools looked nice. Room was adequate. Would rather stay at disney value property for 30.00 more.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: caitlinsdad35
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 2 weeks staying at the Best Western Lakeside and i must say it is good value for money. But you do get what you pay for, cleanliness is not their top priority and come the weekend the hotel does become overun with groups of undesirables whos behaviour leaves alot to be desired. Great location though for getting to and from Disneyland and it is surrounded by restaurants. The Red Lobster across the road serves awesome food at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Cheap Place All Your Needs”
Reviews.Author: angelina49
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay brill for the kids rooms little on the small side but you are never in them to matter.pizza hut on site and will deliever to the room.Disney is 10mins car journey and all eatng places can be walked too. Try the golden coral real value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rate if you call AAA office!”
Reviews.Author: clharold
Reviews.Content: We had a poolside room, which was clean and spacious enough for 4 people. The only thing that I didn't like is there was an moldy odor coming from the air condiditon in the first room that we had. It appears that some of the rooms my need an upgrade in the AC unit, but all and all it was affordable and clean. Because we booked @ the AAA ofc in Atlanta our rate was only $45 each ngt.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hoseface
Reviews.Content: this was a great place to stay. not one single complaint. a great value for the money. close to the parks, shopping , dining, and friendly hotel staff. other visitors were equally friendly. will stay again for our visit back in two years

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: greazel420
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 6 days at the Best Western Lakeside in Jan of 2008, in a two “double bed” room. We both consider ourselves to be “budget” travelers and so I write this review and rate this hotel based on those levels of expectations. Overall I rate the hotel as acceptable for the price we paid of $45 a night. Items of note about the hotel and our room: - The location is great for access to Disney and Interstate 4 which takes you to pretty much all the attractions quickly and easily. - The room was relatively clean o The bathroom smelled a little moldy (I have experienced this at Hilton’s as well), but here the smell leaked into the sleeping area. o The carpet and drapes had small stains. (no larger then 6 inches in diameter) - There was a nice pool area which we did not use, but there was no hot tub. - The beds were probably the worst thing about the room. The best way I can describe them was as soft on support and hard on cushion. My wife did complain about back pain from the bed because it lacked support. I would not recommend using the hotel ticket service. I had done a little homework before we came to Orlando on Disney tickets and so knew what we wanted and about how much they should be. We told the young lady working we wanted to visit Disney for 3 days and go to 3 or maybe 4 parks, so we were considering the “Park Hopper”. She informed us that in order to visit 3 parks we HAD to buy the “Park Hopper”. I told her we didn’t but she insisted that we did. (I later confirmed with Disney that we did not have to buy it if we only wanted to visit one park a day) She also told us the Park Hopper gave us access to the water park which was open, again I told her I didn’t think it did but she insisted that it did, 3 days later we attempted to get into the water park and were told we couldn’t because we only had the “Park Hopper”. I mentioned the misinformation I was given upon check out but they did not really seem to care. I am not really upset about the entire ordeal because we got exactly what we wanted for the price we expected, but I do expect people to know what they are talking about when selling a product. As a last note I would estimate that my wife and I spent a total of 15 hours over 6 nights awake at the hotel. If you plan on spending more then that awake here I would suggest you consider different accommodations if you are paying much more then we did.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great food,bar,pool and location”
Reviews.Author: cardiffoaties
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with hubby ,17yr old and 11yr for New year 2007/08 was very clean, staff helpful, poolside rarely full great for relaxing after several days at Disney (plenty of beds & towels) breakfast at hotel Excellent as were cocktails at Hurricane Sam's Bar(beer/lager get pitcher cheaper as glasses small) nice pizza's at onsite pizzahut. The only downside were rooms small (3 adult 1 child) and often noisy outside. Shuttle to and from hotel apparently very good this from fellow guest (we didn't use had own car a real must) plenty of shops and restaurants nearby Red Lobster,Outback and Kools excellent, especially Red Lobster all walking distance. Hoolihan's 5mins dirve very nice food. Avoid Taco Bell and Chinese restaurant (next door to hotel) very bad food . Best supermarket Wynn Dixies reasonable prices. Pharmacy next door.

Reviews.Title: “Worked for us!”
Reviews.Author: Kari2508
Reviews.Content: We went with another couple in January 2008 and we all thought the beds were comfortable. Yes the air conditioner was noisy but it helped block out the kids yelling outside. We found it to be clean. We basically used it to sleep and shower at and it worked very well for those purposes. We used the Pizza Hut on site a few times and the bar made great drinks. The only minus we found was the guest service counter. They would not help you at all unless you wanted to listen to their time share story and we did not. Check in/out was fast. Was about 10-15 from Disney depending on the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience EVER”
Reviews.Author: vixterrr
Reviews.Content: If you would like to bathe in a dirty bathtub this is the place to stay, dirty buildup everywhere!! uncomfortable beds, pillows were tiny and when we asked for extras they only gave us 2 ! Terrible room service, a pair of pants was stolen and sunglasses were broken, we filled out a report, they did not even process it and for that matter a week later they stil do not care, they told us to call the police or a lawyer! terrible customer service, they were rude and unhelpful. The guest services department was also unhelpful, they didnt let us know that public busses stopped running at 830 which ended up in a 30$$ cab ride back.. all in all TERRRRRRRIBLE experience and i wouldnt recommend going there, i would not go back. oh and there was a red ant problem in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “not a bad hotel....”
Reviews.Author: treebel
Reviews.Content: this was an adequte hotel and we got what we paid for. it was clean and well presented with no frills.air conditioning was a little noisy but then aren't most of them? the beds were very uncomfortable and there wasn't a lot of storage in the room.the bathroom is tiny! maid service was very good with fresh towels and coffee left daily. not a bad hotel all in all but i dont think i would be returning

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: The Traveling Couple
Reviews.Content: Having booked the hotel then read the reviews we were a bit worried about this hotel but it is not that bad. We went with Virgin on 1st December 07 just for the week, we did not stay that much in the hotel as we were out all day and only used it to sleep. Saying that the noise from kids running around untill about 1am was a bit of a pain. We were in the main block next to the reception (room 205) and this could have been the problem with the kids going back to their rooms. The rooms are a bit basic but clean and we had no problems with any of the staff. The hotel is in a good location and we would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: idontlovenicks
Reviews.Content: I had read a few worrying reports about this hotel after booking it , but it is really clean and good value for money. I have enclosed a couple of pictures for you to see. first of all it is very close to disney parks which you can reach in ten minutes by a free shuttle bus. Then there is all sorts of shops and restaurants nearby ( a couple of minutes' walk) where you can eat for a few bucks: at golden china, for instance, all you can eat buffet is only 12.99 $. There's a swimming pool, a minigolf course, a beautiful lake and so on. If you have got a car highway 4 is very close and parking is free. And if you are tired and don't feel like walking EVEN for less than 30 seconds you can have a pizza at pizza hut in the facility or buy something at walgreens. Of course best western lakeside is not a ritz, but you can still enjoy a comfortable and pleasant stay there at a reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: viridis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Lakeside from December 26-30, 2007. We were encouraged by the positive reviews on this site, but the motel did not live up to expectations. There are definitely better choices for a Disney vacation, including the value priced Disney resorts, which are usually cheaper than what we paid for this room. Here is an overview of pros and cons: Cons: - The sink and bathtub drained too slowly when we first used them. We contacted housekeeping about the problem, and they did send someone right away to fix the problem. - There was a bad odor in the bathroom - we finally discovered it was the shower curtain, which had a very unpleasant musty odor. Also, the bath towels were small, thin, and rough. - The bed springs were loud - you could hear them squeaking when you moved. - The hotel's restaurant was not open for dinner. - The hotel has free mini-golf, but we played at dusk, and half of the lights around the course were broken. - We tried to purchase Disney tickets in the lobby. The man at guest relations at first offered us a good deal, but of course there was a catch; listen to a two hour presentation at a new hotel near Epcot. Our time was worth more than the discount. - My wife asked housekeeping for an extra pillow; they said it would be no problem but never delivered it. - The motel has very basic cable, but it seemed like just a few channels. Also, when we watched a movie on TBS there was an annoying buzzing sound from the TV. - As other reviewers have noted, the AC is very loud. However, we were happy about this one of the nights; the sound helped drown out the yells of the teenagers at the pool well past midnight. When we contacted the front desk, they said they would send someone over to the pool to quiet them down, and it did seem to work. - Another noise issue occurred the same night; at around 3:50 am, a very loud group (?) or couple entered the room next to ours. Apparently the walls aren't too thick - we could hear everything in their room, including some things that we didn't really need to hear. My wife was hoping that the kids wouldn't wake up and ask why the woman was screaming (not in pain). They then put the TV on very loudly, finally turning it off around 6:00 am. - There were a couple of strange incidents from housekeeping. At one point the TV didn't work; I discovered that the maid had unplugged it when making up the room. Another time the air was left on in the room during the day, set to 62 F. These aren't major issues, but still rather odd. Pros: - Check-in and out were very quick - no problems. Do be aware that there is a $3.50 resort fee added to your rate. - The fridge in the room was very convenient to have a quick breakfast of milk and cereal in the room. - The in-room safe was much larger than usual - also very convenient. - The room had free wireless Internet access. - Location was good - a busy strip of motels & restaurants very close to the entrance of Disney. There was quite a bit of traffic on the main road in the morning and returning at night, though. Overall, we were disappointed by our experience at the Best Western Lakeside. We have visited Disney many times in the past (since we live in Miami), and there are far better places to stay. The area around Disney is saturated with hotels - do a little research and I'm sure you can find better accommodations for the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Great Cheap Base!”
Reviews.Author: Laramakia
Reviews.Content: I spent a week here at the end of nov/beginning for Dec with my husband and 2 teenage daughters. overall this hotel was great for the price we paid and I would stay here again. Its in a great location right next to a Walgreens and within 5 minutes walk of over a dozen good places to eat. Its also really easy to cross the 192 at this point to quickly go in either direction so making life easier if you arent used to driving on the wrong side like my husband. We were in an upstairs room in block 5 and despite the block being pretty full it was very quiet at night .. my only complaint i guess would be the horrific noise from the air-conditioning, it sounded like a jet taking off and constantly switched on and off! but then you are so tired at the end of the day that you dont notice that much really :-) the rooms were kept very clean and were well maintained and the reception staff were helpful and friendly on the 2 occasions we needed help. the on-site pizza hut was handy, if a bit limited on choice and I never ventured into the pool but my daughters used it a couple of afternoons and said it was ok, (although they did seem to have a problem with flies in the water). we didnt use the hotel bar or shuttle service, and didnt eat there other then pizza so cant comment on any of that but everyone we saw there seemed happy

Reviews.Title: “A decent base”
Reviews.Author: NCVienna
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Best Western Lakeside for four days in mid-December. All things considered, I would say it was a decent and very conveniently located base for exploring the Orlando area, at a very reasonable price (we got a fantastic deal from priceline.com - 2 flights from North Carolina and the room for 4 nights for $440 for the two of us!) On the plus side, staff were very friendly, and the cleaners were excellent. They even returned one afternoon to tidy the room and supply us with fresh towels, sachets of coffee etc. after we had told them in the morning that we were fine... The location is great, and gives you plenty of choices for reasonable dining (the Red Lobster across the street was a pleasant dining experience). On the minus side... first of all, they will try to lure you with a free breakfast to attend a timeshare presentation next door. That would be ok, only they don't tell you that that's what it is... only when I asked directly, did they admit that yes, it was actually a presentation, not just a complimentary free breakfast. In my view, that is dishonest. The musty, damp smell in the room is pretty overwhelming, unless you let the A/C run on high all day and all night (noisy, and with temperatures in the 60s, not an option). We can still smell it in our clothes, even after one laundry. That's not the hotel's fault, but simply the Florida climate I guess. I had forgotten how much I hated the motel set-up - the fact that you cannot open a window, or even draw the curtain without people walking past and looking in. You are also at the complete mercy of the people around you - screaming children at 6.30 AM (and parents who obviously did not think that was an issue for other guests), and party-goers returning at 3 AM one night, shouting and brawling in the parking-lot. They only calmed down after one guest threatened to call the police. Overcharging... again, that seems to be an Orlando, rather than a Bestern Western issue. Be prepared to spend a lot more money than you could have ever budgeted for. In the hotel, the mediocre breakfast buffet cost over $20 (incl. tax) for two people - unless you are a huge morning eater, really not worth the money. It's easier (and a bit cheaper) to just grab a few items (muffins, bacon and egg biscuits) in the inhouse deli - at least you'll have snacks for during the day. Equally, the business center charges a minimum of $2 to even spend 60 seconds on the internet - if you want to print out something (like our boarding passes for the return flight), be prepared to spend another $2... All in all, the Best Western was a decent base for our four days' stay and offered everything we needed. I doubt that I would want to spend 2 weeks there.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel but noisy A/C, plus Seaworld free tickets tip.”
Reviews.Author: Rattylover
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two weeks at Best Western Lakeside in early December. We booked thorugh lastminute.com and had our flights and hotel combined. Getting there was easy: we just booked a return Mears Shuttle at the airport, quite cheap at $32 return each. The hotel is in a good location, surrounded by reasonable restaurants, and set way back from the highway so there is no traffic noise, unlike many of the other hotels nearby, We got a take-away from the Golden Corral every night and ate it in our room. A bit annoying that you're charged by the pound and my tomatoes cost the same as my boyfriend's steak, but still cheap and tasty. The on-site supermarket/pharmacy Walgreens was great, we bought our snacks and water from here every day, a gallon for $1.19, as we find florida water rubbery tasting and undrinkable. We were disappointed at first not to have a room with a nice view, but were instead at the back, in the more secluded end of the carpark. This turned out to be a blessing. I advise you NOT to book a room with a pool view, the noise from here was dreadful until late into the night. Our room was well away from all the activity, we were very lucky, no rowdy people or music or kids or anything. The only problem was the air conditioning. This is so ridiculously loud we didn't even have ours on, but were troubled by the low rumbling from the units on either side of us. I wear ear-plugs but was still disturbed by this. Ironically, no-one was staying on either side of us, but the maids put the units on regardless. Not very environmentally friendly, and a damned nuisance. Apart from this, the room was absoutely perfect. Clean, cosy, nicely decorated, with free cable TV and a safe using a code of your choosing. You will be required to pay $3.50 per room per day for the use of these amenities but even then it's still great value. The free shuttles were good but the times aren't great: leaving at 7.45am for seaworld when it doesn't open till later in the morning, so you're forced to wait around for 40 minutes or so for it to open. Then coming back at 7.30pm means this is a long day. But the Disney times are much better and you can always sleep in and get the 10.45 shuttle, then take a free disney bus to a different park. We tipped the shuttle drivers at least once a day as these guys are on low low wages and rely on tips, many people didn't and i felt a bit sad about that. We never once found tip envelopes left by the maids, so maybe it's just a select few who are a bit more aggressive. There's a lovely lake where you can spot some interesting bird life, albeit framed by the neon signs of Golden China etc. We never spotted an alligator but there are signs there warning of them (they're only tiny). Seaworld tickets are usually $70 or so each. We were offered two for $50 total by the man at the hotel customer information desk, in return for attending a timeshare presentation in another, far-off hotel. We weren't sure whether to do this or not. As it happened, we then went to the Golden Corral and a lovely woman called Robyn offered us two tickets for free if we went to a timeshare presentation only five minute's walk away. We gave a $20 deposit, gritted our teeth, and went (Westgate Resorts). We didn't speak a word and showed not a flicker of interest and they gave up the second our 90 minutes were done. Viola, two free tickets to Seaworld, plus our $20 deposit duly returned. (Apparently if you go for the timeshare then cancel it within the ten day period, they charge you sneakily for the disgusting free breakfast buffet and $50 for the book of info they gave you, so best not to be sucked in at all). All in all, if I was to return to Florida I would head straight back to Best Western Lakeside. However, I realise that, so often in hotels, your experience depends on your room allocation, and I think we were luckier than others who were closer to the pool or had to deal with noisy neighbours. The hotel grounds were clean and attractive, the location convenient, and there are free local calls for any bookings you might need to make. It was just the aircon that was the catch.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy a/c, toilet, & hidden charges.”
Reviews.Author: lagalletaviene
Reviews.Content: This hotel looked alright from the outside, but the horror begins when you come in. The toilet makes a horrible (even scary for little ones) noise when flushed. The water pressure is extremely low. A water cooler has more pressure. And the surprise charges of $3.50 a day for keeping your credit card number on file. Something we were not told before we booked this stay. Needless to say, we will NEVER stay in this place again. And don't be fooled by the fact that is only "2 miles from Disney World maingate" is not.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID like the plague!”
Reviews.Author: SDD86
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner have just returned from our 2 week trip to Florida. The weather was perfect, the parks were great, the hotel however was AWFUL! I often read the reviews on Trip Advisor before I book a holiday and when I see a bad review I think to myself how miserable some people are and that people are exagerating on their reviews, but with hotels like the Best Western Lakeside I now know why! The first room we were placed in was very dirty, with the carpet coming away from the wall, dust, dirty tiles in the bathroom, broken tap on sink, and was generally like stepping back to the 1980's. On our 3rd night in the hotel we were joined in the room by a large cockroach. When we called reception to ask someone to come and get rid of it all they could say was "We will call pest control tomorrow". Eventually we persuaded them to send someone, and they sent a security man to dispose of it. There was no apology whatsoever, even on the first phone call, and there was no follow up. We ended up having to buy cockroach repellent to spray over the room! 6 nights into our stay we were disturbed at 10:15pm by screaming kids from the swimming pool outside our room. It wasn't just the odd scream here and there, it was continuous shouting from around 20-30 kids in the pool. We called reception to complain and they said "the pool will close in 45 minutes, you will have to wait!" Once again there was no apology for this, and no follow up. The following night we were awoken throughout the night (12am-4am) by people walking in and out of their rooms, slamming doors, talking and chatting. After getting back to sleep we were once again woken up by shouting kids in the car park at 8am. 7:15pm that same evening we were trying to watch the television in our bedroom and the noise from the 20-30 kids in the pool was so loud that we couldn't even hear the television. This time we spoke to the Duty Manager and she informed us that there were 5 groups of football teams in the hotel, hence why there was all the noise, and said she would move us to a quieter part of the hotel. The next room we moved too, once again at 12am we could hear people talking loudly outside, and was awoken this time at 7am to screaming teens in the car park shouting from the balcony (3 doors down from our room). Instead of moving us to a quieter block, we had actually been placed in the SAME block as the football teams, hence all the noise in the morning. That morning we went down at 8:30am to speak to the Virgin Holidays rep, and even though she acknowledged we were outside the room waiting for her to finish her welcome meeting, she kept us waiting for over 1 1/2 hours (without coming out to tell us to come back at a certain time). When we eventually spoke to her she told us we could move to another hotel but would have to pay the difference, which we refused to do, seeing as that the hotel should have been providing the service of at least letting us sleep at night, seeing as that was all we were there for (as we were in the parks most of the day!). After speaking to another receptionist, the rep managed to get us moved to a very quiet room at the back of the hotel (which we should have been moved to in the first place!) We told them that we would have some breakfast and then let them know when we were ready to move so they could carry our cases over. At 12:30pm that day, whilst showering in the 2nd room (before moving to the third) we were interrupted by a man who had just been checked into our room (even though they hadn't even serviced the room yet or checked to see if we had left). We called reception and once again there was NO apology, and the receptionist was extremely rude and said they had ASSUMED we had already moved rooms (even though they hadn't even checked or serviced it knowing that we had slept in it the night before!). We called reception at 1pm to tell the receptionist we were ready for our luggage to be moved, and then went out shopping. At 3:30pm when we returned to our new room the luggage had still not been moved, and once again when calling reception there was NO apology. Other problems included being called at 11:30am by the Room Attendant from the room next door asking if we were having our room serviced that day, despite having DO NOT DISTURB on the door. There were dead cockroaches on the stairs and in the corridors, which would take at least 2-3 days to clear. Like a previous review states we were also inundated with tip envelopes from our housekeeper daily. They would always change position to ensure that we would see it, and we too found one hanging from our lamp! The staff in the hotel were generally very rude and unprofessional, with some staff, including receptionists wearing tracksuit hoodies, instead of profesional uniform. Overall the Best Western Lakeside is a hotel which clearly doesn't take it's guests very seriously and has no sense of customer service. Despite having to move rooms 3 times and speaking directly to a Duty Manager, we were not once presented with any form of written or verbal follow up or apology. I will be writing to Virgin Holidays to complain about all of the above, as their "3+ Virgin Hotel Rating" of this hotel clearly needs reviewing!

Reviews.Title: “A great base for Disney”
Reviews.Author: mammyN
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 week with my husband and children aged 13 and 10, whilst "doing disney". We found the hotel perfectly comfortable and clean with excellent service from all staff. The breakfasts set us up for the day very well, after which we were out all day, every day, returning in the evening for a drink at the bar, game of pool and maybe a pizza.(Which could be delivered to your room.) We had everything we needed here such as: a little convenience shop, snackbar, breakfast room, pizza hut, laundry, crazy golf and more that we didn't use such as, the pools and courtesy buses to and from disney. The hotel is on highway 192, and was easy to find. Very short distance to disney parks - only a few minutes in car, and close to the airport. It is surrounded by all sorts of shops and restaurants. Don't go to the chinese buffet restaurant that you can see next door - its awful. Do go to Walgreens (chemist and supermarket) if you need anything from paracetamol to bread to flip-flops. Its on the grounds of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place!!”
Reviews.Author: anorak8
Reviews.Content: Warning do not book this hotel, the rooms are not clean they are filthy filthy filthy, for two weeks myself and my party endured the tip envelope being placed around the room over lamps, if our washing was left too dry in the bathroom the heated light was turned off, the clocks went back and the housemaid set the clock for 7am when it was 6am and did the same time for our other party, there was pubic hair and her hair left on the floor which was not ours, the reception staff were useless told us to get to typhoon lagoon that we would need a taxi at $25.00 each way which was not the case as we could use disney transport but luckily found out that typhoon lagoon was closed. This hotel ruined a holiday that was booked for over a year we went with virgin complaint pending because the virgin reps did not hang about long enough for any issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great deal, Can't beat the value!!!”
Reviews.Author: Xtina130
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for four nights. the location was AMAZING, walking distance to several sit-down restaurants, fast foods, a Walgreens, and those cheesy Orlando gift shops (perfect for sourvenirs). The price was simply amazing and the location was great...the hotel offered complimentary rides to Disney, Universal, Sea World, and Busch Gardens...would definitely stay again when headed to Disney area!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice with just a few IMPORTANT issues !!”
Reviews.Author: Lovetheocean7
Reviews.Content: This place is huge !! Stayed here by mistake, thought I was booking at the new Best Western that was the former Baymont about 6 miles east on 192 but they put me here. Room was updated and on the most part clean, but one VERY IMPORTANT issue needs to be addressed !! When we first arrived to our room for our 2 week stay, there were a lot bugs and flying insects in there and at this point, I would usually go for another room, the reason we didn't was because we figured the housekeeping may of had the door opened while they were cleaning. We killed the insects and through the first few days, there were more. It didn't take me long to figure out where they were coming from. The doors to all the rooms have at least a 1 inch gap beneath them and this is how they are getting in. We even saw a lizard in the guest room window next to ours !! To solve the issue through our stay, I put a towel under the door and each morning I removed it, it was soaked ?? This is a very important issue, if not addressed, it will ruin the carpeting and allow little creatures to visit !! Also, for those that like to sleep in during the morning, this is not the place for you !! Doors start slamming around 7am and continue banging for most of the morning along with laundry carts rolling by every 1/2 hour on the hour !! Housekeeping did a fairly good job throughout our stay, but they do overlook the fan vent in the bathroom that is piled with dirt. Also, drainage is very slow in the tub and our vanity sink water trickled out at best, I figured it must be a water saver. They missed our room once during our 14 night stay and this could be that we slept in until 2pm one afternoon. Throughout our stay, we saw continuous employees doing small preventive maintenance deeds around this complex which says a lot about their respect of being a Best Western. Staff was very pleasant and the only other incident was on check out day, my brand new rental car was hit by another guest from the UK as I was checking out. Don't overlook this motel, it has a lot going for it and is very reasonably priced !! At least 3 pools that we didn't even use, but look very nice.

Reviews.Title: “great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: sumotooth
Reviews.Content: A party of 8 people, 6 adults and 2 children aged 8 and 4, stayed here in October. Before going we read mixed reviews about this hotel but only the positive ones should be taken on board. We had 3 rooms altogether each of which were absolutely fine. Exactly like the brochure. Not much hanging space but loads of draws and most of our clothes didnt need hanging anyway, just t shirts and shorts,afterall this is not a drsssing up holiday. A fridge with small freezer box inside and a coffee maker were in the rooms as well as a tv and air con unit. Everywhere was nice and clean.We took the non drive option and this was my biggest concern before going. No worries though. The hotel is surrounded by endless restaurants all within walking distance at great value prices. Even eating in the hotel bar/restaurant was cheap.Next concern were the hotel shuttle buses again no problems and we stayed here for 3 weeks. Always on time and only had to stand up once in 3 weeks. They run to all the different parks throughout the morning and at 5pm to MK as well. Then they depart the different parks throughout the evening. If the bus isnt going to the park you want, at the time you want ,just go to one of the other parks and use the Disney transport system to link up (this includes the water parks as well). Same at night. For instance , the Epcot bus returns at 8.15pm but the fireworks dont start till 9pm. So we watched the show then got the monorail to the Magic kingdom and returned on the 10.15pm bus from there. Good tip - one night we missed the last bus from MK, so we got the Disney transport bus to the Animal Kingdom Lodge as this is really close to the Best Western, then got a taxi from there to our hotel. As this is only about 2 miles away it only cost $7 (£3.50) between 8 of us.Worth remembering if you want to come back early as well. All in all this is an excellent value hotel, ideally positioned for eveything , you should have a great time but will need another holiday when you get home as there is so much to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room,Beautiful Grounds,Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ChevyMike
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Lakeside Inn for 11 days.The Room was large and clean,with a Refrigerator and room safe,no microwave.The A/C worked good and we slept good after being at the parks all day.They have 1 large pool,1 smaller pool,and 1 kiddie pool,no hot tub.Also on the grounds is a mini golf course,did not get to try,looked nice.The grounds and landscaping are well maintained.The location is great,only a 10 min. drive to the Disney parks,20 min. to Seaworld,1hour to Daytona beach.Restaurants close are Sizzler,Golden Corral,Shoneys,Waffle House,Outback Steakhouse,Red Lobster,Wendys,etc.Directly next door is a 24 hr Walgreens which is great for snacks,inexpensive t-shirts and souvenirs.Also try Dreamworld gift shop across from BW,great selection and reasonable prices.Our overall stay at BW was very good and at less than half the price of staying at a Disney value resort. We will definitely be returning on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “steady”
Reviews.Author: DotandJim
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the school summer holidays. The hotel was busy. There was a pool which was open until 11pm which was great for the kids as they could go there once we had returned from the theme parks. The poolside bar was not open which was a shame. There is a buffet restaurant which is good value, but so is everywhere else! The rooms are a good size but the bathrooms are a little small. Great location right next to Walt Disney World so a great base for sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel**bril for families and Disney Park Access”
Reviews.Author: ssquarebear
Reviews.Content: Arrived for a 2 week family holiday to Disney & Universal Parks..with two children 7 & 9, myself and husband 40 & 41. Had absolutely brill time- best location for Disney Parks. Believe me you don't want to travel far when you have been at Disney Parks ALL day and then we could come home and jump straight into one of the three pools in the hotel - brilliant.....!!!! Very friendly hotel... two restaurants, internet access, large rooms, tvs in rooms, can order latest films to watch too!! Small games Arcade on site, mini golf, maid service every day, cafe/small food court & shop, bar & restaurant including a pizza hut on site for eat in and takeaway. A huge chemist on site too in a separate building!! The chemist is great for last minute/forgotten things- and very cheap -has everything from make-up to suntan, food to photo service etc- 24 hrs too !!! Hotel is very relaxing & clean. Reception staff very helpful, even a car hire dept. on site and leaflets galore on all local attractions. Buses & shuttles to Disney parks are just outside reception. Also you can just walk out of hotel to the main highway and all the food you can eat is on your doorstep -restaurants lined along the road literally- you don't even need to get in your car again!!!!! Driving wise the hotel is very central and we feel ideal for Disney - easily accessable to all major roads as it is also on a main route 'the 192' - but not noisy at all. If you are lucky and have good weather you can see as well as hear the disney park fireworks at 9 every night- don't fret they are in the distance - so does not disturb your rest if you need to get your head down! I would recommend this for families and probably couples for a relaxing but very friendly, helpful, relaxing, convenient stay!! The Lowery family Sept to Oct 2007.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again”
Reviews.Author: NickJB
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself stayed with our friends in this hotel for 10 nights and I would definitely recommend it to other travellers. The location was great, the rooms large, clean and quiet and the customer services was very friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay here again if we go back to Kissimmee

Reviews.Title: “Bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: ReneandAlison
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at this hotel for three nights on part of a USA tour. It was the worst of all the hotels we stayed at. Not for its locality or facilities but for its poor poor customer services. They only booked us in for 2 nights when the booking was for 3. After arriving back at 11pm and being locked out of my room, the last thing I needed was to deal with a liar. I went to reception to see why I was locked out and they said the booking was only for 2 nights. I disagreed as I had checked my voucher 500 times before I left home. I asked him to check again. The guy went out back for all of about 10 secs and said that he had spoken to the manager and they had looked at the voucher again and it was definately only 2 nights. I told him he was wrong and asked him to show me the voucher so I could see for myself. He went out back again and after about 5 minutes came back to say there was a mistake and I was booked for 3 nights afterall. No apologies. My main problem with all of this was the lies they told me. I can understand that mistakes happen, but why lie about it. I made a complaint which fell on deaf ears, so I made another complaint via there online website. This person again made ecxuses rather than deal with my complaint which was the liars at reception. What do they care really if one guy kicks up a stink. There were a few other things that rubbed me the wrong way, like trying to sign you up to a time share convention for cheap disney tickets, without telling you it was a timeshare seminar. Lucky I read the fine print back in my room. The internet room only had one computer which worked. No time limit so some people were there for hours. You get what you pay for I guess. If you are going to Orlando for disney which I guess most are, pay the few dollars extra and stay at a disney resort, there isnt much in it really. Thats what I am doing next year when I go back. Overall I was disappointed and wont go there again. I probably wont stay at best western again because of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kerensa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks - had to swap rooms the first night because of ants! After that we had no problems at all, the room was cleaned daily and was functional - you are only sleeping in it - the safe , fridge and coffee machine was great. Breakfast - great value for money - only went elsewhere once and it was not as good Location - very close to Animal Kingdom - use Sherbeth Road and you will be there in minutes. Good restaurants in walking distance ie cracker barrel, red lobster, and carrabbas(?) Staff very friendly and a well stocked shop. Lovely pools with loads of loungers and towels for you to use.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: plastic orange
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel from 24th September to 3rd October as part of a 3 week tour of San Frincisco, Vegas and Orlando, and chose it on the basis of reviews on trip advisor. We were familiar with the area, so knew the location which is as good as you will get with regard to getting around the various attractions. Our arrival at the check in was quite late at night, and the girl on the desk was chatty and friendly, and when we asked for a quiet room, she said the one we were given met that criteria. When we arrived at the room, we noticed an array of beach towels on the verranda, indicating to us that the adjoining rooms were occupied with families. We decided not to unpack until morning to see what noise level was like, and sure enough, it started at 7 30 with kids running around, Adults out smoking etc etc. We then went back to reception and asked for another room in a quiet area, and the girl on the desk said that she would give us another room no bother, but could not guarantee it would be quiet. Considering that the Hotel was at about 10% capacity I don't think our request was too difficult to meet, but I do understand that they like to concentrate occupancy to facilitate room service etc. However, we got a room at the opposite side of the complex overlooking a Minor road (traffic was very light), and this proved fine. Families adjacent to us were probably just more considerate than the first room (a problem we have found worldwide nowadays). Rooms are typical of this type of Hotel, and had all the ammenities you would expect. The second room also appeared to have been refurbished and was nicer than the first. Air conditioning is always noisy in Hotels (we are not really used to it, coming from the UK, so we probably notice it more), but it worked as required. Housekeeping was a bit haphazard, with minimal soap/shampoo etc left for our use (rectified by call to front desk), The surrounding grounds of the Hotel were very pleasing to the eye, and were very well maintained, as were the pools and their deck areas. Due to the time of year, we never saw the Tiki bar opened (in our pool area), but there was a bar and dining area in the main building. We used the bar on an almost nightly basis, and the barman Petre was a great asset to the property, being both friendly and welcoming. With so many nearby restaurants to choose from, we only ever used the pizza hut for occasional snacks, so I cannot comment on the other eating establishments within the Hotel, but there were numerous pleasant eating areas that we saw. Overall I would recommend this Hotel to anyone, but it has the potential to be quite noisy if inconsiderate guests are present. Generally Orlando was as we expected (have been holidaying there for 12 years), but we did notice a slow down in new building work, and the demolition of older (not that old) shopping areas. On our second last day we visited the Disney town of Celebration, where within 20 minutes of arriving I got a parking ticket, for parking 'left wheel to kerb' - perfectly ok in the UK, and judging by other cars parked the same way, a lucrative earner for Osceola county - be warned the Sherriff cares not a jot for obvious tourists (letter of complaint sent as I couldn't even contest an incorrectly completed parking ticket, so had to pay over the phone with credit card). Pete and Linda Sinclair, Broughty Ferry, Scotland.

Reviews.Title: “Like a resort!”
Reviews.Author: gilmangirl
Reviews.Content: The prices are excellent for a resort-like stay- I couldnt beleive it when they had a restaurant on site, full bar, tiki hut bars at pool, convenient store , breakfast buffet restaurant ALL ON THE property! You dont have to go anywhere- we often go just to hang out by the pool and spend evenings at the outdoor tiki bar. Its very nice- I wouldnt hesitate to reserve a room here if your looking-

Reviews.Title: “cheap price and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: matsMontreal
Reviews.Content: very cheap price for a good value hotel. The hotel is very close to walt disney 10 min, universal 20-25 min. The hotel room is standard but we were only there for sleeping( too much thing too do). nice pool. store, restaurant are all around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but...”
Reviews.Author: Tomzie
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staf at the front desk. My room was clean but it was not the room that I booked. I had booked a poolside room but instead I got a room facing the parking lot. Besides this, sleep was a big problem: The Airco makes a terrible sound, so we had to shut it down every night. Luckuly the airco works fine over the day, so it was possible to sleep in a cool room. So whats the problem? Across the parking lot they do the laundry, I could hear the machines, laundry cars etc... So be aware of this! Another problem was the bathroom: it's not separate true a door or something. So you have zerro privacy. I had to wash myself in the small room where I could find the shower and toilets. It was verry inconvenient. But hey not everything is bad: it's close to the disney parks and you can find foods, shops just outside of your room. Overall this hotel is just good for some sleep (if you get some) and the prices are fair. Good budget hotel I think.

Reviews.Title: “Makes for a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: SunshineSeeker19
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed at the Best Western Lakeside for two weeks last year. The hotel was in the center of plenty of great buffet restaurants at brilliant prices, I would recommend Sizzler's and Pon de Rosa which are right next to it. There is also a crazy golf course across the road and plenty of shops nearby. The hotel is only about 5 minutes from disney and about ten minutes from universal and seaworld. The hotel offers free drinks for under sixteens and the great thing was, the pool doesn't close until 11 o clock, so we just bought some drinks and sat by the pool in the evenings after eating. There is also a games arcade on sight and a mini golf course. Some nights we went to shows and I really loved the dixie stampede, which had great entertainment and delicious food. We also went to the pirates dinner and show and altough I enjoyed myself, none of the rest of my family of seven did. I did agree with them though that the food was not very nice. It was lively and fun though so if you're thinking of going don't let this put you off because everyone has different opinions. The rooms at the hotel were not luxurious but they were clean, comfortable and nicely decorated. I would certainly recommend this hotel and go back again.

Reviews.Title: “It is only a 2/3 star but its nice.”
Reviews.Author: ukUk
Reviews.Content: I was so concerned when I read the mixed reviews for this hotel after I had booked that I wrote to the hotel. They were very helpful, returned my e-mail within minutes and said they were in the process of updating their rooms and would check us into one of those. On arrival I was a little disappointed, the lobby was untidy, the paintwork to the room shabby and the whole place looked quite rundown. I was however very happy with our room, it was really comfortable, housekeeping was excellent and it was very quiet. I didn't try the restaurants in the hotel as there are so many good places nearby and my one visit to the pool was ok. Basically this is a 2/3 star hotel. If you are a family on a budget it is ideal. If you, like us, are more concerned with seeing Disney than having a luxury room it is for you. Steer clear if you like upmarket hotels however, you will be disappointed. Restaurants nearby which we enjoyed are Red Lobster-opposite and Denny's for breakfast. Dont forget Walgreens opposite and Winn Dixy over the road for all the groceries. We found the fruit quite nice from Winn Dixy and a healthy alternative to all the American junk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: SERAB
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in late August 2007. I highly recommend this hotel to other travelers. We had a clean room, polite staff and it was very quiet. We came and went to the parks, etc., each day and came back to a clean room. Every request we had (extra towels or what ever) was met. We've stayed in other places with bad plumbing and noisy neighbors. There were no issues for us to complain about. The hotel has a nice restaurant and clean pool areas.

Reviews.Title: “Really got my money's worth!”
Reviews.Author: Annekoco
Reviews.Content: I was rather pleasantly surprised when I got the Best Western thru Priceline for $25/night. I had asked for a 1* for that price but got this hotel as an immediate upgrade which is a 2* instead. Reception and check in was easy and pleasant. Very nice, large, clean room with 2 queen size beds and all the basic amenities - TV, hairdryer, iron +ironing board, and refrigerator. Outside entrance to the room which I first thought would be noisy but it was quite quiet and convenient as I parked right outside the door to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as expected -- good value for the price.”
Reviews.Author: cdmillen
Reviews.Content: For price to value, this hotel met our needs. We were using the hotel to eat breakfast, sleep, swim at night, and an occassional swim during an afternoon sojourn from a Disney day. Buffet breakfast is good -- omeletes and fresh fruit excellent. The waitresses for bfast were friendly and quick. Kids under 12 eat free with paying adult. The room was average, beds were firm (good), fridge worked well. The shower made a squealing sound and the safe was broken. But these were minor annoyances -- I used the hotel safe for my laptop. The three pools were nicely secluded away from the Irlo Bronson highway and the landscaping surrounding the pool areas is pretty with big palm trees. Not having a whirlpool was something I weighed when booking and in the end decided was something that did not matter much. And it didn't. My kids enjoyed the game room every day. I used the concierge/ticket service to order some of my DWorld tickets and this worked fine. Our room was not poolside facing nor highway facing, and it was quiet which was very good for us. After reading some reviews from this site, I was a little apprehensive about this hotel, but it worked out fine and the price is right. Also, being close to Walgreens was helpful to us and the location is roughly 15 minutes to Disney. Also plenty or restaurants on Irlo Bronson Hway.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Joolsleeds
Reviews.Content: Best Western Lakeside is a great 'motel style' hotel in the Formosa Gardens area of Kissimmee. It's a fab location, just 6 miles away from Animal Kingdom, and about 8 miles away from the other Disney parks. Always use the Sherberth Road route, it's so much better than the 192 route. It's about a 30 minute drive away from Universal & SeaWorld. We have stayed at the BW before when it was a La Quinta, and it's clear that they have spent money on tidying the place, with all gardened areas etc nice and tidy. The check in process was easy - no timeshare offers for us - though we did book direct from the UK. The bar and shop were fine, we did not bother dining in the restaurant for breakfast. The room was clean, tidy and functional. If you are looking for fancy hotel rooms then avoid. If, however, you want a room that will be a good base for your Theme park trips, then you can't choose better than here. We did not experience any noise or any other inconvenience while we stayed - we were there for 3 weeks, and the hotel was full. The pools were never too busy, and plent of towels were provided. There is a Pizza Hut on site, and a Wendys and Walgreens in the car lot. Over the 192, there is a TGI, Red Lobster, Subway, Indian Restaurant, buffet places and an Outback (our favourite!) We would return, without any doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Disney experience”
Reviews.Author: xyling
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised. We had a twin room with two double beds...spacious...but small shower room. Good to have a mini-safe in the room to store all our important stuff. One night we had leakage in our toilet, and we were promptly "upgraded" - i doubt it was really an upgrade though cos i preferred our 1st room - we had to carry our own suitcases...plus the safe wasn't working in the new room...there was no difference in our 'upgraded' room...maybe they lied? Anyway, it was good having a 24 hr Walgreens just round the corner. There is stuff to do around the hotel - lotsa touristy shops (nothing fab to buy tho) - mini golf - lotsa restaurants. ONly thing we didnt like was that free buses to Disneyland had rubbish pickup times (sometimes before the final fireworks show)... But I would recommend staying there as it's relatively cheap

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: AirPirate
Reviews.Content: Went to Orlando area for my graduation back in May, my wife and I stayed in one room, my parents in another. The rooms were VERY nice, well air-conditioned, and quite comfortable. The grounds were well-kept and definitely had a family-oriented (in other words "safe", a plus in the not-so-upscale Kissimmee area) feel. The only two drawbacks were checking in and out. Upon check-in, we were accosted by a timeshare salesman (at 10pm, no less!), whom we had to repeatedly inform that we had no interest in getting a timeshare. The second is the hidden charges this hotel throws in. For instance, there's an in-room safe that we used, and the fine print states that there will be a "nominal" charge for its use. Turns out they tacked an extra $20 on our bill for using it! In addition, I booked the room with an AAA discount, but since I failed to produce it upon check-in (they didn't ask), the rate reverted to the standard. All in all, I ended up paying about $60 more than I was quoted. So, I do recommend the hotel, but do watch out for the above mentioned pitfalls and you'll be alright.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget stay with a few extras”
Reviews.Author: askmeanything
Reviews.Content: We booked through Virgin. Check in was fine although they did not honor any best western reward points as i had booked through Virgin so that was annoying. We requested a room near the pool and lobby and we had a fab location right next to the pool. The rooms are basic , quite large. They had the usual chewy carpet.I always wonder why Florida does not like tiling in the hot climate...carpets are always a dirtier option. Small bathroom but when you come here..its just a base anyway. Walgreens next door was a lifesaver. dad cut his arm open on the first night and my feet literally fell apart after pushing a wheelchair around the parks and Walgreens had everything to bandage us up and keep us going. Cheap drinks and snacks too...ATM etc. Over the road is Formosa Gardens shopping centre....subway and Publix supermarket which was fab. TGI fridays aswell and that was gorgeous. Mind you I even enjoyed the Baked potatoes with brocolli and cheese sauce from Wendys next door so I am easily pleased. Breakfast in the hotel is not as good as elsewhere and more expensive plus they craftily added items we didnt have at least 4 times. We went to Golden Corral for breakfast...ok we`re British and we are not put off by hoards of people scambling over a buffet. i have been to several buffets and several GC`s , but this branch is very good , very clean and hot food. Ponderosa has dipped in quality in the past few years and we ate at sizzlers and it was horrible . The pool at the hotel was fine until june 1st when they turned the heat off. the water did sting my eyes though. The shuttles are fantastic but sometimes very busy so standing may happen , but it is not far to go. They were very helpful with the wheelchair etc. We also got a local lynx bus down to the Old town which was ok...good car show in the evenings. From there you can get the 56 bus to Disney if you accidentally miss the shuttle....the stop is opposite the Old town sling shot ride. I would recommend this hotel to everyone wanting a cheaper option with a great location...no need to drive if you do not want to.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: magical127
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect budget hotel. It isn't the 4 Seasons but it's much nicer than the average 2-star, or even some 3-stars. Check-in was smooth, our main/only complaint was that we were on the second floor and there aren't any elevators, so we had to lug our luggage up a flight of stairs. We got this room from Priceline for $25 per night so in all fairness, that was really the least of our worries. The room was nothing spectacular but nice, very clean, well-maintained, had everything expected of it (a microwave would've been nice, but at least we had a fridge). Bathroom was very clean, hot water never ran out, we couldn't hear the neighbors when inside the room (though we did request a quiet area, maybe that helped). Beds were fine, toiletries were provided, housekeeping was excellent. There is a pool and other amenities there but we didn't visit them so can't comment. You are about a 5-minute drive to the entrance to Disney World. You're in tourist haven so there's any number of gift shops, other stores (including a Nike outlet store, which proved most helpful when my ankle blew out day 1 and had to run there to buy a decent pair of new sneakers) and restaurants at your disposal within a 1-mile radius, and a Walgreens is directly next door to the hotel, which is very handy. They sell discounted tickets to the Disney parks in the hotel lobby and have tons of maps and brochures and whatnot, both in the lobby and in your room to help you find your way. This is the perfect economy hotel for your next WDW vacation!

Reviews.Title: “It's a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeteM11
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at this hotel for 2 weeks. I had 2 rooms, 1 for me and the other half plus 1 for the boys; it was clean, tidy and well kept. Yes, the maid put the envelope on the lamp each day (is one supposed to tip every day - sod that!), no she didn't vacuum every day (do you do that at home?) but the room was tidied, the bed made and even the toilet paper was folded to a point (why do they do that?). Some of the hotel reception staff (receptionist "J") would have trouble spelling their own name, but this added to the charm and a bit of sport timing it so that the others in the queue got her! I went with this hotel because of the feedback from this site (thanks TripAdvisor) and would be happy to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant holiday”
Reviews.Author: Whitetigerlilley
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with the hotel and by the size of the room, it was more like an apartment. the room had a fridge and a safe & also a ice machine near by. The room was kept very clean & tidy. The hotel was near to the main attractions and walking distance to lots of restaurant. The hotel had a pizzahut which was handy after a long day when you cant be bothered to go out. The hotel was just what we wanted and we had a brilliant holiday. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just a 2 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: Datura
Reviews.Content: I booked Best West Lakeside after reading many positive reviews here but unfortunately this place is just a 2 stars at best. The Room: The main problem was the housekeeping. Our room was dirty. There was dust and long hair everywhere and the carpet was absolutely disgusting. Also, I could hear the maids and people walking outside even with the a/c on. Speaking of the a/c unit, it was VERY noisy and it leaked in our room so the carpet was wet near the entrance. Some previous reviewers also said the bathroom was very small and the room was dark and it is true. The Staff: People at the front desk were nice, even the pushy people who sell Disney tickets. I told them I was not interested and they didn't bother me afterwards. The Shuttle (Disney Park & Universal Studios): Avoid the shuttle! Sometimes it was full and people had to stand even though I was told prior to booking that they would send another shuttle if it was full. Other days they were late (15 minutes and more) so you really couldn't count on those people though I found them to be very nice. Also the shuttle schedule didn't make much sense to me. The shows at MGM and Epcot are at 9PM but the shuttle leaves those parks at 8:00 and 8:15 PM. You can always stay and then use Disney's transportation system to catch the bus at the Ticket Center but we did it once and we missed the hotel shuttle by 1 minute and had to pay $25 for a taxi to get back to the hotel. The Food: I only tried the onsite Pizza Hut twice and I found a LONG HAIR in my pizza the second time I went there. The guy apologized and gave me another one with free bread sticks which I appreciated but I really didn't feel like going back after this incident. There are plenty of restaurants nearby anyway. The Pools: There's 3 pools but one of them is very small. I enjoyed the 2 other pools but sometimes it was too crowded. I was glad our room wasn't near one of the pools cause it would've been very noisy. And for some odd reasons they only had a few parasols. Perhaps people steal them, I dunno. Finally I absolutely loved Walt Disney World and Universal Studios & Island of Adventure. I also went to Clearwater, Soto Park, and Daytona but beware, there are many bad drivers in Florida. Be very careful if you drive or even try to cross a street. Going to Taco Bell near the hotel was 100 times scarier than Disney's Tower of Terror. LOL

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.........just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Idunnit1
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews on this site before we left and there was some things to worry about. Now after we have been there it is clear there is nothing to worry about. The reviews I read concerned small details like very poor quality rooms........but our one was ideal. I also read the hotel staff were rude and the ticketeers were annoying and taking no for an answer........we found the staff were helpfull and polite........the ticket sales staff.......well we said no when we first arrived and then they left us alone no problem. If we wanted pizza then we just went down to the restaurant and got it there......they were busy but we got what we wanted no worries. To be honest we found no faults with the hotel..........it was about the standard we expected which was good. The pool was great and uncrowded......we couldnt keep our son out of it. The location was good as there is plenty of shops and restaurants nearby. The only problem we had was the free shuttle.........it was free but about 40 people try to cram onto a 20 seater bus.........not good.........and they only did one run per day..........it was like a 12 hour day at the parks and no guarantee you would get picked up........we decided to use cabs instead but they were expensive...........$35 to universal, $30 sea world, $18 disney world etc etc.......(all prices are one way). I mean the shuttle takes you to sea world for 8 am but the first show is 11.30 am............?.............on the bright side the shuttle to bush gardens is fantastic........good times and a guaranteed seat on the bus........well worth it. We had a great holiday overall and would like to thank best western for there part of our holiday.........If anyone has any questions then please dont hesitate to ask......just send me an e-mail on gordon.oag1@orange.net and I will e-mail you back no worries.

Reviews.Title: “housekeeping was awful”
Reviews.Author: jack619
Reviews.Content: The staff when we tried to order pizza were very rude.My husband was calling in our order the woman put the phone down and told someone else"Can you talk to this dude I can't handle this right know"? Then we didn't leave a tip the first night because it wasn't clean.The cleaning staff put the tip envelope on our lamp.I guess so we would not miss the chance of paying her for her poor service! They didn't fully make the beds,or vaccum,she didn't even go so far as to put the toilt paper on the dispencer????Yet she had the nerve to ask for the tip.Also the discount tickets they claim to have ---They are TIMESHARES,In order to save the money on the tickets you have to do this scam thing.Honestly if you had a good time here that is great for you.My family doesn't share your opinion.I know you get what you pay for,but staying in a clean hotel with nice people should be a given no matter how much you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: nikegirl2k7
Reviews.Content: staying in this hotel was a real treat, all staff were friendly. My family and I have been raving about this hotel to all our friends and we are planning on going to stay in the hotel again next year. The pool wasn't overcrowded and the bar staff in hurricaine sams were friendly and made our stay very welcoming. i recommend this hotel to family's and also small groups. If you want a clean hotel with friendly staff then lakeside is perfect for you. the rooms were kept spotless and the cleaning staff were friendly. great restaurants within walking distance and good bargain souvenier shopping within the vacinity of the hotel. perfect location for visiting Disney theme parks

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is OK for the money, but not all the rooms are OK.”
Reviews.Author: Discounthunter
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room at this hotel a few days before arriving in early June. I reserved a regular room for two adults with two beds at a rate of $55.20/night. When my travel companion and I got to the hotel very early in the morning and entered the room we were given we were not very happy. The room was not the dirtiest I have seen, but the carpet was very worn out. We asked to see another room at the same rate and again we were not satisfied. We ended up going to another hotel we read about online, the AmeriHost Inn, to see if they had better rooms. Well after that hotel showed us a room full of bugs, we ended up racing back to get a room at this Best Western. When we returned the nice young lady at the front desk, I believe her name is Amanda, ended up upgrading us to a pool view room for the same price as the regular room and this time the room was clean. Kissimmee is not the fun and resort like area it is advertised to be. Based on how many of the other hotels in the area looked from the outside, I think this Best Western is really as good as it gets for Kissimmee. If I were to come back to the Disney area I would probably spend the extra money to stay at on of the resort hotels in one of the theme parks. I think especially if traveling with kids, staying in Kissimmee just takes away from the fun of an Orlando theme park vacation. The hotel also charges a $3.50 resort fee, so I ended up paying $58.70/night before taxes. I also want to add that at times the people at the front desk were not very helpful, although the girl that checked us in, Amanda, was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western”
Reviews.Author: cvandenbraak
Reviews.Content: Best Western was fine. Check-in was quick and rooms were found clean. Housekeeper cleaned room daily. Pools were clean and uncrowded. Fitness room was sufficient for the several days I as there. Buffet breakfast was good, uncrowded with prompt service. The only negative item is the noisy air conditioner. But after one night I was either very tired or used to it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice For The Price”
Reviews.Author: randy4cc
Reviews.Content: It was about as rated.The room was roomy and clean as was the pool..It would have been nice if someone spoke English but I'm guessing it's that way at every motel in that area.Room service forgot soap one day and coffee cups another but for 3-3.5 stars it was fine , probably better than fine at the rate I received .I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasure to Stay here. Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Bob_Swingin
Reviews.Content: Superb! Great Facility/Great Location. You will find yourself perfectly situated to highway 4 so-as to reach every tourist destination/attraction. We Ate our way through Florida!___Whether it be Breakfast/Lunch/Dinner/or middle of the night snack, you will find a grand number of choices. I remember commenting a few times to my wife "Florida must be built on Restaurants". A true joy for someone like me that absolutely Loves Food :-) The Hotel itself had air conditioning that worked perfectly. We were always glad to come home to a very cool room when being in the hot florida sun all day. The room smelled fresh, the carpet was clean, all the perks were there...from a coffee pot, a safe anchored to the floor (one in which you choose the combination) to keep your valuables in, tv w/good cable choices, blow-dryer, clean towels which were plentiful, and there was PLENTY of hot water at all times of the day. The staff at the hotel were always courteous, including a "good morning" or a "hope you enjoyed your day" from anyone you passed. Guest Laundry on the site was clean and everything worked well, priced reasonable, and not crowded. The restaurant in the lobby was a great value. A buffet that was full of choices and eggs cooked to your request in minutes. Fresh Fruit and the areas were clean and maintained well. Game room was a joy for my teenagers, and they visited it often. The Internet signal (we requested wireless) was very strong and speeds were as fast as my cable at home. You will be satisfied in this regard. VALUE: Absolutely a great value. The Best Western Lakeside is one I would return to without worry of it repeating the same performance I received in this trip. Book it. :-) Thanks for reading my review. Bob

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrbridger
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the best western from 11-18th june and have nothing but praise for it. reception staff always friendly and very helpful. Rooms clean and tidy and the shuttle buses to the parks were always right on time both going and picking up from the parks. The hotel also has the added bonus of being a pickup point for the busch gardens shuttle. Plenty to do outside the hotel as well with mini golf and restaurants. Would highly recommend a stay there

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: steedge
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 weeks at this hotel. Great Location for all the main attractions. Room clean and comfortable and serviced daily with clean towels if required. As with other reviews the reception staff were competent but not overly helpful or friendly but as we only needed their advice once it was not a problem. Dont buy your tickets from reception as it will include a tour of another complex and the deal you get will not be great no matter what they tell you! We got our tickets from the Official Ticket Centre 5mile drive away for cheaper prices, better offers and they even delivered them to the hotel for $5 within 30mins. Would use this hotel again if returning.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliiant hotel”
Reviews.Author: rufuscrewe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western for 2 weeks from the 24th May, the hotel is great, a really good location on the 192, 10 mins from Disney and really easy to get to. The hotel has 3 pools we only used the one pool, there is a gym and a launderette, the all you can eat buffet breakfast was fab! loads to choose from and really good. One of the best things I thought was that the rooms were cleaned every day, fresh towels, beds made, soap and shampoo left. The staff were really friendly and helpful. We stayed in Block 5 which was at the back and it was really quiet, the air conditioning was a bit noisy but we didn't use it all the time. There is a Walgreens next to the hotel which sells most things and across the road there is a Red Lobster and The Golden Corrall!!! fabulous I have never seen so much food in my life!!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone really good value for money and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “super clean and family oriented”
Reviews.Author: coop3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the motel for 8 days and had no problems at all, the rooms were kept very clean, the pools were very clean, theres a walgreens right next door that was very convienient theres alot of restaurants and shopping close by. its a very nice motel and we will definately stay there again...the pools were not crowded at all, you can play minature golf, the staff was very friendly, they have shuttles that take you right to the parks, over all this is a great motel, we booked through hotwire and got a good deal on motel and flight, give it a try you wont be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Grounds are beautiful”
Reviews.Author: DisneynutsNG
Reviews.Content: We stayed May 10/07 for one week. Room was very clean and the grounds were beautiful. Two pools were great not crowded at all. We are very picky when it comes to a clean room and the maids were great lots of clean towels and extra soap & shampoo. Sherberth Road not far down will take you right to Animal Kingdom or if you turn right it will take you to the other parks just follow the well marked signs. we found it really convenient and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Well Done Best Western”
