Reviews.Author: RHILLSouthWalesUk
Reviews.Content: I have to say my wife and I arrived at Best Western Lakeside on May 4 2007 and after staying at Villas and various other hotels over the years, this has to be one of the cleanest places we have ever stayed. For what the cost of the holiday was it just had to be the best value for money. The hotel and the grounds were clean also they had busy areas and quiet areas all depends in which block you stayed. Ideal for families with kids but also areas where it is quiet and peaceful. Checking in or out NO PROBLEM. The boiler broke down in our block so no hot water but no trouble with the hotel management, they contacted the customers and asked to move them, none of this fuss of going to the desk to complain. In all fairnes, they were brilliant. After staying in Kissimmee on many, many occasions I would certainly use this hotel again, no problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect mix of Affordability, Comfort and Location”
Reviews.Author: k0z
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was pleasantly surprising. It was close to everything yet not right in the middle of the traffic. It was clean and comfortable, family oriented. It was not high end but not low end either - right in the middle. If you book early the price is more than right - $45 a night for us. 2 pools, Game room, mini-golf, restaurants, shuttle to all the parks, discounted attraction tickets. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convinenent Location, Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianVet
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Best Western Lakeside for 10 days early in May. We chose this hotel because of the previous reviews and because we are students (ie, on a strict budget). This hotel was everything we expected and more! Check-in was quick and easy, and the room was large and clean. The best part of the hotel was the location - close to the theme parks, but also right beside a 24 hour Walgreens where we purchased water/snacks for a really good price. There were also many restaurants (both fast food and sit-down) within a few minutes walk. The buffet breakfast was good - enough of a variety that we were not sick after 10 days of eating it. The best part was, we ate a lot in the morning so that we didn't need to eat much at the theme parks (where it is expensive!), and when we got back at night we could just go to a restaurant within a few minutes. Having been to Orlando only once when I was young, I wasn't sure what to expect with the shuttles. It was better than I had hoped for. Shuttles departed daily and at multiple times in the morning to each of the theme parks. They also picked up at different theme parks at different times at night, usually enough to get a full day in. If you don't like the pick up/drop off time, here's a tip - take whatever shuttle you want to Disney, then use Disney's free inner transportation to go to whatever theme park you choose. Doing this, we were able to see Illuminations (the firework show) at Epcot and make it back to the Magic Kingdom in time to catch a late shuttle. The only shuttle where this is not possible is the one to Universal studios/Sea World, but it does give you enough time to have a full day in, and there is always lots of shopping in that area if you tire of the theme park. If you don't mind a bit of waiting sometimes, you don't need to rent a car at this hotel, which saved us a LOT of money. The staff was fairly friendly, although we did not deal much with them as we had no complaints. The beds are a little uncomfy, and the air conditioner a little loud, but after a day walking around Disney, you can sleep through anything! If you are a budget traveller, or one who does not need all the fancy frills of an expensive hotel, I would recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good standard budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: corneliusp
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for a fortnight. didnt have any problems. rooms were basic but clean. bathroom was small but more than adequate. this is not your average mediteranean hotel. the rooms have no balconies or patios.but as you are not in the room much this doesnt matter. fridge was large enough to keep the beer,coke and to cool some water.safe was a nice size to keep everything.pool and area was fine. didnt eat at the hotel at all so cant comment on food. yes there is a $3.50 per night resort fee.but this is less than you would pay for a safe in most european hotels so didnt bother argueing abt it. yes would stay at this hotel again. paul

Reviews.Title: “Great times!”
Reviews.Author: DutchieNS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Lakeside from April 26 to May 2 and we had a very good time! We were in the 14 block, overlooking the pool. We had a room with a kingsize bed, sofa and fairly sized fridge. The bathroom wasn't very spacious, but what more do you need than a shower and toilet? A large counter with sink was just outside of the bathroom. Airco worked well, but was a bit noisy. Cleaning was very good and in-room safe was large enough to stow everything from tickets/passports to videocamera. The pool was lovely, though a bit cold. Very convenient to have pool towels at the pool and there were plenty! Poolbar is also a nice touch. We also really enjoyed the location. Close to all the themeparks, but not as expensive. On hwy. 192 (W. Irlo Bronson) there are many reataurants and we walked to the restaurants like Denny's, Sizzler, T.G.I. Friday's and Golden Corral. Also loads of souvenir shops with Disney and Sea World items for a lot less money! When we ever return to Florida, this would be my choice again!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: AguilanTravellers
Reviews.Content: this hotel is far better than we expected its a bit difficult to find your way round the maze of room blocks but you soon learn your route the rooms are clean and large The Airconditioners are new but a bit loud for sleeping The grounds and pools are all clean and tidy One thing to note if you cant walk up to the first floor make sure you get a ground floor room

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well kept, but if you are in a noisy block ask to be moved!!!”
Reviews.Author: Merlemad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Best Western Lakeside March April 07. Situated perfectly for the parks, nice clean rooms, small bathroom but adequate and clean. Towels changed daily, rooms cleaned daily...no complaints. We were in a noisy block the first couple of nights and it was HELL....young adults racing around slamming doors etc until 3am!!! When we complained we were moved with no fuss (and they did all our moving) all we did was pack up....the new block was much quieter...but by design you do find noise travels and if you have neighbours who think nothing about their neighbours..you will suffer...bathroom vents back onto terrace other side so noise does carry. However, apart from that no complaints at all and to be fair....you cant really compensate for inconsiderate people no matter where you stay. Pizza hut onsite was great value and yes as another has already commented...we thought the gator was a wind up,,,,but no,,,they really are in there and we too have the pics!!! All you can eat chinese buffet across the lake made a change from the usual burgers and steaks......so why not give it a try!!! :-) all in all great value, a good position, ideal for the parks the shops and places to eat...BOB EVANS being our favourite....same as last year. We had a couple of occasions to call for security (problem with a lock and the safe) both times they were there before we had time to put the phone back on the receiver...ok slightly longer...but only slightly. Pools were immaculately kept, as were the gardens etc..paintwork well maintained...paths etc clean and tidy....would go there again. Thanks Best Western!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: rubyroo22
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a perfect hotel for me and my daughter. We were only there for 3 nights and really only slept and showered there. I thought the location was nice too...we had a rented car though. Wake up, go straight to the buffet (free for kids), back to the room, shower and off to disneyworld!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Clean but two frustating areas of concern”
Reviews.Author: trollking
Reviews.Content: My overall view of the hotel is a very frustrating one. Its not a bad hotel by any means but with two changes this hotel would not only be ideal but an excellent choice for anyone stopping in the Kissimmee area. Its good value for money and I hope the hotel takes a note of what i say and acts upon them. Firstly the good points, check in went very smoothly and we were given various vouchers as we booked through Virgin which we could use at the restaurants and allowed the children to eat and drink for free. The two rooms we had over looking the lake were very nice containing two queen beds, safe, television, telephone, fridge and bathroom (small). The room was cleaned daily and the cleaning staff for our room 254 were helpful and good at their job. The grounds were quite well kept as was the pool and miniature golf area. The breakfast buffet was also excellent, lots of choice and nice food. Two major annoying bad points. The shuttle to the parks. The shuttle only runs and returns from the hotel to each park once a day . One day it rained after we arrived at Magic Kingdom and had to wait another 8 hours for the bus or get a taxi. We grabbed a taxi but in my opinion the shuttle should run and return to each park at least twice a day. Also there is absolutely no queuing system for the shuttle, it is just a complete “free for all”, whether you have been waiting 20 minutes or 2 minutes when the shuttle arrives everyone rushes forward and gets on. Very annoying especially with children. The other annoying area is the service in Hurricane Sam’s restaurant. It is very very understaffed, sometimes you can wait 40 minutes to get your food. If you are lucky enough to get Eddy then you are in good hands. If there were another 5 of him then im sure that the problem would be solved, he deserves a pay rise and promotion. Other staff in the restaurant got the orders mixed up or on one occasion completely wrong, even when ordering coke (not diet coke ……… agggghhh). I guess you have to weigh up the cost saved against a hotel within Disney World Resort. For our two rooms we saved about £1000 by not staying on resort and staying at Best Western Lakeside. A side issue we saw sign saying “do not feed the alligators” on the fence surrounding the lake. We thought it was a wind up but it wasn’t see the pictures for proof.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Pond View”
Reviews.Author: tiv1099
Reviews.Content: We needed two rooms and something close to the attractions. The Best Western Lakeside provided those two things and not a whole lot more. The room rates were very reasonable for what you get and the location really nice. There is no lake but a dirty pond. The rooms were very basic, very loud toilet, and the bathroom in dire need of an update. We felt that the rooms were exactly how they should be for the price you pay and perfect for those only needing a place to sleep. The pool was nice and the pool bar and laundry room was a added plus. The problems that we had that we are very upset about was the staff. We went on the time share visit from the front desk because we were curious and we saved money on disney tickets. Don't purchase the time share! Anyway we purchased a two day ticket with the 3rd day either going to Pleasure Island or a water park for free. We went to Pleasure Island on the last night we were there and when we used our pass to get inside the clubs we were told that it was not valid. We explained to the person at the door what happened and he was very kind and gave us bracelets to get in all the clubs. The ticket was supposed to do that. We were leaving the next morning very early so I did not complain about that. Before leaving I asked the front desk person how to get to a rental car location and she said ask the other person, I have no clue what title she held but someone who is supposed to help you in whatever you needed. When I asked her, her response was, "It's in the airport because all rental car places are in the airport." I resonded with no it is not because we took a shuttle from the airport to this rental location. She then said "Well I dont know." What a worthless employee and a waste of space. If she can't even help me get somewhere when this is her job then what is she good for, NOTHING. Well, when the room rates are so cheap I guess the help will be on par with that. Good hotel to save money and sleep, just don't go near the filthy pond.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great people, great times”
Reviews.Author: PEIChris
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon. The staff was great, the pool was unbelievable, and the atmosphere was great. We did two parks and laid around the pool for most of the rest of the trip. We had a room overlooking the pool, which was the best part of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: kinburnont
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days and the hotel was super, it is large and very friendly. We had a room at the back and found it very quiet at night. Room has a fridge and a safe and was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “"Pinocchio" literally.”
Reviews.Author: caseyandshayne
Reviews.Content: We checked in on April 12th for 5 nights. Check in went quickly, we had to give a credit card for incidentals and they said they would only hold $20 on it. They told us to go to the booth next to them for a welcome package. The guy there gave us a little Disney memory book and then tried to get us to buy tickets. We stood there for about 15 minutes and after a while, he became pushy when we didn't want to buy the tickets as we already had some. The first day we had housekeeping come, when we got back, our door was left ajar. That made me a little uncomfortable, as I had a laptop and some other expensive things in the room. Early the next morning, we were woken to screaming from next door. The people were screaming at each other and it sounded like slapping also. I called the front desk to let them know (they didn't seem to care). I heard their phone ring a few minutes later and it went silent. A few minutes later, we heard a knock at our door. We stayed there. Another knock. My husband went to look and it was them at the door. That also made us uncomfortable. We were due to check out the next day, but our flight home got bumped back a few days, so I called the front desk to see if we could stay longer. They had a bit of a problem with that. At first, they said it was ok, that we could get the same rate for the three nights. We just had to go to the front desk and get our keys redone. When we got to the front desk, they said we were only there for one more night and not three. They said we could get the two nights after that for a much higher rate, and not the rate that they promised us. They told us they would check with the manager and let us know. We went to lunch after that. I booked a room at another Best Western closer to Disney so I could get my rate. When we got back to the room, there was a message saying that we were all set, we could stay one more night for our same rate. It was too late. We had already booked our room at the other Best Western. My husband happened to check his credit card and apparently, they tied up almost $300, when they were only supposed to use $20. That went our whole vacation. When he called the front desk, the person there said that he would call the credit card company and have those funds released and then call us back. We never got a phone call. Towards the end of our stay, the housekeeping staff got sloppy. The first day we had our room cleaned, they put soap and everything neatly in a folded towel on a soap dish on the sink. The second day, it wasn't in a towel. The third day, it was thrown all over the sink. Today was the day that we checked out. My husband called his credit card company again and the funds were still tied up. I went to check us out of the room and they asked me if we were checking out early. I said no, they had only booked us for one more night (last night) because they couldn't get us the same rate. They didn't really say much after that. I checked out and asked them about my husband's credit card and the girl at the front desk said the funds should be released by midnight tonight. We'll see. I recommend not going to this hotel if you are on a budget. The front desk staff is fairly rude and lie to you, the ticket salespeople are very pushy, and housekeeping leaves your door unlocked. Don't leave valuables in your room.

Reviews.Title: “very good, AM staff UNFRIENDLY”
Reviews.Author: jenc36
Reviews.Content: Arrived late at night and check in was very quick and friendly. The room was spacious and very clean. Air conditioning was a bit noisy, but not too bad. The room was cleaned daily, we asked for extra pillows and received them quickly. The pool was very clean and had great hours. Pizza hut on grounds was a fun option with the kids, they estimated a 30 minute wait for our order, it was only about 10. Staff was friendly there and in the small shop. Staff in the evening and afternoon were friendly and helpful. The AM staff was not, they were surly and seemed put off by questions about directions, etc. Biggest complaint was the AM staff, overall- it is a very clean, well maintained hotel. We would stay again as it is a great location for Disney parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: enjoylifeOttawa
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Best Western Lakeside in Kissimmee, Florida. The hotel is a great value for the money. The grounds are very well kept. The employess were working hard at keeping it that way. This is a large property, which makes you feel far enough from the main road. We asked for a pool side view room on the second floor and got our wishes. The pools (3 of them) are very clean and heated. Lots of chairs and towels available. This hotel is situated very close to all the main attractions. Lots of restaurant, small shops within a walking distance. A 24 hrs Walgreen pharmacy is located right next to the hotel. The room was spacious and very clean. The toilet was defective twice, and when we called, they came right away to fix it. The hotel staff is very friendly and polite. One salesman (they call themselves customer representative and are offering welcome package) became pushy and argumentative when we didn't fall for his reduced tickets prices on the condition of sitting though a 90 minutes time-share sales pitch at some remote location. I hate those. Our only complaint with the room was with the noisy air conditioning unit. Otherwise, this a very nice and safe hotel to reside. Excellent value for families. Restaurants and bar on site. Pizza Hut on site with take out option.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay...Not at all friendly”
Reviews.Author: menagon
Reviews.Content: I booked a last-minute trip to Disney World and found a great deal on this hotel. The property is reasonably maintained and the rooms are acceptably clean. However, the staff is exceptionally unfriendly and uncaring. But, if you just want a decent stay and are not worried about this, it's a good deal. Be warned that you will be charged a daily fee for use of the resort, although the resort seems to consist of a nice lake view, a good pool, and play items you can borrow from the front desk. Also, free wired internet access was included. This was a nice plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: msredbird51
Reviews.Content: We booked the Best Western for two nights via Hotwire for $49. I'm not sure there could be a better deal near Disney; especially in March. The complex is huge, with 15 buildings, so they should always have space. We didn't use them, but there is a mini-golf course and pools, so plenty of entertainment for the kids. The room was very clean and quiet. There is not a continental breakfast, but the free high-speed internet is nice. Traffic on 192 can be a bit heavy, but with a little planning ahead it's not a problem. The cheap price and proximity to Disney make it well worth the little bit of traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: BigMan99
Reviews.Content: Got a very good deal via Expedia. Hotel exceeded our expectations. It is located extremely well for the parks. Plenty of options for restaurants within a very short distance. The room was clean, spacious and serviced daily. Free wireless internet access available. I would definately recommend this hotel Our only suggestion is that you don't buy "discounted" Disney tickets from the desk - you will be persuaded to attend a time-share presentation that will waste the best part of 1/2 Day!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Buddy_Sina
Reviews.Content: Why do you book a stay at the Best Western? Because you expect to find decent - or better: above average - quality for little money. That is exactly what the Best Western in Kissimmee offers. The Hotels shows a little wear and tear in places but our room was spacious, clean and well worth the money. And we got exactly what we expected: a no frills Motel. The Restaurant area was a bit of a let down but since the adjacent highway offers legions of other places even in walking distance, this was of no concern to us. If you’re a traveller on a budget, this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Easy for Disney”
Reviews.Author: FiveTimesWinners
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via expedia.co.uk. Well located for Disney and good value for money. Useful to pay the extra for Breakfast as on day price is approx £4. Plenty of places to eat on road alongside hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: cannockcroc
Reviews.Content: Spent 8 days at the hotel from the end of February to 3rd of March. Room was comfortable with two twin beds, a fridge, TV, and room safe. The toilet cisterns have been fitted with a new flush mechanism that rattled loudly when used. We thought it was only our room but soon discovered that the noise came from every adjoining one. Cleaners changed towels and made beds every day during our stay. Grounds were clean and well maintained. There is a fitness room on site but it depends on the block you are in as to how easy it is to find. Food in the restaurant and breakfast area was disappointing and we only used each one once. The small shop was well stocked with a small range of goods. location is very good for those wishing to visit the parks and is near to a junction of the I4 and Turnpike. (There are roadworks in progress at the junction of the I4 that would appear to be major). Nearest shops are on the opposite side of the road from the hotel behind a miniature golf course and gift shop. There is a good selection of restaurants within easy reach. There are several good golf courses available. Mystic Dunes is a particularly good test (not suitable for high handicappers) but is expensive at $180. Take advantage of the time share presentation and negotiate a free game and attraction tickets.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Alohagirl72
Reviews.Content: Because of the positive reviews on this site, I thought that staying at the Best Western Lakeside would be a good idea, but we were a bit disappointed. Our room was clean (housekeeping does a great job) but the bathroom was so small and really rundown. Tile was falling off and it just really needed a remodel or something. The night staff was very helpful but we were a bit put-off when trying to buy tickets to Disneyworld at the desk in the morning. The guy that we talked to told us that we could only get the reduced price tickets if we went to a meeting where they tried to sell us a condo. We politely turned him down but he REALLY wanted us to go to this meeting and would not take no for an answer. We just ended up buying tickets at the park. Also, the transportation situation to Disney is a joke. The times that the hotel shuttle left the hotel for Animal Kingdom, Magic Kingdom, etc. did not coincide with the time that the park opened. One shuttle didn't even leave until 10:45 a.m. while the park opened at 9. Pickup was crazy since we all had to line up in the parking lot and wait for the shuttle to pick us up. When it did arrive, there were people already on it as the shuttle went to one park to pick up before they came to the next park to pick up. Honestly, next time I'll stay at Disneyworld in one of the value resorts instead of dealing with this transportation issue. It's really inconvenient, especially with little kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for DisneyWorld”
Reviews.Author: Shawn_Bob
Reviews.Content: Great for visiting Disney or Orlando parks. We stayed 5 nights and found it larger than expected, quiet and very friendly. There are no elevators for second floor but they give you an option for 1st floor. The room was big, clean, had a small fridge and a good sized safe in each room. We found the laundry handy and easy access from parking to all rooms. The breakfast was a great buffet and internet in the lobby. Disney is only 5-10 minutes away and all shopping you could want right near the hotel with Walgreens open 24 hours. Red Lobster across the street served excellent meals. We would definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, most importantly, clean”
Reviews.Author: josanna
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Best Western Lakeside beginning February 19. We received the room we requested. Check-in was very quick. I was very pleased that the rooms were sufficiently clean, as that is always my main concern. We did not swim as it just wasn't warm enough for me. There was no hot tub in our pool area but my son did enjoy the small playset. The only complaint I had was that the refrigerator wasn't terribly cold and on the first full day housekeeping didn't make it to our room until after 4pm which we had returned by then. I got fresh towels and sent them away. However, the following day our room had been cleaned by our 3pm return. We did not eat onsite at all, but did enjoy the Wal-Greens and Wendy's being so close. The beds are doubles, not queens and weren't terribly comfortable nor was there a spare blanket. But, for the money it was a great room in a great location. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “close to disney”
Reviews.Author: stevenstar07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Lakeside for three days and two nights while we went to Disney World theme parks. The hotel was clean, the grounds were nicely landscaped and the rooms were spacious. Although it was unseasonably cold, we did take a dip in the pool, which was decent. We were situated on the ground floor with a parking spot right in front of the room, which was convenient. We checked out the breakfast buffet at the "Greenhouse Restaurant". Although it wasn't horrible, I would recommend going "off property" for a tastier, and more affordable buffet. The bar was o.k. It had a pool table which was small, and poorly situated! (I almost broke the sliding glass doors trying to shoot!)Although we spent most of our time at Disney and off property, we found the service to be excellent. Right next to the bar is a small "convenience store" where you could buy a little of everything, including wine, beer and snacks. All in all the hotel was very nice at a reasonable price. I only wish it would have been warmer so we could have enjoyed the lush grounds a little more!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: fitzclan
Reviews.Content: Went to Disney with 3 yr old son on very short notice & had booked our stay here. Had been hesitant due to some of the negative reviews but was ultimately swayed by the overall rating. This hotel was excellent value for the dollar. The location was close to Disney, surrounded by family friendly value restaurants and the service was great. With only one exception (a woman at the area information counter), the staff was friendly and accommodating. Even though they were booked solid, they honored my request for a room away from the parking areas - and did so graciously. The rooms were generally clean (a bit heavy on the bleach smell) and the beds comfortable. There were some stains on the carpet, but nothing I wouldn't expect for this class of hotel. On a day when my son wanted to stay at the hotel, we swam, played on the playgrounds and played put-put. The put-put area was the only part of the hotel that I felt could have been better maintained. There was some dirty water on the course in areas - but it didn't stop us from playing. The Pizza Hut on site was very convenient an a standard value. I got a personal pan pizza, drink and breadsticks for around $7 with tax. Someone had written that they had paid $25 for pizza on their review so I wanted to add this. We are going back to Disney in December with the entire family and will probably stay here again. It's a typical Best Western and I would easily recommend it to anyone who needs this type of accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are clean, but the beds uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: disluvr
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised by the room's appearance. We had a poolside room on the first floor. It was large enough, very clean, did not appear run-down at all. Was well worth the AAA rate for the room. The only complaint we had is that the beds are too soft and the bottom sheets are not fitted. It seems like a minor thing, but when you roll at night the sheet comes with you, bunches up, and you either sleep on the bunched sheet or bare mattress--neither which appeal to me. We all slept so poorly that we actually won't stay there again because of it. We're going back to the Courtyard by Marriott, Vista Center. It's twenty dollars more a night, but at least we're well-rested the next day for the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the money”
Reviews.Author: trypnotic
Reviews.Content: This place has always been a great value for our quick, weekend trips to Disney. We have wound up with this particular hotel three times via Hotwire at approximately $33 per night. There's also shortcut to the Animal Kingdom area close by! From Hwy 192, go north on Sherberth Rd to Osceola Pkwy.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Stay for the money”
Reviews.Author: oscarmama
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't posh, but our stay was lovely. Got a super low rate from Hotwire. The room was nice and large, very clean, nice big fridge, good in room coffee, walking distance to Walgreens. Positive and friendly service everywhere from the front desk to the Pizza Hut counter. It was too cool to use the pools, but they were clean and well kept. Found a back road onto the Disney roads and it ended up being a 4 minute drive to Animal Kingdom's parking lot and 8 minutes to the TTC with virtually NO traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the $$”
Reviews.Content: This is an average Bestwestern. It is convenient to WDW & Irlo Bronson restaurants. We stayed here for 1 night before transfering to Disney property. The room is ok. Not dirty, but definintely not clean. The grounds were well kept. However, I would not want to spend an extended amount of time at this place as it just seemed dingy.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Darn Good”
Reviews.Author: JAMES O
Reviews.Content: We are not big Best Western fans, especially as one travels east of the Mississippi and staying in Orlando is not one of our favorite nights out. We booked this trip due to a Trade Show commitment and were truly and pleasantly surprised. The property is indeed expansive and there are plenty of families milling around with children of all sizes and shapes, but once in your room with the door closed, all was peace and quiet. The room was clean, ample in size, nicely appointed and convenient to parking lot. The shower worked great, there were plenty of towels, the sink had a new surface and the television worked fine. Should we find ourslves passing through Orlando or needing to be there again, we would seek this location out for another stay (assuming the price was right).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Amsdentraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to use as a head quarters to a Disney vacation. It is close to the complex (also easy to get to Sea World, Universal), and much more reasonable than the Disney lodging. Our room was very clean which was extremely important to our traveling companions and we always felt safe. The staff also was very attentive. The only drawback is that there seemed to be a lot of noise. The garbage trucks arrived at 4 a.m. one morning (we stayed in room 109) to dump the dumpsters and they were not far from our room. People would walk by our room late at night and we could easily hear them. Our infant's crib had a mattress that crinkled when she moved (which caused her to wake up a few times on the first night). Even our mattress had a squeaky spring. In all - this hotel has a great location and a great staff and I would recommend staying here if you are not looking for an upscale resort.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: countryboyManchester
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in january 2007 and were really pleased with the place, the rooms were clean and were cleaned daily, also the towels were changed daily without fail. The pools were all spotless and heated, and the general atmosphere of the place was quiet and relaxed. We have stayed in various hotels on the 192 in kissimmee and found that best western lakeside was better than all the others, we are planning to return next spring and will definately be staying at the best western again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: popejulius
Reviews.Content: We stood here 2 nights on our trip to Epcot. The room, linens, towels, carpets and bathroom were clean and well maintained and the beds were comfortable. Having dryer and a iron and ironing board in the room was really nice. We paid $52 a night and it was well worth it. We would return and recommend this motel.The location is also really excellent if you are going to the Disney attractions. Nice pool well mainatined grounds, friendly and efficient front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EllisMonster
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel for 2 weeks during september/october last year. I also got married at this hotel.I found this hotel one of the best that i have stayed in, the staff were really friendly and helpfull, and were there 24/7. The rooms were also very very clean,and a maid was always there everyday to clean your room. the fridge was always cool, the pools were clean and tidy. The location was brillant, there was a walgreens on site, with a dennys, red lobster,taco bell and other restaurants right outside the hotel. They have shuttles running too and from the parks, although we didnt use this as we did have a hire car. I would give this hotel a POSITIVE 5 OUT OF 5 !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad!!”
Reviews.Author: Mospringvalley
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Best Western from January 21 until the 26th. The first room that we were given had a wet spot around the air conditioner unit. I quickly went to the reception area and without any problems was given a different room. The room itself was clean, bathroom was clean, and clean overall. Beds were springy, but after walking all day they did their job. My wife had a hard time with the shower, because the nob was really hard to pull out. The location of the hotel I felt was very good. There is a 24 hour walgreens near the hotel, and a 7-eleven and gas station nearby as well. The hotel was near the disney amusement parks and several minutes from universal. If going to the hotel(in the near future), there are detours on the highway that will take you a little out of the way to get to the hotel. GPS is very helpful in the orlando area. The lights in Orlando take forever to change, so patience is a must. I guess theyre preapring you for the lines at the amusement parks. Overall, I had a pretty good experience at the Best Western

Reviews.Title: “EXPECTED BETTER!!!”
Reviews.Author: Establo
Reviews.Content: The first room we received had a wet carpet, a dirty tub and a stinky fridge, however they " upgraded us" to a prime room with a pool view, it was okay, but the halls where kind of dirty.Service was okey. If you are low budget its an okey hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, but bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: jalankaki
Reviews.Content: The room is overall clean. There are a few positives and negatives about this hotel. We came on Sunday morning and asked for early check-in. However, we were told the hotel was fully booked and we could not get in. I thought that was fine, because the check in was 3 pm and I did not expect to get in early. If you want to solely depend on hotel shuttle to go to Disney, Seaworld and/or Universal Studio, check out my comment below. Positives: -Clean room -There is a Walgreen within 3 minutes walk. -Wendy's and Burger King are next to the hotel. Taco Bell and Red Lobster are across the street. A few minutes walk will take you to a Denny's, Sizzler's, a supermarket, Chinese restaurant, and a Japanese restaurant. We ate at Giordano's, an Italian restaurant. The pizza was great. We also ordered Chinese food delivery from Full House (the menu and phone # are located in the hotel guest directory in each room). The Chinese food were good, too. Negatives: -Shuttle departs to Seaworld and Universal early morning at 7:45 AM. Picks up guests from Universal at 6:40 PM and Seaworld 6:55 PM. You must wake up early. If you don't like to wake up early during your vacation, check out bus line 56 to Disney and transfer to line 50 to Seaworld. check --- -To Animal Kingdom at 9:15 AM and picks up at 5:45 PM. Even though it normally closes at 5 PM. So, you must spend 45 minutes in gift shops or waiting. Inconvenient. -To Magic Kingdom at 10:00 AM and 5:00 PM, pick ups at 5:20 PM, and 10:15 PM. It normally closes at 7 or 8 PM. Either you go home early, or you transfer to another park to go home. Inconvenient. -To MGM at 10:45 AM, pick up at 8 PM. -To Epcot at 10:45 AM, pick up at 5:30 and 8:15 PM. -The shuttle was late 30 minutes once. -I called front desk to ask about a loud machine used by some workers in front of my room at 9 AM. Good thing I was already awake. I asked, "How long can I expect them to work in front of my room?" I was answered, "Why don't you step out and ask them?" Bad customer service. I had to talk to the manager to get an answer.

Reviews.Title: “A hop, skip and a jump from Disney...Hotel room condition could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Realistic_Reviewer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Lakeside in Kissimmee, Florida. The entrance to the hotel and lobby was inviting and tropical. The check in went quickly and smoothly. We upgraded to a different room that we wanted initially but that wasn't available when we made our reservation, with ease. The overall appreance of the outside of the hotel was pretty good. They have more the one pool, I think three. We stayed in a pool view room and I would advise that if you are planning on catching up on your sleep and not getting up early, then you won't want a pool view room. It's very noisy, early. The room appeared to have been cleaned and the towels were stocked. What I didn't like and felt should have been fixed before our stay was a gash in the wall near the floor by the TV. Also, as we were preparing for bed, we noticed a big gash/almost hole in the wall behind our bed and the area behind the bed didn't look like it had been cleaned. I worried about bugs with this opening behind the bed. The bed seemed to be clean and didn't smell. What I didn't like though was that they used a flat sheet as a bottom sheet which moved and bunched up as we slept, uncovering the matteress below. The air conditioning had a funny smell initially and I wondered about this, maybe it is common but it seemed to go away. The fridge in the room was barley cool, although we didn't ask the front desk about this, maybe there was a way to turn it up. We liked the safe in the room it was easy to use. The Pizza Hut express that they offer on site is rediculiously priced. Twenty dollars for a medium pizza! Their breakfast buffet is cheap, but you get what you pay for sometimes because it tasted cheap as well. The eggs looked slimey and the sausage tasted generic and the bacon was clumped together in a bin. It was warm in the resturant to, even the employees were fanning themselves with the menues. I asked 2 employees about a waterfall rock garden that was advertised on the Best Western website while we were in the breakfast buffet resturant and neither knew were it was. In my opinion the Dennys down the street would have been a better breakfast choice. The location of this hotel is really great though. There's a Walgreens practically in the same parking lot and plenty of fast food resturants and a Kmart just down the street. Getting to Disney is a snap and close by. One more thing I would say about the hotel is there was no elevator, at least we couldn't find one. So we were on the second floor and had to hike up a small stepped stair case to get our luggage to our room. Overall I would give this hotel 3 stars based on everything explained here.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: floridalady2908
Reviews.Content: we stayed 5 nights,from the 12-18-06 until 12-23-06, it was our second stay in the hotel. you get a great,clean room for less money.The Hotel Stuff is kind and friendly.And the most of all when you stay in Kissimmee,it is very close to the Disney Parks.We"ll come back again.....

Reviews.Title: “This place is fine.”
Reviews.Author: puma1.716v
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many US hotel rooms the lakeside is your run of the mill US hotel room.No the lakeside is not a resort but the pools were clean and warm, the rooms clean a bright and for the rates available on the net it is a bargain.We got 4 nights with 2 buffet breakfasts for 2adults for £120 ! If it is a clean safe place to lay your head after a long day in the parks this is it, why go anywhere else?.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Lakeside”
Reviews.Author: cheapeat
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Lakside was an average 3 star hotel, are stay was Dec.2nd to Dec 9. The rooms were kept clean daily ,the grounds were clean and the pools were great and warm the staff was O.K. I think too many people are complaining about nothing it's not a five star place for the price it was great . Lots of places that you can walk to for breakfast and dinner . Ponderosa 3.99 breakfast sizzlers has a great dinner buffet for 9.99 you don't need the entree.Also Golden Corral has a dinner buffet for 10.99 great food. Stay away from the Golden China Buffet west of the Best Western Hotel at the Quality Suites not that good.Best Western shuttle sevice is ok but it would be nice to get to the them parks earlier, when it off season they don't run to early . better to the shuttle to the earliest theme park and jump over from that them to the one you want too go to. All and All I would give 6 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here unless you get a great price”
Reviews.Author: ML006
Reviews.Content: We stayed with a large group for a sporting event at Disney, so I did not get to pick the place or the price. I would not recommend this hotel unless you can get a price of $50 or less per night -- otherwise, it is just not worth it. We paid $69 per night, and I felt that was too much. Some of the basic problems -- (1) very, very RUDE and unhelpful staff -- they seemed to go out of their way to be obnoxious; (2) unreliable shuttle to the Disney parks (and, by the way, the times of the shuttle are unrelated to the operating hours of the parks -- the Magic Kingdom closes at 8:00 on Sundays and the shuttle comes at 10:15 -- we had to take a cab, which cost $25); (3) very musty, damp rooms -- a lot of the kids in the group got sick (coughs etc.) and I think it was in part due to the condition of the rooms (although I should point out that the rooms were quite clean otherwise); (4) shady deals at the restaurant (they overcharged my credit card and refused to re-ring the transaction -- I got the feelingy that they probably do this routinely and skim the extra few bucks -- it was not a lot of money (less than $5) but you get the point; I informed the front desk and they could have cared less); (5) very small bathrooms (so small that it was difficult to change clothes inside); (6) very inconvenient "business center" -- it was difficult to print my boarding passes for our return flight; and (7) pretty far from the airport -- a $50 to $60 ride via hired car or taxi (it would probably be worthwhile to rent a car). Some of the positives (there are almost always some!): (1) there was a Walgreens store next door -- very convenient; (2) although there was some shady business at the restaurant (see above), the food was good and reasonably priced; (3) the A/C worked quite well; (4) although we did not use them, there are 3 pools that looked quite nice; and (5) a small but very nice excercise room. So, overall, I would definately NOT stay there again. I have been to plenty of Best Westerns and have had some fine experiences, but not at this one!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Needs some Updating!”
Reviews.Author: anderdog
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our Honeymoon for 2 nights, after coming from Walt Disney World (WDW), back in June 2006. First off, if you think this is close to WDW,or Seaworld think again. The only reason we stayed here was the quoted rate. If I would have known this hotel was so far away from everything, I would not have stayed here, and paid some more money to stay closer to Orlando. Driving back to this hotel (anywhere from 40mins to 1 1/2 hrs.) from a day of sightseeing, is not fun. The hotel is in need of serious updating, along with the rooms. The bathroom of our room was the worse. The tiles had some black grout lines and the shower curtain had dry soap residue on it. When we arrived, we were checked in earlier than our scheduled check-in time. The door handle of our room almost fell off, but a quick phone call to the front desk, there was someone there in a flash. We stayed on the second floor, so unless you like climbing stairs avoid the second floor. The pool area was nice, and clean. The hotel has an internet connection you can pay a fee to use. Overall for the price I paid, and how far I had to travel to sightsee and to find a place to eat, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Motel not a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bdeyes
Reviews.Content: Best western. Lakeside. Kissimmee.11th/25th Nov.2006. Stayed for 14 nights, changed rooms 3 times. On arrival found parking car right outside room ideal, BUT, Guy in next room left for work at 5.45am and had an audibile reversing alarm on his truck. 3 mornings was enough. Got moved to room overlooking the pool. "Lovely", Till the neighbours from hell moved in next door, coming back to their room around 12.30 am and bringing "Snow white and the seven dwarfs with them and partying till 5am. 3 nights of that was more than enough. Got moved again back facing the car park but a quieter area. Much more relaxing. Found accomadation to be basic but clean. Ideal for one or two nights but totally unsuitable for 2 weeks holiday (vacation). Won`t be rushing back although staff were very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tungstress
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the Thanksgiving long weekend. For the low price, we were not expecting much, so we were more than impressed with the ammenities and beautiful grounds. The three separate heated pools and spacing of the buildings made it feel very serene. The location is good for the theme parks as well as food. The room itself was nothing special, but at least it was clean. Wireless internet access in our room was a definite bonus. There's no breakfast included, but at least you get a fridge. The extra "resort fee" is sneaky, but if you are aware of it ahead of time, factor it into your total price and it's still a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to the moaners”
Reviews.Author: DAZ96
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 week stay at the Best Western Lakeside and we can't understand what some people are complaining about. The hotel rooms are clean and tidy and the pool and grounds area are immaculate. All staff were friendly from front desk to security. The hotel is in a great location for all restaurants, shops and theme parks. This was our 5th visit to Orlando and this was definitely the best value for money compared to some so called superior hotels. We would definitely choose the Best Western Lakeside for future holidays.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ra3
Reviews.Content: oct/nov 06 stayed 3 wks at this hotel very nice whole resort very clean..rooms all new cleaners every day and good cleaners..all staff friendly and helpful..3 heated pools all good size..resteraunts very good ..free basic 18 hole golf putting..24 hr. walgreens riht oposite the main enterance..rooms are decent size..time to magic kingdome from this hotel is 12 minutes..time to universal..30 minutes time to sea world 25 minutes..this was my 17 trip to orlando since 1979..and i have stayed in just about every kind of accomadation..i have no problem recomending this hotel for those who are looking for hotels..as a reasonable priced place to stay..raymond

Reviews.Title: “The worst beds I've ever slept on!!!”
Reviews.Author: ladylindz
Reviews.Content: When my boyfriend and I finally arrived at the hotel we walk up to front desk and noticed a small line of about 2 ppl. We also notice 2 woman employees standing at the front with their arms folded and nasty looks on their faces. But nobody was saying anything so we decided to wait in line. After about 10 minutes of annoying glances at eachother, I decided to ask what the hold up was. One of the employees responded saying the systems were down. And it would be awhile before they were back up. Both employees were rude and unprofessional. I also have to say that the beds at this hotel were so uncomfortable...... We stayed for 10 days and that was way to long to stay in this kind of hotel. Not a good hotel to stay at for more then a few days. And really not a "couples friendly" hotel. I would rate this hotel as a 2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: queen_mab
Reviews.Content: Rooms very clean - grounds very clean - any rubbish that was dropped was picked up every morning by staff. Maid service EXCELLENT - generally ate out. Reception staff always helpful and friendly. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience!”
Reviews.Author: scotsblood
Reviews.Content: Having just got back following two weeks at this hotel I would say this is a good example of a three star hotel with loads of facilities and despite the numerous past comments running the place down we we had a great time and found no problems at all! The check-in clerk was great, explained very well how to use/find most of the things we would need in our first 24 hours and made our six year old twins feel at home straight away. Room had clearly just been refurbished, painwork immaculate, carpet new etc and new curtains changed to match decor during our stay! Beds really comfortable, furniture good, coffee machine, hairdryer and fridge worked perfectly. Whole family thought shower fantastic! Service was fast when required, safe found locked on arrival was opened by very apologetic security guy within a couple of minutes of calling, towels found missing just after midnight on our last night replaced by another very apologetic security guy who arrived withing five minutes of our call. Impressive. Maid service was great, with six year olds around tidyness isn't easy but our room was sorted and cleaned perfectly each and every day. Didn't eat at hotel other than one pizza meal so cant really comment about restaurant but service we had eating in bar was good and kids were made to feel at ease. There are plenty of eating places within a couple of minutes (either walk or car!) and theres a Wendy's right next to Walgreens if you don't want to leave the hotel carpark! We only used main pool area so cant comment on smaller pool but if of the same standard would be clean with plenty of towels and water quality very good. One evening (after taking a short cut to reception through the pool area!) I pointed out at reception one of the "child resistant" pool enclosure locks appeared to be sticking in the open position. By the next afternoon when we went swimming the whole lock had been replaced, impressive again. With regard to the other facilities, my wife tells me the laundry room was perfectly good, video games room looked ok, the minigolf appeared good enough, (we never played much to our kids annoyance) and although the lake did appear short of water and isn't the most pretty we have ever seen didn't appear to harbour mozzies as if there were any I WOULD have been bitten! This is a great place for people doing what we did, staying somewhere close to Disney parks wanting a good value comfortable hotel with a few facilities. We didn't experience any of the negatives mentioned in previous reviews and would recommend the hotel based on our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: IndianaHockeyFamily
Reviews.Content: This hotel is disgusting. The room had bugs and smelled. The pool was descent, but the grounds were not well kept. The parking lot near our room (which was quite difficut to find) was littered with trash and broken glass - we felt leery about leaving our car there. We only stayed one night and that was more than enough. While the rate was great, I will NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Low Cost Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: fox4ster25
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed one week here. "Lakeside" is stretching it. The lake is more like a large pond/swamp. Water level was way down...it looked like mosquito haven (though we did not see any). However, the hotel itself was pleasant. Our room was spacious and clean, all the furniture/bedding/carpeting in very good shape. Beds were very comfortable. Adjoining bathroom was very clean although there was some mould on the shower curtain rings. Service and staff was excellent - our in-room safe was not operational when we arrived and when we called the front desk, a security guard was at our door within less than a minute. Another time a circuit breaker flipped in the bathroom area...again maintenance was there to fix the problem within 10 minutes of our call. There are 3 pools plus a couple of kiddie pools...all very clean. One pool was kept delightfully warm, the other 2 were just slightly cooler and were a wee bit more refreshing on a hot day. Lots of lounge chairs at all pools, though only one has shade huts. Pool towels were small but in ample supply. Motel is very central to all the Orlando attractions, has good amenities within itself, and a ton of restaurants within walking distance. Overall we were very satisfied and would not hesitate to stay there again. Very good value.

Reviews.Title: “No problems at all !”
Reviews.Author: BlondieGirl
Reviews.Content: We travelled from Toronto Canada to see Orlando in October '06. The hotel was perfectly fine. Always had a clean room, never saw any trouble. Ate at their all our can eat brekkie 1 morning. (we prefer Denny's or IHOP) Pool was warm, the deck was clean. We'd certainly go back to this hotel. We love Disney and Orlando, we just have to start saving again! Cheers :o)

Reviews.Title: “Not so pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: seh1985
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to go to orlando for his birthday and decided to stay at best western lakeside for 2 nights. I am very picky about hotel rooms when traveling and their cleanliness and after reading reviews about this lakeside hotel i was very skeptical about staying here. To begin with, I requested a queen size bed and ended up getting 2 double beds. I told the front desk that this was not what i had asked for upon making my reservation and they told me that all rooms were full and that there was nothing they could do. We decided to stay because it was late and everything was paid for but i got even more upset about the uninvited bugs that were either dead on the dresser and table or crawling on the carpet. There was also a series of croaking frogs by the artificial pond they have there that kept us up all night; i dont know if it was simply sound effects or if they were real, point is it was ANNOYING!!! We ended up leaving a day early because i could not stand to go back to that hotel room after returning from a long day at a park. I would definetely not stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Camilo_Leite
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Best Western Lakeside for seven nights, from September 10th to the 17th. Based on what I payed for the hotel, my expectations weren't too high. I loved the hotel and would stay again for sure PROS: * It took me 10 minutes from the parking lot of the hotel to the parking lot of the Disney parks. 5 minutes to the Animal Kingdom * The pool is great: clean, big with lots of chairs and tables available * Free high-speed Internet connection * Nice job done daily by the maid * Walgreens in the parking lot is also great to buy water (don't buy at the parks, it's extremely expensive compared to taking it with you) and snacks * Mini-fridge in the room, great for freezing water overnight to take to the parks next day * Pizza Hut onsite was very convenient, we used it once when we were too tired to go out. * Combination safe in the room, free of charge. * Mini-golf and arcade room in the hotel, good for kids and teens * There was a gym, but we didn't check it out CONS: * The 1st room we stayed at had part of the carpet soaked due to a problem with the A/C. Also, the wardrobe had a weird smell. I complained on Monday and it took them 2 days to see they couldn't fix ithe A/C problem. We were then offered to change to a room by the poolside and to have free breakfast for the remaining 4 days which was nice. The second room was much better, it seemed newer than the 1st one * Breakfast: although it was free for us after the incident above (the regular price is 6.99 in September), it wasn't great compared to the breakfast from Ponderosa (3.99) and Golden Corral (6.49 after applying coupons find everywhere). If you have a car while in the hotel, PLEASE try to eat somewhere else. The good thing about the breakfast in the hotel was the fresh omelet. * I checked the schedule for the free shuttles and it's not very good. I really would recommend renting a car. It's very cheap and offers great flexibility. But if you don't have a car/cant drive, it could be a plus. It's free after all I recommend this hotel and would go back again, for sure. Just don't expect a luxury hotel for what you're paying.

Reviews.Title: “Great except....................”
Reviews.Author: cgober1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the best western for 3 nights everything was good except no wash cloths on the second night. So the next day i left a note and still none. I had to call the front desk and recieved them promptly. They have a pizza hut onsite that delivers to your room.

Reviews.Title: “A Great stay for a great price”
Reviews.Author: GApeach06
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Best Western Lakeside for 5 nights and were surprised at the quality for such a reasonable price. The hotel rooms were average, we utilized the refrigrator and iron. Conveniently located to Disney. A Walgreens in walking distance…. the hotel itself has a nice dinning room, a bar, Pizza Hut and game room!!! I will defiantly stay here again and recommend you do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at Best Western Lakeside”
Reviews.Author: brody-maddison
Reviews.Content: Firstly I want to start by saying that if you want 5* amenities and service, book a 5* hotel, not criticise when a 3* doesn't live up tp 5* expectations. The Best Western Lakeside is an excellent hotel for people on a budget. I booked it as a late deal through a UK travel agent and having spent many Orlando vacations staying in vacation homes I was a little worried that staying in a hotel would feel cramped and uncomfortable. However, the Best Western Lakeside restored my faith in hotels. It's location was excellent, central to everything we wanted to do and had plenty of restaurants around and some within walking distance, especially if you're brave enough to cross the 192. The room was fairly spacious, we had two good size double beds and ample stoage space. There was a mini fridge and also a safe in the room which came in handy for storing valuables. The bathroom wasn't the biggest but the sink was outside the main bathroom, just the bath/shower and toilet in the actual bathroom. All satisfactory and plenty of hot water. The maid service was good, our room was cleaned and had fresh towels and linen daily and all this was done by 11am, unless we were in the room and they would come back at our convenience. Enjoyed our time spent by the pool. Only down side was not having parasols, or at least they didn't at the pool closest to our room. Saying that there were shaded areas under trees. There were usually plenty of free loungers and I thought the pool area was generally clean and tidy. I noticed staff cleaning the area regularly. The pool was lovely and refreshing and fortunately not too crowded during our visits. Also enjoyed the strawberry daquiris from the tiki bar....yum! I guess the prices are what you expect in hotels, slightly above average but not extortionate. As we had car hire we didn't use the shuttle service so I really can't comment on it. I found the hotel staff to be friendly and courtious at all times, no complaints at all. I am very fussy and very sceptical when reading reviews but I truly enjoyed my stay at the Best Western Lakeside and would definitely go back if staying at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “going downhill”
Reviews.Author: teacher6th
Reviews.Content: This hotel used to be a Sheraton and this is the reason the architecture, grounds and pool are beautiful. However, since Best Western purchased it, it's amazing how it's been let go. The rooms are not clean. We were there for 5 nights and the maid never swept the bathroom. When we first got there we noticed a long hair in the bathroom on the floor and laughed everyday that it stayed there. The pillows and sheets smelled like someone's greasy hair. Each night we were bit by fleas!!! We had bites that were not there before bed and when we woke up, we had what resembled flea bites. I plan on writing the hotel a letter of complaint. After our room was "cleaned" and the maid did not leave enough towels, I approached her outside and she could not speak English to help. Just a minor inconvenience. It's a shame that the Sheraton sold it to Best Western because it's not what it used to be.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Content: Package deal through Nolitours, no complaints with them either. I had read the other reviews and was a little nervous. I thought twice about stayibg here!! We upgraded our room to a pool side and had breakfest there every morning ( toaster 9 dollars at Walgreens (in the parking lot) or you can drive to walmart and save 3 dollars) Stocked up the frig the first night. Ate breakfest out once at the Corral across the road (Awsome value) Go Hungry! Hotel was excellent, no complaints. Air con leaked one night, they fixed it within 10 miniutes of calling, can't beat the service.. Tip the maids they work hard. Days at the pool, lunch and then as the sun is setting head to Disney, 3 kms. Pay the 9 bucks for parking ( no waiting for the bus) Buy your disney tickets at one of the discount places or in the hotel, much cheaper than on site or contact this guy, 20 years in the business, knows what he is doing and was very fair, Highly recommended.. Tell him Pat from Japan Sent you. --- Didn't see the alligator but looked. The store in the hotel is nice. Great place if you have kids. Pizza is expensive and not worth the value with soooooo many good resturants close by but alright in a pinch Great rates and 5 pools, mini golf arcade etc Room was clean and people were friendly, lots of security rooming around. Kids are uplate if you are by the pool so take some earplugs but I wouldn't change our stay at all. Close to the pool was great. 4 stars, had a great time..... Will go back again. Thanks Guys Well done

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: emzees
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 2 weeks .clean rooms comfortable after a day in the parks.lovely pools never crowded. breakfast o.k can get better elsewhere.hurricane sams very slow we waited an hour for cold food very poor.freindly staff very helpful.DONT use the shuttle bus.we used this 1 night and wished we had not.2adults 3kids youngest only 3.we were told the pick up was at 10pm and to be there 15mins before.we arrived at 9.30 to make sure we were there early.it was raining and with very tired kids the bus arrived at10.45p.m only after several phone calls to hotel who were not very helpful.a small minibus turned up to collect 45 people .we were split the kids and husband went back .we were told there was another bus on way .iarrived back at 12 midnight... we never used it again .

Reviews.Title: “Great, inexpensive Disney vacation”
Reviews.Author: poulsen11
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a vacation we could take our two young children (2 & 5) on for a week and spend less than $2k (including room, travel and amusement) and we found it! We booked our trip through funjet where we found for about $90 more than airfare for 4, we could stay at the Best Western Lakeside. That's ~$12/night! Before booking, I read many of the reviews found here on TripAdvisor. I was concerned about the negative reviews, but for $12/night, we decided to take the gamble and we won! The rooms were clean and spacious enough for the ~8-9 hours we spent sleeping and grooming per day. We decided to be big spenders and pay the extra $10/night to upgrade to a poolside king bed (tall husband) with a pull-out coach for the two kids (they won't let you reserve it with 4 people, but ask for it at the desk when you get there). Our room was 515. It was plenty of room for everyone. The kids loved the pool. There were two large and two smaller ones on the property, all very clean. The pools were never crowded, but my kids found friendly kids their age to play with every day and really had a ball. We spent 5 days visiting the Disney parks and 1 day at Clearwater Beach. Some tips we picked up along the way: - Buy the "Unofficial Guide to Disney" for $12 at Sam's or at Amazon if you want to know everything there is to know about visiting Disney including full details on each ride, each resort, each restaurant and tons of tips for getting the most out of your trip. - Check out mousesavers and sign up for the newsletter for the lowest Disney tickets on-line. - Get to the parks at opening, leave at mid-day, eat off-site for less, take a rest and a swim in the pool, then head back to the parks in the late afternoon/evening. This kept our kids "fresh" and reduced the "meltdowns" we saw many parents experiencing who pressed on without the mid-day break.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best at all!!!”
Reviews.Author: disney101
Reviews.Content: Has a serious drainage problem. The tub would not drain during showers and mini fridge leaked. Maintenance was good, but didnt fix anything. Instead it was like a quick patch job. Seriously, if you really want to enjoy disney with your family this hotel will take away alot of the gleam. We ended up waking up as early as possible and coming back as late as possible just so we did not have to be there that long.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok”
Reviews.Author: macha2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed (my husband, my 3 years old boy and myself) at the Best Western Lakeside for a week. We knew at the beginning that the hotel was not a castle so we were not surprised of anything. If we went to this hotel il was because we got to Magic Kingdom and more ..... and we did not need to spend to much time in the complex. Our room (231) was basic-simple but clean. We got new towels and sheets ervery day. We really appreciated the little fridge in our room. The pool area could of been more clean. We did not see anyone working around. There was paper , food around and in the pool. there are some rules but nobody respected them. We think that a nice clean un is need it. Overall we enjoyed to cool and relax in the pool. We travels aroud the world and we always got a smile and a hello from the staff at the guests services but there ...... they do not want to see you and for the few questions we asked they did not know the answer ?????? The staff could be more smily. I recommanded this hotel for family with young kids. Do not go there il you want a romantic stay. We never go back twice to a place but if we had to go back i think we will choose Best Western Lakeside.

Reviews.Title: “travel agents view”
Reviews.Author: Vickiuk
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and myself are both travel agent in the uk and stayed at the best western lakeside for 14 nights from 28th june till 12th july. I have to say all these bad reviews are not what we saw, we have a great time, the rooms where clean and big with enough space. the towels were always clean. The pools were great and there are plenty of shops and restaurants round the hotel you just have to cross the 192. Having a fridge and a safe was a great idea. this hotel is great value for money and really good i would sell it to any of my clients with the confidence that they would have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday”
Reviews.Author: GaryBlades
Reviews.Content: Excellent location very close to disney attractions but far enough away from the hustle and bustle of I -drive. It was our first trip to Florida and were pleasantly surprised at the accomodation. Spacious and simple but yet Ideal as base for the busiest holiday of your life. Food was not that good but we ate every night outside the hotel except one and the choice near the hotel is so vast that you will never visit the same resteraunt twice ( and we spent two weeks there) Always went back to hotel bar in the evening for a cool beer or two which was always served with a smile Overall, perfect base, room perfect. facilities average, service good.Air con...............more than welcome and worked contrary to reports otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the $$ - especially in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: NJJOHNNY
Reviews.Content: My wife and three young kids were there for 7 nights from July 5-12 and found the hotel very acceptable for the value (about $60 a night through AAA) and with its proximity to Disney. Granted the rooms were smaller than I would have liked for a family of 5 but think it would fit a family of 4 or less fairly well with two beds. Since we were in Orlando mostly for attractions we spend very little time at the hotel and the kids loved the pool (for a night swim) and having Pizza Hut room delivery service. We were in section 5 which was very quite, away from the main lobby, though it had little in terms of a view (for $70 more I can look at the pool - which I passed on). The room as many have mentioned on Trip Advisor was fairly outdated but was clean and the beds were made daily. Each room had a mini fridge which was cool enough to chill our soda cans and milk for cereal at breakfast (Walgreens is a 1 minute walk from the hotel for cereal, milk and snacks). The staff was helpful and responsive and the food prices were reasonable for coffee and bagels w/butter and muffins. Overall I feel we got what we paid for and was not dissappointed for the price. A few pointers here: - There are Walmarts around that have sections devoted to Disney merchandise and souveners for far less - We bought Disney hopper passes for our family with young kids but never jumped from park to park. Each park when with young ones is essentially and all day event (and most we didn;t even get to do everything). If you have young kids don;t buy the hopper. - Universal was fun and well worth the money. Essentially our tickets for 5 days came out to a total of $50 each purchased online as opposed to Disney Hoppers at $275 each for a total of 4 days. - At Universal buy the meal and cup deal if you will stay all day. We shared 2 cups for the entire family during our stay. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sancho_1983
Reviews.Content: We went on our honeymoon from the 3-10 July and stayed in this hotel, we found it to be excellent, when we arrived we were given 2 complimentary cocktails and 10% off at the food place there, and a bar of chocolate (which was useful at Epcot when we were starving!!) The room was excellent, i don't know if it was because of our honeymoon but we were given a lower level room right in front of the pool, it was very clean and tidy inside, and was kept that way by the excellent house keeping team. It wasn't even shabby round the edges like we expected, don't get me wrong its not 5 star, but it doesn't claim to be, its definately worthy of its rating if not more. Half way through the holiday both of our bedside lamps went, we told the front desk and by the time we got back later in the day they were sorted, so absolutely no complaints!! Anybody with any questions feel free to e-mail me at barnaby.staniland@gmail.com also if you're planning to book then ask for room 526!! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Budget Hotel Close To The Action”
Reviews.Author: dan_wigan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the best western lakeside for 2 weeks from 6th - 20th July 2006 and the hotel more than met my expectations. Many earlier travellers write about the run down state of the hotel but I think they have recently spent much time and effort on refurbishing as we found our room, and the hotel in general to be very clean, tidy and well presented. OK, so there are minor things to gripe about as the hotel may not be as polished as some of the expensive Disney hotels nearby but for a base to sleep at night and spend the odd day by the pool, I have no complaints at all. Our room (292) was on the first floor overlooking the pool which was a short 1 minute walk from the reception. The hotel is a sprawl of 2 storey buildings but ours happened to be close to the main reception which was handy. The room was very clean, had fridge, TV, combination safe, en-suite bathroom and most inportantly of all - air conditioning!!! which was a life saver for us in the July heat. The room had what they class as a king size bed but if you are from the UK believe me, its bigger than king size!!! The bathroom had wash basin, toilet and bath / shower. Rooms are cleaned daily with fresh towels left and beds made etc - if you want a lie in, leave your Do Not Disturb card out as the cleaners sometimes come as early as 9:30. The pool was clean and there are plenty of sun loungers. If you dont like the sun too much, grab a lounger under the shaded areas if you can. The pool is 7.5 feet at the deep end and about 3 feet deep at the shallow. There is a mini golf facility on the site but it is very basic - i mean VERY basic but it passed ten minutes one morning. There is a general store which also doubles as a Pizza Hut Express. The store is a bit pricey and I would recommend going to the Walgreens store just over the parking lot - less than 2 mins on foot. Its open 24 hours and sells everything you could imagine. The Pizza's from the hotel are nice enough and like most places in the states, if you dine in, you get free soda refils. The greehouse restaraunt offers breakfast for $9.50 and is a "help yourself" buffet so I was a bit bemused as to why they include a 15% tip on the bill when they only really bring you a drink which was extra by the way. Breakfast was a mix of bacon, sausage, egg, waffles etc, plus cereal, fresh fruit and made to order omlettes which were passable but not the best. There is a bar in the hotel called Hurricane Sam's which, again is passable but not the best. They have the usual choices of lager plus a cocktail menu. My biggest moan about the hotel was the shuttle services to the Disney Parks. There was 1 drop to each park each morning and then collections at times that arent really ideal. Drops started at 7:45 for Sea World / Discovery Cove and then came back and did Magic Kingdom, Epcot etc but there is only 1 bus each journey that sits 40 people plus maybe 10-15 standing and believe me they always get full. A little tip we found handy is that if you are waiting for the shuttle bus at the stop, stand just away from the sheltered seating towards the reception in between the shelter and the 2 benches that are open as this is were the bus stops and you will be one of the first onto the bus to avoid the mad scrum to get on. If they had a more frequent schedule that did 2 or 3 more trips to the parks through the day this would make things much better in my opinion. There are loads of places to eat within 10 minutes walk from the hotel - choices are everything from Chinese, to Indian, to Taco Bell, Red Lobster, Mcdonalds etc - both sit-in and take out. There are a wide variety of "souvenir" tacky shops plus some supermarkets and World of denim. Journey time to the Disney ticket and transport hub was about 15-20 minutes and for a budget minded traveller, this hotel makes an excellent base to do the disney parks. I would give it a solid 8 out of 10 and would seriously considder staying there again if I was booking a trip to Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Groups”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5-night stay at BW Lakeside. My son's track club stayed here during the AAU National Club Championships. I found the hotel great for our group. After spending mornings running in the hot sun, the kids were happy to be able to cool off in one of the three pools on-site. The pool bars/gazebos meant that we didn't have to haul the kids out of the pool to get lunch. . .we could order from Pizza Hut Express right at the pool. The location was good, too. Several families did not rent cars and were able to walk to nearby restaurants -- T.G.I. Fridays, Outback, Red Lobster, Wendy's, Taco Bell, etc. . . as well as across the parking lot to Walgreens for whatever sundries they had forgotten. The rooms were basic, but well-maintained, and included a complimentary refrigerator. The bathroom was small, but I wasn't expecting luxury for $69. They are adequate, but a little small for our family of 5. My husband and I traveled with our three children, ages 3, 5, and 8. If we return to this hotel again, we will reserve an adjoining room for the older children. The only negative I found was in the shuttle scheduling. The complimentary shuttles depart EARLY. . . 7:45 a.m. for Universal/Sea World and slightly later for the Disney properties. There is only one morning shuttle run for each park. After that, you are on your own until around 5:00 for the Disney properties. The shuttle does not return to drop off at Universal or Sea World, only to pick up, and that is early, too. . . 6:45.
