If you plan on staying at those parks until closing, you'll have to find alternate means of transportation. We rented a car, but for those who did not, transportation did become an issue. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay at Best Western. It's a good choice for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent July 4-7, 2006 at this hotel. It was part of a "great deal" package via the Internet. What a crock! The room was dark and dingy had a musty order. The carpet needed a deep cleaning; we would not let the kids walk barefoot on the floor. The furniture is very outdated, room was small with two double beds. Bathroom very small, floor was grungy around the baseboards, and the exhaust fan did not work. Hot water ran out quickly each morning. Iron did not work. Air conditioner was noisy. Drapery lining was dirty. Shuttle service to parks left late and came back by 9:00pm every night. We rented a car. Hotel needs major renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Lakeside from June 30 - July 3rd 2006. M y family and I were really impressed with this hotel. The room was clean and well maintained. The bathroom was small but that was ok for us. The pool was great and we ate at the pizza hut express several nights. It is in a great location with Walgreens next door,Wendys,Tacobell and Golden Corall all within walking distance. Do your self a favor buy your Disney tickets at Cheap and unused ticket place you will save ALOT !!!. Overall we liked the hotel and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “a couple of issues- but Ok”
Reviews.Author: lovesgoldens
Reviews.Content: A couple of issues.... -stained gross carpet that really needed a good steam cleaning, did not dare to walk barefoot in my own room -our exhaust fan was broke in the bathroom, had to call 3 times for them to come fix -batteries on our remote did not work, again three calls before replaced -no fitted sheets on double beds- would have prefered queens too -tiki bar by pool was never open -they charged handling fees for the disney tickets, making them more expensive then at the gate -the shuttles were not conveneint, sometimes leaving way after park opening and sometimes picking up way before the parks closed- we ended up driving -REALLY loud, we were no where near the pool, but one family let their kids run up and down the walkway, shaking the whole room all night, and then another family took their furniture out of the room and were playing dominoes really loud underneath our room, kind of sketchy that way. We called the front desk to take care of it, but it did not settle down for a few hours. - really coould use some remodeling A couple of highlights.... good breakfast buffet and pizza hut was handy good location, truly one of the best outside of Disney airconditioning worked well we really were not in the room that much, so some of these things did not matter all that much price was great pool was nice Would try to find a different hotel in the same price range....

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: peachypooch
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed at the Best Western Lakeside last summer. We found this hotel to a high standard - maid service every day which included clean towels daily and fresh bed linen every other day. Having a fridge in the room came in handy too. We spent little time in the room as we were out at the parks most days however it was nice to come home to a spacious room with comfortable bed to rest those weary legs! The pool area is nice and clean and there are some parasols to shade yourself from the mid-day sun. I would say you need a car if you are staying in Kissimmee (or anywhere in Orlando really) otherwise you have to rely on the bus service which we opted not to use. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family and would return to it too.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice of Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, son of 11yrs and myself stayed here for 14days commencing 16 June, before we arrived I had read several reviews on the hotel which were very mixed. However we had a great stay, the hotel is minutes from Disney Parks and the choice of eating out within the immediate vicinity was excellent. The shop and snack bar on site was good and prices were not too bad. There is a Wallgreen chemist type shop next door which sold everthing from chemist type items to snacks/magazines/newspapers etc which is handy and open 24hrs. The reception staff were fairly friendly but could of smiled a little more!! The hotel room/bathroom was clean. The beds were comfortable(I have a bad back) but found the mattress okay. The cleaning/maid service was good. All in all this Hotel was better than I expected (after reading some reviews!!!) and I would certainly go back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: lacres524
Reviews.Content: We stayed here June 24 2006 for 3 nights and found it to be very nice. I was concerned after the negative reviews I read here, but I tried to keep in mind, you can't please everyone, and hoped for the best. We had a king room poolside, which is definately the way to go. The bed was very comfortable and the room had a small loveseat that pulled out into a sleeper that fit 2 small boys very nicely. They even commented on how comfortable their bed was. The room was very clean and the housekeeping came in daily and picked up. They have 3 pools, 2 of which are awsome. Very clean and well kept. We don't travel much, but felt like we were in a resort because everything was so nice. We did not eat on site but they have a couple of places in the hotel if you so choose. I highly recommend the Golden Coral across the street, it was wonderful!!!!!!! Small tip though don't go between 6 to 8:30 pm. or you will have to rub elbows with everyone at the bar for your food (very crowded) we went at 9 pm one evening after a full day at one of the parks and went right in. no waiting. and the food quality was still the same as if we had gone during the prime time. Back to the hotel, they also offered guest laundry on site which was very convienent. The only suggestion I would make is that if you can't navigate stairs well be sure to get a 1st floor room. That was the strangest thing I have ever seen a hotel with a 2nd floor and no elevator. At least I couldn't find one anywhere. We had to wrestle our luggage up a flight of stairs which was a little inconvienent. Other than that I would definatley stay at this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A realy nice place, but....”
Reviews.Author: I_booked_it
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. Great location. Pizza hut in the hotel. Clean & Large pools. The hotel grounds are well maintained. Even the rooms were clean...I thought. THat is until I opened the small room refrigerator. Someone had used the fridge as a toilet. My tip..make sure you check the fridge as SOON as you get to your room. I told the front desk about the problem and was told that they were sorry for the inconvience.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Lakeside”
Reviews.Author: adare-jrs.-girl
Reviews.Content: me and my daughter stayed here from the 17th to the 22nd of june. the hotel met my expectations and then some for the price i payed. very spacious hotel with a resort feel to it. it has three pools, mini golf which is free, tennis courts, and a game room. there is a pizza hut express and deli in the main building of the hotel. i would recommend this hotel to any buget conscious family with children. staff was also very friendly and wiling to assist in any way they could.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel at Great price”
Reviews.Author: Alanis628
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bestwestern Lakeside in June of 2006 for five nights. The hotel has a great location, close to many restaurants and is very close to the Disney parks. This hotel has three swimming pools which were very clean and well maintained. The room was clean with a mini fridge which was very convenient. The hotel also offers several places to eat and a Pizza Hut Express to order from your room (yes they delivered). We really had a good time and I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel”
Reviews.Author: footiecook
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many hotels in the US but this is by far the worst we have ever encountered. From the reception not speaking proper english and notbeing able to give out basic information to being re directed to the guest relations for info about Orlando only for them to try and force us to take a time share tour before giving out any info. The shuttle buses to the parks are very infrequent and while we were there we had to leave the parks early thus missing the fireworks at each park as the last bus home was 10pm. The walls were so thin you could hear the movements of all your neighbours next door and upstairs and i dont just mean their footsteps!!!! Very poor quality for a US hotel especially in an area which depends so heavily on tourism

Reviews.Title: “The best on US192.....highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed from May 19 to June 10th and were very pleased. Ok ,the decor is a bit old , but certainly no worse than most hotels in this class. The rooms are big , Tv had good reception and if you called down for anything like pillows...it was there in 10 minutes. We had room 196 which was right in front of the pool ......I would highly recommend that when you book that you ask for a room between 190-199 and then you will have the least walk to both the pool and the lobby/restaurant.....and you will be away from the car park. This is a big resort so we found it best to base ourselves as near as we could to everything....We had a wheelchair and everything was accessible. The swimming pool was gorgeous although they turned off the pool heat on June 1st so it was a little chilly first thing. The shuttles are excellent and they can carry strollers and wheelchairs with no fuss or bother. They can get a bit crowded so get to the bus stop and make sure you get a seat!! The breakfast was good at the hotel , but some of the waitresses are a bit liberal and charge you for extra things you didn`t order....happened all the time so check your bill. The shop is good and the Pizza hut had excellent buffalo wings and pizzas etc. Mind you the Golden Corral opposite is much cheaper for food so cross the 192 (not at the crossing or you`ll die!!....cross opposite the Golden Corral)and have a massive brekkkie and dinner is fabulous. For a more expensive and quality meal , turn right out of the hotel and there is a TGI Fridays , Cracker Barrel and Carrabas. Walgreens is in the parking lot of the hotel and was open 24hrs which was handy...they sell snacks and drinks which you could put in your cooler bag for the theme parks as they cost a fortune once you get there. The 55 Lynx bus stop is opposite the hotel and they are also wheelchair friendly. That`ll take you to Old Town which has shops and rides and real atmosphere....last bus back is 8.49 pm.You can also get a bus from old town to disney at all times (56)so don`t panic if you sleep in. The hotel was very comfortable......if you want the Crowne Plaza Universal....you won`t get it here , but I cannot think of a better hotel for convenience to the parks and amenities and I would really recommend it if you do not want to drive in Florida. I have been to this area 11 times now and this hotel was my best experience. The only tight thing is that if you book through virgin and you are a gold crown rewards member....you do not get rewards points for your stay.....come on Best Western....Holiday Inn and Hilton give those points...shouldn`t you?

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Would Definitely Visit Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We wanted to take the time to write this review because we were very pleased with this hotel. We actually got booked through Priceline at a great price and extended our stay here due to the quality. The rooms are nice, good size and clean. The customer service extended to us was above average and appreciated. The property had several different ammenities that were nice and is a very large facility.

Reviews.Title: “Had A Great Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. I was very worried after reading all of the negative reviews. So I tried to go with an open mind and not expect a whole lot. I was pleasantly surprised. I took my own cleaning supplies just in case I needed to clean before I let my children use the rest room. Everything was very clean. We did eat breakfast and lunch in the room to save money. Shoney's on 192 was very good for breakfast one day and the same price as back home in Illinois. The pool was very nice and clean as well as our room. My husband had a problem with all the non-speaking English workers. It was a little difficult to comunicate, but all in all WE HAD A GREAT TIME.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Lakeside Clean and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: Sue_Mor
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Best Western Lakeside for the week of May 21, 2006 with my mother and two kids and the hotel was very clean and comfortable. The kids enjoyed the pool and the mini-golf. Even though I rented a car, I used the Shuttle service to go to the theme parks, which allowed to me relax and save on parking - $9.00 for each park. Travel Tip #1: To save on the cost of meals, go to Wal-Mart, further west on 192 - off 27, and purchase your breakfast, lunch and snack items. Also Wal-Mart sold toasters for $9.00, we purchased one, and had waffles, toast, and bagels for breakfast. Travel Tip #2: Purchase your disney tickets at discount ticket booths. Purchased a 3 day ultimate WDW park-hopper for $400.00 US for 4 people. If you purchased those tickets through disney it would cost around $700.00US.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here with my family twice now and I am going back this June. It's honestly one of the nicest hotels I've ever been to. I love the poolside bar, the mini golf, the three pools, and I love how you can eat in the hotel and there's a nice little shop inside the hotel. Clean rooms, nice staff. Two minutes from Walt Disney World. I love it, and I don't think I'd rather stay at another hotel when we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were a little nervous about staying here due to some of the less positive reviews, however, we found the rooms to be nice, well kept and a great value. Housekeeping was great our entire stay. Great for families on a budget and with their own transportation. Within minutes of tons of restaurants and shopping. Minutes away from all the major theme parks - less than 5 minutes to Disney, 10 to Sea World, 15 to Universal, and only an hour to Cocoa Beach. Had such a great time, we are planning on returning next year!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: Clint_Estwd
Reviews.Content: Staff was great and always friendly. Rooms were clean and spacious. Couldn't beat the price. There was plenty of restaurants in the area. Minutes from Disney, Universal and Orlando International. Transportation to the parks is provided free. We didn't use this service. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pinkcandy
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site we prepared ourselves for the worst! We booked with Virgin Holidays so got a few little bonus things like a free paper every day, no resort fee to pay etc. We arrived on Friday 28th April (Room 126) to a lovely bright reception, with friendly staff, got checked in within minuites. The rooms. The rooms were large and spacious, but there was only two of us, a family of 4 may be a bit crowded. The rooms were very clean, we were always were provided with clean towels, clean sheets etc. The air conditioning units were noisy but we didnt need it on to sleep as our room always seemed cool. There was a TV with 22 channels, a fridge which worked wonderfully, the bathroom was small but the shower was lovely, always had plenty of hot water available. We had two big double beds, which were so comfy especially after 12 hours at the parks!! The Hotel. The pool was great, always so many sunbeds, the pool was always clean, there was a small pool bar, and clean towels were provided. We never went to the hotel breakfast as our fave was the Golden Corral across the road but what we did see it looked great. We used the small shop every day for early morning coffees and crossaints!! Pizza Hut was a bonus too. We ordered from the room and it was ready in minuites, it tasted so much better than UK pizza huts too! The grounds of the hotel were nicely kept too. I would say it is so much easier to hire a car while you are there, its not really a place you could walk anywhere to. There is a Walgreens on site but we found a little way down the road there is a huge Walmart which was so much better and cheaper. So if you have booked here and really concerned about the reviews please dont worry as its a great base to stay for the parks, it really is so close to Walt Disney World and its in a great location. The only problem I could point out was the fact that the walls are VERY thin and found that you could hear people's TV's and kids early in the morning and late at night so if you are a very light sleeper you may need to bear this in mind. I would definatly stay here again without question, it was our first trip to America/Disney and loved every second of it and have already started planning next years trip :-)

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: KellyInFL
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised after reading some of the other reviews. The property is dated, but the rooms have been remodeled and were very clean. The hotel is quite geared toward families, so expect to hear children running around. I let the front staff know I wanted something quiet and they put me in back, away from the pool area. I will definitely stay at this place again. It's a great bargain.

Reviews.Title: “NASTY !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FayeHLoganville_GA
Reviews.Content: Nasty !!!! This hotel was filthy !!!!! My sons and I visited within the last week and found this hotel to be awful !!!! They are rated as a 3 star, but they really are a 2 star. Maybe even a 1 1/2 star. Upon arriving, the registration area smelled awful. Our room was nasty !!! The carpet was filthy. There was a 1 inch opening from the floor to the bottom of the entry door. We could see the sun from inside our room coming through the crack under the door !!! The corridors were filthy !!! I've never seen so many cigarette butts in my life !!!! All of the air conditioner units were leaking water and the standing water had turned "green". NASTY !!!! The handle on our "not working" fridge was rusty. The putt putt area was gross !!!! The playground was filthy !!! Cigarette butts were in the sand on the playground !!! We checked out after one night (only because I would have lost a one night stay) and stayed somewhere else the remainder of our vacation. Please, please trust the bad reviews. I wish I did !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hotelfanOrlando_FL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Lakeside in Kissimmee for 6 nights and couldn't have asked for a more enjoyable stay! Staff was very helpful and friendly. Our room with 2 dbl beds, coffee maker & refrigerator was large and comfortable and in great condition and the housekeeping staff cleaned our room daily and always left us plenty of towels. Pools, exercise room, guest laundry and the grounds overall were kept up nicely. Good location on Irlo Bronson with many favorite restaurants close by. Having Walgreens right across from the hotel was a plus. Didn't try the breakfast buffet but the bar and general store in the main building of the hotel came in so handy for us. We'd get our muffins and fruit at the end of each day for the following morning. Our laptop did not work with the dataports in the room but a debit card can be purchased inside the business center by the hotel front desk for those needing internet access. The rates to use the computers are not cheap but the service is there if needed. Can't comment on the shuttle service to the attractions because this was a house hunting trip and not a "theme park" vacation for us but the hotel really is at Disney's doorstep. We would highly recommend this hotel to those who wish to take in the theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Not overly impresses”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had initially booked the Holiday Inn (also in Kissimmee) but after reading the terrible reviews I changed to the BW. The rate wasn't bad, but it wasn't "cheap" either. I have to say I was somewhat disappointed. The carpet was stained, and the fridge barely worked. The room was neat and clean. The heated pool was nice and my kids enjoyed it. I had friends stay inside Disney and they also complained about the pool being packed. By contrast ours was empty. I liked having the Pizza Hut inside so we could get take out and eat by the pool. The convenience store was great too and the prices were not much higher than normal. We didn't use the breakfast buffet --even if the kids ate free it was still $15+ for breakfast and there were much better deals in the area. There are dozens of restaurant choices for every meal nearby. It is very close to Disney and made it convenient hotel. (There are many, many choices on the same road). The BW adds a $3.50 a day "resort fee" to the room rate and I'm still trying to figure out what I got for that extra $$... I wouldn't rely on their transportation to get you to the park. The one day I checked into it, the first bus out was 10am and the park opened at 8am. Overall, I'd say it was an average hotel for and average price (by no means a "resort").

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel for Families to Stay While Visiting Disney World!!”
Reviews.Author: Lynn173
Reviews.Content: This budget hotel has to be the best hotel I've ever stayed at in a popular tourist area! Not only was the price right, but the room was very clean and the staff was friendly. After a two hour delayed flight, we arrived at the Best Western at 2:00am! As tired and annoyed as I was, I still noticed how beautiful the landscaping was as we pulled in, and I was treated very well at the desk that early in the morning. We stayed for five days, four nights and every day the maid cleaned the room spotless. The hotel grounds were beautiful, great layout around three different large clean pools, giving you a more private and less busy place to relax by the pool. We visited Disney during a highly busy season "Easter week", so the hotel was full, but you woudn't know it. Friends of ours stayed at a hotel inside the Disney Resort a week prior to ours. They were upset at a dirty room and the pools were jam packed with people. They said when they would escape Disney during the crowded time of the day to relax by the pool, it was so full of people, there wasn't any relaxing! They paid three times what we did per night and were disappointed! The Best Western is so close to the Disney gates, and great resturants are all around it with MUCH better prices then inside Disney World! A very convenant Walgreens is right next to the hotel as well. We had a wonderful trip to Disney, and this hotel helped to make it great!

Reviews.Title: “Tired Rooms, Not Clean Enough”
Reviews.Author: xlnt
Reviews.Content: Didn't agree with the others who said this is great value! While staff was friendly, and room was good size, a/c vents and floor moulding had a thick layer of dust nearly 1/2 inch deep. Carpet was stained, white walls were coated with dirt, tile bathroom floor was sticky every day, and the television reception was blurry and fuzzy. Walls also had chips and nicks. All towels were hard and smelled like vinegar, and were of the cheapest quality possible. Bedspreds had an odor as did the room, which smelled moldy and dusty. We took off one day and stayed on Treasure Island at the Bilmar for $134, and got a beautiful, freshly remodeled room with lovely tropical furnishings, brand new carpet, granite countertops and tub surround, built-in flat screen tv, and a spectacular ocean view on the ground floor where we could step out of a sliding door to the sand-covered terrace. Unfortunately, only spent one night away from Best Western, had to return to the disgusting room since we had paid for it. The only thing we enjoyed was the heated pool, and hot water for tub. Cannot believe Expedia would include the Best Western Lakeside Kissimmee in any of their packages as it really needs an upgrade! Unless you plan to spend your entire vacation going to Disneyworld and the other theme parks, pay a little more and stay at the Bilmar on Treasure Island, You will love it, as well as the gentle lull of the gulf coast waters just outside!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and great location for Disney”
Reviews.Author: Bugs1012
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in April, based on reviews on this site. Once again, Tripadvisor proves its worth! It turned out to be an excellent choice. We paid $75+tax a night for a very quiet, clean motel room. It was only 10 minutes away from Disney World, so for us it was a great location. We didnt use the pool, but it looked clean - and the kids splashing around were certainly having fun. But we did make use of the mini grocery store to buy a few breakfast provisions for our room, as well as getting full use of the laundry. There was also a mini-golf course. We didnt try it. I would highly recommend the Best Western Lakeside.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family stayed three nights. The hotel had a kiddie pool, small playground and they were all used alot during our visit. The breakfast buffet was a great value with a variety of foods. I recommend this hotel for anyone on a budget that wants a clean, fun place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: JoannaVT
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel – which is what we expected. Those that expect 5 stars for the price of 3stars will be in for a surprise. It is not a fancy place and it’s a bit run down. It has Motel 6 type of decor but overall it is clean and we didn’t see any bugs. Rooms are specious but the beds are not comfortable. The biggest negative about the room was the noisy air conditioner. It REALLY does sound like an engine of a tank that runs every few minutes. The location can be viewed either way - it is very close to the parks BUT the traffic is terrible! If you’re like us and only to go to 1 or 2 parks and want to chill out the rest of the time, I’d stay elsewhere. It was a nightmare to even go get something to eat because the location is on a main highway and the restaurants are packed with tourists. On the positive side, the place is inexpensive and the pools are very nice. 2 poolside bars are a bonus, as is the free Putt Putt Golf. Carrabba Italian Grill (to the right on 192) is excellent and very reasonable. Walgreens next door is convenient but don’t buy food there. Best place for groceries is in the shopping mall behind Cracker Barrel, that’s a real supermarket (not what they call supermarkets but are really convenience stores.)

Reviews.Title: “Great value at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent three nights at the Best Western Lakeside during our visit to Orlando (March 31 - April 3 2006). I chose this hotel because it was in my price range and because of the free shuttles to Disney AND Universal Studios. Here is what we thought of the hotel... Check-in - We arrived at 2:45 and were pleasantly greeted and checked in without any problem. We were given the option of first or second floor and we chose second. I would have liked a room facing one of the main pools, but we were facing one of the parking lots and another one of the hotel buildings instead. Room - our room was quite pleasant. Looked just like the rooms on the website. Two double beds, TV, dresser, small table with two chairs, mirror & sink outside of bathroom, small bathroom with toilet and tub. Also an in-room safe, small fridge and air conditioning. The beds were comfortable and the whole room was very clean. We didn't really like the towels though...they seemed to leave a white residue the first time that we used them. They get replaced each night, so the same problem happened each day with the new towels. That was minor though. Shuttles - the free shuttles to the parks were great. The times worked great for us. This is one of the only hotels that I could find that offered free shuttles to Disney and to Universal. They were a little late picking us up at the end of the day from the parks, but that was only minor. The drivers were quite friendly. A caution about calling "cabs" from the hotel...if you ask the desk to call a cab for you, they actually call the shuttle service instead and the shuttles don't have meters in them and they will charge you a flat rate, which could be more than a cab. This kind of annoyed us when we asked them to call us a cab for Downtown Disney. We were charged $25...which was a little more than what a cab would have cost. So, be cautious when asking for a cab and if you get the shuttle, get them to tell you the fee before you get into the "cab". Food - the hotel offers a breakfast buffet for $7 a person. It was okay...nothing too fancy, but you can load up on fresh fruit (bananas, apples, oranges) to take to the parks with you. There was an omelette making station that looked good too...they also had boxes of cereal included in the buffet. There is not much for dinner choices right at the hotel...they do have Pizza Hut, but not really anything else. Pools - there is no hot tub here but the two main pools (and one small pool) are quite nice. They have a pool bar and lots of lounge chairs with towels available there, so you don't have to use your room towels. "Discount" park tickets - Be warned here....you are able to get discounted tickets to the park here, but only if you agree to attend a 90 minute "Vacation Ownership" sales presentation offsite. We reluctantly signed up for this and it ended up being not so bad. The "shuttle" takes you from the hotel to another resort (Wyndham Golf) about 5 minutes away. You can pick the time to take this "tour". You get a free buffet breakfast (which wasn't bad). After you eat, a sales person sits one on one with you to go over their sales pitch. We then got a tour on a golf cart of the property (which was actually a really nice ride outside). We were presented with an offer that we politely turned down and then got two more counter offers which we also turned down. They "released us" and we paid for our tickets. The shuttle came back to get us and took us directly to the Magic Kingdom for no charge...and we got there before the shuttle would have gotten us there by. We saved $60 USD total on our tickets, so I think it was worth it, but it's something you need to be aware of. There were A LOT of other people receiving the sales presentation too...so you won't be the only ones there! Overall, this was a really great hotel and we would definitely stay here again. It seemed like a great hotel for kids too. We paid about $200 US for the three night stay. If you are looking for a pleasant hotel with good value, I would highly recommend this one. Also, as mentioned, it is the only one I could find that had free shuttles. (Magic Kingdom, EPCOT, Animal Kingdom, MGM, Sea World & Universal Studios / Islands of Adventure).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for great value!”
Reviews.Author: pagrl17
Reviews.Content: I am a very picky about where I stay. This hotel met my expectations...and even exceeded them. We arrived around 11:00pm and the desk clerks were very pleasant and provided quick service. Our room was clean on arrival and everything worked properly. The only problem we had was not having enough towels. We called down to housekeeping and we had towels within 10 minutes (very fast for such a large property!). I would recommend this hotel for anyone who is on a budget, likes to be close to the parks, and likes prompt friendly service!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall, I was very pleased with the quality of the hotel for the price paid. My girlfriend and I spent seven nights at the hotel for our spring break. We were not at the hotel all that much but when we were there everything went perfect. The rooms were always clean and the pools were nice. The hotel offers a complimentary bus shuttle to and from the Disney and Universal parks. THe only bad thing is that they run only twice a day so you have to abide by the times otherwise you will have to take a taxi. We found one way around this and that was to utilize the Disney shuttles to and from the parks, which are free, so you can hop on a shuttle back to the hotel at whatever time you want. Also, restaurants around the hotel are pretty limited unless you want to eat at a buffett. If you are looking for a place like TGI Fridays, Red Lobster, etc. you will be ok because there are a few of them around the area. Overall, the hotel is nice and we did not have anything negative to say about what we received from them.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for the parks”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just come back today from a two week stay at this Hotel. It is located just off the 192 which is a busy road and set in its own grounds. There are shops and restraunts within walking distance if you have not got a car, but a car is advisable to get around (take your life in your hands if you try to cross the eight lanes of traffic outside the hotel on the pedestrian crossing). The rooms are basic and clean, although you wont have to look too hard to find some faults, stained carpets, noisy balconies with people coming and going at all times of the day and night. There are three good heated pools to cool off in at the end of the day, they are open till 11pm, also good laundry facilities at only $1.50 per wash and per dry. There is a handy store located next to the hotel where you can pick up a daily paper/develop photos and get any meds that you may need last minute. There is also a good crazy golf course next to the hotel which is worth a visit one evening. The Hotel do a decent breakfast where kids eat free to set you up for the day before you hit the parks. The Hotel was busy while we were there and the majority of those there were from the US which we took as a good sign. Check out times 12pm but if you ask in advance you can keep your room on until 1pm at no extra charge but they only let so many rooms on a daily basis. We used it purley as a base and spent most of the time in the parks and attractions and for that I think it is fine, it is good value basic family accommodation. However if you are fussy or want to spend more time at your Hotel then you may want to look further.

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney Resort alternative!”
Reviews.Author: moose-ca
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on this hotel. Very close to the Disney Properties, but at a fraction of the price. Room was clean, but an older hotel. Didn't have any King Size beds left when we checked in, so we got a room with two doubles. It was a cozy couple of days! Right beside an adventure mini-golf course, but didn't find it too noisy. Just a heads-up: "Lakeside" is misleading. There is a body of water beside the hotel. No swimming. No beach. Just a landmark I guess!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: ebennett
Reviews.Content: Well I got to say, I was a little worried after reading other peoples review. It was a very worth it. I really was impressed with that place. It was very nice. We only swam in 1 of the pools (there are 3) it was really heated. It was so nice. The staff was really nice and very helpful, we did not take the shuttles to anyplace, cause they only ran 2 times a day, so we just drove there. The hotel was really nice, and the rooms were very clean. The showers were very small, but that was the only thing I did not like. We ate at the restaurant 1 night it was good food, the service was a little slow. We did not try the breakfast, only cause of what other people have said about it. I did there mini golf there, it was a little cheesy, but was free, and actually was fun. If we ever went back there I am sure we would stay there. Worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel from feb 24 to mar 3 with my wife and two children (6 and 12 yr). Had our room in block 7 which was a little bit away from swimming pool (two min. walk) but because of that no problem with any noise or such in the evening. Perfect location for visits to major attractions, rooms were spacious and clean, staff was helpfull and friendly. No problems with smell in the room (had the -very noisy- AC on during the day). Breakfast was good. I'm sure there are better hotels in the Orlando area, but considering the price for a room in this hotel it's above average. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right for the Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my wife and i booked this hotel one week prior to our stay. upon arrival we were pleased with the accomodations and service.at first our frig didn't work but a new one was brought right in. there were three heated pools (big time heated) a nice bar,deli and restaurant on premises,not to mention a stones throw from disney,and tons of local shopping and restaurants.we will definetly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Disney resort!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: funplace
Reviews.Content: During our stay of 1 1/2 wks. we stayed at the Best Western Lakeside and the Carribbean beach disney resort. We liked the Best Western Better! It was very clean and quiet, we couldn't have asked for a better hotel. It was right on the main strip of Kissimmee very close to restraunts and shops. This hotel had a lot of nice extras like a playground, clean pool, putt putt golf, laundry, restraunts and a general shop even a fridge in the room. They rooms were very nicely sized, much larger than the disney rooms. I give this hotel 10 stars!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for the money!!”
Reviews.Author: Apydazes
Reviews.Content: We needed an inexpensive hotel in the Disney area. We found the Best Western Lakeside to be one of the least expensive per night. We convinced ourselves that we were just sleeping there.....but were pleased when we arrived. Rooms were clean and bright....Heated pool was a delight on the cool nights. Hotel help was friendly and helpful.....Buffalo wings from hotel restaurant on Super Bowl Sunday delicious....overall it was a very nice experience for a very cheap price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of this hotel I was afraid to stay here, but I decided to find out for myself. I'm very glad I did! The room was clean, the staff was great (some couldn't speak English very well, but they were still very helpful!), the business center where you could access the internet was nice ($0.20 per min. on net & $0.75 per page to print), the game room was ok (could use more/newer games), it was nice to have a Pizza Hut and General Store in the lobby. There was also 2 other restuarants on site. The breakfast bar was awful!!!! It did have quite a variety, but it did not taste at all good!! There was 2 laundry facilities onsite. I did use one of them and it was nice. There was a dispenser for 1 time use detergent and fabric softner ($1.00 each). I would suggest going to the Walgreen's (at the end of the parking lot) to buy a small bottle for multiple loads! The "lake" was disappointing! I'm from TN and it looked to me like the pond I have! Unlike the lake across the road, you could not get into this one. (But after looking at it I wouldn't have gotten in this one anyway!) My room was located on the first floor (rooms 162 & 167). I had a king bed, fridge, 2 phones, a desk, safe, broken hairdryer, couch, and color TV with few channels. The bad part about these rooms would be that they are located directly in front of the mini golf. This can be very loud!! (Drinking adults, not kids!!) I had to call for maintainance 1 time. They did respond within 10 minutes. (The TV wouldn't change channels; needed to be reset) And the only major complaint I had was the rate per night that I was quoted on the phone ($55.00 per night) is not what I was charged. Instead I was charged $69.00 per night (which was still a good deal). When booking I was told I would have adjoining rooms and I did not. But for the most part it was a great place to stay and I will stay there next year as well.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i enjoyed my time in this resort... it has a very easy layout and very nice and clean... friendly employees and very helpful too... my room was very nice... i enjoyed my time there... i enjoyed everything about it...

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3 1/2 star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Best Western for the first week of February. This place is not a 3 1/2 star as Nolitours suggests at best it is a 2 star. The rooms were very small and I do not know how a family of four could ever stay here. There were only three drawers and almost no hanging space. The drapes in the rooms had to be shut all of the time because of the outside corridors which made the room very dark. It was noisy because inconsiderate people let their children run up and down and scream on the outside corridors at 7 AM or sometimes even earlier. The pool was nice, the buffet breakfast was inedible. All and all this place was not at all what I had expected and I am sorry that I wasted 7 days here. You can stay at the Hampton or Clarion down the road for the same price with an inside elevator and much nicer room. I am sorry that I didn't.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: chezny
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed in the best western lakeside. We stayed for 4 nights, the room was clean and quite spacious. The buffet breakfast was not good, we payed $5.95 for it and most of the hot items were cold and tasteless. The evening receptionist was not helpful, he was not friendly and had no personality, would probably stay again, but only because the room itself was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: Jen F
Reviews.Content: My husband, three year old daughter and myself stayed here from 01/15-01/21, 2006. We chose this "hotel" based on the other trip advisor reviews. I had researched Orlando for months and based on info from reviews this place seemed the safest. BIG mistake. Firstly, Do not look at the website pics and think that the hotel looks like this, this place is a Motel 2, not even a Motel 6! All the outdoor corridors are filthy, do they ever clean the trash cans??? The sidewalks are dirty.. The "lake " is ajoke, more like a man made swamp. The rooms are sooo budget, bathroom had cracks, mildew, shabby towels and moldy shower liner. Beds were comfy as were the pillows, but the comforter smelled horrible, I would not even let my mind wander as to what the smell was. The buffet for breakfast which was included in the rate was HORRIBLE! Yes, the selection was great and huge variety, but the bacon was underdone and smelled rancid, everything else was always cold, we even got there when it opened and it still was ice cold. Coffee was horrible. Someimes the servers charged for drinks, sometimes not... They seemed really weary. The shuttle service is you could call it that was horrible, they p/u at strange times and sometimes are an hour late to pick you up from the parks, and Florida is cold at night and with a child, that is unacceptable! The worst shuttle time is to Sea World where you get dropped off nearly 2 hours before the park is open! And the drivers go 30 miles over the speed limit while listening to Metallica! Yikes! But!!! The topper is that I chose this place as a lot of other Orlando hotels have a roach problem and this hotel had no bad reviews about roaches... WELL! On our way to the airport at 4:00a.m. as I was packing up the last bits in my luggage, I had some roaches come out to say "Goodbye"! My worst nightmare, I then stressed about bringing them back home, I had slept a whole week with them hanging out... also, all night long you feel biting and itching.. bed bugs perhaps? I was bitten alive! A word to parents, do not let your child near the lego table.. it has a 2" layer of filth on it! And stay away from the psychos selling discount tickets! They are really agressive and want you on a 2 hour tour to save $70... Hold your ground with them or just bypass them altogether and get the tickets at Disney like we did. Stay away from here!!! Stay at a Disney hotel, you will not be sorry and your child will love ya for it!

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Lakeside”
Reviews.Author: KittyHopper
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 26th Dec 2005- 2nd Jan 2006 Ideal for the Disney Parks (about 10 mins drive away) ample parking, onsite laundry, mini golf, 2 pools, shop, bar, restraunt and Pizza hut. Rooms are clean and spacious with fridge, tea/ coffee making facilities, iron & board, safe and tv. Immediate area - Walgreens pharmacy open 24hrs at the entrance to the site, other stores around include Winn Dixie supermarket acroos the road, gift shops and plenty of places to eat ranging from fast food to proper restaurants. If travelling with virgin the rep service is avaialble every morning from 8.30 am for 1 hour but there is no designated named rep for the hotel, we found the service very poor. If doing a fly drive you will go through pay tolls on the way to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks in December and thought it was a good hotel. Friendly staff, nice clean room and a very good, warm pool. The children also enjoyed the mini-golf course.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western gets better.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with 11 other family members for a 2 week perioed beginning the 3rd of December 05. We travelled from Sanford Airport and took the toll roads ( SR417 )( We got lost ). If i had to do it again i'd take the I4. Its simple. Take the I4 and come off at junction 64b. The slip road takes you directly onto the US192. Continue on the 192 for about 3 miles. The hotel is within spitting distance of marker 5 ( at its junction with Formosa Gardens ). We had 3 rooms. On booking in the reception desk requested a maid charge of $50 per room. This was politely refused with no questions asked. This hotel is quite large so dont unpack your bags at reception -you'll probably end up putting them back in the car and being directed to the far side of the complex. The rooms are what i expected. Budget but neat and tidy. 2 double beds in each room. Coffee and tea making facilities. An ironing board and hairdryer. An electronic keypad safe which was excellent - type in your own 4 digit code and the doors lock. A bathroom / shower with constant hot water. The room doors are operated with a card. What more could you ask for - we were here to explore, not sit in a hotel room all day. The hotel has a large beakfast area though cheaper / better choice options are available within walking disatance. There is an adequate drinking bar and a pizza hut within the reception block. The reception area is neat and clean and staff were friendly.The 3 pools at the hotel were excellent and extra towels were provided at poolside. The hotel itself is situated next to a 24 hr chemist / supermarket. Disney tickets could be bought from reception though again cheaper options are available elsewhere. Try a time-share tour if you've got 3 hours to spare. I went on one advertised for 90 minutes. We actually came out 180 minutes later but we had our cheap tickets.( About $30 per person cheaper ) ( A good experience , and no , we didn't sign up. ) I thought the Best Western at 7769 W.Irlo ( US192 ) was an excellent base for a 2 week stay. It is perfectly situated for all Disney and Universal has to offer. I had read the worst of the reviews, but from what i saw would recommend it to anyone. Oh and yes , we all left the maid a tip. Superb value. (Bolton , uk.)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Value”
Reviews.Author: Seminole_FLTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from Dec. 26 - Dec. 30 - a very busy time! We live outside of St. Petersburg, FL & based on the previous reviews we were a little apprehensive but stayed there anyway & we were glad! The room was clean and the staff was friendly. The breakfast buffet was a decent deal & by the time we got back in the afternoon the room was made up & ready. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: People have varying opinions of this hotel but it all depends on your expectation going in. I got a great price for ten days and my son and I had a wonderful time. We didn't spend too much time in the hotel, but why would you when you're on vacation in Florida? Yes, the room was a little smelly the first day we got there, mostly of bleach or chlorine, but it was gone by the next day. I assumed it meant the room was clean, which it was. The decor was bright and cheerful. My 8 year old thought it couldn't be better. We went to the pool one night and it was fun. Standard pool but it's what we expected. Never tried the mini-golf but it was pretty small, although the kids that were there seemed to be enjoying it. We ate breakfast one morning, taking part in the children eat free with a paying adult promotion. I didn’t enjoy it. The food was cold, the selection wasn’t that great, and you had to pay additional for drinks. We ended up going to the Walgreens right next door and buying breakfast foods. It was cheaper and it suited our mornings in that it was quick and easy. The Pizza Hut in the hotel was good and the food was made quickly. The video game room was completely overpriced and some games didn’t work. Also, the business center in the lobby where you were supposed to be able to get online was never working. But the staff was always courteous and friendly. At one point my door wouldn’t lock as I was trying to leave so I called the front desk and they had a guy there to fix it within three minutes. A lot of stuff was within walking distance and a ton of places to eat and shop were right there nearby. The hotel was off the main street so I never had any traffic noise. Overall, it was exactly what I expected, an older hotel with a little peeling paint but a good atmosphere. I would stay there again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Check-in took less than 5-minutes. Buildings were clearly marked and took even less time to find. I had a corner room close to pool, vending machines and laundry facilities. Good dining on-site but also close to restaurants. Clean room and grounds. Also less than 10 minutes driving to Disney attractions. Well-lit and quiet. Will defiantly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There seems to be mixed reviews about this place, most do seem to be positive which is only how I can describe my 14 night stay. I travel around a lot in the UK and the room I was in was up to the standard you would expect of a Premier Travel Inn or Holiday Inn Express. You even have the added bonus of a Fridge and safe. Both very important. The room was clean, had a TV, decent shower/bath, plenty of room for clothes and loads of room to move around. Now bear in mind I was a solo traveller so a small family may find the room a bit tight for space. For 2 or 3 it's ideal. The hotel has 3 pools, big enough for a decent swim, a breakfast buffet ($10 including drink), a bar with bar meals in the evening and a take away pizza hut. The staff I encountered were friendly and helpful and answered all my questions. The maids came in daily If you wanted and the room was left clean everytime. There's a computer room (extra charge) plus ATM (mind you was a bit costly to use). Also there is a phone in your room where you can make FREE local calls. Beware any other calls are a bit pricey. It has a big car park, is ideally placed for the Disney parks (only about 10 mins drive), to other main roads which take you to Tampa, Daytona, Orlando, Space Centre etc. There is a Walgreens chemist/general store next door, a few restaurants, McDonalds, steak, fish and a massive Walmart just 10 mins drive away on Highway 27. If I was to nit pick then just remember to add sales tax 6.5% and that's on everything you buy in Florida plus $3.50 a night resort fee so expect to play about $10 a night more on top of their quoted price ($59 becomes $71). To end there are worse places on Highway 192 and there are some expensive places but if you just want somewhere to base yourself for an Orlando/Disney/Universal/Theme Park holiday it is a good bet. If I go next year I will probably be back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: molou
Reviews.Content: Just spent a fabulous 16 nights at this hotel, and to be honest, haven't a clue where all the bad reviews have came from. We found everything to be above average for the price we paid (apart from the buffet breakfast in the Greenhouse Restaurant)! Rooms spotless and cleaned daily, clean swimming pool, helpful and efficient staff and the free shuttle buses were excellent, always on time with courteous drivers at all times!! Booking up again for next year as we are non-drivers but this was a great location with plenty of restaurants, shops, etc within a short walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: suzyqwalsall_England
Reviews.Content: Initial concerns due to previous reviews proved to be unfounded!!! Hotel facilities and rooms very clean. Maid service every day. Reception staff are friendly and the odd problem we had was sorted out within minutes. Only slight grievance was the hotel bar called Hurricane sams which we only tried once for a meal and ended up waiting 2 hours for our tea. Similarly don't use the hotel shop. Any groceries can be bought at half the cost at the walgreens chemist next door. Ponderosa restaurant over the road offers great english food at excellent prices- a welcome change from burgers and chips!! Extremely close to all the disney parks the hotel offers an excellent free shuttle service to the parks. Would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Holiday”
Reviews.Author: slacey1070
Reviews.Content: Nearly changed our accomodation when we saw some of the reviews on here, however I'm glad we didn't spend another £100 elsewhere, as this was just fine. The Room, 514, overlooked the pool & was very clean & tidy. Carpet was spotless & fridge clean. All light fittings, etc worked perfectly well. The air con is somewhat noisy, however this was easily solved by turning it off when we wanted to watch the tv or sleep. The pool was clean, with a plentiful supply of clean (but small) pool towels. Reception staff were very friendly & our one query (to sort out the safe that wouldn't lock) was resolved inside 10mins. The hotel has an excellent location along the 192, offset from the road, so no road noise when sat by the pool. All the Disney parks are 10mins or less away & the I4 can be accessed inside 5mins, so Universal is 20mins away. Didn't eat at the hotel (why would you want to with 100's of other places to eat just outside the do?) however did order a pizza from Pizza Hut, which is on site. The bathrooms are small, yet functional. Coffee maker & fridge were very useful - saving on breakfast each day. Enjoyed the stay so much that we are already planning another trip. Best Western Lakeside certainly isn't the Ritz, but for this price I can have no complaints whatsoever. Highly recommended & about half the price of the Disney properties.

Reviews.Title: “Awful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Hepar
Reviews.Content: We were very concerned about staying at the Best Western (formerly La Quinta Inn) after reading the reviews posted, but were hoping they weren't true. On our arrival on the 28th October, we could not believe the state of the rooms in Block 6. We were greeted with the damp, musty smell, which was overpowering, water stains and blood stains on the carpet. As we proceeded into the bathroom (if you could call it that) you couldn't turn around in it. It was cramped, the tiles were grubby and the door touched the toilet. The wash area was seperate from the bathroom, with no curtain to divide the room from the sleeping area. The fridge was broken, the control switches for the lights also broken, there was no wardrobe to hang clothes, and the drawers weren't cleaned out properly. The A/C unit made such a racket could not be turned off at the control and had to be unplugged from the socket, the door had been tampered with from a previous time. To top it all the bedding was damp. We had booked the holiday in August 2004 and in our party were 2 elderly relatives with respiratory problems. We couldn't believe our eyes that this hotel was Virgin's flagship hotel, we felt we were given any old room to stay in. I really thought after reading the reviews that the Best Western had turned it self around since it was La Quinta Inn, but how wrong we were. Fortunately, we were offered alternate accommodation from Virgin and had a great stay in the Calypso Cay Country Inn Suites, I would highly recommend this hotel. Its what we should have expected at the Best Western for the money we paid. The funny thing was that when we complained to the Reception staff who were so unfriendly, they were actually telling people who were checking in that if they had a complaint about the state of their rooms, they would be offered a free upgrade. We did notice that there were 8 other blocks, but I am surprised that people actually enjoyed their stay there, maybe they needed to have a look at Block 6.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from 10/30 - 11/03/05. I was quite aprehensive after reading some of the reviews. We had three poolside rooms in building 1 and they were all in very good condition and very clean. We had no complaints about the rooms at all. One morning the stop in the bathtub would not open and we called maintenance and they were there in 10 minutes. The pool area was very clean and the kiddie pool was excellent if you have any small children. We were 11 people in our party, 9 adults, 3 children. There was plenty for the children with the pools, minature golf, game room. The buffet breakfast in the restaurant in the morning was very good. There were also many restaurants in walking distance of the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Kissimmee area. If was a great deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: preretirement
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Orlando and stayed at the Best Western Lakeside. The hotel was clean and the rooms were comfortable. The hotel has several buildings, but only buildings 1, 2, and 3 offer high speed Internet. The resort offers three pools (no hot tubs), one being in the center of buildings 1, 2, and 3 - we stayed in building 1. We had quick access to the restaurant and shuttle service to the theme parks. These buildings also seemed to be family-friendly. Many families had kids in this area. The first night we stayed in an outer building (9, I think) and there were beer bottles outside and people were outside talking until about 2 a.m. Buildings 1, 2, and 3 seemed to be more low-key. The restaurant seems to be the busiest at breakfast. The food was fair. The hotel is close to several restaurants within walking distance - Outback, Red Lobster, Wendy's, Taco Bell, McDonalds. There is a Walgreens within 50 yards from the check-in desk. You can get snacks and breakfast foods there also. The hotel offers free miniature golf and there is a themed miniature golf course next door. Shuttle services are limited to once daily (except for Magic Kingdom that has two shuttles). Call ahead to see what schedule is being offered for your visit. The times limited some of the activities, for example, we did not get to stay and see the fireworks at the end. For the money, a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dev92
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Florida (14th Oct 2005) stayed at the best western lakeside (formally known as La Quinta). Excellent value for money, close to Disney, refurbished room (inclusive of fridge,air conditioning, 2 double beds). Staff and amenities very good, pool clean. Very worried about staying at this hotel after reading the reviews but make your own mind up, will definately stay at best western again!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tara7UK
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the other reviews I was initially concerned about the state of the hotel rooms but was pleasantly surprised. Ours appeared to be newly decorated and was clean which was the main thing. Yes the rooms are basic but they are cleaned every day and Staff seemed helpful enough. We used the pool regularly and Hurricaine Sam's Bar of an evening. Point to mention is that you will have to pay $3 a day for the safe and tea/coffee re-fills. The location is great for the theme parks and shopping outlets which are a short drive away and there is a wide selection of restaurants in walking vicinity although be careful if you are attempting to cross the roads! Would recommend taking your own drinks to the parks in an attempt to cut down the costs and be warned about buying your discount theme park tickets from the hotel lobby...yes we got a discount but we also had to spend two hours in a time share!! So shop around!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite the same experience”
Reviews.Author: Iain001
Reviews.Content: Generally the place was quiet - apart from the air conditioning, but the room was small & cramped for 2 adults and 2 young children. On the surface it was reasonably clean but not the carpeting. Fridge was antiquated but functional. The TV worked but the power point was an electrical hazard as the socket was coming away from the wall and sometimes failing to work. The staff were not particularly helpful and not very cheerful - perhaps this was something to do with the change of ownership. The corridors were dingy and could do with painting to brighten it up, overall I would not recommend this accomodation to anyone. It was clearly run down and in need of refurbishment. You save up all year and it is disappointing to have this as your base for a couple of weeks for that special holiday. Make a note - they charge a service fee ($49 - 2 weeks) for the room service at the end of your stay. They insist on taking your credit card details (card impression) on arrival and you have to sign a form agreeing to this when you are tired after travelling for many hours. On the plus side they did replace the towels & bed linen frequently. WalMart is fantastic as a one stop shopping place & Sizzlers 10 minutes walk away, on the other side of the 192, is very good value. Just cannot say the same for Best Western Lakeside. Consider other options!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to rest!”
Reviews.Author: ores
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a very enjoyable stay at the Best Western Lakeside. We didn't utilize the free shuttle or the buffet or even the pools as we were busy touring the amusement parks. Our room was lovely and clean and cool and odor-free. A great, clean, hot shower. Very safe environment (a concern of mine with hotel rooms that exit directly to the outside) and DEFINITELY worth the $28/night we paid through Hotwire. We agree that it was easily worth twice that. Friendly, helpful staff and prompt wake-up calls. Very close to Disney and many chain restaurants including fast-food and sit-down chain places very nearby. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money... Don't believe everything you read!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having checked this website for reviews of this hotel, I was horrified to see that I may have made a huge mistake. But seeing is believing, the hotel was great, just what we had last time we visited, clean rooms, lots of towels, pool (they even supplied tools for you to use around the pool, very handy), pizza room service, very close to Disney. What more do you need? Would recommend this hotel to anyone, on this type of holiday you don't need any more than this hotel already supplies.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic time”
Reviews.Author: RuthEastSussex
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews for this hotel since we booked i was very worried but thankfully i dont know where some of these people stayedbut we had a fantastic time. We asked if we could have a pool side room when we booked in and was given one with no problem. The hotel was clean the staff happy and helpfull and we had everything we needed. My only concern was that i dont believe the pool was very clean but my kids loved it

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have picked anywhere better!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Maz Lester
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from Lakeside and had a comfortable stay. the room was clean and well decorated. It was clean to a high standard daily. It was only a couple of miles from DisneyWorld after we found a short cut! The breakfast was excellent value for money with every tempting food you could ask for. The serving staff couldn't do more for you. The only tiny down point was the reception staf who failed to pass on messages to our room. Top banana for location and quality!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Beckatha
Reviews.Content: I'll get right to it....clean rooms, friendly staff, affordable dining, clean pools, free mini golf, decent gameroom, awsome free shuttle to parks (they even have drop down t.v.'s and we watched Shrek on our way to Universal). They have 3 pools to chose from and 2 kiddy pools. My boys ages 10 and 11 enjoyed exploring all 3 pools. Great breakfast buffet at a great price and kids 10 and under eat free plus you get a dollar off for being a hotel guest. The only thing that bothered me was the hour wait for dinner to go. I will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad!”
Reviews.Author: ABBIEXXXXXX
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with some of our family in June. We were impressed with the hotel, seemed pretty clean, and rooms were cleaned each day. This hotel is quite a distance from the Parks, and not an I Drive in sight... if you are thinking of staying here, definately get a hire car. We spent a fortune on taxis. Beware of the staff at reception, they try and sell you timeshares. Overall, this hotel was not bad. We slept with the air con on each night, because it was so HOT. It didnt bother us. Beware of the pool. Looks great, but its never cleaned, and we cut our holiday by a couple of days, and flew back earlier as we all fell ill with Gastroenteritis... wouldn't stay here again though, but if your looking for a place just to crash out, this is the place to stay. Go to Medeval Times dinner show... fantastic!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for price- reccommend for budget traveler”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here based on all the previous reviews. Let me just say that for the price it was great. We stayed in a standard non smoking room with 2 double beds and it was clean and did not smell and it had a pool view. The front desk was very helpful with directions and accomodations. We really didn't stay at the hotel much being that we were busy pretty much of the day, bu the time we were there it was very comfortable. The pool is very clean and big enough for many people. There is a little tiki bar by the pool thats nice, gives it a little tropical feel. The location of the hotel is 5 min to Magic Kingdom and MGM and about 15 to Animal Kingdom and Epcot and Seaworld. There are some outlet stores for great shopping about 10 min away on I-4 and all this was given to us by the staff. We did manage to try the breakfast buffet, where adults are 6.95 and kids eat free with a paying adult. And if you stay at the hotel you get a dollar off each paying adult. I have to stay that it is definitely not the greatest but the staff was extremely nice and helpful. We opted the rest of the time to go around the corner to IHOP. There are a few good places to eat very close to the hotel and a shopping area across the street. There is also a Walgreens walking distance which is good. The hotel definitely met our needs and our budget. I give it a 4 star because I felt like we had a great hotel and great location and great price and a great vacation. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “(simply) great”
Reviews.Author: RobVR6
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with three friends for a late holiday and found it very functional. admittedly its not the most luxurious hotel in the world, but i have been to florida on a number of occaisions and stayed in around 30 hotels. this one, it has to be said is up there with some of the best, not because of any one reason, but more so because the whole package works so well. the rooms are functional and have all the amenities needed, fridge, tv, kettle, ironing board, iron, trouser press, coffee machine a/c, etc. the decor is similar to that found in around 60% of all florida hotels, so no prizes for originality. the hotel couldnt be in a better location for those of us that drive. in the immediate vicinity there are a host of restaraunts and shops, including the black angus steakhouse (which is FANTASTIC, cheers phil!), angels diner, and many more. the theme parks are only a stones throw away, as is more of the entertainment that kissimmee has to offer, such as old town, with the worlds largest skycoaster, and the weekly classic car cruise as well as plenty of bars for those of you that like a good old --- up. along the highway 192 there are plenty of things to do ranging from 'flea markets' where bargains galore can be had (dont let the name put you off its all brand new stuff and cheap as chips), to evening shows such as arabian nights, and medieval nights. back to the hotel... we didnt have any problems with the rooms or the staff, and made good use of the free onsite gym (small but gets the job done) to burn off the extra calories that we (well me) were eating. i would definately go back and infact i am!!

Reviews.Title: “No probs, we'd stay again tomorrow.”
Reviews.Author: rtyson
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two weeks in January and everything was fine, our room was clean and comfortable. The ameneties were pretty good, pools were clean. We had no complaints at all. We had stayed at another place in Kissimee a year before and it wasn't anywhere near as good as this place. So if (when) we go to Florida again we'd have no problem with staying at this hotel. For the price we were well chuffed and 'cos we saved here we had more spending money! In fact we had to buy another suitcase to bring our purchases back. The staff were friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from FL. Our stay at this hotel was great...we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Better than your average hotel/motel”
Reviews.Author: GarryM
Reviews.Content: The la quinta (it is now the Best Western lakeside) is more of a motel with additional amenities, rather than a hotel resort. If you are intending to spend your time at the theme parks, and just want somewhere to have a good rest this place is fine. If you intend to spend some time onsite then I would suggest you ask for a room with either a lake or pool view, as this will move you away from the car parking area that is in the centre. The food onsite is OK, but not worth the additional cost when you can go to numerous eateries within a 5 minute walk. 5 minutes by car further west on the 192 is a publix supermarket to stock up on groceries. Each room has a large fridge, so you can get snacks and drinks and store them easily. The onsite bar is OK but the bar staff seem a little disinterested. Some renovations were taking place whilst we were there, but this did not cause us any problems. Housekeeping were great, our room was very clean and they would come back in the afternoon if we were still in the room in the morning when they tried to clean it. Overall I would recommend this place to anyone who is going to Orlando to see the theme parks and doesn't intend spending whole days onsite.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to say this was a great hotel and in a perfect location. Just down the road from Disney. They are very friendly and have everything you could possibly need. I highly recommend this hotel. I know I will definitely use them again.

Reviews.Title: “dont believe all you read!”
Reviews.Author: christinnabelle
Reviews.Content: my family have just returned from this hotel after a 2 week stay and had a fantastic time. Some trip advisors have said the carpets are filthy and smell,and i would like to suggest that this not down to the cleanliness of the hotel,and more to do with peole walking across the carparks to get to the pools with no flip flops on and treading dirt everywhere.these are the same people who do not shower before using the pools.We saw this every day.Yuk! Our room was cleaned daily by Josephina,who did a great job and towels changed daily.The phone in our room had a fault and was replaced within 10 minutes of notifing reception. we have no hesitation in visiting this hotel again and cannot reccommend it enough for its value and location to all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and friendly”
Reviews.Author: stevegilbe
Reviews.Content: I must admit that after reading some of the reviews, I was a liitle nervous about going here on honeymoon. On arrival my views changed. The staff were friendly and efficient. The room we had was spacious and cleaned every day with new linen (the only comment would be that the air conditioning was quite noisy). The "all you can eat" buffet breakfast was excellent value at $6.95 per adult with a child eating free. Hurricane Sam's Bar was a friendly evening retreat for the family with efficient staff. There is a childrens club which we used for our 6 and 5 year old daughters and, had we realised they would enjoy it, we would have used it more than once. Centrally located on US192 with numerous bars, diners and restaurants nearby. With the hotel only 2 miles from Walt Disney World it should be a hit with familys on a reasonable budget. Car parking was close to the room. This was my wife's first experience of an American hotel and she wants to return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very uneasy at first before I arrived due to the reviews that I read. What I found was a very nice, clean , and affordable hotel. I didn't notice any smell from the room. Everything was clean and the housekeepers were great. It won't compare to the $100+ a night hotels, but it depends what you want. It only was used for sleeping and swimming after a long day at the park. They have 3 pools to choose from. The other tourist there were mostly from the U.K. They were so great to talk to and play soccer and games in the pool. The location is excellent too. The 192 strip is better for people with rental cars. It is right out side Disney and only minutes from Sea World and Universal. The only thing to look out for is the gas prices right around the hotel area. The run 32 cents per gallon more than the same stations two miles further east. So, don't worry about this place if you want a clean safe place to stay for a reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “armpit of the world!!”
Reviews.Author: Andi1973
Reviews.Content: yes that is right this hotel is the armpit of the world, gross just doesn't do it justice. the rooms(we had a good one) stink, the carpets stink and are badly stained and the throws on the bed are never washed eeewww! the coffee machine didn't work, the hairdryer didn't work , the aircon...well what a waste of time, it made soooo much noise that you would never get to sleep. i ended up giving the room a good scrub down just to try and get rid of the smell (didn't work tho). this hotel should be called a motel. i think it is ok if you are not bothered what your hotel is like but if you are wanting value for money, general cleanliness and comfort then DO NOT stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: tomsy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks in November. The room was nice, we had all amenities, the housekeeping was excellent. The pool area was lovely, though very busy as we were there for part of the school holidays. They do have 3 separate pools though, one at the centre of each block of apartments. The hotel is conveniently located for Disney, and we could get up the I-4 to Seaworld etc in about 20 minutes. Lots of restaurants and supermarkets nearby, plus the inevitable gift shops. The hotel has it's own shop & fast food restaurant, as well as the breakfast restaurant. All food was good. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad At All!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews about this hotel before we left for our very first "dream" holiday to Orlando, I was starting to feel very nervous about staying at La Quinta, but I needn't have worried at all!! Part of our holiday was spending 10 nights at La Quinta & from the moment we checked in, we were impressed. Yes, there was some renovation work going on on one of the blocks, but it really didn't affect us at all. We must have been lucky to have a room allocated which had already been renovated before we got there as it was clean, pleasantly decorated & had all the amenities we could wish for (even a fridge which the hotel we stayed at in Fort Lauderdale didn't have!!) Probably a touch on the small side for 2 adults & 2 children, aged 12 & 8, but who cares when you're hardly in the room anyway!? The pool areas were nice & quiet & the kids loved the pool. The maid service was excellent. The rooms were always left very clean each day; clean towels & beverages left every day & if we forgot to leave the air-conditioning unit during the day, she would put it on for us, ready for us to come back to, which we thought was a nice touch! Yes, air conditioning unit a bit noisy, but we got used to it & aren't all air-conditioning units noisy?! Must admit we did notice the "smell" which everyone seems to mention in their reviews. We think it must have been something to do with the air-conditioning unit because when we turned it off, the smell disappeared!?!
