Perhaps it was some sort of freshener in there or even a mosquito-repellant!?! We found some of the staff on the reception desk to be a little abrasive sometimes. They looked at me one day as if I'd asked for $1000 when I asked if they could book us a cab so that we could collect our hire car....!!! But like another reviewer commented, they probably all have their individual jobs! The few times we used the Shuttle Bus service to the parks, we found it to be excellent. Obviously, you had to adhere to their scheduled times, but that wasn't a problem. All in all, we had no complaints whatsoever & would definitely stay there again, if we were to visit the Orlando area again.

Reviews.Title: “No Regrets”
Reviews.Author: pheasant_plucker2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last 2 weeks in April. The room was fine, the housekeeping excellent and the staff very helpful. Pool was great, mini golf for free, Pizza Hut on site. Not the most luxurious of hotels, but perfectly functional when you are spending most of the time in the parks. We travelled with Virgin for the first time and were very impressed with the whole package (maybe they get the better rooms?) No complaints, would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed at all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife in April . We love Florida/Orlando area and holiday here regularly but we have never stayed in such a horrible hotel. From outside all looks ok, however, once we had unpacked we realized that this hotel is not quite as described in the brochures. The first room we had was quite dirty; cobwebs on the lampshades, food debris/spills on and inside the fridge, dog hairs all over the bedspread, wet and stained areas all over the carpet, bathroom very cramped and in need of a good scrub (oh and the huge glob of hair removing from the bath plug hole so the water would drain). We were appalled at the lack of housekeeping and obvious “leftovers” from the previous occupants and their “pet”. We complained at reception and eventually they agreed to move us to another room. This was still not much better, very musty smelling and again dirty. We were told there were no other rooms available so we accepted this one as it was late. The following morning we checked out and would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend this one to anyone!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family, for 1 week in February this year, and to be honest, we wished we hadn't. The rooms were very outdated, and not very clean at all. (please see photo's posted separately). The carpet was very worn, and badly stained all over. So much so that your shoes stuck to it when you walked in. The walls and curtains showed evidence of damp (serious damp!!) with mould growing on both, and the whole room had a damp and musty smell to it. We couldn't tell though if the smell came from the damp on the walls, or the fact the toilet was cracked and created a paddling pool in the bathroom every time it was flushed! The pool areas are also dated, and would benefit from some serious renovation, tiles are missing, and there was a "scum" line around the top of the pool. We did complain to Hotel management, no other interconnecting rooms were available, so they assured us that the problems would be dealt with, however all of the photo's I have posted were taken on the last day of our stay, and as you can see, nothing had been done. The location of this hotel is ideal, with the Disney parks only about 10mins drive away, Walgreens right next door, and a variety of restaurants and fast food outlets over the road, however we did not feel this could in any way make up for the state of the rooms, and we would definitely not stay here again in the future. There are many other hotels in the area that offer just as convenient location, but a much better standard of accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week at the beginning of April and had a great time. Our room overlooked one of the pools and was clean and comfortable. Our tv was changed while we were there, even though there was nothing wrong with the old one. The public areas were clean, bright and nicely decorated, there was a real holiday atmosphere in the hotel. There was a decking area outside the bar which overlooked the lake and was very tranquil. We had the continental breakfast most mornings, a bit limited but ok. There was a more extensive buffet breakfast which only cost a little more. The bar area was a little lacking in atmosphere but as there was a pool table my boys were fine. The location of the hotel was fine, far enough away from the main road to be quite peaceful but not too far from all the main attractions by car. The 24 hour Walgreens next to the hotel was also very handy. We booked through Virgin as it's one of their flagship hotels and we found it to be perfectly adequate for what we paid. We would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Low grade motel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last two weeks in March ’05, very poor standard of hotel. Repairs going on, but a lot more work is needed to get this hotel up to scratch. General condition of rooms (we were moved 3 times) were poor; housekeeping left a lot to be desired; furnishings old, marked and need replacing. We got this accommodation for a very good price, so were prepared for the worst, and boy did we get it!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Managed one night here, and couldn’t stand it any longer. The room smelt awful, I don’t know if it was the damp, or the air conditioning, but nothing would get rid of it. Little or no cleaning had been done from the previous occupants. The door didn’t fit properly, and left about a half inch gap at the bottom. The bathroom was incredibly small, the shower didn’t work as you couldn’t turn off the mixer tap, so the bath filled up with water. The final straw came when the bed linen had not been changed as we found hairs and stains on the sheets (EEEyuch!) WE MOVED OUT THE NEXT MORNING!

Reviews.Title: “We wouldnever stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: raffpolizei
Reviews.Content: La Quinta Lakeside Inn We would never stay here again! This hotel is old and needs a total makeover. It maybe cheap but the old saying "you get what you pay for" definitely applies. This is not a 3 star property; it is dirty, dilapidated and should be closed down until it is brought up to standard.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok by itself if it wasn't part of the Ramada resorts package”
Reviews.Author: KatrinaV
Reviews.Content: This isn't a luxurious hotel, based off what Ramada Plaza resorts had promised as part of a vacation package. But it was much cleaner than the hotel in Ft. Lauderdale. Granted we had changed rooms 3 times before we were happy with our room. The first room we were assigned, it smelled like someone had vomited and they were trying to get rid of the smell by spraying tons of Lysol. Then the second room we got booked it had a view of a huge construction area, which made a lot of noice, which then tells you we had to get a different room. I think the only room I saw that were decent, but didn't stay in, were the rooms close to the pool area. If you wanted that room they charge you an extra $10/night, which I think is ridiculous. The decor of the room totally looked like it came out of a 70's era. Even rooms in Bangkok that cost me $25/night were better than this place! I think the only good quality about this hotel is it's location. It's not far from Disney World and had a fun golf course right next door. But I suggest you try and avoid getting a room that is behind the golf course. Who knows what kind of people can climb over the fence and try to get in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Price was right”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and two kids (6 & 9) went March 10th to March 17th. For the price that we paid, I really cannot complain. It really needs to be renovated as it is very old and out-dated. They are starting to renovate, but will probably take a while to finish. It was clean, and for the amount of time we stayed in the rooms, we found it satisfactory. If you are looking for something posh, this is not the place to stay. The staff was friendly and the restaurants were good.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: Beatons
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews I was very nervous about staying here but decided to try it anyway. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms were clean but really in need of being updated. The only fault I found with the rooms were the damp smell. As soon as we walked in there was a strong smell of bleach and dampness. The smell seemed to come from the air conditoning so we would shut it off at night and after you were there a day the smell didn't seem so bad. The only sink in the room is outside of the bathroom so it made it hard to get washed up if there were kids in the room there was no privacy. The hotel was in a perfect location with a Walgreens about a minute walk away and very close to Disney. The hotel was not as bad as some of the reviews make it out to be. They are renovating some of the rooms but until the renovations were completed I would have to say that I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money and look for a real hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: bigbrat
Reviews.Content: This should be classed as a motel, and a low class one at that, the rooms are awful, damp patches on the ceilings and walls, awful smells, filthy bedding, and extremely unsafe for children. They seem to like digging holes all over the property and "fencing" them off with a strip of plastic tape. This hotel was a total disappointment and does not even deserve a one star rating.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Physically here, wishing I was there
Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: AlanWhicker
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel from the UK and were tired and a bit emotional! but we found the staff extremely sympathetic, friendly and helpful. The room itself was more than adequate for my family of 4. Clean and tidy with no sign of the expected plumbing issues that I had read with horror. The hotel was set in lovely surroundings. The pool area was beautiful and the Pool was crystal clear. I would gladly reccomend this Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the Price”
Reviews.Author: tkfarley
Reviews.Content: OK for the money - would return. Close to everything. You get a nice clean room, decent service, and a few amenities. Good/Safe place for young kids - no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel. None of the problems listed in previous reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed from February 20 -25, 2005. Had a fine time. Room was very clean though it did have a type of musty smell that could have been from the pool or the shampoo they use on the rug. After several minutes in the room the smell was not detectable. Our room was on the second floor facing one of the pools. The view was very nice and the place was laid out very nicely. The location is very convenient to disney and local shopping. There is a 24 hour walgreens adjacent to the property. We did not have any of the problems listed by others. The refrigerator in the room was large for a hotel room refrigerator and nicely hidden inside a cabinet. The air conditioner at times was not as effective as I would have liked. They did tack on $3.50 a day for whatever they call it. The continental breakfast was actually pretty good. Overall, we had a nice time and I would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great people!”
Reviews.Author: lawrencegirl3
Reviews.Content: I have just returned with my family from a 14 night stay at La Quinta Lakeside and found the hotel to be more than OK for our needs. I was concerned to read the negative reports before I went and was a little apprehensive when we arrived but all in all the hotel room, staff, facilities and location we all really good. The slightly damp smell in the room was caused by the air conditioning unit - not a problem, just turned it off! Some people just like to moan - what do they expect for the price? You get what you pay for and in my opinion the hotel did everything possible to make sure we had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “CHEAP, Don't Brother!”
Reviews.Author: trlyons
Reviews.Content: Rented two rooms, one room never had hot water the entire 4 night stay. Resort Needs a total renovation. Water pipe broke at 1:00 am and workers jack hammered all night above us. Pool needs major overhaul. Front desk tried to charge us for "free breakfast and in-room safe." Don't stay here we wish we did not, it is not a 3 star or even 2 and I am not picky.

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed at the la quinta inn on jan 22 to jan 29 2005. the room was alright for a place to shower and sleep..there was alot to do at the hotel since the parks closed early..the heated pools were great and very clean..right across the street were restuarnts, a liquor store, supermarket..etc. great location from the parks..did not eat at the hotel, but the onsite pizza hut was very good..the only bad thing was the shuttle buses, they came to pick you up around and hour and half after the parks closed so we had to wait for it to take us back to the hotel..had a very good time and would definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. Would of checked out the day we arrived but it was New Years Eve Weekend and we knew we would have a hard time finding the same great deal we received. The room was not nice. There was a huge stain in front of the air conditioner - probably an old water stain but still disgusting. The carpet was very dirty. The water in the shower would go from warm to boiling hot. There was mold/mildew on the back of the shower curtain rods. You couldn't help but stare at it in the shower. The water pressure was absolutely the worst! The bathroom was so small you could barely get in and close the door. There is a curtain that blocks off the bathroom sink from the rest of the hotel room. There is no bottom sheet on the bed just a regular old sheet laid on the bed! The free breakfast buffett was not to spectacular. The paid breakfast across the way was okay. Kids ate free so it was worth it. Orlando is full of hotels so I would think twice before I would stay here! Look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother unless your really want a cheap holiday!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Quinta Inn over the 2004 xmas period for 2 weeks. We checked into the room in the early hours of the morning and the first thing that hit us was the smell, it smelt really damp. At this hour of the morning we just wanted to go to bed. We did complain and they offered to move rooms but once you have unpacked we couldn't be bothered. Apart from that the rooms were ok, could do with a lick of paint! The breakfast at the hotel was ok and good value for money, especially if you have kids that eat for free, but i wouldn't bother with the evening meal, it was cheap but nothing special. The cost of alcholic drinks was REALLY expensive, unless your in time for happy hour 5-7pm. The hotel isn't what you exoect when you look in the Virgin brochure. If you are going there to spend all day in theme parks and are not bothered about where you rest your head, then you will be ok, be we did not keep busy EVERY day and sometimes wanted a rest to spend in a nice hotel. OK if your on a very tight budget and don't mind a damp, niosy air-con hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible - don't Ever Stay there!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at La Quinta on December 10, 2004 (was supposed ot say another night but checked out early). Checked into our room and although it looked not bad, I pulled back the sheets after a long day and found pubic haris all over my sheets - Gross. I called the front desk and the lady said she was sending someone with new sheets - acted like it wasn't a big deal- usual? A man came and didn't even offer to help me and just gave me the sheets. Also their were little bugs all over the room We stayed at a poolside room and there was alarge convention of people there drking and swimming. They were very loud and althought the pool closed at 11:00 pm they carried onw ay on into the night past 2:30 pmn. I called the front desk twuce and they told me they were senidng security there Never quited down so i finally had to take a sleeping pill. Was so tired and disgusted the next mornign we checked out early. The man at the front desk told me after 2 nights of complaints they hire a policeman! It should never get to this! crazy. The guy at the front desk acted like he didn't care. Don't ever stay there!

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: polly49
Reviews.Content: stayed at the la quinta 20/11/04 for 2 weeks. bed linen changed every 2 days, room quite clean. Fail to see how it could be a virgin flagship hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at lots of hotels and this one was distinctly average. The food was ok (except one lady who worked at the shop who did not know what '2' was and always gave us 3 of everything we ordered! which was a bonus) the rooms were not very very clean but again ok. The transport to the parks were dubious, I am not sure how road worthy they were, with lots of people commenting on the bald tyres! We had a fantastic holiday though mainly due to the time spent in WDW.

Reviews.Title: “You're on your own”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Quinta Lakeside during the first week of November, 2004. The first room we were in had hundreds of small bugs on the table so we requsted a new room. Our new room did not seem to have bugs, but there were other problems. First of all, there was a dirty bath towel left on the floor of the bathroom. Also, neither the drain in the tub nor the drain in the sink worked properly. Although we fixed the tub, we could not fix the sink. Water drained extremely slowly and was quite annoying. We reported it immediately to the front desk. The woman answering the phone did not seem to care and nobody ever did show up to fix it. Other than that, the room was adequate. One good thng was that the pool area was very nice. There was lots of space, lots of tropical plants and trees and ample spots for both sun and shade. Although it was relatively inexpensive, we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I visited this hotel in Nov. We were limited to our choices of hotels because we brought our dog with us. This hotel excepts pet at no extra fee, and you could leave the pet unattended. If we went out we would put a sign on our door for the maid asking not to go into the room. We would even request the maid to come up at certain times so we could take the dog out while she cleaned. Are requests were respected at all times. So if your traveling with a pet, this is def a +. I must say we were very pleased with the room. It had a college size fridge & a decent size safe deposit box. There was no mircowave, but there is a microwave by the buffet area that can be used. The room had a spacious desk area & not only did the room have drawers for clothing but an armoire + additional space near the sink area to hang clothing & place belongings above. The pool area was clean, & inc. a tiki bar that served drinks and food. + Free miniture golf and 2 nice game rooms. One for the children and one for adults. There is a pizza hut on site, + a restautant, & deli. I had a slight prob with my TV & phone when I first arrived, but I called maintenence & they arrived immediately. I drove down to Fl from NJ & stayed at 3 other hotels during my trip, this one was def the best. I would def stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “stayed on the 7/11/04- 21/11/04 clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had very good holiday .the room was clean but basic .the staff where very polite and helpful, five of us shared a room but it was a bit small. the buses to disney where on time but looked old and sometimes we had to stand. over all the hotel just needs some redecorating, excellent location. we went with virgin holidays, all my kids eat free at the all you can eat buffet breakfast (yes! the 16 year old as well) very good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good time had by all!”
Reviews.Author: WendyH-M
Reviews.Content: Stayed during the last 2 weeks of October - Didn't hear anything about this 'abduction' incident, though! The hotel was adequate with the room being large enough for 2 adults and 1 child, although I do have reservations about it being of high enough standard to be a Virgin 'Flagship' hotel. My only complaint really was the noise of the air conditioning unit, we had to switch it off at night in order to sleep (mind you, we come from the middle of the countryside and are used to absolute silence!). Our room overlooked the main pool area. The pool was delightfully warm. Our child really liked the fact that she could go to the shop and fill her drink up anytime (a perk of being with Virgin apparently), and the mini-golf course was very popular with her. The Hotel was very conveniently sited for the Disney Parks and only 15 minutes drive from Discovery Cove/Sea World. The biggest draw with my husband was the fact that there really was an alligator in the lake! If we visited Florida again, I would definitely go with Virgin Atlantic again, but I'm not sure that I would go back to LQ lakeside, I would probably go for one of the Disney hotels for the amount of money that the whole trip costed.

Reviews.Title: “Most honest review for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: zerimar007
Reviews.Content: OK...I got a great deal on hotwire for $295 per person. It was just me and my daughter...from Oct 30 - Nov 6 2004. IT WAS GREAT!!! for the price. The room was clean. The grounds were well maintained and honestly we weren't at the hotel long enough to care. We never tried the free or breakfast there at the restaurant. Upon arrival I was given $1.50 coupons off the breakfast and kids under 10 eat free. But we were up and out by 9 a.m. everyday and not back until 10 or 11 p.m. every night. It was nice place to lay your head and take a shower. There is walgreens amlost on the parking lot and a huge supermarket almost right across the street. Great restaurants within walking distance. The shuttle service offered by the hotel may be substandard, with people having to stand sometimes and having to pick up 4 or 5 hotels before going to the parks...but the hotel is only a $20 cab ride from downtown disney....better off if you rent a car. the hotel offers there own on site taxi/shuttle service. the front desk staff, i'm sure if i needed them were more than helpful...on the day we checked in we just dropped off our bags and went to eat...about 2 hours and when we got bakc to our room there was already a message from the front desk hoping that we would have a great stay with them and if we need anything call them. The pools are nice, the fitness room looked ok...good enough to do a quick work out and the rooms have fridges so go to the grocery store and stock up on cereal and stuff, could save you some money. BUT OVERALL yes i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stay 1 week 19th Oct 2004. I have been reading reviews about this place for some time before actually going there and although a lot of people quite rightly say that the facilties are excellent, some people slate the place so badly that I cannot understand it and just had to post a response of my own. I stayed with my wife and two children (7 and 3) and my elderly parents.Our rooms were more than adequate, cleaned every day and the air con was great.The breakfast at the hotel was very good and worked out at about 18 quid for 6 of us..great value..some people just want everything for nothing!!!The pools were very good and clean and the location is ideal for getting around Disney.Good restaurants nearby etc etc..This is an excellent hotel for this type of holiday where all you want is a good reliable,clean and value for money base.Don't be afraid to stay there..

Reviews.Title: “warning to parents”
Reviews.Author: dallasontario
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at this hotel a number of times mainly because its inexpensive(we have never paid more than $45..once got it for $29, you can walk to the Outback Steakhouse, and its about a 7 minute drive to disney. however on our last visit(oct 24 - 27)my husband overheard a lady at the front desk expressing concern over something suspicious to do with a man hanging around. my husband asked the staff if this was anything we should know about and she replied not. (we have 2 children) on oct 27 we returned from breakfast to find police everywhere, we found out that a person had gone into the arcade/games room near the lobby and inticed a 10 year old into a car before another guest managed to free the child by breaking the cars window. I know this could have happened anywhere but I just wanted to alert parents to this incident.

Reviews.Title: “La Qu9”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first real extended vacation in almost four years. My wife and I decided to visit Disney World for a week. We were accustomed to staying at LQ properties on all our out of town stays. We made the reservations in advance on the LQ website at $65/night for govt. rate for LQ Lakeside. I thought this was a little high since it was off-season and a stay at a Disney resort was only $8 more per night. This specific hotel has caused my wife and I to think twice about reserving a LQ hotel in advance without seeing it for ourselves. The hotel’s website(Lakeside) stated the usual free breakfast(as all LQ’s do) included in the price. I called in advance just to make sure of this. Funny thing. I received three responses from three different employees concerning the breakfast. Nobody knew how to tell the truth about what was going on. Apparently, the hotel had decided to charge for their breakfast b/c there is a restaurant located inside the main lobby. I contacted LQ Guest Services to confirm this and was given Rick Adlington’s(Regional VP of LQ) personal cell number. He told my wife and I that all LQ’s were required to offer the free option in order to be given the LQ branding and we would receive coupons for the free option upon arrival. He said the hotel had taken it upon themselves to decide to not offer the free breakfast and it was not approved from the corporate office. I should have known this was the start of a disaster waiting to happen. Now, the room was the icing on the cake. During the entire week, the Lakeside hotel had around 50% occupancy as far as I could tell. You know, the windows are always open and nobody is in the rooms. After all the fighting and run around about the reservations and the breakfasts, you would think the manager of the hotel(Nicole) would be interested in making sure we were happy during our stay. We thought so, too. The sink in our room was “falling” off the wall. Yes, falling off the wall. It had been propped up to keep it attached to the wall. The room was disgusting and mold/mildew was everywhere. This was certainly not what we were used to in a LQ type hotel. When I requested another room, my request was refused b/c they said the hotel was booked. Think again. I knew they cared very little about our vacation and our happiness. One morning, I found a young passed out in front of one of the rooms. Yes, ! To my surprise, the LQ employee I saw didn’t seem to mind that the was laying there while she calmly prepared a breakfast for some school kids at the poolside less than 20 yards away. I certainly would not have my kids here! To this day, their website still offers the free breakfast at this hotel. You make your own judgement. Some reviews say nice value. Ask yourself if LQ is really providing me a value by staying at an old, falling down hotel versus staying at a better property for the same money? Is it worth it to you to pay over $60/night off-site of Disney when these people don’t provide true customer service? I ought to know. I am a customer service manager myself. I would be ashamed to treat a customer in this manner.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the La Quinta Inn Lakeside from 1 - 15 Oct. We didn't know what too expect after reading some of the reviews but we thought this was a great family hotel. The pools were great for the children - The general store was no more expensive that the larger supermarkets and was handy - particularly the free drink refills for children. Whilst facilities were basic we were never in the hotel long enough to want more and the location was excellent. There was plenty of choice of restaurants near by and although the breakfast in the hotel was reasonable there was some good alternatives within a very short walk if you fancied a change (we too had the free continental breakfast taken away after 3 days without explanation but too be honest it was an added bonus it was there as we hadn't expected it!) The transport was good although we had one or two occasions where there appeared to be too many people waiting to get on to the bus (I think they were busier than expected due to rearranged holidays as a result of the hurricanes) We had a great time - the hotel was just what we needed and we would consider returning to La Quinta if we went to Florida again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice value. Clean rooms. Friendly staff. Pretty.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The La Quinta Lakeside is a pretty standard hotel. The room was clean, and a good size. My best friend and I stayed for two nights and didn't have any troubles. The facilities were great: a nice pool, a resteraunt, and even a little store for snacks. It seemed very condusive for families. We got a great price on the hotel at hotwire so it was totally worth it. Everyday they have a free shuttle that goes from the hotel to Disneyworld. The area is safe and it was very resort like. We felt like we were on vacation. Good value for traveling college students and families alike.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible two star motel - don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: Colbats
Reviews.Content: I can't believe that the people who wrote these other reviews stayed at the same place! It's a dump. It's not a ***+ (as described in the Virgin brochure but a two star motel. We had three rooms with an ‘attractive’ view of the car park and because of the concrete walkway could hear comings and goings throughout the night. That was bad enough but 3 of the 4 rooms had additional problems: 1. One room had a broken air-con unit that had leaked all over the carpet. The carpet was damp, rotten and stank. 2. Another room (despite being designated a non-smoking room) stank of cigarette or cigar smoke. 3. A third room had the air-con system stuck on maximum power, which could only be quietened by unplugging the whole unit. This left us with a choice of being deafened or baking. We changed hotels the very next day!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: onemangang1000
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel with plenty of ammenities with a good location, this is a great place to stay. Stayed here with the wife & kids 1-7 March 2004. We did not have a car, thus the many restaurants within a 10-15minute walk were much appreciated. Even the restaurants on-site, such as Pizza Hut & Hurricane Sams were just fine and the kids eat for free. The 5 pools were well maintained and the mini golf course was alot of fun. The shuttles ran on time, but the buses are rather old and be prepared to stand at days end coming back from the theme parks. As for the rooms, carpets were stained in spots and the room was a little dated, but were well-kept and clean(we were in Orlando, so how much time do you really spend in the room anyways?). The in-room safe was great too. If you are looking for a property with VALUE at a reasonable cost, I highly recommend. Compare this property dollar for dollar with other hotels and what they offer and this one does nicely. Would I stay here again? without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want”
Reviews.Author: anncavanagh2002
Reviews.Content: Found La Quinta an ideal base for a family trip to see Disney / Universal. Room was large enough, for our 4 adults and 3yr old, and was serviced daily. The grounds were beautifully landscaped and the pools included a foot deep one next to the larger one - enabling my youngster to be fully independant in the water. Unexpected highlight was the shuttle driver (an Elvis lookalike) Fred who was full of useful info. No need for a car as the shuttle provided any transport needed. Would definately use again if we were to go back

Reviews.Title: “worth it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife, 6-year old daughter and I stayed at La Quinta for five nights in mid July 2004. We were very satisfied with what the hotel had to offer. The fridge in the room was excellent as you could purchase groceries from the drugstore next door or nearby Winn Dixie. Variety of restaurants (we ordered Chinese to the room from a restaurant near Winn Dixie - good), and shops close by and a free shuttle service daily to an outlet mall (Gap, Old Navy etc.) about 30 minutes away. Breakfast was satisfactory and a buffet b'fast was available at extra cost, beware beverages not included. Rooms were spacious and clean and extra towels were available at the pool. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: OHpk
Reviews.Content: Great place!! Beautiful landscaping and well maintained rooms! I personally saw random checks being done on some of these rooms so I can assure you that quality is at the top of their list. All staff were very helpful and knowledgeable about the area. Lots of dining offered within walking distance; lots of souvenir shops nearby. I took 2 11 y.o. girls with me and they enjoyed their stay very much. No complaints!! Groceries nearby for the refrigerator they offer. Clean laundry room and excellent maid service. Will stay again at this hotel - anytime!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 2nd to 16th June 2004. We got a special deal on this hotel so we were not expecting it to be as good as it was. Good well equipped rooms and a great location for all of the theme parks. Planning to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here in Feb 2004 and thought it was excellent value for money. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the food very good and the amenities very clean. We would most certainly be happy to stay at the La Quinta Inn Lakeside again. The only complaints that we had was that one of our neighbours was very noisy and the bottom of the pool could benefit from some maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value had an excellent time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews we were worried about taking our son to this hotel. However, our worries were soon gone as the Hotel was fantastic - great value for money. It was very clean and comfortable. Our son enjoyed the pools (5 in total). The rooms are in need of a little updating. We did not hear any noise from other guests, nor did we see any bugs. I would recommend this hotel to others as the location is great for Disney, Universal, Shopping and Food. You do not need to use your car at night as there are several eateries well within walking distance. We had to call maintenance as the water was not going down the sink - they came out within 5 minutes of the call.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but old!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Quinta from the 15th to 29th May 04.We found the rooms to be old and needed redecorating, but were kept clean by housekeeping, sheets and towels were changed every day.The staff are friendly and helpful.Our children loved the heated pool it was open till late.La Quinta is value for money and if you're expecting luxurious accommodation then you will be disappointed.We enjoyed our stay at La Quinta it was ideal as we spent most of our time at the many parks.

Reviews.Title: “OK but noisy!”
Reviews.Author: YGOLFA
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the other reviews in that the Motel rooms could do with a refurb. I travelled with Virgin Holidays which classify the Motel as 3+. I would classify it 2+. Saying that, there were definately more good points than bad. The rooms were cleaned every day (even on Memorial Weekend). Clean sheets and towels ED. The pool temp was like stepping into a bath (although there is no shallow end for small kids - 3 FT 6inch). The free breakfast is very good if you can get up before 9.00am and are prepared to Queue for 10 minutes. Hurricane Sam's, Breakfast and Pizza Hut all reasonably priced. Very close to Disney and good choice of local resturants if you are driving. My biggest complaint is the AC units. They are so noisy that we turned them off at night and suffered the 75 degree night time temp. Not Good !

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: vickireilly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights for a total cost of £52, booked through Expedia. A real bargain! The location was excellent, just 10 minutes drive from the Disney parks. The rooms were spacious with two double beds. The bathroom was tiny but well equipped! The Lakeside Inn itself is well equipped and we had breakfast both mornings in the little deli! A treasure of a find and if the price is right, we will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a great trip. We arrived at LaQuinta on May 1, 2004 ans stayed until May 8, 2004. The staff was courteous and was willing to help. The hotel is on the older side. Everything that the hotel claims to have is available, but is quite older than the pictures on their website indicate. I did not eat in any of their restaurants, but they looked great and were very clean. The food also looked good. The playgrounds were nice for the little ones. Security was seen many times, which gave a safe atmosphere. The rooms were clean and having a fridge in the room was great. There is a Walgreens within walking distance to the hotel and restaurants (Ponderosa, a chinese res., Sizzler, McDonalds, Taco Bell, Burger King, Golden Coral, and more) were very close. Overall, I would recommend this hotel highly. I was very happy!

Reviews.Title: “IN NEED OF A GOOD CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very shabby and in need of a good clean and redecoration. I found it very strange that there were no washroom facilities at the main pool. However the pool bar staff Mario, Bob and Paul were fantastic and really helped to make our holiday enjoyable as well as the girls Margarita and Miekla from Hurrican Sams.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort in late April and would recommend it to a budget traveler who is looking for something a bit out of the ordinary. The layout of the motel really gives it a resort feel for far less than a resort prices. I strongly suggest you request a 2nd floor room if you are not an early bird. If you are an early bird then go for the bottom floor and let the other get a bit more rest. The breakfast was terrific. We paid in advance and it was great to have that expense taken care of. I could have done without the timeshare salespersons who are selling "discounted" park tickets. The pool and pool bar were very nice and the room was adequately clean. The grounds just okay. My only real complaint was the shuttle service to the theme parks. In order to go to MK we had to leave at 7:30 or 11:00 AM...too early & too late! We ended up driving which cost an additional $8.00 to park. The resort will charge you $3.50 for resort fee which includes newspaper, transportation, phone, safe, etc. I was pretty annoyed by that. However, I would stay again and would recommend it to anyone not looking for something fancy.

Reviews.Title: “will go again i am sure.”
Reviews.Author: theonlyone
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at the hotel and was very happy.Great service and a very good deal through Go direct.We are planning our next vacation the same.Kissimmee was great.I want to retire there,can not wait.

HotelInfo.Name: Maingate Lakeside Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 7769 West Irlo Bronson Memorial Hwy, Kissimmee, FL 34747
